docs.text: Dpm advice faq ‎ ‎Common Mistakes Made in Combat and How to Fix Them The following list notes some of the common mistakes made by players in PvM. It is likely that if you're working on upping your DPM, you will need to improve in one or many of these areas. The first step is recognizing what mistakes you're making, then work on the solution. Don't be discouraged if you don't get it right away, some of these mistakes are harder to fix than others. Remember, everything takes practice. Cancelling Channelled Abilities Late or Early Channeled Abilities ⬥ Concentrated Blast : 2hit (3t/1.8s) ⬥ Snipe : (4t/2.4s) ⬥ Fury : 2hit (3t/1.8s) ⬥ Asphyxiate : 4hit (7t/4.2s) ⬥ Rapid fire : 8 hit (8t/4.8s) ⬥ Assault : 4hit (7t/4.2s) ⬥ Destroy : 4hit (7t/4.2s) ⬥ Greater Flurry : 2 or 3 hit(3t/1.8s or 5t/3.0s) Note: The listed cancel timings are standard, depending on overall rotation the cancel time you use may differ. Why it’s Important Depending on what ability you cancelled late, you will lose anywhere from 1 to 3 ticks every channeled ability you don’t cancel properly. As an example, in a 5 minute gem you will use up to 12 Asphyx's , assuming you don't cancel them, it will add up to 21.6 seconds that you’re standing idle for. That’s enough time for 10 extra abilities. Canceling too early is also suboptimal as you lose out on the damage from the channeled ability. How to Fix #Evil Lucario's video guide on correct canceling timing: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=unCtj7IosVA Note: The buff bar timers shown are outdated in the video, use !cancelling in #unknown-channel instead to get up-to-date timers. Threshold Prioritisation During Your Ultimate Why it’s Important With Magic and Ranged , the expected number of thresholds with an Adrenaline Potion is 6. with Melee using up to 3. These numbers may vary depending on your adrenaline gained with other sources. How to Fix Take a look in #dpm-advice-mage #dpm-advice-range #dpm-advice-melee to see the optimal threshold order. Threshold Prioritisation Outside Your Ultimate Why it’s Important Some thresholds have different damage values when used inside a Sunshine , Death's Swiftness , and Berserk , it is thus necessary to understand their differences for proper priorization. How to Fix Take a look in #dpm-advice-mage #dpm-advice-range #dpm-advice-melee to see the optimal threshold order. Ability Prioritisation During Your Ultimate Why it’s Important As silly as it may sound, pressing stronger buttons will greatly increase your DPM moreso than any other gear upgrade. How to Fix Familiarize yourself with which abilities you should prioritise at any given time: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1OetEUz4xU5sg7pqmJBkkafmZIye8qoPOXprUPGhin14/edit?usp=sharing Lossless Auto Attack at the Start of Your Ultimate Cause Not releasing the auto attack, or releasing a dual wield auto attack. Why it’s Important It’s a lossless attack (no lost ticks). How to Fix Use a dual-wield ability before activating your ultimate, and immediately after activating your ultimate switch to a 2h and click on the target to obtain a free auto attack before the GCD is over. Clicking the target is only necessary if you clicked your Planted Feet/2h switch from your inventory. If you keybound everything, disregard clicking the target; the auto will come with no extra input needed. Utilizing Flanking in Your Rotation Why it’s Important Your basic Flanking is a 260% ability and is better than nearly any other basic ability in terms of damage. How to Fix Practice. Make an effort to use it as often as possible. Ability Prioritisation in Your Rotation Why it's Important Prioritizing strong abilities over weaker abilities. How to Fix For Revolution, take a look at the official RuneScape Wiki and set up an optimized revolution bar. For full manual, take a look at this spreadsheet to understand which abilities are stronger. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1OetEUz4xU5sg7pqmJBkkafmZIye8qoPOXprUPGhin14/edit?usp=sharing Managing Cooldowns of Good Abilities Why it’s Important Your good abilities often come with a long cooldown, using them first all at once will leave you with weaker abilities for a large period of time How to Fix By using filler abilities such as Sonic Wave , Concentrated Blast , Dazing Shot , Needle Strike , Fury , Cleave , and Decimate (abilities that have decent damage with a short cooldown) in-between the strong abilities, you can craft a rotation where you will never run into a scenario where you have to resort to weaker abilities. Losing Ticks Cause Not inputting the next ability fast enough, having trouble determining what is the next ability, or clicking and being slow on weapon switches Why it’s Important Same rationale as canceling channels. This adds up overtime to lost abilities. How to Fix Practice, try and think 2 abilities ahead and plan out your rotation. Changing Weapons Mid-Channel Ability Why it’s Important Changing your weapon mid-Conc will cancel it. Thus this requires precise timing to make sure you’re still getting 2 hits from your conc blast. Further, changing your main-hand mid-Conc will lose you the crit bonus from the ability. How to Fix Practice the timing.
docs.title: Dpm advice faq

docs.text: Dpm advice mage Introduction In RuneScape PvM, the meta at the time of writing is about pushing out as much damage in as little time as possible. It is important to understand that good and efficient PvM, especially at the higher tiers, is about squeezing out as much damage as possible in between mechanics. This channel will go over general damage output lessons, ability prioritizations, crafting a rotation, a learning path, common mistakes, and tips and tricks. Terminology Common Abbreviations in PvM ⬥ DPM - damage per minute, a measure of how much damage is done over a minute time ⬥ DPS – damage per second, or in-general referring to damage ⬥ DW – dual wield, a wand/orb or wand/book weapon ⬥ 2H – Two hand, a staff weapon ⬥ Juggling/Swapping – Generally referring to switching between dual wield and 2H weapons to gain access to more damaging abilities ⬥ Camping – Refers to using only one type of weapon, ie. 2H camping or DW camping ⬥ Rotation – Refers to the usage of abilities and managing ability cooldowns ⬥ Switch – Refers to a weapon or gear item that is equipped and use temporarily for its effects ⬥ Auto – an auto attack, damage based on which spell tier is used in your spellbook ⬥ Tick – A unit of time in which a game action can occur. Runescape's tick is 0.6 seconds in duration ⬥ Lossless - meaning no ticks are lost in performing an action ⬥ GCD - global cooldown. An innate cooldown built into every ability. Lasts for 3 ticks (1.8 seconds) Note: For more abbreviations, see Evil Lucario's list of common PVM Lingo and Abbreviations: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yZmDhx-SJsrVo0iTNwgMN3YsuJ9CrHcySd3hptvz3Ds/ Revolution Revo++ ⬥ Revolution++ is a combat mode wherein you can toggle the game to automatically activate basic, threshold, and ultimate abilities automatically upon reaching the required adrenaline. ⬥ While we do not encourage using Revo++ as it limits the amount of control a player has over their own rotation, it is low-input and low maintenance. ⬥ Revo++ can be desirable for afking, low-effort pvm, or slayer tasks. ⬥ Here is an ability bar we recommend for Revo++, using this bar with 0 player input will yield ~130k DPM: ⬥ To toggle on revolution++ and highlight how many abilities to trigger with it, click the cog icon on your ability bar: Basic Revolution ⬥ Basic Revolution (commonly referred to as simply "Revolution") is a combat mode wherein basic abilities are used automatically by the game but threshold and ultimate abilities are manually activated. ⬥ Newer players may find this combat mode helpful starting out as it allows for some control over your rotation but doesn't overburden you with managing basic abilities. ⬥ Below is an ability bar we recommend to use for revolution: ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note that the thresholds and ultimate abilities can be placed in any order as it does not matter where they are on the bar − you will be manually activating them. ⬥ If you are new to using revolution, simply let revo use basic abilities for you. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Activate sunshine once you reach 100% adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- From there use your thresholds whenever you reach 50% adrenaline (Wild Magic , Asphyxiate , Deep Impact ). Repeat. ⬥ Following this simple repeating pattern of Build to 100% → Sunshine → Thresholds → Repeat , one can expect to reach around 150k dpm with low-medium player input. Full Manual Why to Use Full Manual ⬥ Full Manual is a combat mode wherein all abilities are manually activated by the player. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No automatic inputs from the game means no damaging abilities will be done, therefore this mode requires high input from the player. ⬥ The benefit of this mode is that it allows for the greatest degree of control over which abilities are used in any given scenario. ⬥ Most high level pvmers opt to use this combat mode. How to Approach Using Full Manual ⬥ While it does not matter where you place your abilities on your bar with full manual, you may still find it helpful to organize your bar based on basics to thresholds to ultimate. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Refer to the revolution bars as examples. ⬥ Transitioning from revo to full manual can seem intimidating but all it takes is practice. ⬥ Most players start by letting revolution activate basics while they manually input thresholds and ultimates. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The next step would be to manually activate basic abilities too, with revolution still active as a failsafe. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Once you feel confident in activating basic abilities manually, try turning off revolution. ⬥ An exercise to help you here is to only use basics for a full minute of combat on a combat dummy. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Your goal is to not lose any ticks between basic abilities, either due to cooldowns or due to not manually activating the next ability fast enough. ⬥ Once you get comfortable at a combat dummy, try on a real boss such as GWD1 (Graador/K'ril/Kree) or GWD2 (Vindicta). There is no easy "trick" to skip past the practice. It takes time to learn full manual so stick with it! Ability Prioritizations & Building a Rotation Ability Prioritization ⬥ Generally speaking, high damaging abilities should be prioritized and used more often than low damaging abilities ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• However, there's a catch. High damaging abilities often come with long cooldowns. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you use all of the high damaging abilities at once, you will be forced to wait for cooldowns before you may use them again – during which time you are forced to use low damage abilities. ⬥ To circumvent this, the trick is to use 'filler abilities', abilities with decent damage AND short cooldowns, in-between your high damaging abilities in order to pace your cooldowns. ⬥ See this image for an idea of which abilities should be prioritized based on damage (in a vacuum): Note: You should not necessarily use abilities in the listed order due to aforementioned reasons. Building a Rotation ⬥ When building a rotation, ability prioritizations AND cooldowns should be on your mind. ⬥ You want to make sure to prioritize usage of Wild Magic and Asphyxiate as these are your strongest thresholds, ideally you use them in your ultimate like Sunshine , and generally they should the first couple thresholds you use. Further, if cooldowns and adrenaline permit outside of these cases they are of high priority too. ⬥ Filler abilities such as Sonic Wave and Concentrated Blast should be used in-between high damage abilities such as Dragon Breath , Corruption Blast , flank Impact , and walked Combust . ⬥ Any basic ability with damage lower than Sonic Wave/Concentrated Blast / would be considered a weak ability (Wrack , Tuska's Wrath , Sacrifice , non-flank Impact , single-target Chain ). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally speaking, these should be avoided. ⬥ If you are 2H or DW camping, you will be limited to only one filler ability (Sonic Wave or Concentrated Blast , respectively). Thus, try to utilize Sonic Wave or Concentrated Blast as often as possible in your rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A basic pattern of Sonic Wave → Ability → Ability → Repeat is recommended for camping rotations. ⬥ For weapon juggling, you will have access to both Sonic Wave and Concentrated Blast as filler abilities. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This lets you have more breathing room in what rotations and fillers you create. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• While there is no singular rotation that is best here, a general pattern of Sonic Wave → Ability → Concentrated Blast → Ability → Repeat will give you strong dps. Ability Information General ⬥ Note: t = "ticks", s = "seconds" ⬥ All Magic AoE abilities (except Corruption Blast ) give an extra 2 + (Invigorating Rank * 0.2) adrenaline if they hit a secondary target. Autos ⬥ All Autos are affected by Invigorating: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• (Invigorating Rank * 10)% increased adrenaline on Autos ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- For Magic this translates to (Invigorating Rank * 0.2) more adrenaline per Auto ⬥ Barrages ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: Based on Weapon Speed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Fastest (Wand): 4t (2.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Average (Staff): 6t (3.6s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is an AoE: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- 3x3 AoE ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Secondary targets take reduced damage. ⬥ Blitzes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: Based on Weapon Speed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Fastest (Wand): 4t (2.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Average (Staff): 6t (3.6s) Note: Ancients autos have a 100% effect proc chance. ⬥ Surges ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: Based on Weapon Speed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Fastest (Wand): 4t (2.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Average (Staff): 6t (3.6s) ⬥ Incite Fear ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: Based on Weapon Speed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Fastest (Wand): 4t (2.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Average (Staff): 6t (3.6s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Every ability cast applies a stack: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This caps at 5 stacks, after which it will no longer consume runes on ability casts ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Stacks are lost every 20 seconds, refreshed when attempting to apply another stack ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Each stack reduces Tsunami's cast cost by -12% adrenaline ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Frost Surge: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- At 5 stacks an ability cast triggers Frost Surge which deals 10-50% ability damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Triggering it costs runes even at max stacks ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Frost Surge is also a 5x5 AoE around your primary target which hits up to 8 secondary targets in range for 10-50% ability damage each ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Frost Surge has a 12 second cooldown, after which you must have another ability cast trigger it again ⬥ Exsanguinate ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: Based on Weapon Speed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Fastest (Wand): 4t (2.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Average (Staff): 6t (3.6s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Every ability cast applies a stack: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This caps at 12 stacks, after which it will no longer consume runes on ability casts ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Stacks are lost every 20 seconds, refreshed when attemping to apply another stack ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Each stack increases basic ability damage by +1% (excluding and ) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Wrack and Ruin : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- At 12 stacks becomes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- It deals 60-300% ability damage (120-360% on stun/bound) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Using it resets all stacks and also makes your next Combust do 2 additional hits ⬥ Smoke Cloud ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: Based on Weapon Speed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Fastest (Wand): 4t (2.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Average (Staff): 6t (3.6s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases damage dealt with critical hits by 15% for Magic, 6% otherwise ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases critical hit damage cap by 12% for Magic, 4.8% otherwise ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This also stacks with Grimoire to make the hitcap 16.8k for Magic, 15.72k otherwise ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Lasts 120 seconds Other Spells ⬥ Animate Dead ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This applies a flat damage reduction: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This reduction is based on 10% of equipped magic tank gear's armor + 33% of your current Defence level after any buffs or debuffs ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The damage reduced cannot exceed 75% of the damage taken ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This 75% cap is based off the damage after all other damage reductions such as deflect prayers ( / / ) on the hit ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Lasts 12 minutes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Does not reduce Resonance /Divert Hp/adrenaline gain Basics ⬥ Combust ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 25t (15s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is a Bleed: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Not affected by Precise or Equilibrium ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Hits 5 times total, once every 2t (1.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is Walkable: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Doubles damage of each hit ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is affected by Lunging : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Max increases by (Lunging Rank * 20)% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Walking bleed only causes it to increase by 50% damage ⬥ Corruption Blast ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 25t (15s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is a Bleed: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Not Affected by Precise or Equilbrium ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Hits 5 times total, once every 2t (1.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is an AoE: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Spreads to targets within 2 tiles each hit ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Does not aggro said targets ⬥ Impact ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 25t (15s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is a Stun and Bind: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Lasts 2t (1.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It shares cooldown with Shock ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is affected by Flanking: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Increases Max by (Flanking Rank * 40)% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Increases Minimum by (Flanking Rank * 8)% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- No longer stuns or binds ⬥ Shock ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 25t (15s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is a Stun and Bind: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Lasts 2t (1.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It causes Knockback ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Pushes 1x1 targets back 1 tile ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It shares cooldown with Impact ⬥ Dragon Breath ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 17t (10.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is an AoE: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Conal AoE ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Hits 3 targets, inclusive of main ⬥ Sonic Wave ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 9t (5.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It provides a 6% hitchance buff ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This works cross-style ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This does not work cross-target ⬥ Concentrated Blast ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 9t (5.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It provides a critical hit buff: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- 5% for each hit it does ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Lost when swapping mainhands ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Channelled ability ⬥ Chain ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 17t (10.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is an AoE: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Hits within a 6 square radius ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Hits 3 targets, inclusive of main ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is affected by Caroming : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Chain hits (Caroming Rank) more targets ⬥ Greater Chain ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 17t (10.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• All normal chain things apply ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It has an additional effect: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Any secondary targets hit by chain will take the next ability cast on your main target within 6s at 50% of its damage range ⬥ Wrack ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 5t (3s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Damage boosted on stun/bound targets: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Becomes a 188% basic ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Not affected by Impatient ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Affected by Energizing: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Gain (Energizing Rank * 0.6) more adrenaline Thresholds ⬥ Wild Magic ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 34t (20.4s) ⬥ Asphyxiate ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 34t (20.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is a stun ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Stuns for 6t (3.6s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Channelled ability ⬥ Deep Impact ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ability Notes: ⬥ All distances mentioned assume Melee Distance (MD) is tile 1, so "8" = (MD + 7) tiles ⬥ r2H means "release stalled ability with 2H", rDW means "release stalled ability with dual wield" Cancelling Channels Why to Cancel ⬥ Magic has 3 channeled abilities ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These 3 are: Concentrated Blast , Asphyxiate , and Smoke Tendrils ⬥ It is important to properly cancel abilities in order to not lose any ticks, as the animation can take longer than the actual channel takes to fully apply ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Watch the following example of a Cancelled vs an Uncancelled channel (Snipe in this scenario) When to Cancel Channels ⬥ In almost all scenarios, you will cancel Concentrated Blast on its 2nd hit, this is as your Global Cooldown ends (3t/1.8s) ⬥ Typically you will cancel your Asphyxiate on the 4th hit (7t/4.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To cancel on 3rd hit you would cancel on t5 (3s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To cancel on 2nd hit you would cancel on t3 (1.8s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The above cancel timings are the same for Smoke Tendrils ⬥ For more information on cancelling, refer to #Evil Lucario's Video on cancelling Note: The Buff Bar timers are outdated in this video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=unCtj7IosVA Detonate What Makes Detonate Unique ⬥ As mentioned, Magic has 3 channels; however, Detonate is often considered one too even if it technically is not one due to the need to charge it. This section will be dedicated to Detonate due to how differently it works compared to normal channels. ⬥ Unlike other channels, Detonate acts like or can have the following done within it: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It acts somehwat like a defensive in the context of defensive autos (you can release Detonate with an Auto given the Auto is not on cooldown) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can throw Vulnerability Bombs during its charge time ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can SBS during its charge time ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can Shield Dome during its charge time ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can stall its release ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Generally speaking you cannot stall channels (outside of melees wherein only 1 hit is stalled) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is not affected by the Channeller's Ring due to not actually being a channeled ability ⬥ Typically, when releasing Detonate you will release it with an Auto and an Ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• An example would be the following: Auto Sonic Wave → Detonate (3t/1.8s) → Auto Deto Dragon Breath ( → (3t/1.8s) → ) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The order things are listed here are important, you want to do Auto then Detonate then Dragon Breath on the same tick in that order to release them with Detonate ⬥ There is an odd occurence wherein Detonate will cost 30% adrenaline instead of 15% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This can be explained as follows: the game thinks you both have a target and not at the same time, so it uses adrenaline from both your target and the adrenaline inherently used from using it without a target ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- To prevent this, try casting any damaging ability before you hit Detonate ⬥ Further, Detonate works like normal AoEs wherein it is centered at the true center of the target (for any >=2x2 target this will be the SW tile) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• However, if you cast Detonate without a target, it will be centered on your player ⬥ Moreover, its worth keeping in mind the difference in AoE size dependent on the charge of deto on release, as represented in the following diagram: Dual Wield vs Staff Camp This section is meant to list the benefits of camping one over the other though it is strongly recommended to just juggle, as it gives access to all the following benefits, and more. Staff Camp Benefits ⬥ Access to 2H Autos ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When staff camping this lets you make use of Defensive Autos to replace weaker abilities like Tuska's Wrath which you would otherwise have to use due to lack of abilities ⬥ More Revolution-friendly ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Due to using Sonic Wave over Concentrated Blast , as Sonic Wave is not a channeled ability. Dual Wield Camp Benefits ⬥ Easier swapping ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can swap to Shield or Flanks more easily, as you do not need to do an additional mainhand swap Defensive Autos Note: While this section is colloquialy referred to as "Defensive Autos", it is more technical to say it is non-damaging abilities, and so includes Sunshine and Metamorphosis . Why Defensive Autos Exist ⬥ Typically, when you cast an ability it put your Auto on cooldown based on the weapon speed of the weapon it was cast with ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• i.e., if you cast an average speed (staff ability) it will be 6t (3.6s), if you cast a fastest speed (wand ability) it will be 4t (2.4s) ⬥ Non-damaging abilities are the exception to this rule, so if you cast one it will not put your auto on cooldown ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This has several implications, the first applies to all styles, the second is magic specific Implications ⬥ Firstly, this means if you cast a dual wield ability into a defensive ability, your Auto will happen mid Global Cooldown (GCD) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Normally this will be whatever you have set as your autocasted spell, however you can alter what will be cast with the defensive by doing the spell (e.g., Ice Barrage or Entagle ) then the defensive ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The following table will break down the ticks of this: T0: Wand Ability T3: Defensive T4: Auto is cast T6: Ability ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Further, you can exploit this to make it a 2H Auto , as the cooldown for any Auto ends on t4, so you would simply swap to a 2H weapon somewhere between the dw abil cast and the defensive cast, or right after the defensive cast and before the Auto would be cast (this then puts your 2H auto on a 6t (3.6s) cd where you wont be able to cast it at all) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A further consideration, is if that ability on t6 is a non-channeled dw ability, you can 4tick an ability afterwards ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This can be seen in the following video by #Glaucon https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UmsbPrkqrtw ⬥ Secondly, a benefit magic has, due to it having auto binds, is that you can make sure an auto + ability is cast on the same tick (rather than an auto is cast on 1 tick, and the ability a tick after) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This allows magic to do a 2H abil into a defensive auto as a result ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The following table will break down the ticks of this: T0: Staff Ability T3: Defensive T6: Auto + Ability ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For Melee and Ranged this would result in: T0: Average Speed 2H Ability T3: Defensive T6: Auto T7: Ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is important as it is highly beneficial to make use of this when staff camping, as it will aid in preventing you using bad abilities like Tuska's Wrath and Sacrifice due to the lack of abilities at your disposal ⬥ It is important to note that Freedom works a little differently, in that you will get both an off-hand and a main-hand/2h auto ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You will always get the off-hand auto, and what is cast as an off-hand auto can be changed by casting the auto before, but on the same tick, as Freedom ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you wanted to change what the 2H auto is, you would have to 3 tick it ⬥ It is also important to note that if you click anything from your inventory, or click the ground anywhere, before the auto would naturally fire then you must re-click your target ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• With Magic, hitting your auto bind yields the same result Delaying Defensive Auto ⬥ Based off this fact, you can make use of this if you need to delay a defensive auto for whatever reason ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• More specifically, this can be useful for Freedom if you need to change what both the off-hand and 2H auto are when casting Freedom after a faster than Average speed weapon, as you can only change the 2H Auto if you 3t it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The following examples will be done with Freedom , however the same idea applies to delaying the auto with other non-damaging abilities, except that you only have the 2H Auto and that you can off any time after your ability before the defensive and by the time the Auto should be cast ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For Freedom specifically, we will "off" to delay the auto directly after the OH Auto is cast, otherwise we lose the OH Auto ⬥ There are several ways to "off" to delay the auto, these include: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clicking under yourself ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clicking a spell you cannot cast (e.g., trying to cast Disruption Shield when on the Ancient Spellbook) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clicking something from your inventory Note: If you do any of these things before or directly as you cast your defensive normally you will either have to click or hit your auto bind again to actually cast your auto. ⬥ There are also a couple differences between hitting your auto bind to cast your auto and clicking to cast your auto after you "off", they are as follows: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You cannot hit your auto bind to try and recast your auto mid-GCD, you need to 3 tick it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you use your auto bind to recast your auto, you can alter what the auto will be when you cast it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can click to recast your auto mid-GCD ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you click to recast your auto, your next ability must be at least 1 tick after otherwise you will override it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- if you click to recast your auto ideally you do it mid-GCD so that you do not waste ticks ⬥ Thus, for Freedom we can do as follows: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Instead of the normal T0: Dual Wield Ability T3: Freedom + OH Auto Cast T4: 2H Auto cast T6: Ability ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• We can instead do: T0: Dual Wield Ability T3: Freedom + OH Auto Cast T4: "Off" T6: 2H Auto + Ability Note: For both of these sample videos, Air Surge is the auto-casted spell and Fire Surge is the manually selected auto. I manually change the Defensive Auto to Fire Surge where possible for sake of demonstration ⬥ What are the differences between these two scenarios? ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The 2H Auto is cast and thus hits at different times ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• We can alter the 2H Auto in the second scenario, whereas in the first it will be whatever your autocasted spell is ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- We can alter the OH Auto in both scenarios by simply doing Other Auto → Freedom (e.g., → ) Note: This is how we can alter the Auto sent with Non-Damaging Abilities normally as well, though you can still alter it if you "off" for it and 3 tick it afterwards like the 2H Auto with Freedom . Switches This section will detail several switches that are useful for magic, and should be incorporated as comfortable and when relevant. Juggling / ⬥ This is simply referring to either adding a Dual Wield swap or Staff swap depending on if you currently Staff camp or Dual Wield Camp. ⬥ This is highly beneficial to do as it gives you access to Conc Blast or Sonic Wave respectively. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Thus, it gives you a new filler ability to make use of and so you can manage cooldowns more effective and also increase your average damage overall. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Moreover, it gives you all the benefits that Staff camping and Dual Wield camping alone provides. ⬥ This is a good stepping stone for those that wish to move away from weapon camping but are not confident enough, or simply to not desire, to 4-tick auto attack (4TAA). Guthix Staff ⬥ This is a basic switch to incorporate into rotations, and is beneficial to do so where possible. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is generally speaking bosses where you require the affinity debuff or if you have excess adrenaline to dump. ⬥ The main purpose of incorporating this switch is to make use of its special attack. ⬥ There are a few considerations to list, and they are as follows: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is benficial to Ring of Vigour this special attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This brings the adrenline cost from 25% to 22.5%. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have Aftershock you will have to 0-tick your special attack in order to keep your Aftershock stacks. ⬥ 0-ticking in this context refers to swapping from a weapon with Aftershock to Guthix Staff , which does not have it, to a different weapon with Aftershock in the same tick. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This works because the game only checks if Aftershock is on at the end of a tick. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Starting on Weapon A, to do this simply do: → → Weapon B ⬥ If you 4TAA, you will generally wish to Auto into this special attack (as it is an Average Speed weapon, so think of it as a Staff Ability). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Thus, to 0-tick your spec starting on Weapon A you will have to: → → equip Weapon B ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you do not wish to 0-tick your spec, then you do not need to do the weapon swap at the end on the same tick. Planted Feet ⬥ This is a very strong switch that requires minimal effort to incorporate. ⬥ This perk increases the duration of Sunshine at the cost of its Damage over Time (DoT). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It makes Sunshine's duration go from 52t/31.2s total (t0→51) to 64t/38.4s total (t0→t63). ⬥ Generally speaking you always want to Sunshine with your Planted Feet switch. ⬥ Typically this perk will go on a defender so that you do not need to bring both a shield and planted feet when a shield is required for Resonance or building adrenaline only ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This perk can also be seen put on Wands ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Further, in rare instances, this perk can also be seen put on an Enhanced Excalibur for content that requires both a shield and planted feet switch where saving any inventory space is important. Flanking ⬥ This is a simple, yet strongly recommend switch to incorporate, especially for those doing group-based content. ⬥ This turns Impact and Deep Impact into far stronger abilities at the cost of their stun which is largely irrelevant ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It increases Minimum of Impact by (Flanking Rank * 8)% and its Max by (Flanking Rank * 40)% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It increases Minimum of Deep Impact by (Flanking Rank * 6)% and its Max by (Flanking Rank * 30)% ⬥ It is recommended to put this perk on an off-hand switch ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Reduces the damage and accuracy loss of using a lower tier weapon for switch (Praesul Wand + Virtus Book > + Imperium Core ) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Due to the fact that if you swap main-hands you lose the crit buff of Concentrated Blast Dragonrider Amulet ⬥ This is a more advanced switch thats usefulness goes down as the necklace you primarily wear gets better. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unless Reaper Necklace accuracy is needed, in the current state of the game even with an Essence of Finality (or) equipped it is still a DPS increase to incorporate this as a switch. ⬥ This necklace increases the power of Dragon Breath ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It boosts its damage by 10% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It has a 10% chance of applying a bleeding effect that hits 3 times and deals 10% of Dragon Breath's max hit rounded down per hit ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This excludes boosts that do not normally boost bleeds Seren Godbow ⬥ This is an advanced switch to incorporate into rotations, though it is highly beneficial to do so where it is worth it. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• this is generally speaking bosses that are 5x5 in size or larger. ⬥ The main purpose of incorporating this switch is to make use of its special attack. ⬥ There are a few considerations to list, and they are as follows: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You must own the Ingenuity of the Humans ability (Ingen) to ensure the special attack does not splash. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you do not, depending on the content done, you may have to remove several pieces of armor to reduce the odds of splashing. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is beneficial to Ring of Vigour this special attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This brings the adrenaline cost from 30% to 27%. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is highly beneficial to pray flick to either Anguish or Desolation . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This not only increases accuracy if you need to cast the special attack without Ingen , but also considerably increases the damage in any scenario. ⬥ If you 4taa, you will generally wish to Auto into this special attack (as it is an Average Speed weapon, so think of it as a Staff Ability) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is worth noting as it is a heavy input sequence to execute in a single tick: → → → / → → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The order in which you do things does not necessarily matter so long as the Auto is first and the Special is last. 4TAA What it is ⬥ 4-tick Auto Attack (4TAA), is an extension of weapon juggling wherein, as the name implies, you force an auto attack on the 4th tick after casting the ability before ⬥ As mentioned earlier, when you cast a damaging ability it will put your autos on cooldown ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 4t cooldown after a fastest speed (wand) ability, 6t after an average speed (staff) ability ⬥ So to 4TAA, we make use of this fact, along with the fact that Magic can force an auto + ability on the same tick due to having access to spell (and thus auto) binds ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• We make use of this by delaying our next ability by a tick to force an auto and ability on the 4th tick How it Works ⬥ The general 4TAA structure will be like: Auto + 2H/Dw Ability → non-channeled Dw Ability → Repeat ⬥ As you can see, the auto is forced every other ability, this is simply due to the fact that 2H autos have a 6t cooldown so you can only cast it after every other ability ⬥ Further, you can see the ability before it repeats (i.e., before you do your next auto + ability) has to be a non-channeled Dw ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It must be a dw ability due to the 4t auto cooldown associated with it, allowing you to do a 2H auto 4t later ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It must be non-channeled because each hit of a channel resets your auto cooldown ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Thus it is generally ideal to always do an auto into your channeled ability ⬥ Moreover, you can see that after an auto you can do either a 2H or Dw ability, this is because it does not particularly matter assuming same perking and tiers ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• That being said, you must (outside of very niche cases) always ensure that when you do an auto into a channeled, that the channeled ability is done with Dw (this is mostly important for Asphyxiate, as Concentrated Blast is already Dw locked, and Smoke Tendrils is not relevant) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This is because of the fact that when the channeled hits reset your auto cd, it is going to reset it based off the weapon you are wearing, thus if you staff asphyx, when your asphyx ends your auto is on a 6t cooldown again ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The table below will showcase two different scenarios: 2H Asphyxiate: You MUST do: auto + asphyxiate → ability → dw abil → auto + ability Dw Asphyxiate: You can do: auto + asphyxiate → dw ability → auto + ability 4TAA Guides Video Guide by #Aiex https://youtu.be/HmZR1BBwsK0 Text Based Guide ⬥ The basic principles is you can do lossless spellcasting by hitting a spell from actionbar (lossless meaning you don't lose ticks performing the action) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This lets you auto the same tick as you use an ability (input is auto → abil) ⬥ When you can autoattack is based on a delay depending on your weapon speed: = 4t and = 6t ⬥ ‎ ‎Your delay after an action is given by max(currentdelay, delay from action) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Implications from this are that if you do a wand ability you'll be able to autoattack 4 ticks after. If you do a staff ability, you will be able to autoattack 7 ticks after. A Simple Step-by-Step Practice Rotation on How to 4 Tick Auto Attack ⬥ Things you need: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Wand + Orb ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Staff ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Runes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• An ability bar with the basic abilities: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Sonic Wave ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Concentration Blast ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Wrack ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Auto Attack (such as ) Note: is being used for practice solely due to its short cooldown, in actual PvM you should almost never be using this ability ⬥ Step 1 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip Wand + Orb , acquire a target, and Wrack ⬥ Step 2 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip Staff ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Press Auto Attack + Sonic ( + ) in the listed order on the same tick ⬥ Step 3 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip Wand + Orb and Wrack ( → ) ⬥ Steps 2-3 demonstrated: ⬥ Step 4 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip Staff, wait 1 tick after gcd and press Auto attack → Equip Wand + Orb → Concentrated Blast ( → + + ) ⬥ Step 5 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Wrack with Wand + Orb still equipped ( ) ⬥ Step 6 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip Staff and wait 1 tick after gcd. Repeat steps 2-6. ⬥ Steps 4-6 demonstrated ⬥ Steps 2-6 in one video ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Entire rotation: → → + → → + + → → repeat https://youtu.be/RVpzQgtG--Y 4TAA Additional Info ⬥ Note that this is just a practice rotation . Wrack is generally not a good basic ability to use in combat and is only utilized here due to it's very short cooldown. In real combat, replace Wrack with Dragon Breath , Corruption Blast , Impact , Wild Magic , etc. ⬥ When practising, set the combat dummy to 'Max Hit Mode' then take note of how much damage your Staff auto attack deals compared to a Wand auto attack. To benefit from 4TAA, you want to consistently do Staff auto attacks. ⬥ Step 4 must be done in quick succession; all inputs must be done within one tick. To make this easier on yourself try keybinding your Wand/Orb/Auto in an easy to reach set of keystrokes. ⬥ This guide only covers the basic pattern of 4TAA. Once you're confident in performing steps 1-6, try to mix and match other basic abilities to create your own 4TAA rotation. ⬥ You will know you did not lose any ticks between auto and abilities if you do not see the auto firing animation, but the auto itself still firing 4TAA Troubleshooting While practising you may be unsure if you are messing up or not, so the following clips will showcase various scenarios: too fast, correctly, and too slow Note: the Auto damage in all the following clips is 2515 Too Fast This means you simply did not wait the additional tick required for the auto, and so casted your ability at GCD end instead of 1 tick after GCD end to get an Auto + Ability Correctly This means you did it correctly, this will demonstrate how it looks like in both Normals and Ancients Spellbooks ⬥ If you did not mess up on Normals, you will not get the Auto casting animation and you will see the auto still be fired out. ⬥ If you did not mess up on Ancients, you will not get the Auto casting animation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As you can also see, the Auto and Ability are cast as the GCD bar flashes Too Slow This means you were too late to cast your auto + ability, typically this results in a 5TAA (auto cast on tick 4, ability cast on tick 5), or worse (ability cast far later). More specifically, it means your ability will be delayed as your auto will automatically fire on the 4th tick either way, assuming you did not off General Sun Rotations This section will just detail a rough idea of thresholds to use under certain assumptions: 4TAA and Blast Diffusion Boots used. Note: these are likely not going to be applicable to certain bosses or certain boss rotations may differ, but it is a rough basis to work off of No Adrenaline Potion Planted-feet (pf) Sun Wild Magic → Deto → Asphyxiate → Wild Magic → Deep Impact Adrenaline Potion Pf Sun Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deto → Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deep Impact Enh Adrenaline Potion Pf Sun Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deto → Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deep Impact Adrenaline Renewal Pf Sun Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deep Impact → Deto ‎ ‎→ Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deep Impact Limitless Pf Sun Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deep Impact Gem Rotations Note: These are not going to necessarily translate to boss rotations, but it can help aid you in getting an idea of to make use of your abilities Staff Only 4TAA Video Examples ⬥ Staff Only Courtesy of #RexT (885k score, 177k DPM): https://youtu.be/QUyUt_QEyMw Note: Getting an optimal staff camp rotation is not required before learning 4TAA. If you want to do more damage, it will be easier to learn to 4TAA. ⬥ 4TAA Courtesy of #RexT ‎ ‎(1002k score, 200k DPM) https://youtu.be/XkDqJFcck4I
docs.title: Dpm advice mage

docs.text: In RuneScape PvM, the meta at the time of writing is about pushing out as much damage in as little time as possible. It is important to understand that good and efficient PvM, especially at the higher tiers, is about squeezing out as much damage as possible in between mechanics. This channel will go over general damage output lessons, ability prioritizations, crafting a rotation, a learning path, common mistakes, and tips and tricks.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Common Abbreviations in PvM ⬥ DPM - damage per minute, a measure of how much damage is done over a minute time ⬥ DPS – damage per second, or in-general referring to damage ⬥ DW – dual wield, a wand/orb or wand/book weapon ⬥ 2H – Two hand, a staff weapon ⬥ Juggling/Swapping – Generally referring to switching between dual wield and 2H weapons to gain access to more damaging abilities ⬥ Camping – Refers to using only one type of weapon, ie. 2H camping or DW camping ⬥ Rotation – Refers to the usage of abilities and managing ability cooldowns ⬥ Switch – Refers to a weapon or gear item that is equipped and use temporarily for its effects ⬥ Auto – an auto attack, damage based on which spell tier is used in your spellbook ⬥ Tick – A unit of time in which a game action can occur. Runescape's tick is 0.6 seconds in duration ⬥ Lossless - meaning no ticks are lost in performing an action ⬥ GCD - global cooldown. An innate cooldown built into every ability. Lasts for 3 ticks (1.8 seconds) Note: For more abbreviations, see Evil Lucario's list of common PVM Lingo and Abbreviations: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yZmDhx-SJsrVo0iTNwgMN3YsuJ9CrHcySd3hptvz3Ds/
docs.title: Terminology

docs.text: Revo++ ⬥ Revolution++ is a combat mode wherein you can toggle the game to automatically activate basic, threshold, and ultimate abilities automatically upon reaching the required adrenaline. ⬥ While we do not encourage using Revo++ as it limits the amount of control a player has over their own rotation, it is low-input and low maintenance. ⬥ Revo++ can be desirable for afking, low-effort pvm, or slayer tasks. ⬥ Here is an ability bar we recommend for Revo++, using this bar with 0 player input will yield ~130k DPM: ⬥ To toggle on revolution++ and highlight how many abilities to trigger with it, click the cog icon on your ability bar: Basic Revolution ⬥ Basic Revolution (commonly referred to as simply "Revolution") is a combat mode wherein basic abilities are used automatically by the game but threshold and ultimate abilities are manually activated. ⬥ Newer players may find this combat mode helpful starting out as it allows for some control over your rotation but doesn't overburden you with managing basic abilities. ⬥ Below is an ability bar we recommend to use for revolution: ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note that the thresholds and ultimate abilities can be placed in any order as it does not matter where they are on the bar − you will be manually activating them. ⬥ If you are new to using revolution, simply let revo use basic abilities for you. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Activate sunshine once you reach 100% adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- From there use your thresholds whenever you reach 50% adrenaline (Wild Magic , Asphyxiate , Deep Impact ). Repeat. ⬥ Following this simple repeating pattern of Build to 100% → Sunshine → Thresholds → Repeat , one can expect to reach around 150k dpm with low-medium player input.
docs.title: Revolution

docs.text: Why to Use Full Manual ⬥ Full Manual is a combat mode wherein all abilities are manually activated by the player. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No automatic inputs from the game means no damaging abilities will be done, therefore this mode requires high input from the player. ⬥ The benefit of this mode is that it allows for the greatest degree of control over which abilities are used in any given scenario. ⬥ Most high level pvmers opt to use this combat mode. How to Approach Using Full Manual ⬥ While it does not matter where you place your abilities on your bar with full manual, you may still find it helpful to organize your bar based on basics to thresholds to ultimate. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Refer to the revolution bars as examples. ⬥ Transitioning from revo to full manual can seem intimidating but all it takes is practice. ⬥ Most players start by letting revolution activate basics while they manually input thresholds and ultimates. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The next step would be to manually activate basic abilities too, with revolution still active as a failsafe. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Once you feel confident in activating basic abilities manually, try turning off revolution. ⬥ An exercise to help you here is to only use basics for a full minute of combat on a combat dummy. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Your goal is to not lose any ticks between basic abilities, either due to cooldowns or due to not manually activating the next ability fast enough. ⬥ Once you get comfortable at a combat dummy, try on a real boss such as GWD1 (Graador/K'ril/Kree) or GWD2 (Vindicta). There is no easy "trick" to skip past the practice. It takes time to learn full manual so stick with it!
docs.title: Full Manual

docs.text: Ability Prioritization ⬥ Generally speaking, high damaging abilities should be prioritized and used more often than low damaging abilities ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• However, there's a catch. High damaging abilities often come with long cooldowns. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you use all of the high damaging abilities at once, you will be forced to wait for cooldowns before you may use them again – during which time you are forced to use low damage abilities. ⬥ To circumvent this, the trick is to use 'filler abilities', abilities with decent damage AND short cooldowns, in-between your high damaging abilities in order to pace your cooldowns. ⬥ See this image for an idea of which abilities should be prioritized based on damage (in a vacuum): Note: You should not necessarily use abilities in the listed order due to aforementioned reasons. Building a Rotation ⬥ When building a rotation, ability prioritizations AND cooldowns should be on your mind. ⬥ You want to make sure to prioritize usage of Wild Magic and Asphyxiate as these are your strongest thresholds, ideally you use them in your ultimate like Sunshine , and generally they should the first couple thresholds you use. Further, if cooldowns and adrenaline permit outside of these cases they are of high priority too. ⬥ Filler abilities such as Sonic Wave and Concentrated Blast should be used in-between high damage abilities such as Dragon Breath , Corruption Blast , flank Impact , and walked Combust . ⬥ Any basic ability with damage lower than Sonic Wave/Concentrated Blast / would be considered a weak ability (Wrack , Tuska's Wrath , Sacrifice , non-flank Impact , single-target Chain ). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally speaking, these should be avoided. ⬥ If you are 2H or DW camping, you will be limited to only one filler ability (Sonic Wave or Concentrated Blast , respectively). Thus, try to utilize Sonic Wave or Concentrated Blast as often as possible in your rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A basic pattern of Sonic Wave → Ability → Ability → Repeat is recommended for camping rotations. ⬥ For weapon juggling, you will have access to both Sonic Wave and Concentrated Blast as filler abilities. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This lets you have more breathing room in what rotations and fillers you create. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• While there is no singular rotation that is best here, a general pattern of Sonic Wave → Ability → Concentrated Blast → Ability → Repeat will give you strong dps.
docs.title: Ability Prioritizations & Building a Rotation

docs.text: General ⬥ Note: t = "ticks", s = "seconds" ⬥ All Magic AoE abilities (except Corruption Blast ) give an extra 2 + (Invigorating Rank * 0.2) adrenaline if they hit a secondary target. Autos ⬥ All Autos are affected by Invigorating: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• (Invigorating Rank * 10)% increased adrenaline on Autos ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- For Magic this translates to (Invigorating Rank * 0.2) more adrenaline per Auto ⬥ Barrages ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: Based on Weapon Speed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Fastest (Wand): 4t (2.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Average (Staff): 6t (3.6s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is an AoE: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- 3x3 AoE ‎ ‎ Ancients autos have a 100% effect proc chance. ⬥ Surges ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: Based on Weapon Speed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Fastest (Wand): 4t (2.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Average (Staff): 6t (3.6s) ⬥ Incite Fear ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: Based on Weapon Speed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Fastest (Wand): 4t (2.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Average (Staff): 6t (3.6s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Every ability cast applies a stack: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This caps at 5 stacks, after which it will no longer consume runes on ability casts ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Stacks are lost every 20 seconds, refreshed when attempting to apply another stack ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Each stack reduces Tsunami's cast cost by -12% adrenaline ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Frost Surge: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- At 5 stacks an ability cast triggers Frost Surge which deals 10-50% ability damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Triggering it costs runes even at max stacks ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Frost Surge is also a 5x5 AoE around your primary target which hits up to 8 secondary targets in range for 10-50% ability damage each ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Frost Surge has a 12 second cooldown, after which you must have another ability cast trigger it again ⬥ Exsanguinate ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: Based on Weapon Speed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Fastest (Wand): 4t (2.4s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Average (Staff): 6t (3.6s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Every ability cast applies a stack: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This caps at 12 stacks, after which it will no longer consume runes on ability casts ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- At 12 stacks becomes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- It deals 60-300% ability damage (120-360% on stun/bound) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Using it resets all stacks and also makes your next Combust do 2 Magic, 15.72k otherwise ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Lasts 120 seconds Other Spells ⬥ Animate Dead ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This applies a flat damage reduction: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This reduction is based on 10% of equipped magic tank gear's armor + 33% of your current Defence level after any buffs or debuffs ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The damage reduced cannot exceed 75% of the damage taken ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This 75% cap is based off the damage after all other damage reductions such as deflect prayers ( / / ) on the hit ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Lasts 12 minutes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Does not reduce Resonance /Divert Hp/adrenaline gain Basics ⬥ Combust ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 25t (15s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is a Bleed: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Not affected by Precise or Equilibrium ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Hits 5 times total, once every 2t (1.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is Walkable: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Doubles damage of each hit ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is affected by Lunging : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Max increases by (Lunging Rank * 20)% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Walking bleed only causes it to increase by 50% damage ⬥ Lasts 2t (1.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It shares cooldown with Shock ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is affected by Flanking: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Increases Max by (Flanking Rank * 40)% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Increases Minimum by (Flanking Rank Pushes 1x1 targets back 1 tile ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It shares cooldown with Impact ⬥ Dragon Breath ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 17t (10.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is an AoE: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Conal AoE ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Hits 3 targets, (Flanking Rank * 30)% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Increases Minimum by (Flanking Rank * 6)% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- No longer stuns or binds ⬥ Horror ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 25t (15s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is a stun and bind: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ Blast Diffusion Boots : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- It takes 4t (2.4s) to reach 100% instead of 6t (3.6s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- It gains 40% charge at a time instead of 20%. Special Attacks ⬥ Guthix Staff ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: based on a couple factors ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Its special attack applies an affinity and defence reduction: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- +2 affinity ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reduces Defence level by 5% of base Ultimates ⬥ Sunshine ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 100t (60s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is an on cast buff ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It increases damage by 50% from t0→t51 (52t/31.2s duration), where buff starts t1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It shares coodlown with Metamorphosis ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It has a 7x7 buff radius ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is affected by Planted Feet : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Increases duration by 25%: duration becomes t0→t63 (64t/38.4s duration), where buff starts t1 ⬥ Metamorphosis ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 100t (60s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is an on hit buff ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To get the buff the spell type of and the spell type of your abilities and autos have to correspond ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- E.g., Fire into Fire ability works, Fire into Air ability would not ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It increases damage by 63.5% from t0-t25 (26t/15.6s duration), where buff starts t1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It shares cooldown with Sunshine ⬥ Omnipower ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 50t (30s) ⬥ Tsunami ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown: 100t (60s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is an AoE ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It provides an Critical Adrenaline buff: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- For the next 30s, critical hits give 10% adrenaline ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This buff is applied on release of the ability Hit Timings Refer to this table for hit timings of each ability Notes: ⬥ All distances mentioned assume Melee Distance (MD) is tile 1, so "8" = (MD + 7) tiles ⬥ r2H means "release stalled ability with 2H", rDW means "release stalled ability with dual wield"
docs.title: Ability Information

docs.text: Why to Cancel ⬥ Magic has 3 channeled abilities ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These 3 are: Concentrated Blast , Asphyxiate , and Smoke Tendrils ⬥ It is important to properly cancel abilities in order to not lose any ticks, as the animation can take longer than the actual channel takes to fully apply ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Watch the following example of a Cancelled vs an Uncancelled channel (Snipe in this scenario) When to Cancel Channels ⬥ In almost all scenarios, you will cancel Concentrated Blast on its 2nd hit, this is as your Global Cooldown ends (3t/1.8s) ⬥ Typically you will cancel your Asphyxiate on the 4th hit (7t/4.2s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To cancel on 3rd hit you would cancel on t5 (3s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To cancel on 2nd hit you would cancel on t3 (1.8s) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The above cancel timings are the same for Smoke Tendrils ⬥ For more information on cancelling, refer to #Evil Lucario's Video on cancelling Note: The Buff Bar timers are outdated in this video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=unCtj7IosVA
docs.title: Cancelling Channels

docs.text: What Makes Detonate Unique ⬥ As mentioned, Magic has 3 channels; however, Detonate is often considered one too even if it technically is not one due to the need to charge it. This section will be dedicated to Detonate due to how differently it works compared to normal channels. ⬥ Unlike other channels, Detonate acts like or can have the following done within it: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It acts somehwat like a defensive in the context of defensive autos (you can release Detonate with an Auto given the Auto is not on cooldown) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can throw Vulnerability Bombs during its charge time ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can SBS during its charge time ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can Shield Dome during its charge time ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can stall its release ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Generally speaking you cannot stall channels (outside of melees wherein only 1 hit is stalled) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is not affected by the Channeller's Ring due to not actually being a channeled ability ⬥ Typically, when releasing Detonate you will release it with an Auto and an Ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• An example would be the following: Auto Sonic Wave → Detonate (3t/1.8s) → Auto Deto Dragon Breath ( → (3t/1.8s) → ) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The order things are listed here are important, you want to do Auto then Detonate then Dragon Breath on the same tick in that order to release them with Detonate ⬥ There is an odd occurence wherein Detonate will cost 30% adrenaline instead of 15% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This can be explained as follows: the game thinks you both have a target and not at the same time, so it uses adrenaline from both your target and the adrenaline inherently used from using it without a target ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- To prevent this, try casting any damaging ability before you hit Detonate ⬥ Further, Detonate works like normal AoEs wherein it is centered at the true center of the target (for any >=2x2 target this will be the SW tile) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• However, if you cast Detonate without a target, it will be centered on your player ⬥ Moreover, its worth keeping in mind the difference in AoE size dependent on the charge of deto on release, as represented in the following diagram:
docs.title: Detonate

docs.text: This section is meant to list the benefits of camping one over the other though it is strongly recommended to just juggle, as it gives access to all the following benefits, and more. Staff Camp Benefits ⬥ Access to 2H Autos ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When staff camping this lets you make use of Defensive Autos to replace weaker abilities like Tuska's Wrath which you would otherwise have to use due to lack of abilities ⬥ More Revolution-friendly ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Due to using Sonic Wave over Concentrated Blast , as Sonic Wave is not a channeled ability. Dual Wield Camp Benefits ⬥ Easier swapping ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can swap to Shield or Flanks more easily, as you do not need to do an additional mainhand swap
docs.title: Dual Wield vs Staff Camp

docs.text: Note: While this section is colloquialy referred to as "Defensive Autos", it is more technical to say it is non-damaging abilities, and so includes Sunshine and Metamorphosis . Why Defensive Autos Exist ⬥ Typically, when you cast an ability it put your Auto on cooldown based on the weapon speed of the weapon it was cast with ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• i.e., if you cast an average speed (staff ability) it will be 6t (3.6s), if you cast a fastest speed (wand ability) it will be 4t (2.4s) ⬥ Non-damaging abilities are the exception to this rule, so if you cast one it will not put your auto on cooldown ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This has several implications, the first applies to all styles, the second is magic specific Implications ⬥ Firstly, this means if you cast a dual wield ability into a defensive ability, your Auto will happen mid Global Cooldown (GCD) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Normally this will be whatever you have set as your autocasted spell, however you can alter what will be cast with the defensive by doing the spell (e.g., Ice Barrage or Entagle ) then the defensive ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The following table will break down the ticks of this: T0: Wand Ability T3: Defensive T4: Auto is cast T6: Ability ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Further, you can exploit this to make it a 2H Auto , as the cooldown for any Auto ends on t4, so you would simply swap to a 2H weapon somewhere between the dw abil cast and the defensive cast, or right after the defensive cast and before the Auto would be cast (this then puts your 2H auto on a 6t (3.6s) cd where you wont be able to cast it at all) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A further consideration, is if that ability on t6 is a non-channeled dw ability, you can 4tick an ability afterwards ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This can be seen in the following video by #Glaucon https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UmsbPrkqrtw ⬥ Secondly, a benefit magic has, due to it having auto binds, is that you can make sure an auto + ability is cast on the same tick (rather than an auto is cast on 1 tick, and the ability a tick after) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This allows magic to do a 2H abil into a defensive auto as a result ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The following table will break down the ticks of this: T0: Staff Ability T3: Defensive T6: Auto + Ability ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For Melee and Ranged this would result in: T0: Average Speed 2H Ability T3: Defensive T6: Auto T7: Ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is important as it is highly beneficial to make use of this when staff camping, as it will aid in preventing you using bad abilities like Tuska's Wrath and Sacrifice due to the lack of abilities at your disposal ⬥ It is important to note that Freedom works a little differently, in that you will get both an off-hand and a main-hand/2h auto ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You will always get the off-hand auto, and what is cast as an off-hand auto can be changed by casting the auto before, but on the same tick, as Freedom ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you wanted to change what the 2H auto is, you would have to 3 tick it ⬥ It is also important to note that if you click anything from your inventory, or click the ground anywhere, before the auto would naturally fire then you must re-click your target ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• With Magic, hitting your auto bind yields the same result Delaying Defensive Auto ⬥ Based off this fact, you can make use of this if you need to delay a defensive auto for whatever reason ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• More specifically, this can be useful for Freedom if you need to change what both the off-hand and 2H auto are when casting Freedom after a faster than Average speed weapon, as you can only change the 2H Auto if you 3t it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The following examples will be done with Freedom , however the same idea applies to delaying the auto with other non-damaging abilities, except that you only have the 2H Auto and that you can off any time after your ability before the defensive and by the time the Auto should be cast ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For Freedom specifically, we will "off" to delay the auto directly after the OH Auto is cast, otherwise we lose the OH Auto ⬥ There are several ways to "off" to delay the auto, these include: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clicking under yourself ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clicking a spell you cannot cast (e.g., trying to cast Disruption Shield when on the Ancient Spellbook) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Clicking something from your inventory Note: If you do any of these things before or directly as you cast your defensive normally you will either have to click or hit your auto bind again to actually cast your auto. ⬥ There are also a couple differences between hitting your auto bind to cast your auto and clicking to cast your auto after you "off", they are as follows: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You cannot hit your auto bind to try and recast your auto mid-GCD, you need to 3 tick it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you use your auto bind to recast your auto, you can alter what the auto will be when you cast it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can click to recast your auto mid-GCD ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you click to recast your auto, your next ability must be at least 1 tick after otherwise you will override it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- if you click to recast your auto ideally you do it mid-GCD so that you do not waste ticks ⬥ Thus, for Freedom we can do as follows: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Instead of the normal T0: Dual Wield Ability T3: Freedom + OH Auto Cast T4: 2H Auto cast T6: Ability ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• We can instead do: T0: Dual Wield Ability T3: Freedom + OH Auto Cast T4: "Off" T6: 2H Auto + Ability Note: For both of these sample videos, Air Surge is the auto-casted spell and Fire Surge is the manually selected auto. I manually change the Defensive Auto to Fire Surge where possible for sake of demonstration ⬥ What are the differences between these two scenarios? ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The 2H Auto is cast and thus hits at different times ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• We can alter the 2H Auto in the second scenario, whereas in the first it will be whatever your autocasted spell is ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- We can alter the OH Auto in both scenarios by simply doing Other Auto → Freedom (e.g., → ) Note: This is how we can alter the Auto sent with Non-Damaging Abilities normally as well, though you can still alter it if you "off" for it and 3 tick it afterwards like the 2H Auto with Freedom .
docs.title: Defensive Autos

docs.text: This section will detail several switches that are useful for magic, and should be incorporated as comfortable and when relevant. Juggling / ⬥ This is simply referring to either adding a Dual Wield swap or Staff swap depending on if you currently Staff camp or Dual Wield Camp. ⬥ This is highly beneficial to do as it gives you access to Conc Blast or Sonic Wave respectively. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Thus, it gives you a new filler ability to make use of and so you can manage cooldowns more effective and also increase your average damage overall. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Moreover, it gives you all the benefits that Staff camping and Dual Wield camping alone provides. ⬥ This is a good stepping stone for those that wish to move away from weapon camping but are not confident enough, or simply to not desire, to 4-tick auto attack (4TAA). Guthix Staff ⬥ This is a basic switch to incorporate into rotations, and is beneficial to do so where possible. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is generally speaking bosses where you require the affinity debuff or if you have excess adrenaline to dump. ⬥ The main purpose of incorporating this switch is to make use of its special attack. ⬥ There are a few considerations to list, and they are as follows: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is benficial to Ring of Vigour this special attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This brings the adrenline cost from 25% to 22.5%. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have Aftershock you will have to 0-tick your special attack in order to keep your Aftershock stacks. ⬥ 0-ticking in this context refers to swapping from a weapon with Aftershock to Guthix Staff , which does not have it, to a different weapon with Aftershock in the same tick. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This works because the game only checks if Aftershock is on at the end of a tick. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Starting on Weapon A, to do this simply do: → → Weapon B ⬥ If you 4TAA, you will generally wish to Auto into this special attack (as it is an Average Speed weapon, so think of it as a Staff Ability). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Thus, to 0-tick your spec starting on Weapon A you will have to: → → equip Weapon B ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you do not wish to 0-tick your spec, then you do not need to do the weapon swap at the end on the same tick. Planted Feet ⬥ This is a very strong switch that requires minimal effort to incorporate. ⬥ This perk increases the duration of Sunshine at the cost of its Damage over Time (DoT). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It makes Sunshine's duration go from 52t/31.2s total (t0→51) to 64t/38.4s total (t0→t63). ⬥ Generally speaking you always want to Sunshine with your Planted Feet switch. ⬥ Typically this perk will go on a defender so that you do not need to bring both a shield and planted feet when a shield is required for Resonance or building adrenaline only ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This perk can also be seen put on Wands ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Further, in rare instances, this perk can also be seen put on an Enhanced Excalibur for content that requires both a shield and planted feet switch where saving any inventory space is important. Flanking ⬥ This is a simple, yet strongly recommend switch to incorporate, especially for those doing group-based content. ⬥ This turns Impact and Deep Impact into far stronger abilities at the cost of their stun which is largely irrelevant ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It increases Minimum of Impact by (Flanking Rank * 8)% and its Max by (Flanking Rank * 40)% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It increases Minimum of Deep Impact by (Flanking Rank * 6)% and its Max by (Flanking Rank * 30)% ⬥ It is recommended to put this perk on an off-hand switch ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Reduces the damage and accuracy loss of using a lower tier weapon for switch (Praesul Wand + Virtus Book > + Imperium Core ) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Due to the fact that if you swap main-hands you lose the crit buff of Concentrated Blast Dragonrider Amulet ⬥ This is a more advanced switch thats usefulness goes down as the necklace you primarily wear gets better. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unless Reaper Necklace accuracy is needed, in the current state of the game even with an Essence of Finality (or) equipped it is still a DPS increase to incorporate this as a switch. ⬥ This necklace increases the power of Dragon Breath ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It boosts its damage by 10% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It has a 10% chance of applying a bleeding effect that hits 3 times and deals 10% of Dragon Breath's max hit rounded down per hit ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This excludes boosts that do not normally boost bleeds Seren Godbow ⬥ This is an advanced switch to incorporate into rotations, though it is highly beneficial to do so where it is worth it. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• this is generally speaking bosses that are 5x5 in size or larger. ⬥ The main purpose of incorporating this switch is to make use of its special attack. ⬥ There are a few considerations to list, and they are as follows: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You must own the Ingenuity of the Humans ability (Ingen) to ensure the special attack does not splash. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you do not, depending on the content done, you may have to remove several pieces of armor to reduce the odds of splashing. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is beneficial to Ring of Vigour this special attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This brings the adrenaline cost from 30% to 27%. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is highly beneficial to pray flick to either Anguish or Desolation . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This not only increases accuracy if you need to cast the special attack without Ingen , but also considerably increases the damage in any scenario. ⬥ If you 4taa, you will generally wish to Auto into this special attack (as it is an Average Speed weapon, so think of it as a Staff Ability) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is worth noting as it is a heavy input sequence to execute in a single tick: → → → / → → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The order in which you do things does not necessarily matter so long as the Auto is first and the Special is last.
docs.title: Switches

docs.text: What it is ⬥ 4-tick Auto Attack (4TAA), is an extension of weapon juggling wherein, as the name implies, you force an auto attack on the 4th tick after casting the ability before ⬥ As mentioned earlier, when you cast a damaging ability it will put your autos on cooldown ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 4t cooldown after a fastest speed (wand) ability, 6t after an average speed (staff) ability ⬥ So to 4TAA, we make use of this fact, along with the fact that Magic can force an auto + ability on the same tick due to having access to spell (and thus auto) binds ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• We make use of this by delaying our next ability by a tick to force an auto and ability on the 4th tick How it Works ⬥ The general 4TAA structure will be like: Auto + 2H/Dw Ability → non-channeled Dw Ability → Repeat ⬥ As you can see, the auto is forced every other ability, this is simply due to the fact that 2H autos have a 6t cooldown so you can only cast it after every other ability ⬥ Further, you can see the ability before it repeats (i.e., before you do your next auto + ability) has to be a non-channeled Dw ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It must be a dw ability due to the 4t auto cooldown associated with it, allowing you to do a 2H auto 4t later ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It must be non-channeled because each hit of a channel resets your auto cooldown ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Thus it is generally ideal to always do an auto into your channeled ability ⬥ Moreover, you can see that after an auto you can do either a 2H or Dw ability, this is because it does not particularly matter assuming same perking and tiers ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• That being said, you must (outside of very niche cases) always ensure that when you do an auto into a channeled, that the channeled ability is done with Dw (this is mostly important for Asphyxiate, as Concentrated Blast is already Dw locked, and Smoke Tendrils is not relevant) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This is because of the fact that when the channeled hits reset your auto cd, it is going to reset it based off the weapon you are wearing, thus if you staff asphyx, when your asphyx ends your auto is on a 6t cooldown again ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The table below will showcase two different scenarios: 2H Asphyxiate: You MUST do: auto + asphyxiate → ability → dw abil → auto + ability Dw Asphyxiate: You can do: auto + asphyxiate → dw ability → auto + ability
docs.title: 4TAA

docs.text: Video Guide by #Aiex https://youtu.be/HmZR1BBwsK0 Text Based Guide ⬥ The basic principles is you can do lossless spellcasting by hitting a spell from actionbar (lossless meaning you don't lose ticks performing the action) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This lets you auto the same tick as you use an ability (input is auto → abil) ⬥ When you can autoattack is based on a delay depending on your weapon speed: = 4t and = 6t ⬥ ‎ ‎Your delay after an action is given by max(currentdelay, delay from action) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Implications from this are that if you do a wand ability you'll be able to autoattack 4 ticks after. If you do a staff ability, you will be able to autoattack 7 ticks after. A Simple Step-by-Step Practice Rotation on How to 4 Tick Auto Attack ⬥ Things you need: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Wand + Orb ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Staff ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Runes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• An ability bar with the basic abilities: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Sonic Wave ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Concentration Blast ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Wrack ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Auto Attack (such as ) Note: is being used for practice solely due to its short cooldown, in actual PvM you should almost never be using this ability ⬥ Step 1 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip Wand + Orb , acquire a target, and Wrack ⬥ Step 2 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip Staff ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Press Auto Attack + Sonic ( + ) in the listed order on the same tick ⬥ Step 3 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip Wand + Orb and Wrack ( → ) ⬥ Steps 2-3 demonstrated: ⬥ Step 4 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip Staff, wait 1 tick after gcd and press Auto attack → Equip Wand + Orb → Concentrated Blast ( → + + ) ⬥ Step 5 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Wrack with Wand + Orb still equipped ( ) ⬥ Step 6 : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip Staff and wait 1 tick after gcd. Repeat steps 2-6. ⬥ Steps 4-6 demonstrated ⬥ Steps 2-6 in one video ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Entire rotation: → → + → → + + → → repeat https://youtu.be/RVpzQgtG--Y 4TAA Additional Info ⬥ Note that this is just a practice rotation . Wrack is generally not a good basic ability to use in combat and is only utilized here due to it's very short cooldown. In real combat, replace Wrack with Dragon Breath , Corruption Blast , Impact , Wild Magic , etc. ⬥ When practising, set the combat dummy to 'Max Hit Mode' then take note of how much damage your Staff auto attack deals compared to a Wand auto attack. To benefit from 4TAA, you want to consistently do Staff auto attacks. ⬥ Step 4 must be done in quick succession; all inputs must be done within one tick. To make this easier on yourself try keybinding your Wand/Orb/Auto in an easy to reach set of keystrokes. ⬥ This guide only covers the basic pattern of 4TAA. Once you're confident in performing steps 1-6, try to mix and match other basic abilities to create your own 4TAA rotation. ⬥ You will know you did not lose any ticks between auto and abilities if you do not see the auto firing animation, but the auto itself still firing
docs.title: 4TAA Guides

docs.text: While practising you may be unsure if you are messing up or not, so the following clips will showcase various scenarios: too fast, correctly, and too slow Note: the Auto damage in all the following clips is 2515 Too Fast This means you simply did not wait the additional tick required for the auto, and so casted your ability at GCD end instead of 1 tick after GCD end to get an Auto + Ability Correctly This means you did it correctly, this will demonstrate how it looks like in both Normals and Ancients Spellbooks ⬥ If you did not mess up on Normals, you will not get the Auto casting animation and you will see the auto still be fired out. ⬥ If you did not mess up on Ancients, you will not get the Auto casting animation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As you can also see, the Auto and Ability are cast as the GCD bar flashes Too Slow This means you were too late to cast your auto + ability, typically this results in a 5TAA (auto cast on tick 4, ability cast on tick 5), or worse (ability cast far later). More specifically, it means your ability will be delayed as your auto will automatically fire on the 4th tick either way, assuming you did not off
docs.title: 4TAA Troubleshooting

docs.text: This section will just detail a rough idea of thresholds to use under certain assumptions: 4TAA and Blast Diffusion Boots used. Note: these are likely not going to be applicable to certain bosses or certain boss rotations may differ, but it is a rough basis to work off of No Adrenaline Potion Planted-feet (pf) Sun Wild Magic → Deto → Asphyxiate → Wild Magic → Deep Impact Adrenaline Potion Pf Sun Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deto → Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deep Impact Enh Adrenaline Potion Pf Sun Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deto → Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deep Impact Adrenaline Renewal Pf Sun Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deep Impact → Deto ‎ ‎→ Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deep Impact Limitless Pf Sun Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Wild Magic → Asphyxiate → Deep Impact

docs.text: Note: These are not going to necessarily translate to boss rotations, but it can help aid you in getting an idea of to make use of your abilities Staff Only 4TAA Video Examples ⬥ Staff Only Courtesy of #RexT (885k score, 177k DPM): https://youtu.be/QUyUt_QEyMw Note: Getting an optimal staff camp rotation is not required before learning 4TAA. If you want to do more damage, it will be easier to learn to 4TAA. ⬥ 4TAA Courtesy of #RexT ‎ ‎(1002k score, 200k DPM) https://youtu.be/XkDqJFcck4I

docs.text: Dpm advice melee Introduction In RuneScape PvM, the meta at the time of writing is about pushing out as much damage in as little time as possible. It is important to understand that good and efficient PvM, especially at the higher tiers, is about squeezing out as much damage as possible in between mechanics. This channel will go over general damage output lessons, ability prioritizations, crafting a rotation, a learning path, common mistakes, and tips and tricks. Terminology Common Abbreviations in PvM ⬥ DPM - Damage per minute, a measure of how much damage is done over a minute time ⬥ DPS – Damage per second, or in-general referring to damage ⬥ DW – Dual wield, a wand/orb or wand/book weapon ⬥ 2h – Two hand, a staff weapon ⬥ MD - Melee distance, to be standing within 1 square distance to your target ⬥ Scythe Range - Halberd type weapons that allow you to attack from 2 squares away (eg.
