to Tile x from True Centre, so MD → 2 = MD to Tile 2 from True Centre ⬥ Javelins (only mainhand required) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unload hits fast at MD → 3 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Piercing Shot and Ricochet hit fast at MD → 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rapid Fire and Snapshot hit fast at MD ⬥ Darts (only mainhand required) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unload hits fast at MD → 3 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Piercing Shot and Ricochet hit fast at MD → 5 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rapid Fire and Snapshot hit fast at MD → 4 ⬥ Knives (only mainhand required) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unload hits fast at MD → 3 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Piercing Shot and Ricochet hit fast at MD ⬥ Blowpipe (2H override) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dazing Shot and Non-bleed hit from Deadshot hits fast at MD → 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Piercing Shot and Ricochet hit fast at MD → 5 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rapid Fire and Snapshot hit fast at MD → 4 Note: A list of all hit timings, including other overrides, can be found at: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17S4WGJ5iRVxy4kyn3tzrGDQb10O6tKAkNBnl7MaSE64/edit#gid=0 Notable benefits Included but not limited to: ⬥ Nex ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each phase will be a tick faster, up to 6s faster for the whole kill. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Phasing faster will reduce the danger from some of her special attacks, including but not limited to Embrace the Shadows, Blood Siphon, and Die in a Prison of Ice. ⬥ Raksha ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Faster hitting abilities can mean phasing before an auto, saving several ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Faster hitting abilities can mean you get a mind poison skip when you otherwise would have not, saving several seconds. ⬥ Vorago ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Allows you better choices of what to Target Cycle on Phase 1, and Teamsplit and The End P3s. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can allow you to fit an extra ability's hit in before reflect. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Allows consistent 0-speccing ⬥ Eldritch Crossbow ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Split Soul damage is only applied if your hit would've healed you from Soul Split within the duration of your special attack, this can have a substantial impact on your rotations by allowing you to fit in more abilities on the given window.
docs.title: Weapon Overrides

docs.text: What Makes It Special Tendrils , despite deal damage, acts as a non-damaging ability with a couple caveats. ⬥ This allows you to use what is colloqually referred to as "Defensive Autos" with it. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These are simply lossless autos that fire during non-damaging abilities as they do not reset your Auto cooldown. How It Works ⬥ To get your Auto with Shadow Tendrils you must perform a non-channeled fastest speed weapon ability before Tendrils . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For example, Needle with Blightbound Crossbows . ⬥ To further make use of this interaction, you want to ensure that this Auto is a 2h-Auto, such as SGB or ECB , or Dbow (where accuracy permits). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• To do this, simply swap to your 2h after your ability before Tendrils , or swap to your 2h directly as you or after you cast Tendrils . Differences From Typical Non-Damaging Abilities As mentioned prior, there are some caveats to this ability and they are as follows: ⬥ You cannot delay the Auto with Tendrils like other Defensive Autos. ⬥ Fast speed weapons do not work like with other Defensive Autos. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Thus, the non-channeled ability before Tendrils must be fastest. ⬥ You have to spam click if you want to get Auto after Tendrils if you offed for some reason before it, though clicking once before Tendrils works too.
docs.title: Shadow Tendrils

docs.text: Dragonkin laboratory magic Dragonkin Laboratory (Courtesy of #Linie) Introduction The second Elite Dungeon released, the Dragonkin Laboratory is a relatively straightforward encounter. Categorized as mid tier PvM, the encounter is useful for anyone wanting to learn how to deal with large mobs as well as bosses, combining aspects of single target and AoE damage. The three bosses of the Laboratory drop the Greater Flurry, Greater Fury and Greater Barge codices in the order that they appear, improving your Melee techniques vital to end-game PvM Each solo run of ED2 is worth 9,276,146 in uniques. Advanced players can get up to 4 kph, earning on average 37,104,586 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ You can Surge or Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry. Presets Beginner/Group Magic ⬥ Food can be swapped out for Spiritual Prayers as needed. ⬥ Cinderbanes can be camped for the full dungeon. ⬥ Generally solid food is fine, as you are typically only healing between encounters, so the adrenaline loss is acceptable. ⬥ More charms can be brought if needed. ⬥ If lacking an Essence of Finality , bring both an Amulet of Souls for mobs, and Reaper for bosses. Advanced/Solo Magic ⬥ ‎ ‎ Seismic singularity Flanking 4 ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Monster Information Note: No monster in ED2 has a slayer requirement to damage. Laboratory Slime ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 (Spawnlings: 10,000) ⬥ Special Attack : After every odd-numbered auto attack they will spawn a smaller slime with similar damage output. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If killed, these spawnlings do not count toward opening any barriers. ⬥ They attack with rapid, low-damage melee attacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As they often spawn in groups their damage will quickly stack up if not dealt with or evaded. Lava Spider ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ They attack with very rapid, low-damage ranged attacks with very long range. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As they often spawn in groups their damage will quickly stack up if not dealt with or evaded. ⬥ There are no critical path barriers that require Lava Spiders to be defeated. If the goal is fast, full runs, all Lava Spiders can be ignored. Chromatic Dragons ⬥ Life Points : Red Dragon: 29,000; Black Dragon: 39,000 ⬥ These are very basic and have no mechanical differences compared to overworld counterparts. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage melee and magic attacks. Magma Golem ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 ⬥ They are much weaker in general compared to their Lost Grove counterparts and have no special attacks. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage, halberd-range melee attacks. Animated Book ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ A basic, high damage output enemy. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage melee , ranged , and magic attacks. Celestial Dragon ⬥ Life Points : 48,000 ⬥ The melee and magic defence of ED2 celestial dragons is drastically reduced compared to their counterparts on Dragontooth Isle. ⬥ Special Attack : After being damaged under 36,000 life points, rapidly heal 2,400 life points per tick for 9 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This special attack will be repeated every 6 auto attacks after its first use. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This effect can be canceled early or prevented alltogether by stunning or binding the dragon as or before it occurs. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Most stuns and binds will cancel this effect including: Stunning/binding abilities, binding spells , or Sticky Bombs . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• They do not have access to the special attack of the celestial dragons in the Dragontooth Isle resource dungeon. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage melee and magic attacks. Lava Strykewyrm ⬥ Life Points : 30,000 ⬥ These are significantly weaker than their counterparts near the Lava Maze, and cannot use any of their special attacks. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage magic attacks. Gemstone Dragons ⬥ Life Points : Dragonstone Dragon: 55,000; Onyx Dragon: 60,000; Hydrix Dragon: 75,000 ⬥ The melee and magic defence of ED2 gemstone dragons is drastically reduced compared to their counterparts on Karamja. ⬥ Each gemstone dragon has a special, slow moving, 3x3 aoe attack with an extra effect. They will not use this attack in melee distance. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dragonstone Dragon: Reduces antifire potion timers. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Onyx Dragon: Heals the dragon. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hydrix Dragon: Drains adrenaline to 0% and temporarily halves adrenaline gain. ⬥ They each attack with moderate-damage melee and magic attacks. Section 1 Room 1 ⬥ Lure Slimes to AoE them, kill 4 to proceed. Room 2 ⬥ Surge Bladed Dive to the staircase to avoid aggroing Spiders and Sunshine on the edge of the wall, ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kill 3 Red Dragons to proceed. Room 2.5 ⬥ Walk around the wall back into the Sunshine you placed earlier and finish your rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have Slimes following you, you need to Surge past the Red Dragons and they will get blocked behind them. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Slimes get blocked very easily which can be utilized multiple times throughout the section. Room 3 ⬥ Surge to the back of the bridge and Detonate Tsunami . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You only need to kill 4 Golems to proceed but you can catch them all in AoE's very easily. Room 4 ⬥ The optimal way to do this room depends on the positioning of the Slimes and books right as the barrier goes down. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you are immediately aggroed by multiple Slimes and Books: Entangle and clear them from the bridge. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you draw only Slime aggro, look to Surge Bladed Dive behind the Celestial (Slimes will get blocked). ⬥ You must kill the Celestial + several Slimes to pass this room so if you draw no aggro at all you must manually tag some slimes to bring behind the Celestial. Room 5 ⬥ Most of the time you will have extra enemies following you from the previous room so Surge past the 3 Celestials and Sunshine at the back of the room (extra books, slimes, golems will be blocked). ⬥ Sunshine there and clear the Celestials. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can use Dominion Mines for the dragon. Room 6 ⬥ Deal damage as normal, Sunshine if you'd like. Note: Room 6 actually occurs after Astellarn. Astellarn, the First Celestial The first encounter of the Laboratory, This fight heavily utilizes punishing area-of-effect mechanics but is still very straightforward and easy to master with some practice. Additionally, he drops the Greater Flurry Codex . Mechanics ⬥ ‎ ‎ Pulsar: Spawned after 2-3 autoattacks, it has 20,000 hp, dealing moderate periodic damage. Shortly after, a bar will appear above the player's head and a Wyrmhole will spawn at their current location when it fills. This special attack is cast based upon the time you entered the dungeon, potentially de-syncing with the Neutron Star. Placing the wyrmhole along these lines will prevent it from being blocked out by the later rain mechanic. Pulsar pulsing its firey waves ⬥ Neutron Star: This will follow the player around and must be lured into the Wyrmhole, stabilizing it, turning white, and giving increased damage to Astellarn. This special attack is cast based upon the time you started the fight with Astellarn, potentially de-syncing with the Wyrmhole. If it touches a player, it will explode, dealing 5000 damage. Its highly recommended to teleport out and restart the fight if this happens. ⬥ Celestial Rain: Once the boss reaches 200,000 HP, Asterllarn will take decreased damage and spawn a continuous rain in a random quadrant that deals increasing damage as long as it is stood in. This will change quadrants occasionally and will only be a major issue if the Wyrmhole was placed improperly. From here on, these mechanics repeat with the rain lasting for the remainder of the encounter. Section 2 Room 1 ⬥ Spider aggro can be a nuisance here, Surge Bladed Dive immediately East here and depending on how many Spiders come along you may need to clear them first. ⬥ Clear the two Lava Strykes at the end to proceed. If lots of aggro is drawn, stand here to stack. Room 2 ⬥ Sunshine in the middle of the Black Dragons and clear them. Room 3 ⬥ Surge to the end of the path while killing the Dragons and Sunshine when it comes up. ⬥ You need to kill every Black Dragon here to proceed. Room 4 ⬥ You must kill 4/6 Lava Strykes to proceed, Sunshine at the end of the path right next to the barrier to clear the last two. Room 5 ⬥ Your Sunshine from the previous room will still be ongoing to clear the 3 Black Dragons at the start. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• build to 100 at the last Dragon at the end of the path in preparation for Verak Lith. Verak Lith The second encounter of the Laboratory, his attack rotation is very predictable but deals consistent moderately high damage so it is recommended to learn the few mechanics properly to avoid any unnecessary deaths. Additionally he drops the Greater Fury Codex . It will always melee auto attack when the player is in melee distance and always mage otherwise. The auto attacks hit quite hard and specifically the mage ones are desynced visually so it is important to not mess up too many prayer flicks here. Verak Lith's Attack Rotation 4 Auto attacks → Spire → 4 Auto attacks → Ricochet → 4 Auto attacks → Spire → 4 Auto Attacks → Nosedive/Hurricanes → Repeat Mechanics ⬥ Spire : The message "Verak Lith slams his tail against the ground, the earth shakes beneath your feet!" will appear and after a short delay and spire with 15,000 hp will spawn near the player. The boss will be immune to damage while the spire is alive so it is good to threshold to get it down immediately. The spawn will also be accompanied by a moderate melee hit that can be Resonanced . In a typical kill, this will be the primary method alongside Soul Split flicking to restore HP. ⬥ Ricochet : Verak Lith will send out a projectile that lands at a spot around the player after a few seconds. The element of this projectile can be poison, ice, or shock, and corresponds with the three groups of eggs found around the arena. The correct way to deal with this mechanic is to pick up the projectile and interact with a different type of egg to disperse it before the bar fills up. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Missing the projectile will deal 4000 damage and missing the dispersal can deal 9000+ damage so it is especially important not to miss the second half of this mechanic. Generally, if the projectile matches the element of the nearest group of eggs to the player, it should be ignored with Disruption Shield , Debilitate , or Reflect (or nothing if the player is high HP). This will end the mechanic early. A player picks up the projectile ⬥ Nosedive : A message will appear on the screen mentioning that a dragon is nosediving. An arrow will show up near the player to indicate the direction the dragon is approaching from and, after a short delay, a thin line of dragonbreath will be fired along the line the arrow is pointing. This can deal over 8000 magic damage and can be avoided by simply moving out of the way. However, the arrow will adjust it's position based on the player's movement for a short period so it is recommended to learn the timing on this mechanic and move as it goes off. ⬥ Hurricanes : Verak Lith will say "Let the flames melt the flesh from your bones" and engulf the area around the player in fire. This will deal no damage but after a short delay, hurricanes will spawn in the area that deal extremely high damage and last for roughly 20 seconds. This is a fairly large area attack and should be surged from to be a safe distance away. It isn't very complicated however, simply don't touch a hurricane. Projectile is fired Hurricanes unleashed Section 3 ⬥ Really straightforward just spam Dominion Mines and Sunshine at those spots. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can skip the two Onyx Dragons at the start and the other two Hydrix Dragons in the middle. Black Stone Dragon The Black Stone Dragon is the final boss encounter in the Dragonkin Laboratory and is the main source of the dungeon's primary unique: Draconic Energies , which are used to make the Mage T92 Elite Tectonic set . Alongside dropping the Greater Barge Codex , which sees frequent use in endgame melee encounters. This fight consists of fairly simple mechanics but can be very punishing if mistakes are made. It is also one of the few bosses to auto attack in all three combat styles, with melee hitting especially hard, so it is possible to die just from auto attacks if the player can't outheal with soul split, is low on food, and/or can't prayer flick the fight. Attack Rotation ⬥ Phase 1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 Auto Attacks → Gemstone Spikes → 2 Auto Attacks → Dragonbreath → Repeat ⬥ Phase 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Black Hands ⬥ Phase 3 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1-5 Auto Attacks → Smoke Spiral → 3 Auto Attacks → Mage AoE → 2 Auto Attacks → Dragonbreath → Gemstone Spikes → 3 Auto Attacks → Mage AoE → Repeat Mechanics ⬥ Gemstone Spikes : This mechanic occurs a few auto attacks into the start of the fight and after each dragonbreath after phase 1. This is identical to the hydrix dragon special attack where a line of spikes are shot through the ground and erupt under the player. This deals 5000+ melee damage and drains all adrenaline upon impact. It will also apply a debuff that reduces all adrenaline gain by 50% for a short duration. Simply move out of the way when this comes out. ⬥ Dragonbreath : The skybox will turn dark blue and Black Stone Dragon will fire a 100% accuracy mage attack that deals moderate damage. This is essentially just a mage auto attack that hits slightly harder but signals that the spikes are coming out immediately after (phase 3). ⬥ Black Hands (Phase 2): Phase 2 will begin as Black Stone Dragon's first attack after reaching 520k HP. This is signaled by Black Stone Dragon moving to the center of the arena and 4 black hands with 80,000 hp each spawning where the rocks are located. These hands will slam the ground regularly and send out a very heavy mage auto if they are in range of the player. Shortly after, a line of small hands will move towards the player that deal rapid 2000+ damage if stood on. These hands will never reach the player if they are standing in one of the four spots pictured below. The phase will end when all 4 hands are dead, dominion mines are highly recommended here as you can potentially use 6 if you placed some during phase 1. ⬥ Smoke Spiral : A line of smoke will spiral inwards towards Black Stone Dragon, dealing 4000+ damage per tick if stood on. The boss will remain stationary during this time so Flanking is possible here. It is recommended to learn where you can stand safely to avoid having to cancel channeled abilities. Generally, a max range Sunshine to the sides of the boss will provide decent freedom of movement and allow for Flanking ⬥ Mage AoE : Black Stone Dragon will call out "GET. OUT. OF. ME." or "The shadow overwhelms!" and turn to fire a black projectile towards a random spot in the arena. This is very similar to Verak Lith's hurricanes special and will explode into black tendrils that deal 4000+ damage in the area for a short period. In a solo encounter, this will miss most of the time and isn't a big concern. The boss can also be flanked when it turns to send out the special. ⬥ Fly : Upon hitting 260,000 hp, Black Stone Dragon will become invulnerable and fly around the arena, landing at various spots and sending out smoke lines towards the player each time. Additional lines will also spawn out of existing ones on each land, so movement can get hectic if the boss lands at the same area multiple times. This smoke is functionally identical to the type in the spiral mechanic and should be avoided at all costs. This will occur 7 times before the boss becomes vulnerable again and continues the phase 3 rotation starting from Smoke Spiral. The lines will not spawn if the boss lands out of range but it is still highly recommended to follow and use an ability after each landing as the boss will take longer to fly again if the player stays far away. Example Run https://youtu.be/lsris6thu8g - 18:02 no food no bank run by #Linie https://youtu.be/rQDaUsbrbQM - 14:38 by #Onyksi

This will end the mechanic early. A player picks up the projectile ⬥ Nosedive : A message will appear on the screen mentioning that a dragon is nosediving. An arrow will show up near the player to indicate the direction the dragon is approaching from and, after a short delay, a thin line of dragonbreath will be fired along the line the arrow is pointing. This can deal over 8000 magic damage and can be avoided by simply moving out of the way. However, the arrow will adjust it's position based on the player's movement for a short period so it is recommended to learn the timing on this mechanic and move as it goes off. ⬥ Hurricanes : Verak Lith will say "Let the flames melt the flesh from your bones" and engulf the area around the player in fire. This will deal no damage but after a short delay, hurricanes will spawn in the area that deal extremely high damage and last for roughly 20 seconds. This is a fairly large area attack and should be surged from to be a safe distance away. It isn't very complicated however, simply don't touch a hurricane. Projectile is fired Hurricanes unleashed
docs.title: Verak Lith

docs.text: ⬥ Really straightforward just spam Dominion Mines and Sunshine at those spots. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can skip the two Onyx Dragons at the start and the other two Hydrix Dragons in the middle.
docs.title: Section 3

docs.text: The Black Stone Dragon is the final boss encounter in the Dragonkin Laboratory and is the main source of the dungeon's primary unique: Draconic Energies , which are used to make the Mage T92 Elite Tectonic set . Alongside dropping the Greater Barge Codex , which sees frequent use in endgame melee encounters. This fight consists of fairly simple mechanics but can be very punishing if mistakes are made. It is also one of the few bosses to auto attack in all three combat styles, with melee hitting especially hard, so it is possible to die just from auto attacks if the player can't outheal with soul split, is low on food, and/or can't prayer flick the fight. Attack Rotation ⬥ Phase 1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 Auto Attacks → Gemstone Spikes → 2 Auto Attacks → Dragonbreath → Repeat ⬥ Phase 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Black Hands ⬥ Phase 3 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1-5 Auto Attacks → Smoke Spiral → 3 Auto Attacks → Mage AoE → 2 Auto Attacks → Dragonbreath → Gemstone Spikes → 3 Auto Attacks → Mage AoE → Repeat Mechanics ⬥ Gemstone Spikes : This mechanic occurs a few auto attacks into the start of the fight and after each dragonbreath after phase 1. This is identical to the hydrix dragon special attack where a line of spikes are shot through the ground and erupt under the player. This deals 5000+ melee damage and drains all adrenaline upon impact. It will also apply a debuff that reduces all adrenaline gain by 50% for a short duration. Simply move out of the way when this comes out. ⬥ Dragonbreath : The skybox will turn dark blue and Black Stone Dragon will fire a 100% accuracy mage attack that deals moderate damage. This is essentially just a mage auto attack that hits slightly harder but signals that the spikes are coming out immediately after (phase 3). ⬥ Black Hands (Phase 2): Phase 2 will begin as Black Stone Dragon's first attack after reaching 520k HP. This is signaled by Black Stone Dragon moving to the center of the arena and 4 black hands with 80,000 hp each spawning where the rocks are located. These hands will slam the ground regularly and send out a very heavy mage auto if they are in range of the player. Shortly after, a line of small hands will move towards the player that deal rapid 2000+ damage if stood on. These hands will never reach the player if they are standing in one of the four spots pictured below. The phase will end when all 4 hands are dead, dominion mines are highly recommended here as you can potentially use 6 if you placed some during phase 1. ⬥ Smoke Spiral : A line of smoke will spiral inwards towards Black Stone Dragon, dealing 4000+ damage per tick if stood on. The boss will remain stationary during this time so Flanking is possible here. It is recommended to learn where you can stand safely to avoid having to cancel channeled abilities. Generally, a max range Sunshine to the sides of the boss will provide decent freedom of movement and allow for Flanking ⬥ Mage AoE : Black Stone Dragon will call out "GET. OUT. OF. ME." or "The shadow overwhelms!" and turn to fire a black projectile towards a random spot in the arena. This is very similar to Verak Lith's hurricanes special and will explode into black tendrils that deal 4000+ damage in the area for a short period. In a solo encounter, this will miss most of the time and isn't a big concern. The boss can also be flanked when it turns to send out the special. ⬥ Fly : Upon hitting 260,000 hp, Black Stone Dragon will become invulnerable and fly around the arena, landing at various spots and sending out smoke lines towards the player each time. Additional lines will also spawn out of existing ones on each land, so movement can get hectic if the boss lands at the same area multiple times. This smoke is functionally identical to the type in the spiral mechanic and should be avoided at all costs. This will occur 7 times before the boss becomes vulnerable again and continues the phase 3 rotation starting from Smoke Spiral. The lines will not spawn if the boss lands out of range but it is still highly recommended to follow and use an ability after each landing as the boss will take longer to fly again if the player stays far away.
docs.title: Black Stone Dragon

docs.text: Dragonkin laboratory melee Dragonkin Laboratory (Courtesy of #Terpsichore) Introduction The second Elite Dungeon released, the Dragonkin Laboratory is a relatively straightforward encounter. Categorized as mid tier PvM, the encounter is useful for anyone wanting to learn how to deal with large mobs as well as bosses, combining aspects of single target and AoE damage. The three bosses of the Laboratory drop the Greater Flurry, Greater Fury and Greater Barge codices in the order that they appear, improving your Melee techniques vital to end-game PvM Each solo run of ED2 is worth 9,276,146 in uniques. Advanced players can get up to 4 kph, earning on average 37,104,586 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ You can Surge Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry. ⬥ The Corbicula Rex perk (112 Farming) in ROoT is extremely helpful in this dungeon, as Meteor Strike is frequently used here. Presets Universal ⬥ Dragon Slayer ability - works on all dragons, including bosses. ⬥ Dragon Slayer perk - works on all dragons, including bosses. ⬥ Tuska's Wrath - hits for high damage against your current slayer assignment. It does not deal extra damage against the bosses in this dungeon. ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves - can be camped for the full dungeon. ⬥ Ring of Death - its passive gives a 50% chance to gain an additional 5% adrenaline when killing any monster in the dungeon. ⬥ Dominion Mines - used against high life point mobs and certain boss mechanics. ⬥ Sticky Bombs - used to prevent Celestial dragons from using their special attack. Note: it is recommended to calculate melee hit chance of the loadout you plan to use against the dragons in the dungeon, and judge which weapons you intend to use against which dragon. Beginner/Group Melee ⬥ Dragon Bane Longsword Precise 6 - used against bosses and dragon mobs depending on hit chance. ⬥ Dragon Bane 2h Sword Precise 6 + Equilibrium 4 - used against bosses and dragon mobs depending on hit chance. ⬥ Enhanced Excalibur Mobile ⬥ Reaper Necklace is preferred depending on hit chance against monsters. It is highly recommended to calculate the hit chance of your set up against the monsters in the dungeon. ⬥ Food can be swapped out for Spiritual Prayers as needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally solid food is fine, as you are typically only healing between encounters the adrenaline loss is acceptable. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Guthix Rests and Jellyfish are preferred. ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Advanced/Solo Melee ⬥ Fury of the Small - Rotations in this guide take advantage of the Fury of the Small relic for extra adrenaline and must be modified if the relic is not active. ⬥ Dragon Bane Longsword Precise 6 Aftershock 1 - used against bosses and dragon mobs depending on hit chance. The efficacy of dragon bane 2h is lessened as more upgrades are accumulated. ⬥ Terrasaur Maul - can be used against Black Hands during the Black Stone Dragon fight. ⬥ Off-hand Drygore Mace Flanking 4 ⬥ Essence of Finality Dragon Claws stored ⬥ Seren Godbow - used in conjunction with Ingenuity of the Humans or by removing enough melee armor to ensure it hits. ⬥ Reaver's Ring - used against bosses and dragons mobs depending on hit chance. ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Note: This set up assumes Borrowed Power is set to Smoke Cloud . Alternatively use "Non-Magic" . Monster Information Note: No monster in ED2 has a slayer requirement to damage. Laboratory Slime ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 (Spawnlings: 10,000) ⬥ Special Attack : After every odd-numbered auto attack they will spawn a smaller slime with similar damage output. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If killed, these spawnlings do not count toward opening any barriers. ⬥ They attack with rapid, low-damage melee attacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As they often spawn in groups their damage will quickly stack up if not dealt with or evaded. Lava Spider ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ They attack with very rapid, low-damage ranged attacks with very long range. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As they often spawn in groups their damage will quickly stack up if not dealt with or evaded. ⬥ There are no critical path barriers that require Lava Spiders to be defeated. If the goal is fast, full runs, all Lava Spiders can be ignored. Chromatic Dragons ⬥ Life Points : Red Dragon: 29,000; Black Dragon: 39,000 ⬥ These are very basic and have no mechanical differences compared to overworld counterparts. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage melee and magic attacks. Magma Golem ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 ⬥ They are much weaker in general compared to their Lost Grove counterparts and have no special attacks. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage, halberd-range melee attacks. Animated Book ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ A basic, high damage output enemy. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage melee , ranged , and magic attacks. Celestial Dragon ⬥ Life Points : 48,000 ⬥ The melee and magic defence of ED2 celestial dragons is drastically reduced compared to their counterparts on Dragontooth Isle. ⬥ Special Attack : After being damaged under 36,000 life points, rapidly heal 2,400 life points per tick for 9 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This special attack will be repeated every 6 auto attacks after its first use. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This effect can be canceled early or prevented alltogether by stunning or binding the dragon as or before it occurs. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Most stuns and binds will cancel this effect including: stunning/binding abilities , binding spells , or sticky bombs . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• They do not have access to the special attack of the celestial dragons in the Dragontooth Isle resource dungeon. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage melee and magic attacks. Lava Strykewyrm ⬥ Life Points : 30,000 ⬥ These are significantly weaker than their counterparts near the Lava Maze, and cannot use any of their special attacks. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage magic attacks. Gemstone Dragons ⬥ Life Points : Dragonstone Dragon: 55,000; Onyx Dragon: 60,000; Hydrix Dragon: 75,000 ⬥ The melee and magic defence of ED2 gemstone dragons is drastically reduced compared to their counterparts on Karamja. ⬥ Each gemstone dragon has a special, slow moving, 3x3 aoe attack with an extra effect. They will not use this attack in melee distance. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dragonstone Dragon: Reduces antifire potion timers. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Onyx Dragon: Heals the dragon. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hydrix Dragon: Drains adrenaline to 0% and temporarily halves adrenaline gain. ⬥ They each attack with moderate-damage melee and magic attacks. Section 1 In terms of raw damage intake, Section 1 has some of the most strenuous and intense rooms in the dungeon. Laboratory Slimes, Spiders, and Magma Golems can stack up their damage extremely quickly, and the Celestial dragons can output a lot of damage in their own right. If committed to using Erethdor's grimoire in the dungeon, it may still be worth camping Scrimshaw of vampyrism in the more populated rooms, if only to prevent having to eat through all of your supplies before Astellarn. Room 1 (Defeat 4 Laboratory Slimes) ⬥ Surge forward into the chest then cut the corner by Bladed Diving down the steps. ⬥ Only 3 slimes spawn on either side of the room, so at least one must be lured to the other side to aoe enough to clear the barrier. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Damage from laboratory slimes will rapidly stack up if the room is not dealt with quickly. → → (If necessary) + → Room 2 (Defeat 3 Red Dragons) ⬥ A safe, consistent way to handle this room is to Surge down the steps, Bladed Dive toward the red dragon on the second set of stairs, and Surge down to the wall down the stairs. This will consistently lure the other two red dragons together at the top of the stairs to easily aoe them. ⬥ Berserk as soon as possible against the first red dragon, continue your berserk using aoes against the next two, and finish your berserk on the red dragons past this barrier. + → → → (on-task) → (build) → + → (aoe) Room 3 (Defeat 4 Red Dragons) ⬥ Finish your Berserk while aoeing the closest pack of 3 red dragons. Build adrenaline to prepare to use Meteor Strike against the magma golems on the bridge after you defeat the fourth red dragon. (finish) → (aoe) → (build) Room 4 (Defeat 4 Magma Golems) ⬥ Surge down the bridge and use Meteor Strike against 4+ Magma golems as soon as possible. Finish them off with aoes until the barrier is cleared. → → (If necessary) + → Room 5 (Defeat 1 Celestial and 2 Slimes/Books) ⬥ From the bridge, Bladed Dive + Surge behind the celestial dragon. Apply your bleeds, preferably walking Slaughter , and then use a sticky bomb to pre-bind it. If executed correctly, you may finish off the celestial and two slimes with aoes as the sticky bomb will cancel the celestial dragon's healing special attack. ⬥ Damage will add up very quickly in this room. Watch your life points and finish it quickly. (walked) → (bleeds) + → (aoe) Room 6 (Defeat 3 Celestial Dragons) ⬥ After clearing the barrier, use a defensive ability and Surge through the door. This will allow the use of Devotion without draining adrenaline. ⬥ Build with basics to use Berserk as soon as possible. Use aoes to clear the 3 celestial dragons. → → (aoe) + (spam) Room 7 (Defeat 1 Celestial Dragon) ⬥ Ideally, use a Sticky bomb , finish your Berserk on the next dragon, and finish it with bleeds and thresholds. (finish) + → (thresholds) Room 8 (Defeat 1 Celestial Dragon) ⬥ Surge down the steps to lure the non-critical path celestial dragon and block the slimes from following you down. ⬥ Use a Sticky bomb and kill the celestial dragon closest to the boss barrier. End with greater than ~60% adrenaline minimum. (on-task) + → (bleeds) → (build to 60%+ adrenaline) Astellarn, the First Celestial Overview ⬥ Life Points : 250,000 ⬥ Special Drops ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Flurry Codex ⬥ Attack Rotation Pulsar → Wyrmhole → Neutron Star → White Hole Mechanics ⬥ Damage Reduction - Upon reaching 200k life points, Astellarn will gain strong damage reduction. This is applied following her first auto attack after she is damaged under 200k life points. ⬥ Pulsar - Astellarn spawns small orange orb with 20k life points that periodically deals moderate "cannon-type" damage and is successible to ‎ ‎Dominion mines . It is highly recommended to kill this soon after it spawns. ⬥ Celestial Rain - Upon reaching 200k life points, Astellarn will targets a quadrant of the boss room with a low-damaging typeless-damage aoe effect that ramps up if stood in for too long. ⬥ Wyrmhole - Astellarn will mark a player with a blue bar. When the bar empties it will drop a black circle on the floor that deals moderate typeless damage when stood in. ⬥ Neutron Star - A small black orb with an orange trail that will explode, dealing severe typeless damage to the player that came in contact with it. Must be lured into the wyrmhole to progress the boss fight. ⬥ White Hole - Once the Neutron star is lured into the Wyrmhole, the aoe will turn white. When a player stands on top of it, Astellarn's damage reduction will be removed, and the player's damage output will be boosted even further. Note: Due to the way the attack timing is determined, it is possible for the wyrmhole and neutron star to desynchonize. Be aware that it is possible, but very rare, for the neutron star to spawn before the wyrmhole is placed. Strategy ⬥ Astellarn can be a very punishing and complex boss ‎ ‎for beginners, especially when using melee, but once the mechanics are understood and handled properly she becomes a very consistent encounter. ⬥ Unlike most bosses, Astellarn's boss fight timer does not start until she is attacked. Keeping this in mind, it is still important to start the boss fight as soon as possible, both for overall dungeon clear time, and because it is possible for slimes from previous rooms to follow you into the boss room if they are not blocked by a celestial dragon, stopped by sticky bombs before the boss room, or stopped by the barrier that closes once the boss fight begins. ⬥ The beginning of the fight is straightforward. Referring to the image, it is highly recommended to only stand in the area highlighted by green. Due to a quirk in Astellarn's auto attack AI, she will only attack with magic autos while you are standing in the green area, while standing anywhere else will allow her to use all of magic , ranged , and ‎ ‎melee autos. Standing in this area significantly reduces her damage output on you, and makes soul split flicking her attacks much easier. ⬥ The goal of the first part of the boss fight is to damage Astellarn to under 200k life points (upon which she will gain massive damage reduction) before she spawns her first pulsar. Regardless of her life points, when the pulsar spawns, use dismember on it, drop your dominion mines, and finish it off with basics. Generally by the time this is accomplished, Astellarn will have already marked you with a secondary bar under your adrenaline that counts down until an aoe damaging "Wyrmhole" is placed underneath you. ⬥ Ideally, this wyrmhole is placed in melee distance, on one of the axes denoted in the image by red, perpendicular lines. The best placement location for this special attack on the axis marked by a red "X" on the image. This placement ensures that the next mechanic, the Neutron star, will not spawn on top of you, ruining the kill. ⬥ Once the wyrmhole is placed, build adrenaline for berserk and lure the slow moving Neutron star toward the wyrmhole. Once the Neutron star moves into the Wyrmhole, the aoe on the ground will turn white and boost the damage you deal while you stand on top of it. Following this, use Berserk + Adrenaline renewal → , and finish your Berserk rotation. Rotations ⬥ Phase 1 (dw) + → (4taa) + → (t92) → 188s → s → r + to prephase Note: Must be "fastest" mh speed to 4taa after barge; dbane will not work. ⬥ Pulsar + → basics → into position for wyrmhole ⬥ Phase 1.5 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Build to 100%. If needed, and/or Astellarn's auto attacks while waiting for the Neutron star to be lured. If you have a lot of extra adrenaline, it's possible to apply bleeds to the boss for some extra damage during and after luring the neutron star. ⬥ Phase 2 + → → → → → (t92) → → → → or unequip-armor at approx. 35,000 life points Note: This rotation should net consistent approximately 50 second kills or better. Room 10 (Defeat 2 Celestials) ⬥ Surge toward the two celestial dragons. Use your bleeds on the first one, walk Slaughter , and use a Sticky bomb to cancel its special attack. Use aoe abilities, thresholds, and sticky bombs to finish them off. → (walked) + → (aoe) Room 11 (Defeat 2 Lava Strykewyrms) ⬥ Bladed Dive down the steps after the barrier opens, then Surge toward the 2 Lava Strykewyrms near the barrier on the far end of the room. ⬥ Greater Barge onto one, bleed Assault ⬥ Finish them off with aoes. → → (tc) + (if necessary) + → Section 2 Section 2 is significantly more relaxed compared to the previous section; however, it can also be more difficult to stack up and aoe the Black dragons compared to the much smaller and closely packed Slimes, Golems, and Celestials of the previous areas. Focus heavily on damage output, smart usage of long cooldowns, and efficient movement and lures. Verak Lith is also a comparatively much more simple boss than Astellarn. Room 1 (Defeat 4 Black Dragons) ⬥ After the two Strykewyrms, use a dose of Powerburst of Acceleration and Surge + Bladed Dive around the corner to the first black dragon. ⬥ Use your bleeds, on-task Tuska's Wrath if it is available, then Surge + Bladed Dive toward the barrier to lure the other three black dragons together. ⬥ Use ZGS special attack or Meteor Strike and finish them off with aoes and thresholds. + + → (first dragon) (walked) → → (on-task) → + (to barrier) (remaining dragons) / → (aoe) Room 2 (Defeat 6 Black Dragons) ⬥ Surge through the barrier as it opens and use bleeds against the first black dragon. ⬥ Build to Berserk and use aoes to kill as many black dragons as possible before it runs out. ⬥ Finish any remaining black dragons with bleeds and thresholds. (first dragon) (walked) → → (build) → → (aoe) Room 3 (Defeat 4 Lava Strykewyrms) ⬥ Any four strykewyrms can be killed to open the next barrier, however it is recommended to kill them in pairs. ⬥ Utilize bleeds; and aoes with a halberd-range weapon. (first 2 Strykewyrms for aoe Cleave and last 2 Strykes to be close to the barrier as it opens) (bleeds) → (aoes) Room 4 (Defeat 4 Black Dragons) ⬥ Surge or Bladed Dive through the barrier. Depending on how the black dragons are clumped together, utilize bleeds, aoes, and/or the ZGS special attack to defeat them. ⬥ Finish off the last black dragon while building to Berserk and preparing for Verak Lith. (first 3 dragons) → (aoes) (last dragon) → (build to 100%) Verak Lith Overview ⬥ Life Points : 600,000 ⬥ Special Drops ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Fury Codex ⬥ Attack Rotation 4 Autos → Spire → 4 Autos → Egg Bomb → 4 Autos → Spire → 4 Autos → Divebomb → 4 Autos → Spire → Egg Bomb → 4 Autos → tornados → repeat Mechanics ⬥ Spire - Verak Lith becomes immune to most damage and spawns a spire with 15k life points for each player in the room that deals 100% accurate, moderate melee damage as it spawns. Familiars can still damage Verak Lith while the spire is alive. ⬥ Egg Bomb ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Verak Lith hits everyone in the room with a moderate damage magic attack that bounces from the player and places a marker on the ground. The intended way to deal with this mechanic is to catch the bomb as it lands on the marker, take note of the element of the bomb (Shock, Ice, or Poison), and match it with one of the opposing clusters of eggs in the boss room. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If the bomb is not caught by the player, it will deal 4000 soft-typeless aoe damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If not matched to an opposing egg, the energy will discharge, dealing 9000 soft-typeless damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As the first part of this special attack is soft-typeless , the optimal way to deal with this mechanic is to simply tank it using Disruption Shield , Resonance , or a Powerburst of Vitality . ⬥ Divebomb - Verak Lith calls down a dragon that will deal severe magic damage in a line, similar to Vindicta's fire attack, after a short delay. It is best dealt with by simply moving out of the way. ⬥ Tornados - Verak Lith places a cluster of flaming tornados on the players location. After activating, they deal rapid, severe magic damage if not avoided. Run far away to ensure you are not stacked out. Seeing this special attack can be indicative of a slow kill. Strategy ⬥ Though straightforward, the Verak Lith fight can be punishing to players with low damage output. Spires must be dispatched quickly to ensure enough time to damage the boss before the next Spire spawns, and each additional Spire will slow the encounter down significantly. Therefore, the aim, like many bosses, is to output as much damage as possible, using as many boosts as are available to the player, while dealing with mechanics as they come. If followed well, this rotation will result in consistent 1:20 to 1:30 kills or better. At this speed, Verak Lith's tornado attack will be completely skipped. ⬥ Verak Lith deals moderate to high damage, using only melee attacks in melee distance, and only magic attacks outside of melee distance. Rotations + → (2 ticks) → → (tc) + (dw) + → (4taa) + → → (t92) → → → → Spire (tc) + → (basics) → (walked) → → → + (2h auto) → → → → → Spire (tc) + → (basics) / → + → → → → + → → → → Note: If the fight is not over at this point, kill the spire with + basics and finish Verak Lith off with bleeds and basics. Save for the next barrier. Section 3 Section 3 is much like Section 2 in that the enemies will have a difficult time stacking out your life points (though they can still do a lot of damage if you aren't careful), but it can also be easier to get better lures on the Gemstones compared to the previous Black Dragons. Be very aware of Hydrix dragon special attacks as getting hit by one may force you out of the dungeon due to its high damage and adrenaline drain. Room 1 (Defeat 3 Dragonstone dragons and 1 Onyx dragon) ⬥ Move back out of the boss room, toward the bank chest and teleport to option 4: 'Kalist Kiket Fia'. Bladed Dive + Surge across the bridge and toward the barrier. Greater Barge on the nearest of the 3 dragonstone dragons, bleed Assault and dump bleeds. ⬥ Bladed Dive in between the other 3 dragons, build to ZGS Special Attack or Berserk depending on cooldowns, and clear them with aoes and thresholds. (closest dragonstone) → → (on-task) → (bleeds) (into pack of 2 dragonstones+onyx) → / (as soon as possible) → → (aoe) Room 2 (Defeat 2 Dragonstone dragons) ⬥ If Berserk was skipped, Berserk here and clear the dragons with aoes → → + → (aoe) Room 3 (Defeat 2 Dragonstone dragons) ⬥ Use a dose of Powerburst of Acceleration then Bladed Dive + Surge around the corner to the next two dragonstone dragons. ⬥ Clear them with bleeds and aoes. + → → + → (if available) → (bleeds) → (aoe) Room 4 (Defeat 2 Dragonstone dragons) ⬥ Surge toward the final two dragonstone dragons. ⬥ On-task Tuska's Wrath if available, clear them with bleeds and thresholds. → → → (on-task) → (bleeds) → (aoe) Black Stone Dragon Overview ⬥ Life Points : 650,000 (Black Hands: 80,000) ⬥ Special Drops : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Barge Codex ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Draconic Energy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Inert Black Stone Crystal ⬥ Attack Rotation ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Phase 1 (650k - 520k) 3 Autos → Gemstone Spikes → 2 Autos → Dragonbreath → Repeat ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Phase 2 : Black Hands ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Phase 3 (520k - 260k, flying, 260k-0) 1-5 Autos → Smoke Spiral → 3 Autos → Mage aoe → 2 Autos → Dragon Breath → Gemstone Spikes → 3 Autos → Mage aoe → Smoke Spiral → Repeat after Smoke Spiral Mechanics ⬥ Gemstone Spikes - This attack is extremely similar to the Hydrix Gemstone dragon special attack encountered earlier in the dungeon. Upon impact it deals high melee damage, drains adrenaline to 0%, and temporarily halves adrenaline gain. ⬥ Dragonbreath - A moderate damage magic attack with extremely high accuracy. Note: this does not do "dragonfire"-type damage. ⬥ Smoke Spiral - The Black Stone Dragon will root itself in place while a smoke cloud that deals severe typeless damage spirals around it. No matter where it starts, the spiral will never hit a player standing directly behind Black Stone Dragon's tail. It is possible to flank the boss by standing in position while this special attack is occurring. ⬥ Mage AoE - Similar to Verak Lith's tornados, Black Stone Dragon sends several smoke clouds out to somewhere in the boss room. Standing in this area will result in rapid, severe magic damage. Strategy ⬥ The Black Stone Dragon is the final encounter in the Dragonkin Laboratory. Though her attack speed is relatively slow, she can utilize high-damage magic , ranged , and melee auto attacks, and has very strong area denial mechanics. ⬥ After being damaged to 520k life points, during the time of her next attack she will become immune to damage and four level 122 Black Hands with 80k life points will spawn at the shackles surrounding her. These Black Hands will periodically slap at the ground and fire off high damage magic attack. After this attack lands, a line of shadow hands will spawn out of the hand in a line toward where the tile the attack landed in. These shadow hands deal very rapid, severe typeless damage. Optimally, the best way to deal with this attack is to allow the magic attack to hit you, move to another side of the hand one tick later, and continue attacking. These enemies are susceptable to the Terrasaur maul and Dominion mines . ⬥ In addition to this magic attack, black hands also have a low damage melee attack that may, under currently unknown circumstances, target familiars for inconsequential damage. ⬥ After the four Black Hands have been destroyed, retarget the Black Stone Dragon and continue the rotation until 260k life points, being aware that a smoke spiral special attack will quickly follow the Black Hands phase. Following this, she will jump into the air, land in another place in the boss room and fire out a slow moving, rapid typeless damage line of smoke. After landing 7 times, the fight will continue until the boss is dead. Rotations ⬥ Phase 1 + → (2 ticks) → → (tc) + (dw) + → (4taa) + → → (t92) → → → / (to prephase depending on adren and life points) ⬥ Phase 2 : Black Hands ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hand 1 (tc) + + → → (basics) → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hand 2 + → + (2h auto) → → → (basics) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hand 3 / → → + → → → + → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hand 4 + (finish zerk) (basics) → ⬥ Phase 3 (walked) + → → → → (4taa) + (dw) → + (2h auto) → → (flank) + → → → → → (3 hit) → (flank) → → (walked) → (basics) → (dump at ~265k life points) ⬥ Flying : Build while avoiding smoke lines she leaves when she lands. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Prioritize → → build for then Berserk → when she lands the last time. ⬥ Post-Flying + + → → (flank) → → + (t92) → → → → → (walked) → → → → → (dump) Example Runs https://youtu.be/yus2b6Di2xY - 15:40 no-sgb/maul, pre-smoke cloud; on-task by #Terpsichore https://youtu.be/qAGd1KLGjeA - 14:19 pre-smoke cloud; on-task by #Finah
docs.title: Dragonkin laboratory melee

docs.text: The second Elite Dungeon released, the Dragonkin Laboratory is a relatively straightforward encounter. Categorized as mid tier PvM, the encounter is useful for anyone wanting to learn how to deal with large mobs as well as bosses, combining aspects of single target and AoE damage. The three bosses of the Laboratory drop the Greater Flurry, Greater Fury and Greater Barge codices in the order that they appear, improving your Melee techniques vital to end-game PvM Each solo run of ED2 is worth 9,276,146 in uniques. Advanced players can get up to 4 kph, earning on average 37,104,586 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ You can Surge Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry. ⬥ The Corbicula Rex perk (112 Farming) in ROoT is extremely helpful in this dungeon, as Meteor Strike is frequently used here.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Universal ⬥ Dragon Slayer ability - works on all dragons, including bosses. ⬥ Dragon Slayer perk - works on all dragons, including bosses. ⬥ Tuska's Wrath - hits for high damage against your current slayer assignment. It does not deal extra damage against the bosses in this dungeon. ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves - can be camped for the full dungeon. ⬥ Ring of Death - its passive gives a 50% chance to gain an additional 5% adrenaline when killing any monster in the dungeon. ⬥ Dominion Mines - used against high life point mobs and certain boss mechanics. ⬥ Sticky Bombs - used to prevent Celestial dragons from using their special attack. Note: it is recommended to calculate melee hit chance of the loadout you plan to use against the dragons in the dungeon, and judge which weapons you intend to use against which dragon. Beginner/Group Melee ⬥ Dragon Bane Longsword Precise 6 - used against bosses and dragon mobs depending on hit chance. ⬥ Dragon Bane 2h Sword Precise 6 + Equilibrium 4 - used against bosses and dragon mobs depending on hit chance. ⬥ Enhanced Excalibur Mobile ⬥ Reaper Necklace is preferred depending on hit chance against monsters. It is highly recommended to calculate the hit chance of your set up against the monsters in the dungeon. ⬥ Food can be swapped out for Spiritual Prayers as needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally solid food is fine, as you are typically only healing between encounters the adrenaline loss is acceptable. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Guthix Rests and Jellyfish are preferred. ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Advanced/Solo Melee ⬥ Fury of the Small - Rotations in this guide take advantage of the Fury of the Small relic for extra adrenaline and must be modified if the relic is not active. ⬥ Dragon Bane Longsword Precise 6 Aftershock 1 - used against bosses and dragon mobs depending on hit chance. The efficacy of dragon bane 2h is lessened as more upgrades are accumulated. ⬥ Terrasaur Maul - can be used against Black Hands during the Black Stone Dragon fight. ⬥ Off-hand Drygore Mace Flanking 4 ⬥ Essence of Finality Dragon Claws stored ⬥ Seren Godbow - used in conjunction with Ingenuity of the Humans or by removing enough melee armor to ensure it hits. ⬥ Reaver's Ring - used against bosses and dragons mobs depending on hit chance. ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Note: This set up assumes Borrowed Power is set to Smoke Cloud . Alternatively use "Non-Magic" .
docs.title: Presets

docs.text: Note: No monster in ED2 has a slayer requirement to damage. Laboratory Slime ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 (Spawnlings: 10,000) ⬥ Special Attack : After every odd-numbered auto attack they will spawn a smaller slime with similar damage output. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If killed, these spawnlings do not count toward opening any barriers. ⬥ They attack with rapid, low-damage melee attacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As they often spawn in groups their damage will quickly stack up if not dealt with or evaded. Lava Spider ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ They attack with very rapid, low-damage ranged attacks with very long range. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As they often spawn in groups their damage will quickly stack up if not dealt with or evaded. ⬥ There are no critical path barriers that require Lava Spiders to be defeated. If the goal is fast, full runs, all Lava Spiders can be ignored. Chromatic Dragons ⬥ Life Points : Red Dragon: 29,000; Black Dragon: 39,000 ⬥ These are very basic and have no mechanical differences compared to overworld counterparts. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage melee and magic attacks. Magma Golem ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 ⬥ They are much weaker in general compared to their Lost Grove counterparts and have no special attacks. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage, halberd-range melee attacks. Animated Book ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ A basic, high damage output enemy. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage melee , ranged , and magic attacks. Celestial Dragon ⬥ Life Points : 48,000 ⬥ The melee and magic defence of ED2 celestial dragons is drastically reduced compared to their counterparts on Dragontooth Isle. ⬥ Special Attack : After being damaged under 36,000 life points, rapidly heal 2,400 life points per tick for 9 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This special attack will be repeated every 6 auto attacks after its first use. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This effect can be canceled early or prevented alltogether by stunning or binding the dragon as or before it occurs. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Most stuns and binds will cancel this effect including: stunning/binding abilities , binding spells , or sticky bombs . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• They do not have access to the special attack of the celestial dragons in the Dragontooth Isle resource dungeon. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage melee and magic attacks. Lava Strykewyrm ⬥ Life Points : 30,000 ⬥ These are significantly weaker than their counterparts near the Lava Maze, and cannot use any of their special attacks. ⬥ They attack with moderate-damage magic attacks. Gemstone Dragons ⬥ Life Points : Dragonstone Dragon: 55,000; Onyx Dragon: 60,000; Hydrix Dragon: 75,000 ⬥ The melee and magic defence of ED2 gemstone dragons is drastically reduced compared to their counterparts on Karamja. ⬥ Each gemstone dragon has a special, slow moving, 3x3 aoe attack with an extra effect. They will not use this attack in melee distance. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dragonstone Dragon: Reduces antifire potion timers. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Onyx Dragon: Heals the dragon. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hydrix Dragon: Drains adrenaline to 0% and temporarily halves adrenaline gain. ⬥ They each attack with moderate-damage melee and magic attacks.
docs.title: Monster Information

docs.text: In terms of raw damage intake, Section 1 has some of the most strenuous and intense rooms in the dungeon. Laboratory Slimes, Spiders, and Magma Golems can stack up their damage extremely quickly, and the Celestial dragons can output a lot of damage in their own right. If committed to using Erethdor's grimoire in the dungeon, it may still be worth camping Scrimshaw of vampyrism in the more populated rooms, if only to prevent having to eat through all of your supplies before Astellarn. Room 1 (Defeat 4 Laboratory Slimes) ⬥ Surge forward into the chest then cut the corner by Bladed Diving down the steps. ⬥ Only 3 slimes spawn on either side of the room, so at least one must be lured to the other side to aoe enough to clear the barrier. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Damage from laboratory slimes will rapidly stack up if the room is not dealt with quickly. → → (If necessary) + → Room 2 (Defeat 3 Red Dragons) ⬥ A safe, consistent way to handle this room is to Surge down the steps, Bladed Dive toward the red dragon on the second set of stairs, and Surge down to the wall down the stairs. This will consistently lure the other two red dragons together at the top of the stairs to easily aoe them. ⬥ Berserk as soon as possible against the first red dragon, continue your berserk using aoes against the next two, and finish your berserk on the red dragons past this barrier. + → → → (on-task) → (build) → + → (aoe) Room 3 (Defeat 4 Red Dragons) ⬥ Finish your Berserk while aoeing the closest pack of 3 red dragons. Build adrenaline to prepare to use Meteor Strike against the magma golems on the bridge after you defeat the fourth red dragon. (finish) → (aoe) → (build) Room 4 (Defeat 4 Magma Golems) ⬥ Surge down the bridge and use Meteor Strike against 4+ Magma golems as soon as possible. Finish them off with aoes until the barrier is cleared. → → (If necessary) + → Room 5 (Defeat 1 Celestial and 2 Slimes/Books) ⬥ From the bridge, Bladed Dive + Surge behind the celestial dragon. Apply your bleeds, preferably walking Slaughter , and then use a sticky bomb to pre-bind it. If executed correctly, you may finish off the celestial and two slimes with aoes as the sticky bomb will cancel the celestial dragon's healing special attack. ⬥ Damage will add up very quickly in this room. Watch your life points and finish it quickly. (walked) → (bleeds) + → (aoe) Room 6 (Defeat 3 Celestial Dragons) ⬥ After clearing the barrier, use a defensive ability and Surge through the door. This will allow the use of Devotion without draining adrenaline. ⬥ Build with basics to use Berserk as soon as possible. Use aoes to clear the 3 celestial dragons. → → (aoe) + (spam) Room 7 (Defeat 1 Celestial Dragon) ⬥ Ideally, use a Sticky bomb , finish your Berserk on the next dragon, and finish it with bleeds and thresholds. (finish) + → (thresholds) Room 8 (Defeat 1 Celestial Dragon) ⬥ Surge down the steps to lure the non-critical path celestial dragon and block the slimes from following you down. ⬥ Use a Sticky bomb and kill the celestial dragon closest to the boss barrier. End with greater than ~60% adrenaline minimum. (on-task) + → (bleeds) → (build to 60%+ adrenaline)
docs.title: Section 1

docs.text: Overview ⬥ Life Points : 250,000 ⬥ Special Drops ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Flurry Codex ⬥ Attack Rotation Pulsar → Wyrmhole → Neutron Star → White Hole Mechanics ⬥ Damage Reduction - Upon reaching 200k life points, Astellarn will gain strong damage reduction. This is applied following her first auto attack after she is damaged under 200k life points. ⬥ Pulsar - Astellarn spawns small orange orb with 20k life points that periodically deals moderate "cannon-type" damage and is successible to ‎ ‎Dominion mines . It is highly recommended to kill this soon after it spawns. ⬥ Celestial Rain - Upon reaching 200k life points, Astellarn will targets a quadrant of the boss room with a low-damaging typeless-damage aoe effect that ramps up if stood in for too long. ⬥ Wyrmhole - Astellarn will mark a player with a blue bar. When the bar empties it will drop a black circle on the floor that deals moderate typeless damage when stood in. ⬥ Neutron Star - A small black orb with an orange trail that will explode, dealing severe typeless damage to the player that came in contact with it. Must be lured into the wyrmhole to progress the boss fight. ⬥ White Hole - Once the Neutron star is lured into the Wyrmhole, the aoe will turn white. When a player stands on top of it, Astellarn's damage reduction will be removed, and the player's damage output will be boosted even further. Note: Due to the way the attack timing is determined, it is possible for the wyrmhole and neutron star to desynchonize. Be aware that it is possible, but very rare, for the neutron star to spawn before the wyrmhole is placed. Strategy ⬥ Astellarn can be a very punishing and complex boss ‎ ‎for beginners, especially when using melee, but once the mechanics are understood and handled properly she becomes a very consistent encounter. ⬥ Unlike most bosses, Astellarn's boss fight timer does not start until she is attacked. Keeping this in mind, it is still important to start the boss fight as soon as possible, both for overall dungeon clear time, and because it is possible for slimes from previous rooms to follow you into the boss room if they are not blocked by a celestial dragon, stopped by sticky bombs before the boss room, or stopped by the barrier that closes once the boss fight begins. ⬥ The beginning of the fight is straightforward. Referring to the image, it is highly recommended to only stand in the area highlighted by green. Due to a quirk in Astellarn's auto attack AI, she will only attack with magic autos while you are standing in the green area, while standing anywhere else will allow her to use all of magic , ranged , and ‎ ‎melee autos. Standing in this area significantly reduces her damage output on you, and makes soul split flicking her attacks much easier. ⬥ The goal of the first part of the boss fight is to damage Astellarn to under 200k life points (upon which she will gain massive damage reduction) before she spawns her first pulsar. Regardless of her life points, when the pulsar spawns, use dismember on it, drop your dominion mines, and finish it off with basics. Generally by the time this is accomplished, Astellarn will have already marked you with a secondary bar under your adrenaline that counts down until an aoe damaging "Wyrmhole" is placed underneath you. ⬥ Ideally, this wyrmhole is placed in melee distance, on one of the axes denoted in the image by red, perpendicular lines. The best placement location for this special attack on the axis marked by a red "X" on the image. This placement ensures that the next mechanic, the Neutron star, will not spawn on top of you, ruining the kill. ⬥ Once the wyrmhole is placed, build adrenaline for berserk and lure the slow moving Neutron star toward the wyrmhole. Once the Neutron star moves into the Wyrmhole, the aoe on the ground will turn white and boost the damage you deal while you stand on top of it. Following this, use Berserk + Adrenaline renewal → , and finish your Berserk rotation. Rotations ⬥ Phase 1 (dw) + → (4taa) + → (t92) → 188s → s → r + to prephase Note: Must be "fastest" mh speed to 4taa after barge; dbane will not work. ⬥ Pulsar + → basics → into position for wyrmhole ⬥ Phase 1.5 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Build to 100%. If needed, and/or Astellarn's auto attacks while waiting for the Neutron star to be lured. If you have a lot of extra adrenaline, it's possible to apply bleeds to the boss for some extra damage during and after luring the neutron star. ⬥ Phase 2 + → → → → → (t92) → → → → or unequip-armor at approx. 35,000 life points Note: This rotation should net consistent approximately 50 second kills or better. Room 10 (Defeat 2 Celestials) ⬥ Surge toward the two celestial dragons. Use your bleeds on the first one, walk Slaughter , and use a Sticky bomb to cancel its special attack. Use aoe abilities, thresholds, and sticky bombs to finish them off. → (walked) + → (aoe) Room 11 (Defeat 2 Lava Strykewyrms) ⬥ Bladed Dive down the steps after the barrier opens, then Surge toward the 2 Lava Strykewyrms near the barrier on the far end of the room. ⬥ Greater Barge onto one, bleed Assault ⬥ Finish them off with aoes. → → (tc) + (if necessary) + →
docs.title: Astellarn, the First Celestial

docs.text: Section 2 is significantly more relaxed compared to the previous section; however, it can also be more difficult to stack up and aoe the Black dragons compared to the much smaller and closely packed Slimes, Golems, and Celestials of the previous areas. Focus heavily on damage output, smart usage of long cooldowns, and efficient movement and lures. Verak Lith is also a comparatively much more simple boss than Astellarn. Room 1 (Defeat 4 Black Dragons) ⬥ After the two Strykewyrms, use a dose of Powerburst of Acceleration and Surge + Bladed Dive around the corner to the first black dragon. ⬥ Use your bleeds, on-task Tuska's Wrath if it is available, then Surge + Bladed Dive toward the barrier to lure the other three black dragons together. ⬥ Use ZGS special attack or Meteor Strike and finish them off with aoes and thresholds. + + → (first dragon) (walked) → → (on-task) → + (to barrier) (remaining dragons) / → (aoe) Room 2 (Defeat 6 Black Dragons) ⬥ Surge through the barrier as it opens and use bleeds against the first black dragon. ⬥ Build to Berserk and use aoes to kill as many black dragons as possible before it runs out. ⬥ Finish any remaining black dragons with bleeds and thresholds. (first dragon) (walked) → → (build) → → (aoe) Room 3 (Defeat 4 Lava Strykewyrms) ⬥ Any four strykewyrms can be killed to open the next barrier, however it is recommended to kill them in pairs. ⬥ Utilize bleeds; and aoes with a halberd-range weapon. (first 2 Strykewyrms for aoe Cleave and last 2 Strykes to be close to the barrier as it opens) (bleeds) → (aoes) Room 4 (Defeat 4 Black Dragons) ⬥ Surge or Bladed Dive through the barrier. Depending on how the black dragons are clumped together, utilize bleeds, aoes, and/or the ZGS special attack to defeat them. ⬥ Finish off the last black dragon while building to Berserk and preparing for Verak Lith. (first 3 dragons) → (aoes) (last dragon) → (build to 100%)
docs.title: Section 2

docs.text: Overview ⬥ Life Points : 600,000 ⬥ Special Drops ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Fury Codex ⬥ Attack Rotation 4 Autos → Spire → 4 Autos → Egg Bomb → 4 Autos → Spire → 4 Autos → Divebomb → 4 Autos → Spire → Egg Bomb → 4 Autos → tornados → repeat Mechanics ⬥ Spire - Verak Lith becomes immune to most damage and spawns a spire with 15k life points for each player in the room that deals 100% accurate, moderate melee damage as it spawns. Familiars can still damage Verak Lith while the spire is alive. ⬥ Egg Bomb ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Verak Lith hits everyone in the room with a moderate damage magic attack that bounces from the player and places a marker on the ground. The intended way to deal with this mechanic is to catch the bomb as it lands on the marker, take note of the element of the bomb (Shock, Ice, or Poison), and match it with one of the opposing clusters of eggs in the boss room. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If the bomb is not caught by the player, it will deal 4000 soft-typeless aoe damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If not matched to an opposing egg, the energy will discharge, dealing 9000 soft-typeless damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As the first part of this special attack is soft-typeless , the optimal way to deal with this mechanic is to simply tank it using Disruption Shield , Resonance , or a Powerburst of Vitality . ⬥ Divebomb - Verak Lith calls down a dragon that will deal severe magic damage in a line, similar to Vindicta's fire attack, after a short delay. It is best dealt with by simply moving out of the way. ⬥ Tornados - Verak Lith places a cluster of flaming tornados on the players location. After activating, they deal rapid, severe magic damage if not avoided. Run far away to ensure you are not stacked out. Seeing this special attack can be indicative of a slow kill. Strategy ⬥ Though straightforward, the Verak Lith fight can be punishing to players with low damage output. Spires must be dispatched quickly to ensure enough time to damage the boss before the next Spire spawns, and each additional Spire will slow the encounter down significantly. Therefore, the aim, like many bosses, is to output as much damage as possible, using as many boosts as are available to the player, while dealing with mechanics as they come. If followed well, this rotation will result in consistent 1:20 to 1:30 kills or better. At this speed, Verak Lith's tornado attack will be completely skipped. ⬥ Verak Lith deals moderate to high damage, using only melee attacks in melee distance, and only magic attacks outside of melee distance. Rotations + → (2 ticks) → → (tc) + (dw) + → (4taa) + → → (t92) → → → → Spire (tc) + → (basics) → (walked) → → → + (2h auto) → → → → → Spire (tc) + → (basics) / → + → → → → + → → → → Note: If the fight is not over at this point, kill the spire with + basics and finish Verak Lith off with bleeds and basics. Save for the next barrier.
docs.title: Verak Lith

docs.text: Section 3 is much like Section 2 in that the enemies will have a difficult time stacking out your life points (though they can still do a lot of damage if you aren't careful), but it can also be easier to get better lures on the Gemstones compared to the previous Black Dragons. Be very aware of Hydrix dragon special attacks as getting hit by one may force you out of the dungeon due to its high damage and adrenaline drain. Room 1 (Defeat 3 Dragonstone dragons and 1 Onyx dragon) ⬥ Move back out of the boss room, toward the bank chest and teleport to option 4: 'Kalist Kiket Fia'. Bladed Dive + Surge across the bridge and toward the barrier. Greater Barge on the nearest of the 3 dragonstone dragons, bleed Assault and dump bleeds. ⬥ Bladed Dive in between the other 3 dragons, build to ZGS Special Attack or Berserk depending on cooldowns, and clear them with aoes and thresholds. (closest dragonstone) → → (on-task) → (bleeds) (into pack of 2 dragonstones+onyx) → / (as soon as possible) → → (aoe) Room 2 (Defeat 2 Dragonstone dragons) ⬥ If Berserk was skipped, Berserk here and clear the dragons with aoes → → + → (aoe) Room 3 (Defeat 2 Dragonstone dragons) ⬥ Use a dose of Powerburst of Acceleration then Bladed Dive + Surge around the corner to the next two dragonstone dragons. ⬥ Clear them with bleeds and aoes. + → → + → (if available) → (bleeds) → (aoe) Room 4 (Defeat 2 Dragonstone dragons) ⬥ Surge toward the final two dragonstone dragons. ⬥ On-task Tuska's Wrath if available, clear them with bleeds and thresholds. → → → (on-task) → (bleeds) → (aoe)
docs.title: Section 3

docs.text: Overview ⬥ Life Points : 650,000 (Black Hands: 80,000) ⬥ Special Drops : ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Greater Barge Codex ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Draconic Energy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Inert Black Stone Crystal ⬥ Attack Rotation ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Phase 1 (650k - 520k) 3 Autos → Gemstone Spikes → 2 Autos → Dragonbreath → Repeat ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Phase 2 : Black Hands ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Phase 3 (520k - 260k, flying, 260k-0) 1-5 Autos → Smoke Spiral → 3 Autos → Mage aoe → 2 Autos → Dragon Breath → Gemstone Spikes → 3 Autos → Mage aoe → Smoke Spiral → Repeat after Smoke Spiral Mechanics ⬥ Gemstone Spikes - This attack is extremely similar to the Hydrix Gemstone dragon special attack encountered earlier in the dungeon. Upon impact it deals high melee damage, drains adrenaline to 0%, and temporarily halves adrenaline gain. ⬥ Dragonbreath - A moderate damage magic attack with extremely high accuracy. Note: this does not do "dragonfire"-type damage. ⬥ Smoke Spiral - The Black Stone Dragon will root itself in place while a smoke cloud that deals severe typeless damage spirals around it. No matter where it starts, the spiral will never hit a player standing directly behind Black Stone Dragon's tail. It is possible to flank the boss by standing in position while this special attack is occurring. ⬥ Mage AoE - Similar to Verak Lith's tornados, Black Stone Dragon sends several smoke clouds out to somewhere in the boss room. Standing in this area will result in rapid, severe magic damage. Strategy ⬥ The Black Stone Dragon is the final encounter in the Dragonkin Laboratory. Though her attack speed is relatively slow, she can utilize high-damage magic , ranged , and melee auto attacks, and has very strong area denial mechanics. ⬥ After being damaged to 520k life points, during the time of her next attack she will become immune to damage and four level 122 Black Hands with 80k life points will spawn at the shackles surrounding her. These Black Hands will periodically slap at the ground and fire off high damage magic attack. After this attack lands, a line of shadow hands will spawn out of the hand in a line toward where the tile the attack landed in. These shadow hands deal very rapid, severe typeless damage. Optimally, the best way to deal with this attack is to allow the magic attack to hit you, move to another side of the hand one tick later, and continue attacking. These enemies are susceptable to the Terrasaur maul and Dominion mines . ⬥ In addition to this magic attack, black hands also have a low damage melee attack that may, under currently unknown circumstances, target familiars for inconsequential damage. ⬥ After the four Black Hands have been destroyed, retarget the Black Stone Dragon and continue the rotation until 260k life points, being aware that a smoke spiral special attack will quickly follow the Black Hands phase. Following this, she will jump into the air, land in another place in the boss room and fire out a slow moving, rapid typeless damage line of smoke. After landing 7 times, the fight will continue until the boss is dead. Rotations ⬥ Phase 1 + → (2 ticks) → → (tc) + (dw) + → (4taa) + → → (t92) → → → / (to prephase depending on adren and life points) ⬥ Phase 2 : Black Hands ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hand 1 (tc) + + → → (basics) → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hand 2 + → + (2h auto) → → → (basics) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hand 3 / → → + → → → + → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Hand 4 + (finish zerk) (basics) → ⬥ Phase 3 (walked) + → → → → (4taa) + (dw) → + (2h auto) → → (flank) + → → → → → (3 hit) → (flank) → → (walked) → (basics) → (dump at ~265k life points) ⬥ Flying : Build while avoiding smoke lines she leaves when she lands. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Prioritize → → build for then Berserk → when she lands the last time. ⬥ Post-Flying + + → → (flank) → → + (t92) → → → → → (walked) → → → → → (dump)
docs.title: Black Stone Dragon

docs.text: https://youtu.be/yus2b6Di2xY - 15:40 no-sgb/maul, pre-smoke cloud; on-task by #Terpsichore https://youtu.be/qAGd1KLGjeA - 14:19 pre-smoke cloud; on-task by #Finah

Each solo run of ED2 is worth 9,276,146 in uniques. Advanced players can get up to 4 kph, earning on average 37,104,586 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ You can Surge or Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry.
