docs.text: Room 1 ⬥ Use Greater Ricochet with a long range weapon (2h) on one of the 2 Sakadagamis, then step 2 tiles south, 1 tile west and manually run 2 tiles back towards them. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dont get pulled in by using an ability, otherwise the 2 Sotapannas to west will start attacking you. ⬥ Equip Mechanised Chinchompas and kill them with → → → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Using stuns on them will delay their stuns. Note: You can choose to instead (if you have enough adrenaline). Room 2 ⬥ Sticky Bomb the 2 Eastern Mercenaries, equip Mechanised Chinchompas , then → → → → finish with basics. Surge Bladed Dive north and stand on any of the tiles shown on picture: ⬥ If standing in white outline(1), target Menaphite Soldier #3. ⬥ If in green outline(2), target Menaphite Soldier #2 or #3. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Make sure to not walk into them because this can mess up the lure. You can always walk East, as long as none of them are bound or stunned. ⬥ Use → → → finish with basics if needed. Room 3 ⬥ Surge Bladed Dive towards the west gate as shown in the picture: ⬥ Stand on the spot shown in the picture, run 2 tiles west, wait 1 tick and go back: ⬥ Target the zealot shown in this picture: ⬥ Equip → → → → → finish with basics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Build to 100% if not already, Surge towards the chest and bank. ⬥ After banking step east so you are looking into Masuta's arena, use any defensive and onto stairs to Masuta.
docs.title: Section 4

docs.text: Masuta, the second boss of the dungeon, keeps true to the dungeon's theme of heavy damage dealt and high KO potential. Using a variety of hard-hitting mechanics and boasting attacks from all three combat styles, Masuta is a noticeable difficulty spike up from the first boss. Drops ⬥ Onyx dust ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Common drop, 1-29 dropped per kill ⬥ Masuta's warspear ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rare drop Phase 1 ⬥ Attack Rotation Autoattacks → Hurricane → Autoattacks → Tsunami → repeat Mechanics ⬥ Autoattacks: Mostly Melee-based although he can also uncommonly use Ranged instead. The number of autoattacks he does between each special attack can vary, meaning that the time it takes for him to use his special attacks also varies. Along with his autoattacks Masuta has a chance to summon an untargetable clone, which will hit you once with Melee before disappearing. His ranged auto-attacks A clone melee auto-attack Note: Masuta usually starts by doing 4 autoattacks before using Hurricane, however he can use Hurricane earlier (as soon as after 2 autoattacks) or later depending on RNG. ⬥ Hurricane: ‎ ‎Masuta's Hurricane attack lasts for about 12 seconds, hitting nearby players for increasing Melee damage once per tick, chasing after you at walking speed during this attack. The best way to deal with this is + 1 GCD after the attack starts. This allows you to continue dealing damage in MD and nullifies most of the damage you take. Note: Its possible to flank Masuta from the north side during this attack. ⬥ Tsunami: After the Hurricane, Masuta returns to throwing autoattacks, alongside one of his autoattacks, usually the 4th, 5th or 6th autoattack, purple waters appear around the arena. The purples water will thrash about while Masuta uses 3 more autoattacks. Right after the 3rd of these autoattacks, Masuta launches his Tsunami towards his target using the purple waters. This attack will hit you with two extremely high (7k+) Magic hits. This can be dealt with by using both Disruption Shield + Resonance after Masuta's 3rd autoattack, or by moving far enough to avoid getting hit. This can be done by either running or using Surge as the autoattack before the Tsunami hits. Note: If you dont have Disruption Shield unlocked, it is possible to Resonance and flick Deflect Mage . This, although tricky at first, is a valid way to deal with Tsunami. Reso prayer flick demonstration - https://youtu.be/WZlGkkmUsis Note: There will be kills where you will have to cancel one threshold early to deal with this mechanic, prioritize dealing with it. Surge timing demonstration - https://youtu.be/qrcCqidKhe0 Note: If Masuta phases into the flight phase after the purple waters have appeared, Tsunami will still be used even when Masuta stops autoattacking. ⬥ Pulverise After Tsunami, for the rest of Phase 1 Masuta will be able to use Pulverise in place of an autoattack. This will hit moderate melee damage, and can be dealt with by using Deflect Melee or running 2 tiles away from your location. You have 1 tick to move far enough when the text "I'll pulverise you!" appears over Masuta. Note Masuta will repeat his attack cycle from the beginning with the addition of Pulverise until his HP reaches the phasing point, 275k. Flight phase ⬥ Once his HP reaches 275k, Masuta will stop attacking, start levitating and become practically undamageable. ⬥ Shortly after Masuta will start spawning thrashing waters at random locations in the arena. These have 8000 HP and a very long-ranged Magic autoattack. Up to 15 Thrashing Waters will be spawned over a 90s span. Pray Deflect Magic . for the duration of this special attack. ⬥ When a thrashing water is killed, if you are within a 2-tile radius (halberd distance) of the water, you will receive a 5% Calm Waters buff that will help you for Phase 2. Notes: Dominion Mines will work on the waters - they will deal 1600 damage per mine. You can use Devotion here to reduce damage taken. You must be on 100% adrenaline when the flight phase ends. Phase 2 Starts when Masuta yells "These waters will choke you where you stand!" and returns to the floor from his levitation. In this phase, Masuta will only use Ranged autoattacks and a powerful Magic attack. ⬥ The Magic attack hits for very high damage, however this is reduced by the amount shown on the Calm Waters buff icon obtained during the flight phase - up to 75%. Masuta starts the phase with 2 Ranged autoattacks followed by his Magic attack, after which he will repeatedly do a varying amount of Ranged autoattacks before using another Magic attack. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The amount of Ranged attacks done before a Magic attack ranges from 3 to 6. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The magic attack has a travel time based on distance. Due to this, while in MD of the boss, the attack hits you instantly, while Ranged autoattacks take 1 tick to hit you. As Masuta has an attack speed of 4 ticks, by rotating your overhead prayers → → → → repeat, you will always be praying correctly against whatever attack is used. Strategy ⬥ Start Notes: This rotation requires the Heightened senses relic. (tc) → → → → → → → → → → ‎ ‎auto → → → → (walk under) → → → → → dump until Masuta phases. ⬥ Start Notes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• At the start camp and swap to for 2 abilities after Ruby proc. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After camp and swap to once you have high adrenaline (around 70%+). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Masuta does late spin, use Surge to get far enough away to not have to leave your . ⬥ Thrashing Waters ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note the time you phased on P1 and add 1min 08s to it, this will be when you use ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Stand on the bottom edge of the south platform. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Pray and heal off of Masuta with ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kill any geysers that can hit you. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Push Masuta south using and ⬥ Final Phase ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 68s after phasing P1, camp and use → → → build to → spam while improvising. Kill Example https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=agjfrQ5JfBo
docs.title: Masuta, the Ascended

docs.text: Room 1 ⬥ Use Surge Bladed Dive on minimap onto west stairs, target middle Pylon and use → after releasing → on either of the 2 south Pylons: ⬥ → the last Pylon (basics if not 100% adren), get to 88%+ with defensives on the remaining Pylons without attacking them. ⬥ Use and → to get behind Seiryu's head.
docs.title: Section 5

docs.text: To finish the dungeon, you need to free Seiryu by destroying the three black crystals on his shackles. This fight will challenge a player's ability to utilise the space they have in the arena to avoid a series of area-based mechanics. Drops ⬥ Ancient scale ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Common drop, 4-110 dropped per kill ⬥ Chipped black stone crystal ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/300 base, 60 threshold Note: The above is strictly for solo encounters. Mechanics ⬥ Overview ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This fight is split into 2 phases: the face phase, where the goal is to reduce Seiryu's HP from 7.500M to 7.200M, and the crystal phase, where you have limited time to damage the black crystals. You will only be attacked during the face phase of the fight. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Throughout the fight Seiryu's basic attack will either be a Magic autoattack, or Seiryu will use his tail to summon a blackhole under the player that deals rapid damage. You can heal back HP lost from Magic autoattacks using Soul Split flicking easily due to Seiryu's slow attack speed. ⬥ Tail Blackholes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Summoned blackholes will cover a 2x2 area (centered northeast). It will deal rapid and increasing damage (~2000 per tick) to anyone standing within the targeted area, lasting for about 10 seconds before disappearing. This can be dealt with by simply moving out (1 tile north/east or 2 tiles south/west) of it. ⬥ Attack Rotations Note: Seiryu starts the fight by using 4 attacks, after which his attack rotation is as follows: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Huge Breath → 2 attacks → Shadow Energy → 2 attacks → repeat ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The 2nd Shadow Energy mechanic will be replaced by the Black Hands mechanic. ⬥ Huge Breath ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When the Huge Breath attack starts, the game message "Seiryu takes a huge breath" will appear on your screen. This attack is an accurate, high-damaging (~8000) Magic attack. You can dodge this attack by standing within 3 tiles of the southern edge of the arena. Alternatively, its possible to block it with Disruption Shield / Resonance or use Vengeance and tank it. ⬥ Shadow Energy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When Seiryu's Shadow Energy mechanic starts, the game message "Shadow energy bursts forth from Seiryu." appears, and arrows will appear under your character, on the arena, and on your minimap pointing to a specific tile. Seiryu will launch a shadow projectile towards this specific tile. Once the shadow projectile lands, highly damaging black hands will move from the marked tile towards your current location. Dodge these hands by simply moving out of their path. ⬥ Black Hands ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Seiryu's 2nd Shadow Energy mechanic is replaced by the Black Hands mechanic. These hands deal extremely high damage, avoiding them is vital. They will spawn from a random point on the south wall and move north, with the spawn point moving both east and west, making the hands form a V-shape. Once this mechanic has been cast, a new formation of black hands will always spawn when the current formation is complete. Be wary of where the hands start spawning each time as if they spawn near you, death is imminent. ⬥ Crystal Phase ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Once the crystal phase starts, the arena is cleared of any remaining mechanic and Seiryu stops attacking you. After the crystal phase ends, Seiryu will continue his rotation from where he left off, however his first special attack will always be his Huge Breath mechanic. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Seiryu used his Huge Breath followed by 1 basic attack before the crystal phase started, he will do 1 basic attack then his Huge Breath attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• During the crystal phase, you will be able to jump onto Seiryu's shackles and start damaging the crystals. Soon after, a set of 6 shadow enigmas will spawn in the arena and slowly move towards Seiryu. When an enigma reaches his face, it will heal any standing crystal by 50k HP. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You should ignore the first set of enigmas and DPS the crystals. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- You have roughly 1 minute until the first heal is activated, and after the 6th heal is finished, you have another 13.2 seconds before you get stunned and teleported back down. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As you get back to the floor a second set of enigmas will have spawned, if you left any crystal alive and damaged, deal with them before attacking Seiryu. Strategy Note: Camp Hydrix bolts (tc) → → → → → → → → → → → → → → → → → → improvise until phased → onto 1 of these spots to climb up: Phase 1 Notes ⬥ further away from head (East / West) so you can dodge Seiryu's tendril attack without leaving Flank range. ⬥ Lower HP to ~5k before Shadow Tendrils, only heal up to ~3k before each mage hit after Shadow Tendrils , camp mage prayer after to lower your HP even more (~1.5k). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is so that you can benefit from the Berserker's Fury relic power. ⬥ Make sure to end on 90%+ adren so that you don't have to rely on procs. Crystal 1 Note: (Camp , swap to if you get a ruby proc) Spam target cycle and → → → → → → → → → auto → improvise if not dead. Crystal 2 Note: Camp Hydrix bolts , use for thresholds if needed → → → → → → → → improvise Note: Improvise using → if you don't get procs. Make sure to be 110% adren before third crystal. Crystal 3 Camp :, swap to after you get a ruby proc. Make sure to have Vigour equipped for every → 2 ticks after 2nd heal → (Place when cooldown ends) → → → → (wait 6t) → → ( only if you drank your late) → 1 Cycle Notes ⬥ Never Soul Split unless under to keep HP as low as possible. ⬥ Use to get to thresholds if low adrenaline. ⬥ Vigour for all Dark Bow specs . ⬥ If you are not using Heightened Senses , it is important to time your during properly for the 3rd Crystal, if it's late then you won't get enough adrenaline in time and if it's too early you will overboost. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ideally use it on the 6th tick of Rapid Fire .
docs.title: Seiryu, the Azure Serpent

docs.text: The shadow reef magic The Shadow Reef (Courtesy of #Linie & #Akva) Introduction The third installment in the Elite Dungeon series, the Shadow Reef is home to the long awaited boss known as Kranon, the Ambassador , which drops pieces for the T92 weapon: the Eldritch Crossbow This guide is structured in the order that rooms would be encountered if running the dungeon. Rotations are written to utilize the Greater Chain ability and assume 4TAA is used; however, neither is required to effectively do this dungeon. Each solo run of ED3 is worth 22,909,091 in eldritch pieces. Advanced players can get up to 3.5 kph, earning on average 80,181,818 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ Consider downgrading your graphics to Minimum with Medium+ draw distance for the Dungeon, as it is poorly optimized and prone to frame drops. ⬥ You can Surge or Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry. Presets Note: The dungeon can be effectively run with a single preset but for general speed reasons a separate preset should be used for Ambassador. Universal ⬥ Undead Slayer ability ⬥ Undead Slayer perk ⬥ Salve Amulet for undead mobs and Taraket ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves ⬥ Spiritual Prayers - use with a Ripper Demon familiar. ⬥ Weapon Poison ⬥ Maniacal Aura Note: Mahjarrat Aura is also ok and makes the Taraket strategy noticeably easier to execute. Optional ⬥ A few empty inventory spaces if picking up charm drops. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elite Dungeon chest upgrade solves this issue. ⬥ Adjust food as seen fit. ⬥ Lucky Charms ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doesn't increase Eldritch drop rate. ⬥ Flanking 4 - not super impactful especially in solo. Beginner/Group ⬥ Bringing both dual-wield and 2h is optional and should be done if the player is comfortable with switching. ⬥ Guthix Staff for increased hitchance ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Advanced Solo ⬥ Powerburst of Acceleration ⬥ Seismic Singularity - Caroming 4 ⬥ Superior Zuriel's Robe Bottom - Undead Slayer ⬥ Adrenaline Urn - not necessary but you sometimes drop combat during a few of the obstacles ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Note: Feel free to downgrade the Caroming 4 and Undead Slayer switches. Advanced Solo Ambassador ⬥ Powerburst of Vitality ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Relevant Mob Breakdown Crassian Scout ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Ranged hits. Crassian Scuttler ⬥ Life Points : 9,000 ⬥ They attack with moderately damaging Melee hits. Crassian Warrior ⬥ Life Points : 22,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Cloaked Zealot ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Summon Crassian : Can spawn Crassian mobs to attack you with. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Armoured Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Ulthven Necromancer ⬥ Life Points : 16,500 ⬥ Summon Undead : Can spawn a continous horde of Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Huge Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Sea Horror ⬥ Life Points : 35,500 ⬥ Scream : A 2,000 typeless hit used at melee distance. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise. Enlightened Sotapanna ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ They attack with melee abilities for moderate damage. Undead Witch ⬥ Life Points : 30,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with a delayed, highly damaging Magic hit. Kal'gerion Demon ⬥ Life Points : 33,700 ⬥ Life Drain : Reduces your Constitution level by 2 ⬥ Demonic Ritual : Reduces all combat stats alongside rapid magic damage to anyone in range. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits otherwise. Warped Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Frenzy : Rapid 3,000 magic hits that also heal the Skeleton. Triggers are unknown. ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise. First Floor - Pre-Crassian Note: All Greater Chain are assumed to be done with the Caroming 4 perk. Room 1 Tag mob 3 with → → (tc mob 2) → (tc mob 1) → run past mob 4 and use . Room 2 Surge and run straight along the path before bladed diving behind the Scouts. ‎ ‎Tag the northern most Scout with gChain then charge Detonate → (tc) . and into the next room. Room 3 Tag with (dw) gChain → and clean up the survivors. Room 4 There's only two Cloaked Zealots to clear here and they're lined up for AoEs but if you're quick your Detonate will still be on cooldown from Room 2. ‎ ‎Do → → → / . Bladed dive → surge into the next room as shown below. Room 5 There are two Crassian Scouts and two Cloaked Zealots spaced apart here. gChain one of the Zealots and use Asphyxiate . Clean up any stragglers with basics. Bladed dive diagonally into the next room. Note: Here and anywhere else in the mob sections of this guide, when using → you should not auto in between as it is important that your main target does not die early. Room 6A Equip your salve amulet and tag a Zombie with gChain . Charge Detonate → (tc) . Bladed dive diagonally across the rock to Room 6B. Room 6B Use Corruption Blast first if gChain is still on cooldown. Otherwise use → → → Room 7 Spam surge to use it as soon as you can. Aim to gChain a more central Zombie to ensure it reaches the Zombie close to the barrier. Use either Wild Magic or Guthix Staff here depending on speed and clean up with autos and bleeds. Blade dive diagonally into the next room. Room 8 You only need to kill the two Zealots. Detonate → → should be adequate to clear this room and end on high adren for Leviathan. The Crassian Leviathan As the first boss of The Shadow Reef, The Crassian Leviathan has a very small and easy set of area denial mechanics that can deal a lot of damage if ignored. The boss heals passively over the duration of the fight, largely negated with Weapon Poison active. Mechanics ⬥ Poison Pits + Additional Heads - The center of the arena is filled with poison and is surrounded by the additional heads of the Leviathan. Never stand here. ⬥ Dragon Breath - This will always be the first mechanic of the fight and is signaled by the Leviathan firing a stationary breath attack in front of it, dealing rapid heavy typeless damage. Stand off to the side to avoid this. ⬥ Head Sweep - The Leviathan will slam its' head across the ground twice, dealing very heavy damage to anyone caught in the area, avoided by moving to the opposite side of where the sweep begins. ⬥ After going through one Dragon Breath and two sets of Head Sweeps , the Leviathan will move to other opposite side of the arena, repeating his previous rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bladed Dive + Surge to the opposite end of the arena. Strategy ⬥ Aim to Sunshine right away either directly in front of the Leviathan's nose or on the same tile you throw vuln bombs to (directly east of the Leviathan's head). Both spots allow for you to safely hit the boss in while avoiding the Head Sweep special. Drink your apot and look to use → . ⬥ At this point the Head Sweep will have started. Use an Guthix Staff spec either before or after you move to dodge the Head Sweep followed by a Detonate after dodging once. Get in another → → before you ends. ⬥ After your ends, try to just use thresholds to do damage up until it switches sides. If your damage doesn't look too great when you hit about the 1 minute mark, try to build to high adren to use a Metaphoris + Limitless immediately after the switch. Otherwise look to finish the boss off with more thresholds and Guthix Staff specs after the switch. Note: Leviathan switching sides counts as walking for Combust so look to use that as one of your last abilities on the initial side. ⬥ Example Kill: https://youtu.be/wdwPoXs06q0 Post-Crassian - Second Floor Entry Room 9 Drink your Acceleration Powerburst exiting the Leviathan and utilize surge and bladed dive as demonstrated below to quickly reach this room. There is a Cloaked Zealot and various Scuttlers in this room you need to clear to proceed. gChain the Zealot and use Asphyxiate followed by Dragonbreath . If your does not hit all the Scuttlers, you may want to use Corruption Blast before . Diagonally bladed dive into the next room. Room 10 Put your salve amulet back on. In the middle of the room, tag a Zombie with gChain and charge Detonate → (tc) . Surge → bladed dive → to reach the cliff. Room 11 Jump down the cliff to clear an Ulthven Necromancer and two Huge Skeletons. Use gChain → Asphyxiate on the Necromancer to clear the entire room. Room 12 There are two Necromancers off at the sides and a line of three Armoured Zombies guarding the door. You only need to kill one Necromancer and the Zombies to proceed to section 2, the temple area. Run to the archway and surge straight before diagonally bladed diving towards a Necromancer. Kill the Necromancer with Wild Magic → Combust . Use gChain on an Armoured Zombie and charge Detonate → . Second Floor Entry - Taraket Entry Room 1 There are two Ulthven Necromancers guarding the gates to the east and west that you must clear to access the black stone artefacts. The main gate will not drop until these have been activated. A mass of summoned skeletons will form in the room as you go about this task. Equip your and surge + bladed dive down the path. Go west first and kill the Necromancer with → → . through the open barrier to go tag the artefact. diagonally back to the doorway and through. Kill the east Necromancer with → and towards the doorway. Go tag the artefact then run back and diagonally towards the bridge. Demonstrated: https://youtu.be/dGDwdi6PojI Room 2 Surge twice down the bridge to the two Sea Horrors and a Necromancer that you must clear to proceed. Use gChain → Asphyxiate → Dragonbreath on the east Horror while running to the far northeast corner. Charge Detonate on the west Horror → . The Necromancer should die to AoE during this clear but kill with basics if it suvives. Diagonally bladed dive to the next hallway afterwards. Note: It is ok to use Devotion here, but it should ideally be before reaching the Horrors. Room 3 There's a line of three Acolytes of Seiryu guarding the gate here that must be cleared to proceed. Tag the northernmost Acolyte with gChain and use Wild Magic before switching targets. Finish off the survivors with Dragonbreath and Corruption Blast . Immediately after clearing this room, drink your Acceleration Powerburst to bladed dive back to back to back as demonstrated below. Room 4 There are many mobs here but only the Necromancers and Huge Skeletons must be cleared. Put your salve amulet back on and use gChain → Asphyxiate → Dragonbreath on the western Necromancer. Finish off what's left with basics, but try not to use Corruption Blast as it will stop your from banking at the chest. Taraket the Necromancer This encounter is the second boss of the Shadow Reef, and is a clear step up in difficulty from the first. Taraket, Corpses and Skeletons are classified as Undead for Salve Amulet , Undead Slayer perk and sigil purposes. Mechanics ⬥ Rift of Undeath - ‎ ‎This Rift with 30k HP will spawn a large amount of skeletons that each deal low amounts of damage. After roughly 30 seconds, it will explode for heavy typeless damage to the player. Prevented by killing it. ⬥ Death's Swiftness - Taraket will shroud himself in a Death's Swiftness, becoming immobile and switching attack styles from Mage to Ranged. These autos are slightly stronger than his Magic ones. ⬥ Corpse Carrier and Bloated Monstrosity - Upon reaching 200K hitpoints, Taraket will become invulnerable and fly towards one of the two black crystals at the sides of the arena, healing himself and spawning one of the two corpses: Corpse Carrier (west) or the Bloated Monstrosity (east), with 90K HP each. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Corpse Carrier will continuously spawn skeletal mobs as it's alive ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Bloated Monstrosity increases the damage of Taraket's attacks. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Both of these attack with melee and are very easy to kite if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taraket can only spawn these once each and will not heal upon hitting 200K HP afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The first spawn will always be the closest crystal to Taraket. ⬥ Spirit Line - Taraket smashes the ground infront of him for heavy melee damage, summoning a line of spirits infront of him that will move towards the player, dealing rapid typeless damage upon contact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move out of the way as needed be. Strategy ⬥ Utilizing 4TAA with Blood Barrage and gChain will make a world of difference in this fight in particular allowing players to essentially tank almost everything, especially on Mahjarrat Aura rather than Maniacal . ‎ ‎With , the last 300k can be sketchy at times; however, it is very much worth using. ⬥ Start out the fight with an apot Sunshine and your salve amulet equipped. → → → → (→ if Taraket is still above 200k hp) / the Rift → to clear the skeletons → + the Bloated Monstrosity → run back to just west of where Taraket was before flying and charge on him → → → (→ → if not phased but try to stay high adren) Note: Where you stand is important here as you're looking to body block Taraket from flying west. ⬥ Equip → on the Bloated Monstrosity and build back to 100 to back on Taraket and build with 2 basics → → → → step to the other side of Taraket before the Corpse Carrier reaches melee distance to effective stack it on top of Taraket Blocking + + Stacking Demonstrated: Note: Stacking Corpse Carrier in this way is not 100% guranteed and it is very important that you move back through Taraket to restack if it does not work. → → → → → → ( ends) ⬥ From here finish off taraket with more thresholds and . Be sure to side step the melee hits from the Spirit Line special as they will severly hurt your ability to outheal the majority of the damage you take. Also use off cooldown (preferably before thresholds or ) to improve overall healing and to repeatedly clear out the skeletal mobs the Corpse Carrier spawns. A second rift will spawn but you should be killing Taraket before it explodes so you can generally ignore it. ⬥ The Dark Form prayer is helpful here especially if using Spiritual Prayers . Note: Untested but players who do not 4TAA can likely follow this strategy up until when the Corpse Carrier spawns, at which point they would want to focus it down while in Sunshine . ⬥ Example Kill: https://youtu.be/qhA1C_HZrPQ Taraket Exit - Second Floor Exit Note: This section and the following section can be cleared fairly easily with little to no food. As such, do not bank after Taraket even if running low. Room 5 Surge + bladed dive → out of Taraket's room. There is a Sea Witch and two Armoured Zombies in this room. Tag the Witch with gChain → Asphxyiate /Wild Magic /Guthix Staff depending on cooldowns following Taraket. into the next room. Room 6 Put back on your Essence of Finality . Only the Kalgerion Demon needs to be killed here to proceed. He's really big and impossible to miss. If you have it, the Demon Slayer ability can be used here. Guthix staff (dw) → Asphyxiate /Wild Magic should be enough. The Demon Slayer ability can be used here if you already own it. After killing the demon, look to utilize surge and bladed dive and an Acceleration Powerburst as demonstrated below. Note: You can manipulate one of the required Necromancers in room 7 to move from his position to make the next room easier on you by running as close as you can to him, so he aggros you through the wall. This isn’t 100% guaranteed. Room 7 There's two Necromancers hiding around in this room that need to be cleared. Use either Wild Magic or Guthix Staff followed by Combust on the west Necromancer then surge back towards the east Necromancer. If low on Hp or food use gChain → Asphyxiate on the east Necromancer, otherwise simply . Diagonally bladed dive through the corner into the next room and keep running to angle yourself for the next surge . Room 8 Only the two Necromancers are guarding the gate here. Kill the first Necromancer with Sonic → Guthix Staff then surge diagonally through the corner to the second Necromancer. Kill it with Wild Magic → Corruption Blast and diagonally bladed dive through the corner to the cliff. Third Floor Entry - Pre-Ambassador Room 1 Use surge twice to reach the group of Crassian Warriors and Scuttlers around the gate that must be killed. They stack up very nicely for all AoEs and aren't very threatening in general. Tag a Warrior with gChain → Combust on your way to the barrier and charge a Detonate → → (→ → if bad ). Improvise to finish off the survivors. Room 2 There's two Warped Skeletons in here that can completely clear you if you aren't paying attention. Equip your salve amulet and gChain the two Skeletons. Proceed to Asphyxiate → (tc skeleton 2) → . Surge into the next room and immediately bladed dive behind the line of Zealots. Room 3 Re-equip your Essence of Finality and use gChain on either one of the eastern Zealots or Skeleton if close. From here use Tsunami then improvise to finish off the stragglers ideally with Detonate . Room 4 The last room before the final boss of the dungeon. There are two more skeletons along with two Crassian Scouts that need to be cleared to proceed. There are three minibosses that can spawn in this room with a fairly inconvenient aggro range so try to avoid them by hugging the western wall. Ideally look to gChain the Skeletons → Asphyxiate → Combust /Corruption Blast . Build on the Scouts to ensure you have full adren for Ambassador. Note: If no minibosses spawn in this room, look to zoom to the door and all 4 mobs. Kranon, the Ambassador At the bottom of the abyssal section awaits Kranon, the Ambassador, the final boss of the Elite Dungeon 3. This boss has a moderate learning curve compared to most solo bosses and has a variety of mechanics ranging from DPS checks, area denial, self-healing, and the usage multiple combat styles. The boss primarily attacks with ranged , with a heavy mage attack after every 5 autos. The mage hit is replaced by a small but instant melee swipe if the player is in melee distance. Ambassador's Attack Rotation ⬥ 1M HP to 550K - Phase 1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mage/Melee auto → 5 autos → Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Black Hole → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Sinister Fragments → Repeat Magic Auto-Attack ⬥ 550K to 400K - Phase 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Uses the same auto attack rotation until Ritual. ⬥ Ritual - Kill ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5 autos → Melee/Magic → 5 autos → Melee/Magic → Onslaught 1M-550K HP ⬥ Purple Corruption ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador fires a spout into the player, dealing no damage and placing a bar over their head. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When this bar nears depletion, a 5x5 area around the player will become corrupted until Seiryu clears them at the Ritual phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is similar to the Sanctum Guardian's mechanic from ED1 but will create two areas instead, separated by 2 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These zones will last until the final phase of the fight and will ramp up to 2000 typeless damage to anyone standing inside. ⬥ Black Hole ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador will spawn a black hole near the area that will explode a few seconds afterwards, dealing 8000+ damage to the player ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Despawned by stunning it. ⬥ Sinister Fragments ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Six fragments will disperse from the boss to the edges of the arena with 20K HP each. At the same time, the Ambassador will fire three slowly rotating beams that last for about a minute. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Failing to destroy a fragment(s) prompts the Ambassador to absorb them, and release a hard hitting typeless explotion per fragment absorbed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The beams always spawn in set locations (N, SE, SW), and rotate counterclockwise slowly. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• He'll use the Fragments one minute into the fight or by hitting the 650K cap. Burn! Like the ants you are. A fragment is absorbed 550K-400K HP ⬥ The Ambassador stops spawning Sinister Fragments. ⬥ The Ambassador spawns invulnerable Crassian Ritual Keepers that deal low ranged damage, making Resonance harder to use. 400K-0 HP ⬥ The Ambassador will stop doing his corruption and black hole mechanics, continuing his auto attack pattern as normal. ⬥ Seiryu will emerge shortly after 400K, clearing all Crassians and infested areas. ⬥ A ring of black hands will spawn to encompass the edge of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The hands will slam down in a clockwise fashion, sending constant smoke projectiles towards the Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These will heal the boss 2500 HP for each smoke let in and can be blocked, directing a small amount of damage towards the player. Seiryu arrives Ritual begins ⬥ Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Every 10 auto attacks, the Ambassador will send out 5 extremely hard hitting Magic attacks. Ambassador Strategy General Tips ⬥ Use a Ripper demon with scrolls and drink Spiritual Prayers . ⬥ Try to avoid using solid food. Stick to Blue jellies , and Guthix rest or Saradomin brews , if you can. ⬥ Try to maximize the potential healing from soulsplitting Spinners and the Seiryu Heal at 400k to cut down on food usage throughout the fight. Resonance can also be used on the magic auto attack occasionally to preserve food. ⬥ You will need to Spellbook Swap to use Disruption Shield throughout the fight. Bring runes accordingly. ⬥ Flanking can be utilized throughout the fight by stepping directly underneath the Ambassador. Phase 1 - 1M-650k HP Note: Most autos and basics will be omitted in the rotations below. If either is listed below, the timing achieved is intentional. Also all Detonate are charged for 3 ticks. ⬥ Magic 1st Auto vs Melee 1st Auto ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doing → (during gcd) to reach melee distance instantly at the start of the fight will switch the 1st auto into a melee auto. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Changing the 1st auto into a melee auto changes the timing of the 1st smoke. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Mage 1st auto leads to a 22.8s (38t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Melee 1st auto leads to a 31.8s (53t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No other timings are changed. Note: The rotation in this guide assumes Magic 1st auto for timings. ⬥ Start the Fight with an Apot Sunshine ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Disruption Shield while running down the ramp + → → → run to the north/northwest corner of your while waiting to auto → → (1st smoke timer will start + switch to for the 2nd magic auto) → → move out of smoke → (3rd magic auto) → → clear black hole with immediately (timer will be close to ending) ( ends) build with basics → → (2nd smoke timer starts) → (4th magic auto will come out towards the end of smoke timer) → move out of smoke → → → ⬥ Phase 1 Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Try to place the 2nd smoke next to your 1st smoke. This will put them out of the way as after spinners you will primarily stay south/southwest of Ambassador while also leaving a large path on the east side for pathing during spinners. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you switch prayers properly and the last magic auto attack, it is fairly straight forward to no food phase 1 starting from full hp. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Depending on where the black hole spawns, you may need to start moving early to reach it in time. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Be careful that you do not stall then cancel . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Having the flanking perk equipped will cause to not clear the black hole. Phase 2 - Spinners ⬥ Spinner Strategy (not all basics listed) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1st: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 2nd: → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3rd: → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 4th: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5th: → basics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 6th: ignore and build on Ambassador ⬥ Spinners Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You only need to kill 5 out of 6 and then use either or to block the explosion hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No movement abilities are required to effectively move between spinners; however, if desired, it is recommended to use Bladed Dive as its cooldown will be reset by each spinner death. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Using Vulnerability bombs on each of the spinners is not necessary but recommended. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The spinners are not immune to binds and therefore Ice Barrage + Wrack can be utilized. Phase 3 - 650k-400k ⬥ Natural Instinct Sunshine → 3-4 basics → the eruption → → (5th magic auto) → (3rd smoke timer start) → → move → (6th magic auto) → → clear black hole with immediately build with basics → (7th magic auto) (if bad adren skip to not delay next ) → (dw) ⬥ Phase 3 Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you are confident in your ability to on tick, you can the 7th magic auto here to save food. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Try to end this phase on very low hp for a large heal from Seiryu but beware as flicking to to block a magic auto will still cost you somewhere around 2-3k hp. Phase 4 - Ritual (400k-0 HP) ⬥ General Strategy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blocking the Healing Smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Understand your character as a wedge when blocking smoke. You can always block 2 smoke directions at once so whenever you have to move, rather than moving to block the current smoke, move to block the current smoke and the next smoke . For this reason it is also more beneficial to move to melee distance for this phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Alternatively you can spam click under him to block all of the healing smoke without needing to move, though this is also the most click-intensive and difficult thing you can do. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blocking Magic Onslaught (from most to least ideal) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Devotion ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Vitality Powerburst ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Debilitate ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Vitality Powerburst + Shield Dome Note: is very dangerous and is only to save kills following misjudgements. You should never want to use this method. Timing a for hp or using to block the 1st hit of Magic Onslaught also helps this method but adds even more risk. ⬥ Apot Sunshine ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Run underneath and activate Sunshine . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This will allow you to move to block smokes while remaining in . + → → → → → → → (sun ends) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Devotion to block the Magic Onslaught Note: Very unideal but depending on the timing you may need to activate Limitless to . ⬥ Last 100k or So ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Depending on the hp remaining, you have 3 options here. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The right option is a judgement call and takes practice. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Factors to consider include: hp remaining, food remaining, availability, dps, and confidence ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Safe and Slow - use a thresh or 2 then build to Sunshine → → → build (save ) + eat → → + the 2nd Magic Onslaught (may come before or after asphyx) → improvise with thresh ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option is slow as it generally will not finish the kill until some time after the 2nd Magic Onslaught; however, this option is the safest as it always has access to a safe approach to dealing with the Onslaught. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• All-in for the Skip - use a thresh then build to → → → 2 basics → → → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option should be fairly consistent in skipping; however, it leaves you in a bad way if you fail the skip with the only option being to resort to . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Example: https://youtu.be/sjP9TMF_0nM ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Speed - assuming hp remaining is fairly low, spam thresh and Guthix Staff EoF to kill before 2nd Magic Onslaught → → → → → improvise ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option is the fastest as it is not restricted by cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you choose this option and fail to skip the 2nd Magic Onslaught, eat up and use to hopefully survive. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you choose this method and consistently fail to skip, consider trying the All-in method. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Example: https://youtu.be/p11g8eljI9o Example Kill https://youtu.be/NFtB7jfFULo Example Runs https://youtu.be/AzzzO^^05-Q 15:24 by #Akva https://youtu.be/5DvBhiZM3iY 17:37 (pre-gChain) by #Linie
docs.title: The shadow reef magic

docs.text: Introduction The third installment in the Elite Dungeon series, the Shadow Reef is home to the long awaited boss known as Kranon, the Ambassador , which drops pieces for the T92 weapon: the Eldritch Crossbow This guide is structured in the order that rooms would be encountered if running the dungeon. Rotations are written to utilize the Greater Chain ability and assume 4TAA is used; however, neither is required to effectively do this dungeon. Each solo run of ED3 is worth 22,909,091 in eldritch pieces. Advanced players can get up to 3.5 kph, earning on average 80,181,818 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ Consider downgrading your graphics to Minimum with Medium+ draw distance for the Dungeon, as it is poorly optimized and prone to frame drops. ⬥ You can Surge or Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry.
docs.title: The Shadow Reef (Courtesy of #Linie & #Akva)

docs.text: Note: The dungeon can be effectively run with a single preset but for general speed reasons a separate preset should be used for Ambassador. Universal ⬥ Undead Slayer ability ⬥ Undead Slayer perk ⬥ Salve Amulet for undead mobs and Taraket ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves ⬥ Spiritual Prayers - use with a Ripper Demon familiar. ⬥ Weapon Poison ⬥ Maniacal Aura Note: Mahjarrat Aura is also ok and makes the Taraket strategy noticeably easier to execute. Optional ⬥ A few empty inventory spaces if picking up charm drops. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elite Dungeon chest upgrade solves this issue. ⬥ Adjust food as seen fit. ⬥ Lucky Charms ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doesn't increase Eldritch drop rate. ⬥ Flanking 4 - not super impactful especially in solo. Beginner/Group ⬥ Bringing both dual-wield and 2h is optional and should be done if the player is comfortable with switching. ⬥ Guthix Staff for increased hitchance ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Advanced Solo ⬥ Powerburst of Acceleration ⬥ Seismic Singularity - Caroming 4 ⬥ Superior Zuriel's Robe Bottom - Undead Slayer ⬥ Adrenaline Urn - not necessary but you sometimes drop combat during a few of the obstacles ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Note: Feel free to downgrade the Caroming 4 and Undead Slayer switches. Advanced Solo Ambassador ⬥ Powerburst of Vitality ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for )
docs.title: Presets

docs.text: Crassian Scout ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Ranged hits. Crassian Scuttler ⬥ Life Points : 9,000 ⬥ They attack with moderately damaging Melee hits. Crassian Warrior ⬥ Life Points : 22,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Cloaked Zealot ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Summon Crassian : Can spawn Crassian mobs to attack you with. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Armoured Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Ulthven Necromancer ⬥ Life Points : 16,500 ⬥ Summon Undead : Can spawn a continous horde of Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Huge Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Sea Horror ⬥ Life Points : 35,500 ⬥ Scream : A 2,000 typeless hit used at melee distance. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise. Enlightened Sotapanna ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ They attack with melee abilities for moderate damage. Undead Witch ⬥ Life Points : 30,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with a delayed, highly damaging Magic hit. Kal'gerion Demon ⬥ Life Points : 33,700 ⬥ Life Drain : Reduces your Constitution level by 2 ⬥ Demonic Ritual : Reduces all combat stats alongside rapid magic damage to anyone in range. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits otherwise. Warped Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Frenzy : Rapid 3,000 magic hits that also heal the Skeleton. Triggers are unknown. ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise.
docs.title: Relevant Mob Breakdown

docs.text: Note: All Greater Chain are assumed to be done with the Caroming 4 perk. Room 1 Tag mob 3 with → → (tc mob 2) → (tc mob 1) → run past mob 4 and use . Room 2 Surge and run straight along the path before bladed diving behind the Scouts. ‎ ‎Tag the northern most Scout with gChain then charge Detonate → (tc) . and into the next room. Room 3 Tag with (dw) gChain → and clean up the survivors. Room 4 There's only two Cloaked Zealots to clear here and they're lined up for AoEs but if you're quick your Detonate will still be on cooldown from Room 2. ‎ ‎Do → → → / . Bladed dive → surge into the next room as shown below. Room 5 There are two Crassian Scouts and two Cloaked Zealots spaced apart here. gChain one of the Zealots and use Asphyxiate . Clean up any stragglers with basics. Bladed dive diagonally into the next room. Note: Here and anywhere else in the mob sections of this guide, when using → you should not auto in between as it is important that your main target does not die early. Room 6A Equip your salve amulet and tag a Zombie with gChain . Charge Detonate → (tc) . Bladed dive diagonally across the rock to Room 6B. Room 6B Use Corruption Blast first if gChain is still on cooldown. Otherwise use → → → Room 7 Spam surge to use it as soon as you can. Aim to gChain a more central Zombie to ensure it reaches the Zombie close to the barrier. Use either Wild Magic or Guthix Staff here depending on speed and clean up with autos and bleeds. Blade dive diagonally into the next room. Room 8 You only need to kill the two Zealots. Detonate → → should be adequate to clear this room and end on high adren for Leviathan.
docs.title: First Floor - Pre-Crassian

docs.text: As the first boss of The Shadow Reef, The Crassian Leviathan has a very small and easy set of area denial mechanics that can deal a lot of damage if ignored. The boss heals passively over the duration of the fight, largely negated with Weapon Poison active. Mechanics ⬥ Poison Pits + Additional Heads - The center of the arena is filled with poison and is surrounded by the additional heads of the Leviathan. Never stand here. ⬥ Dragon Breath - This will always be the first mechanic of the fight and is signaled by the Leviathan firing a stationary breath attack in front of it, dealing rapid heavy typeless damage. Stand off to the side to avoid this. ⬥ Head Sweep - The Leviathan will slam its' head across the ground twice, dealing very heavy damage to anyone caught in the area, avoided by moving to the opposite side of where the sweep begins. ⬥ After going through one Dragon Breath and two sets of Head Sweeps , the Leviathan will move to other opposite side of the arena, repeating his previous rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bladed Dive + Surge to the opposite end of the arena. Strategy ⬥ Aim to Sunshine right away either directly in front of the Leviathan's nose or on the same tile you throw vuln bombs to (directly east of the Leviathan's head). Both spots allow for you to safely hit the boss in while avoiding the Head Sweep special. Drink your apot and look to use → . ⬥ At this point the Head Sweep will have started. Use an Guthix Staff spec either before or after you move to dodge the Head Sweep followed by a Detonate after dodging once. Get in another → → before you ends. ⬥ After your ends, try to just use thresholds to do damage up until it switches sides. If your damage doesn't look too great when you hit about the 1 minute mark, try to build to high adren to use a Metaphoris + Limitless immediately after the switch. Otherwise look to finish the boss off with more thresholds and Guthix Staff specs after the switch. Note: Leviathan switching sides counts as walking for Combust so look to use that as one of your last abilities on the initial side. ⬥ Example Kill: https://youtu.be/wdwPoXs06q0
docs.title: The Crassian Leviathan

docs.text: Room 9 Drink your Acceleration Powerburst exiting the Leviathan and utilize surge and bladed dive as demonstrated below to quickly reach this room. There is a Cloaked Zealot and various Scuttlers in this room you need to clear to proceed. gChain the Zealot and use Asphyxiate followed by Dragonbreath . If your does not hit all the Scuttlers, you may want to use Corruption Blast before . Diagonally bladed dive into the next room. Room 10 Put your salve amulet back on. In the middle of the room, tag a Zombie with gChain and charge Detonate → (tc) . Surge → bladed dive → to reach the cliff. Room 11 Jump down the cliff to clear an Ulthven Necromancer and two Huge Skeletons. Use gChain → Asphyxiate on the Necromancer to clear the entire room. Room 12 There are two Necromancers off at the sides and a line of three Armoured Zombies guarding the door. You only need to kill one Necromancer and the Zombies to proceed to section 2, the temple area. Run to the archway and surge straight before diagonally bladed diving towards a Necromancer. Kill the Necromancer with Wild Magic → Combust . Use gChain on an Armoured Zombie and charge Detonate → .
docs.title: Post-Crassian - Second Floor Entry

docs.text: Room 1 There are two Ulthven Necromancers guarding the gates to the east and west that you must clear to access the black stone artefacts. The main gate will not drop until these have been activated. A mass of summoned skeletons will form in the room as you go about this task. Equip your and surge + bladed dive down the path. Go west first and kill the Necromancer with → → . through the open barrier to go tag the artefact. diagonally back to the doorway and through. Kill the east Necromancer with → and towards the doorway. Go tag the artefact then run back and diagonally towards the bridge. Demonstrated: https://youtu.be/dGDwdi6PojI Room 2 Surge twice down the bridge to the two Sea Horrors and a Necromancer that you must clear to proceed. Use gChain → Asphyxiate → Dragonbreath on the east Horror while running to the far northeast corner. Charge Detonate on the west Horror → . The Necromancer should die to AoE during this clear but kill with basics if it suvives. Diagonally bladed dive to the next hallway afterwards. Note: It is ok to use Devotion here, but it should ideally be before reaching the Horrors. Room 3 There's a line of three Acolytes of Seiryu guarding the gate here that must be cleared to proceed. Tag the northernmost Acolyte with gChain and use Wild Magic before switching targets. Finish off the survivors with Dragonbreath and Corruption Blast . Immediately after clearing this room, drink your Acceleration Powerburst to bladed dive back to back to back as demonstrated below. Room 4 There are many mobs here but only the Necromancers and Huge Skeletons must be cleared. Put your salve amulet back on and use gChain → Asphyxiate → Dragonbreath on the western Necromancer. Finish off what's left with basics, but try not to use Corruption Blast as it will stop your from banking at the chest.
docs.title: Second Floor Entry - Taraket Entry

docs.text: This encounter is the second boss of the Shadow Reef, and is a clear step up in difficulty from the first. Taraket, Corpses and Skeletons are classified as Undead for Salve Amulet , Undead Slayer perk and sigil purposes.
docs.title: Taraket the Necromancer

docs.text: ⬥ Rift of Undeath - ‎ ‎This Rift with 30k HP will spawn a large amount of skeletons that each deal low amounts of damage. After roughly 30 seconds, it will explode for heavy typeless damage to the player. Prevented by killing it. ⬥ Death's Swiftness - Taraket will shroud himself in a Death's Swiftness, becoming immobile and switching attack styles from Mage to Ranged. These autos are slightly stronger than his Magic ones. ⬥ Corpse Carrier and Bloated Monstrosity - Upon reaching 200K hitpoints, Taraket will become invulnerable and fly towards one of the two black crystals at the sides of the arena, healing himself and spawning one of the two corpses: Corpse Carrier (west) or the Bloated Monstrosity (east), with 90K HP each. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Corpse Carrier will continuously spawn skeletal mobs as it's alive ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Bloated Monstrosity increases the damage of Taraket's attacks. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Both of these attack with melee and are very easy to kite if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Taraket can only spawn these once each and will not heal upon hitting 200K HP afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The first spawn will always be the closest crystal to Taraket. ⬥ Spirit Line - Taraket smashes the ground infront of him for heavy melee damage, summoning a line of spirits infront of him that will move towards the player, dealing rapid typeless damage upon contact. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move out of the way as needed be. Strategy ⬥ Utilizing 4TAA with Blood Barrage and gChain will make a world of difference in this fight in particular allowing players to essentially tank almost everything, especially on Mahjarrat Aura rather than Maniacal . ‎ ‎With , the last 300k can be sketchy at times; however, it is very much worth using. ⬥ Start out the fight with an apot Sunshine and your salve amulet equipped. → → → → (→ if Taraket is still above 200k hp) / the Rift → to clear the skeletons → + the Bloated Monstrosity → run back to just west of where Taraket was before flying and charge on him → → → (→ → if not phased but try to stay high adren) Note: Where you stand is important here as you're looking to body block Taraket from flying west. ⬥ Equip → on the Bloated Monstrosity and build back to 100 to back on Taraket and build with 2 basics → → → → step to the other side of Taraket before the Corpse Carrier reaches melee distance to effective stack it on top of Taraket Blocking + + Stacking Demonstrated: Note: Stacking Corpse Carrier in this way is not 100% guranteed and it is very important that you move back through Taraket to restack if it does not work. → → → → → → ( ends) ⬥ From here finish off taraket with more thresholds and . Be sure to side step the melee hits from the Spirit Line special as they will severly hurt your ability to outheal the majority of the damage you take. Also use off cooldown (preferably before thresholds or ) to improve overall healing and to repeatedly clear out the skeletal mobs the Corpse Carrier spawns. A second rift will spawn but you should be killing Taraket before it explodes so you can generally ignore it. ⬥ The Dark Form prayer is helpful here especially if using Spiritual Prayers . Note: Untested but players who do not 4TAA can likely follow this strategy up until when the Corpse Carrier spawns, at which point they would want to focus it down while in Sunshine . ⬥ Example Kill: https://youtu.be/qhA1C_HZrPQ
docs.title: Mechanics

docs.text: Note: This section and the following section can be cleared fairly easily with little to no food. As such, do not bank after Taraket even if running low. Room 5 Surge + bladed dive → out of Taraket's room. There is a Sea Witch and two Armoured Zombies in this room. Tag the Witch with gChain → Asphxyiate /Wild Magic /Guthix Staff depending on cooldowns following Taraket. into the next room. Room 6 Put back on your Essence of Finality . Only the Kalgerion Demon needs to be killed here to proceed. He's really big and impossible to miss. If you have it, the Demon Slayer ability can be used here. Guthix staff (dw) → Asphyxiate /Wild Magic should be enough. The Demon Slayer ability can be used here if you already own it. After killing the demon, look to utilize surge and bladed dive and an Acceleration Powerburst as demonstrated below. Note: You can manipulate one of the required Necromancers in room 7 to move from his position to make the next room easier on you by running as close as you can to him, so he aggros you through the wall. This isn’t 100% guaranteed. Room 7 There's two Necromancers hiding around in this room that need to be cleared. Use either Wild Magic or Guthix Staff followed by Combust on the west Necromancer then surge back towards the east Necromancer. If low on Hp or food use gChain → Asphyxiate on the east Necromancer, otherwise simply . Diagonally bladed dive through the corner into the next room and keep running to angle yourself for the next surge . Room 8 Only the two Necromancers are guarding the gate here. Kill the first Necromancer with Sonic → Guthix Staff then surge diagonally through the corner to the second Necromancer. Kill it with Wild Magic → Corruption Blast and diagonally bladed dive through the corner to the cliff.
docs.title: Taraket Exit - Second Floor Exit

docs.text: Room 1 Use surge twice to reach the group of Crassian Warriors and Scuttlers around the gate that must be killed. They stack up very nicely for all AoEs and aren't very threatening in general. Tag a Warrior with gChain → Combust on your way to the barrier and charge a Detonate → → (→ → if bad ). Improvise to finish off the survivors. Room 2 There's two Warped Skeletons in here that can completely clear you if you aren't paying attention. Equip your salve amulet and gChain the two Skeletons. Proceed to Asphyxiate → (tc skeleton 2) → . Surge into the next room and immediately bladed dive behind the line of Zealots. Room 3 Re-equip your Essence of Finality and use gChain on either one of the eastern Zealots or Skeleton if close. From here use Tsunami then improvise to finish off the stragglers ideally with Detonate . Room 4 The last room before the final boss of the dungeon. There are two more skeletons along with two Crassian Scouts that need to be cleared to proceed. There are three minibosses that can spawn in this room with a fairly inconvenient aggro range so try to avoid them by hugging the western wall. Ideally look to gChain the Skeletons → Asphyxiate → Combust /Corruption Blast . Build on the Scouts to ensure you have full adren for Ambassador. Note: If no minibosses spawn in this room, look to zoom to the door and all 4 mobs.
docs.title: Third Floor Entry - Pre-Ambassador

docs.text: At the bottom of the abyssal section awaits Kranon, the Ambassador, the final boss of the Elite Dungeon 3. This boss has a moderate learning curve compared to most solo bosses and has a variety of mechanics ranging from DPS checks, area denial, self-healing, and the usage multiple combat styles. The boss primarily attacks with ranged , with a heavy mage attack after every 5 autos. The mage hit is replaced by a small but instant melee swipe if the player is in melee distance. Ambassador's Attack Rotation ⬥ 1M HP to 550K - Phase 1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mage/Melee auto → 5 autos → Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Black Hole → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Purple Corruption → 5 autos ‎ ‎→ Sinister Fragments → Repeat Magic Auto-Attack ⬥ 550K to 400K - Phase 2 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Uses the same auto attack rotation until Ritual. ⬥ Ritual - Kill ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5 autos → Melee/Magic → 5 autos → Melee/Magic → Onslaught 1M-550K HP ⬥ Purple Corruption ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador fires a spout into the player, dealing no damage and placing a bar over their head. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When this bar nears depletion, a 5x5 area around the player will become corrupted until Seiryu clears them at the Ritual phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is similar to the Sanctum Guardian's mechanic from ED1 but will create two areas instead, separated by 2 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- These zones will last until the final phase of the fight and will ramp up to 2000 typeless damage to anyone standing inside. ⬥ Black Hole ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Ambassador will spawn a black hole near the area that will explode a few seconds afterwards, dealing 8000+ damage to the player ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Despawned by stunning it. ⬥ Sinister Fragments ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Six fragments will disperse from the boss to the edges of the arena with 20K HP each. At the same time, the Ambassador will fire three slowly rotating beams that last for about a minute. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Failing to destroy a fragment(s) prompts the Ambassador to absorb them, and release a hard hitting typeless explotion per fragment absorbed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The beams always spawn in set locations (N, SE, SW), and rotate counterclockwise slowly. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• He'll use the Fragments one minute into the fight or by hitting the 650K cap. Burn! Like the ants you are. A fragment is absorbed 550K-400K HP ⬥ The Ambassador stops spawning Sinister Fragments. ⬥ The Ambassador spawns invulnerable Crassian Ritual Keepers that deal low ranged damage, making Resonance harder to use. 400K-0 HP ⬥ The Ambassador will stop doing his corruption and black hole mechanics, continuing his auto attack pattern as normal. ⬥ Seiryu will emerge shortly after 400K, clearing all Crassians and infested areas. ⬥ A ring of black hands will spawn to encompass the edge of the arena. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The hands will slam down in a clockwise fashion, sending constant smoke projectiles towards the Ambassador. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These will heal the boss 2500 HP for each smoke let in and can be blocked, directing a small amount of damage towards the player. Seiryu arrives Ritual begins ⬥ Magic Onslaught ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Every 10 auto attacks, the Ambassador will send out 5 extremely hard hitting Magic attacks.
docs.title: Kranon, the Ambassador

docs.text: General Tips ⬥ Use a Ripper demon with scrolls and drink Spiritual Prayers . ⬥ Try to avoid using solid food. Stick to Blue jellies , and Guthix rest or Saradomin brews , if you can. ⬥ Try to maximize the potential healing from soulsplitting Spinners and the Seiryu Heal at 400k to cut down on food usage throughout the fight. Resonance can also be used on the magic auto attack occasionally to preserve food. ⬥ You will need to Spellbook Swap to use Disruption Shield throughout the fight. Bring runes accordingly. ⬥ Flanking can be utilized throughout the fight by stepping directly underneath the Ambassador. Phase 1 - 1M-650k HP Note: Most autos and basics will be omitted in the rotations below. If either is listed below, the timing achieved is intentional. Also all Detonate are charged for 3 ticks. ⬥ Magic 1st Auto vs Melee 1st Auto ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doing → (during gcd) to reach melee distance instantly at the start of the fight will switch the 1st auto into a melee auto. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Changing the 1st auto into a melee auto changes the timing of the 1st smoke. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Mage 1st auto leads to a 22.8s (38t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Melee 1st auto leads to a 31.8s (53t) 1st smoke drop. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No other timings are changed. Note: The rotation in this guide assumes Magic 1st auto for timings. ⬥ Start the Fight with an Apot Sunshine ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Disruption Shield while running down the ramp + → → → run to the north/northwest corner of your while waiting to auto → → (1st smoke timer will start + switch to for the 2nd magic auto) → → move out of smoke → (3rd magic auto) → → clear black hole with immediately (timer will be close to ending) ( ends) build with basics → → (2nd smoke timer starts) → (4th magic auto will come out towards the end of smoke timer) → move out of smoke → → → ⬥ Phase 1 Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Try to place the 2nd smoke next to your 1st smoke. This will put them out of the way as after spinners you will primarily stay south/southwest of Ambassador while also leaving a large path on the east side for pathing during spinners. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you switch prayers properly and the last magic auto attack, it is fairly straight forward to no food phase 1 starting from full hp. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Depending on where the black hole spawns, you may need to start moving early to reach it in time. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Be careful that you do not stall then cancel . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Having the flanking perk equipped will cause to not clear the black hole. Phase 2 - Spinners ⬥ Spinner Strategy (not all basics listed) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1st: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 2nd: → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3rd: → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 4th: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5th: → basics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 6th: ignore and build on Ambassador ⬥ Spinners Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You only need to kill 5 out of 6 and then use either or to block the explosion hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• No movement abilities are required to effectively move between spinners; however, if desired, it is recommended to use Bladed Dive as its cooldown will be reset by each spinner death. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Using Vulnerability bombs on each of the spinners is not necessary but recommended. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The spinners are not immune to binds and therefore Ice Barrage + Wrack can be utilized. Phase 3 - 650k-400k ⬥ Natural Instinct Sunshine → 3-4 basics → the eruption → → (5th magic auto) → (3rd smoke timer start) → → move → (6th magic auto) → → clear black hole with immediately build with basics → (7th magic auto) (if bad adren skip to not delay next ) → (dw) ⬥ Phase 3 Tips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you are confident in your ability to on tick, you can the 7th magic auto here to save food. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Try to end this phase on very low hp for a large heal from Seiryu but beware as flicking to to block a magic auto will still cost you somewhere around 2-3k hp. Phase 4 - Ritual (400k-0 HP) ⬥ General Strategy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blocking the Healing Smoke ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Understand your character as a wedge when blocking smoke. You can always block 2 smoke directions at once so whenever you have to move, rather than moving to block the current smoke, move to block the current smoke and the next smoke . For this reason it is also more beneficial to move to melee distance for this phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Alternatively you can spam click under him to block all of the healing smoke without needing to move, though this is also the most click-intensive and difficult thing you can do. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blocking Magic Onslaught (from most to least ideal) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Devotion ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Vitality Powerburst ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Reflect + Debilitate ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Vitality Powerburst + Shield Dome Note: is very dangerous and is only to save kills following misjudgements. You should never want to use this method. Timing a for hp or using to block the 1st hit of Magic Onslaught also helps this method but adds even more risk. ⬥ Apot Sunshine ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Run underneath and activate Sunshine . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This will allow you to move to block smokes while remaining in . + → → → → → → → (sun ends) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Devotion to block the Magic Onslaught Note: Very unideal but depending on the timing you may need to activate Limitless to . ⬥ Last 100k or So ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Depending on the hp remaining, you have 3 options here. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The right option is a judgement call and takes practice. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Factors to consider include: hp remaining, food remaining, availability, dps, and confidence ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Safe and Slow - use a thresh or 2 then build to Sunshine → → → build (save ) + eat → → + the 2nd Magic Onslaught (may come before or after asphyx) → improvise with thresh ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option is slow as it generally will not finish the kill until some time after the 2nd Magic Onslaught; however, this option is the safest as it always has access to a safe approach to dealing with the Onslaught. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• All-in for the Skip - use a thresh then build to → → → 2 basics → → → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option should be fairly consistent in skipping; however, it leaves you in a bad way if you fail the skip with the only option being to resort to . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Example: https://youtu.be/sjP9TMF_0nM ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Speed - assuming hp remaining is fairly low, spam thresh and Guthix Staff EoF to kill before 2nd Magic Onslaught → → → → → improvise ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This option is the fastest as it is not restricted by cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you choose this option and fail to skip the 2nd Magic Onslaught, eat up and use to hopefully survive. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you choose this method and consistently fail to skip, consider trying the All-in method. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Example: https://youtu.be/p11g8eljI9o Example Kill https://youtu.be/NFtB7jfFULo
docs.title: Ambassador Strategy

docs.text: https://youtu.be/AzzzO^^05-Q 15:24 by #Akva https://youtu.be/5DvBhiZM3iY 17:37 (pre-gChain) by #Linie
docs.title: Example Runs

docs.text: The shadow reef melee The Shadow Reef (Courtesy of #Evil Lucario, #Linie, & #Akva) Introduction The third installment in the Elite Dungeon series, the Shadow Reef is home to the long awaited boss known as Kranon, the Ambassador , which drops pieces for the T92 weapon: the Eldritch Crossbow This guide is structured in the order that rooms would be encountered if running the Dungeon. Each solo run of ED3 is worth 22,909,091 in eldritch pieces. Advanced players can get up to 4 kph, earning on average 91,636,364 gp/hr. General Notes ⬥ The rotations listed for the bosses are for an advanced setup, lower tiered set-ups will require improvisation. ⬥ It's recommended to set your anti-spam delay for your Double Surge to 1 via the Lectern at Anachronia. ⬥ Consider downgrading your graphics to Minimum with Medium+ draw distance for the Dungeon, as it is poorly optimized and prone to frame drops. ⬥ You can Surge or Bladed Dive a tick before each gate unlocks to save a tick on every entry. ⬥ The Corbicula Rex perk (112 Farming) in ROoT is extremely helpful in this dungeon, as Meteor Strike is frequently used here. Presets Universal ⬥ Undead Slayer Ability ⬥ Undead Slayer Perk ⬥ Salve Amulet for undead mobs. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Applicable to Taraket ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves ⬥ Spiritual Prayers ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For use with a Ripper Demon familiar. Optional ⬥ A few empty inventory spaces if picking up charm drops. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elite Dungeon chest upgrade solves this issue. ⬥ Adjust food as seen fit. ⬥ Lucky Charms ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doesn't increase Eldritch drop rate. ⬥ Flanking 4 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• ‎ ‎Applicable to a small degree to solo runs. Beginner/Group Melee ⬥ Noxious Scythe to deal area-of-effect damage. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Advanced/Solo Melee ⬥ Terrasaur Maul for Taraket and The Ambassador ⬥ Essence of Finality with either: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dragon Battleaxe to save an inventory space. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dragon Claws for good damage on Relentless procs. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Relevant Mob Breakdown Crassian Scout ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Ranged hits. Crassian Scuttler ⬥ Life Points : 9,000 ⬥ They attack with moderately damaging Melee hits. Crassian Warrior ⬥ Life Points : 22,000 ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Cloaked Zealot ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Summon Crassian : Can spawn Crassian mobs to attack you with. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Armoured Zombie ⬥ Life Points : 20,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Ulthven Necromancer ⬥ Life Points : 16,500 ⬥ Summon Undead : Can spawn a continous horde of Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits. Huge Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits. Sea Horror ⬥ Life Points : 35,500 ⬥ Scream : A 2,000 typeless hit used at melee distance. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise. Enlightened Sotapanna ⬥ Life Points : 15,000 ⬥ They attack with melee abilities for moderate damage. Undead Witch ⬥ Life Points : 30,000 ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with a delayed, highly damaging Magic hit. Kal'gerion Demon ⬥ Life Points : 33,700 ⬥ Life Drain : Reduces your Constitution level by 2 ⬥ Demonic Ritual : Reduces all combat stats alongside rapid magic damage to anyone in range. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Magic hits otherwise. Warped Skeleton ⬥ Life Points : 12,000 ⬥ Frenzy : Rapid 3,000 magic hits that also heal the Skeleton. Triggers are unknown. ⬥ Classified as Undead. ⬥ They attack with low-damage Melee hits otherwise. First Floor - Pre Crassian Room 1 GBarge the eastern crassian scout and bleed Assault on it. Move to the spot two squares north of the other scout and Hurricane , hitting all four enemies. Finish off with Cleave → Quake . Room 2 Use GFlurry on the scouts, hitting as much scuttlers and scouts as possible. Finish with Cleave → Hurricane . Room 3 Move to the center of the cluster and Meteor Strike . Cleave → Quake should finish the job afterwards Room 4 Use Hurricane , GFlurry , and Quake on the Zealots to kill them. How to cut the corner: Room 5 There are two Crassian Scouts and two Cloaked Zealots spaced apart here. Line up your Cleave , Hurricane , and Quake to hit everything in one go. You only need to kill the two Scouts and Zealots to move to the next room. Room 6 ⬥ Hit the first group with Cleave then keep running past while putting on your salve amulet. ⬥ Quake the second group, then run back to the middle to lure both groups of zombies next to you. ⬥ Hurricane and finish off the rest with Bladed Dive (with Laceration boots) and GFlurry . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you have it available, Meteor Strike is good but you likely won’t have it back in time. Room 7 GBarge a zombie, Cleave , then target the 20k armored zombie and bleed Assault on it. Then run back to the zombie you used Barge on and AoE with what you have available. Room 8 You only need to kill the two Zealots here to proceed. Use GFlurry and Cleave and prepare your gear for the next boss, watching your adrenaline and amulets. The Crassian Leviathan As the first boss of The Shadow Reef, The Crassian Leviathan has a very small and easy set of area denial mechanics that can deal a lot of damage if ignored. The boss heals passively over the duration of the fight, largely negated with Weapon Poison active. Mechanics ⬥ Poison Pits + Additional Heads - The center of the arena is filled with poison and is surrounded by the additional heads of the Leviathan. Never stand here. ⬥ Dragon Breath - This will always be the first mechanic of the fight and is signaled by the Leviathan firing a stationary breath attack in front of it, dealing rapid heavy typeless damage. Stand off to the side to avoid this. ⬥ Head Sweep - The Leviathan will slam its' head across the ground twice, dealing very heavy damage to anyone caught in the area, avoided by moving to the opposite side of where the sweep begins. ⬥ After going through one Dragon Breath and two sets of Head Sweeps , the Leviathan will move to other opposite side of the arena, repeating his previous rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bladed Dive + Surge to the opposite end of the arena. Strategy For whatever reason, the Crassian Leviathan actually has decent defense so beware if not using Berserker . Both strategies utilize channeled abilities and spamclicking the ground to stay on 2 specific "safe tiles" on either side of Crass's head during the Dragon Breath and Head Sweep mechanics. ‎ ‎If used correctly, you do not need a scythe to melee this boss. ⬥ Standard 1 Cycle Your target is to pop Berserk and ZGS spec during the fight to finish him. + → → bleed → → (3 hit) → → → → (2-3 hit) ⬥ 2 Zerk 1 Cycle Slower but potentially more consistent than the standard rotation -- your objective is to use gFlurry to reduce the cooldown of Berserk , allowing for 2 s in the roughly 1:10 time frame. This rotation does not work if you do not have Limitless . + → → bleed → → (3 hit) → → ( if good adren) → (4 hit) → → 188 → bleed → 2 188s (1 if impatient proc) → / depending on HP Note: With this rotation, you are looking to the second time as soon as it comes off cooldown. Post-Crassian - Second Floor Entry Room 9 There is a Cloaked Zealot and various Scuttlers in this room you need to clear to proceed. GBarge one of the scouts for both the Barge buff and faster movement. Bleed Assault on the zealot, then immediately target a Scuttler to Hurricane and Quake . Room 10 Wait for them to MD you and use Meteor Strike with a few AoEs. Room 11 Run down a long path and jump down the cliff to clear an Ulthven Necromancer and two Huge Skeletons. There's not much to this room but focusing the necromancer will clear the skeletons in the AoE available. Save the following abilities for next Room: Cleave and GFlurry Room 12 Kill one of the Necromancers with a walked Slaughter → Decimate . Then quickly move to the zombies guarding the entrance to the temple itself. Cleave and GFlurry the zombies, then finish off with good basics. Second Floor Entry - Taraket Entry Room 1 ⬥ Go to either necromancer and GBarge (with Mobile) → Assault . ⬥ Kill that necromancer and activate the artifact, ⬥ Go to the other necromancer and GBarge (with Mobile again) → GFlurry , then activate the artifact. Room 2 ⬥ Use Devotion right as you start moving into the bridge and Bladed Dive + Surge to the end immediately mid-GCD, ⬥ GBarge one of the sea horrors. ⬥ Bleed Assault on it, then target the necromancer to Hurricane . ⬥ Cleave → Quake the horror you didn’t attack to kill both the first horror and the necromancer. ⬥ Finish off the horror with other strong basics to proceed. Room 3 There's a line of three Acolytes of Seiryu guarding the gate here that must be cleared to proceed. They are melee and line up well for AoEs. Room 4 ⬥ Bladed Dive + Surge through the staircase as marked to avoid aggroing the four acolytes ⬥ Go all the way to the next gate. There are many mobs here but only the necromancers and Huge Skeletons must be cleared. ⬥ Start with a Meteor Strike and finish off all the mobs with other AoE abilities, but make sure to have high adrenaline as the next room is the second boss, Taraket the Necromancer. Taraket the Necromancer This encounter is the second boss of the Shadow Reef, and is a clear step up in difficulty from the first. Taraket, Corpses and Skeletons are classified as Undead for Salve Amulet , Undead Slayer perk and sigil purposes. Mechanics ⬥ Rift of Undeath - ‎ ‎This Rift with 30k HP will spawn a large amount of skeletons that each deal low amounts of damage. After roughly 30 seconds, it will explode for heavy typeless damage to the player. Prevented by killing it. ⬥ Death's Swiftness - Taraket will shroud himself in a Death's Swiftness, becoming immobile and switching attack styles from Mage to Ranged.
