docs.text: Helwyr Helwyr (Courtesy of #Inflem & #Archeus) Introduction Helwyr, the Seren general residing in the Heart of Gielinor, requires 80 magic and 40 Seren killcount to fight. The notable drops for this boss are the Cywir Wand , Cywir Orb, and Crest of Seren . These items can be augmented and disassembled for Cywir components which are required for Planted Feet . Drops ⬥ Serenic essence ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/128 base, 1/64 at 100% reputation ⬥ Crest of Seren ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/512 base, 1/256 at 100% reputation ⬥ Wand of the Cywir Elders ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/512 base, 1/256 at 100% reputation ⬥ Orb of the Cywir Elders ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/512 base, 1/256 at 100% reputation ⬥ Twisted Antler ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/2000 base (Normal Mode) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/1000 base (Hard Mode) Each Helwyr kill is worth 291,160, with 148,837 of that being from commons. Advanced players can get up to 70 kph, earning on average 20,381,232 gp/hr. Presets Advanced Melee Preset ⬥ ‎ ‎ Cinderbane Gloves ⬥ ‎ ‎ Amulet of Souls - extra HP back with and mitigate more damage with protection curses. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for and ) Mechanics Attack Rotation Mushroom gas → 2 Autos → Cleave → 2 Autos → Frenzy → 2 Autos → Minion Spawn → 2 Autos → Repeat Mushroom Gas Avoided by just running out of it. Avoid standing directly on top of a mushroom to decrease the distance needed to move out of the gas. Standing in the mushroom gas will give you a 250 damage bleed every tick, and if standing in the gas for a prolonged time will bind you. Cleave Hits in a frontal cone for up to 3k and apply a bleed. Do not freedom this bleed. If you are standing a distance away from Helwyr, he will first lunge towards you before the attack. There are a few methods to handle this attack. ⬥ If using or , move out of the damage cone. Can also be done with but is DPS waste ⬥ A well-timed Resonance will heal a nice chunk. Note you will still acquire the bleed. This method is best if you are struggling to Soul Split your HP back up and surviving the whole hour. This method can become difficult with the Cywir Alphas alive, but it can also be a good chance to practice some tick Resonances with little risk as long as you are above 3kish HP. ⬥ Lastly, while praying Soul Split , cast / from the Lunar Spellbook. Frenzy Helwyr’s frenzy attack has him leaping around doing rapid melee damage while applying a bleed stack with each attack. Again, while using Range or Magic, you can just run away from Helwyr’s Frenzy attack, but with Melee it is better to stay put and continue doing damage. If you are getting smacked around, you can always pray melee and Devotion or Debilitate . After this attack has concluded, feel free to Freedom the bleed if you wish. Minion Spawn Helwyr’s minion spawn attack has him howl and summon two 3k HP Cywir Alphas. Easily taken out with AoEs. Casual Melee Helwyr Guide (Courtesy of #Piegood and #Archeus) What to Expect This method can achieve ~65 kills per hour with average kill times of 27.6s Preset ⬥ ‎ ‎ Fury of the Small and Berserker's Fury relics ⬥ ‎ ‎ Berserker aura ⬥ ‎ ‎ Essence of Finality Dragon Claws ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for and ) Rotations ⬥ Base rotation: Join instance → → → + → (tc) → (walk under) → → + → + 2H Auto → → → → OH + 2H Auto → → (5TAA) → (4hit) → (if you get 1 proc) OR (2hit) (if you don't/no ) OR (if neither nor ) → (or if ~6-7k HP left) ⬥ Base rotation adjusted to minimize switching (Courtesy of #NamoV): https://i.imgur.com/lEpVnKI.png ⬥ Alternate start without (Courtesy of #Pleb): Join instance → → → → (tc) (dw) → (4t) (walk under) → continue as normal then loot, tele out to altar to reset cooldowns, then to crystal to build adrenaline (use Excalibur while building) then repeat. Note: Always Vengeance the cleave, ideally with SS on (Deflect Melee if ~70% HP though, or if not using Trimmed Masterwork ) Sample Kills https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=12qTzSHLTTs&ab_channel=VideoDump Tips and Tricks ⬥ If you get shroomed, ideally walk under Helwyr until you are out of the shroom radius ⬥ If your HP gets really low then utilize Disrupt ⬥ To make looting more efficient, you can bind the open area loot interface in control settings, and then just hit that bind and the loot bind as soon as Helwyr dies. Casual Mage Helwyr Guide What to Expect This method can achieve around 55 kills per hour with average kill times around 35-45 seconds. Preset ⬥ ‎ ‎ Fury of the Small and Berserker's Fury relics ⬥ ‎ ‎ Maniacal aura > Mahjarrat aura > Dark Magic aura Note: Replace Reaver's Ring with a Ring of death or Asylum surgeon's ring if not using Maniacal aura. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Essence of Finality Guthix Staff ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for and ) Note: You can swap Super Restores for Spiritual Prayers , but extra ripper specs do not aid much as you are already gated by Sunshine's cooldown in this guide, likewise with using a Scrimshaw over Zamorak Book . Rotation → → → (tc) → → → / → → → → → → (3t) → → → → → → → improv w/ basics and try to end at 100 adren Sample Kills https://youtu.be/1wBU6dBY1tQ Timing Target Cycle To time target cycle you want to use 3 ability from rejoining instance, this is what the Anticipate → Bladed Dive → Sunshine accomplishes Tips and Tricks ⬥ When you finish a kill, wait until Sunshine is ~4sec off cooldown before rejoining instance. ⬥ If you end a kill at <100 adrenaline, teleport out and use Adrenaline Crystal to build. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you end at 91-99 adren, use an ability on a wolf instead. ⬥ While you have a lot of leeway on Sunshine positioning, you want to ensure you are standing 1 southwest of the middle shroom so that you are Melee Distance to Helwyr from Target Cycle tick. ⬥ Ensure to walk two tiles west when walking your combust in the above rotation. ⬥ If you get a middle shroom explosion at start, tank it until you finish your first Asphyxiate , then walk 1 more west then adapt to Helwyr's walk before your Detonate to ensure you are still in Sunshine but not taking damage ⬥ If you get the shroom explosion that is directly west of middle shroom, then after your first Asphixate walk to another side of your Sunshine to avoid the shroom damage. ⬥ If you get both middle and west just teleport out or try to not die. ⬥ If you wish to use Vulnerability Bombs , throw it after Sunshine Undergeared Helwyr What to Expect This method can achieve around 20 kills per hour with average kill times around 1:50-2:00. Preset Inventory Setup ⬥ Armour : Lunar (T60 Power Armour) ⬥ Weapon : Vanquish (T75 Weapon) ⬥ Pocket Slot : Illuminated Godbook ⬥ Aura : Maniacal ⬥ Ring : Vigour ⬥ Shield : Bandos Warshield (T70 Shield) ⬥ Inventory : Left → Right, Up → Down: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Grand Magic Potion ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Super Guthix Rest ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Green Blubber Jellyfish ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Super Prayer Renewal ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Weapon Poison+++ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bandos Warshield ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Expensive Spices ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Guthix Staff ⬥ Runes : (Runes for ) Brief Guide Drink Grand Magic Potion before going in w/ prayers on (prot melee + augury), spam Target Cycle whilst going into spot displayed in the VOD (view image below, its 1 tile Southwest of the middle shroom), then and make sure to be at that spot and then follow the rotation below. Rotation (Target Cycle) → → → → → → → → → → → → → → → → → Improvise with thresholds + specials + good basics to kill Sample Kills https://youtu.be/2PLV7HSl-vw Note: While it is beneficial to follow the rotation, as it is written in a way to deal and mitigate damage, it is not vital to follow it. It is just important to remember that you should ultimate ( ), thresh ( twice, once ideally), and that you should Resonance the cleave and Devotion the frenzy. Tips and Tricks ⬥ Avoid moving unless absolutely necessary, as it will cause Helwyr to skip autos and specs ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Only move Helwyr under the following circumstances: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Walking a bleed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Avoiding mushroom damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Avoiding the frenzy when Devotion is on cooldown (can just Debiliate or face tank it too) ⬥ If you get shroomed in your ultimate at the start just teleport out. ⬥ Always aim to Resonance the cleave, ideally without protect from melee on. ⬥ You can Devotion every other frenzy special. ⬥ Ensure to Freedom when it ends, Vulnerbility with every second Freedom you do (this will be the Freedom after the non-Devotioned frenzy). ⬥ To time Target Cycle just spam it and run to spot and you will get it, ideally have these binds near one another to make it easy to do ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Refer to #mechanics to set up Target Cycle. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Further, it is important to ensure you run and spam the bind, for if you try to Target Cycle without a target it goes on a cooldown which is reset by walking a tile ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you properly Target Cycle Helwyr, his HP box will not show. AFK Magic Strategy (~35-39 kph) (Courtesy of #FriggityFrank) Gp/hr Total 10,190,616 Note: Assumes Max Reputation and 35 kph. Explanation ⬥ This method will net less kills per hour but may be used if you do not wish to put high amounts of effort into a mid level boss. ⬥ It is important to pray as this method relies on constant healing. It is also important to use the Animate Dead spell, as the method heavily relies on its usage. ⬥ Please note this setup/guide is VERY new and is subject to change in the near future. ⬥ Aura choice can vary, but will affect how afk kills can be. They are listed in order of effectiveness: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vampyrism Aura provides extra safety through its healing and allows more chances for poison damage. Due to the constant damage being taken while fighting Helwyr, this is by far the safest and most reliable aura choice to afk with. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Penance Aura allows for the most afk experience, but is less safe to use and doesn't benefit the usage of a Blood Reaver familiar. It is advised to pay attention to your HP with this aura, and to be prepared to eat. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dark Magic provides extra damage, but you must pay more attention to both your HP and your prayer points. This should be an effective aura for fast kills, but is the least afk choice. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mahjarrat Aura provides extra damage, but does not give any extra poison procs. Still, it is a viable option as a secondary aura. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do not use Maniacal for afking, as it will get you killed very easily. ⬥ An Inquisitor's Staff will be one of the most effective weapons for this setup due to its passive. If you do not have one, other 2-handed staffs such as Superior Zuriel's or Noxious should be fine to use, but may be slightly slower. Mandatory Requirements ⬥ This setup should reliably allow you to afk Helwyr, with the duration between checking your status dependent on the aura you are using. However, the following needs to be done or else This method will be either unreliable or will outright not work. Cutting corners will result in failure: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You are standing 1 step west of the center mushroom ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Adrenaline retention is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Guthix Book is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blood Spell or Exsanguinate is auto-casting ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Animate Dead is unlocked and active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Soulsplit is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Torment or Affliction is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elder Overload is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Poison is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cinderbane Gloves are equipped ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blood Reaver is summoned if using Vampyrism Aura ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ripper Demon is summoned if using other auras ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Auto-retaliate is on Preset ⬥ Persistent Rage Relic - Prevents adrenaline from draining while out of combat. Can be substituted with an Adrenaline Urn with ocassional stalling. ⬥ Kwuarm Incense Sticks - Provide extra poison damage. ⬥ Achto Armour - Tank armor is required for Animate Dead to reduce enough damage for this afk method. Can be substituted with Seasinger's armour (Even the tradable version!). Can also replace the top with power armour . ⬥ Runes - Runes are of course required to cast Animate Dead and your autocast of choice. The runes you should bring are: , , , , and . Blood Burst/Blitz will be cheaper and slightly safer, while Exsanguinate will be slightly faster but more expensive to use. Note: A possible setup is bringing with and then filling with . This way you can switch between Blood Burst/Blitz and Exsanguinate to see which one works best for you. ⬥ Essence of Finality - Stored special attack is not used, but is worn for the accuracy bonus and Soulsplit passive. ⬥ Reaver's Ring - Extra critical chance helps speed up kills. If not owned or a weaker staff is being used, can be substituted for other strong rings such as Asylum Surgeon's or Ring of Death. ⬥ Book of Balance - Decent passive pocket item, provides extra poison procs and damage when activated. The damage contributed by this is actually quite massive, and should be used to ensure the most efficient kills. Reflecting Blood Essence can be used as a budget alternative. Action Bar Example/Supplementary Video: https://youtu.be/f8BJu47nH8M

The notable drops for this boss are the Cywir Wand , Cywir Orb, and Crest of Seren . These items can be augmented and disassembled for Cywir components which are required for Planted Feet .

docs.text: ⬥ Serenic essence ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/128 base, 1/64 at 100% reputation ⬥ Crest of Seren ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/512 base, 1/256 at 100% reputation ⬥ Wand of the Cywir Elders ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/512 base, 1/256 at 100% reputation ⬥ Orb of the Cywir Elders ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/512 base, 1/256 at 100% reputation ⬥ Twisted Antler ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/2000 base (Normal Mode) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/1000 base (Hard Mode) Each Helwyr kill is worth 291,160, with 148,837 of that being from commons. docs.text: Advanced Melee Preset ⬥ ‎ ‎ Cinderbane Gloves ⬥ ‎ ‎ Amulet of Souls - extra HP back with and mitigate more damage with protection curses. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for and )
docs.title: Presets

docs.text: Attack Rotation Mushroom gas → 2 Autos → Cleave → 2 Autos → Frenzy → 2 Autos → Minion Spawn → 2 Autos → Repeat Mushroom Gas Avoided by just running out of it. Avoid standing directly on top of a mushroom to decrease the distance needed to move out of the gas. Standing in the mushroom gas will give you a 250 damage bleed every tick, and if standing in the gas for a prolonged time will bind you. Cleave Hits in a frontal cone for up to 3k and apply a bleed. Do not freedom this bleed. If you are standing a distance away from Helwyr, he will first lunge towards you before the attack. There are a few methods to handle this attack. ⬥ If using or , move out of the damage cone. Can also be done with but is DPS waste ⬥ A well-timed Resonance will heal a nice chunk. Note you will still acquire the bleed. This method is best if you are struggling to Soul Split your HP back up and surviving the whole hour. This method can become difficult with the Cywir Alphas alive, but it can also be a good chance to practice some tick Resonances with little risk as long as you are above 3kish HP. ⬥ Lastly, while praying Soul Split , cast / from the Lunar Spellbook. Frenzy Helwyr’s frenzy attack has him leaping around doing rapid melee damage while applying a bleed stack with each attack. Again, while using Range or Magic, you can just run away from Helwyr’s Frenzy attack, but with Melee it is better to stay put and continue doing damage. If you are getting smacked around, you can always pray melee and Devotion or Debilitate . After this attack has concluded, feel free to Freedom the bleed if you wish. Minion Spawn Helwyr’s minion spawn attack has him howl and summon two 3k HP Cywir Alphas. Easily taken out with AoEs.
docs.title: Mechanics

docs.text: What to Expect This method can achieve ~65 kills per hour with average kill times of 27.6s Preset ⬥ ‎ ‎ Fury of the Small and Berserker's Fury relics ⬥ ‎ ‎ Berserker aura ⬥ ‎ ‎ Essence of Finality Dragon Claws ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for and ) Rotations ⬥ Base rotation: Join instance → → → + → (tc) → (walk under) → → + → + 2H Auto → → → → OH + 2H Auto → → (5TAA) → (4hit) → (if you get 1 proc) OR (2hit) (if you don't/no ) OR (if neither nor ) → (or if ~6-7k HP left) ⬥ Base rotation adjusted to minimize switching (Courtesy of #NamoV): https://i.imgur.com/lEpVnKI.png ⬥ Alternate start without (Courtesy of #Pleb): Join instance → → → → (tc) (dw) → (4t) (walk under) → continue as normal then loot, tele out to altar to reset cooldowns, then to crystal to build adrenaline (use Excalibur while building) then repeat. Note: Always Vengeance the cleave, ideally with SS on (Deflect Melee if ~70% HP though, or if not using Trimmed Masterwork ) Sample Kills https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=12qTzSHLTTs&ab_channel=VideoDump Tips and Tricks ⬥ If you get shroomed, ideally walk under Helwyr until you are out of the shroom radius ⬥ If your HP gets really low then utilize Disrupt ⬥ To make looting more efficient, you can bind the open area loot interface in control settings, and then just hit that bind and the loot bind as soon as Helwyr dies.
docs.title: Casual Melee Helwyr Guide (Courtesy of #Piegood and #Archeus)

docs.text: What to Expect This method can achieve around 55 kills per hour with average kill times around 35-45 seconds. Preset ⬥ ‎ ‎ Fury of the Small and Berserker's Fury relics ⬥ ‎ ‎ Maniacal aura > Mahjarrat aura > Dark Magic aura Note: Replace Reaver's Ring with a Ring of death or Asylum surgeon's ring if not using Maniacal aura. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Essence of Finality Guthix Staff ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for and ) Note: You can swap Super Restores for Spiritual Prayers , but extra ripper specs do not aid much as you are already gated by Sunshine's cooldown in this guide, likewise with using a Scrimshaw over Zamorak Book . Rotation → → → (tc) → → → / → → → → → → (3t) → → → → → → → improv w/ basics and try to end at 100 adren Sample Kills https://youtu.be/1wBU6dBY1tQ Timing Target Cycle To time target cycle you want to use 3 ability from rejoining instance, this is what the Anticipate → Bladed Dive → Sunshine accomplishes Tips and Tricks ⬥ When you finish a kill, wait until Sunshine is ~4sec off cooldown before rejoining instance. ⬥ If you end a kill at <100 adrenaline, teleport out and use Adrenaline Crystal to build. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you end at 91-99 adren, use an ability on a wolf instead. ⬥ While you have a lot of leeway on Sunshine positioning, you want to ensure you are standing 1 southwest of the middle shroom so that you are Melee Distance to Helwyr from Target Cycle tick. ⬥ Ensure to walk two tiles west when walking your combust in the above rotation. ⬥ If you get a middle shroom explosion at start, tank it until you finish your first Asphyxiate , then walk 1 more west then adapt to Helwyr's walk before your Detonate to ensure you are still in Sunshine but not taking damage ⬥ If you get the shroom explosion that is directly west of middle shroom, then after your first Asphixate walk to another side of your Sunshine to avoid the shroom damage. ⬥ If you get both middle and west just teleport out or try to not die. ⬥ If you wish to use Vulnerability Bombs , throw it after Sunshine
docs.title: Casual Mage Helwyr Guide

docs.text: What to Expect This method can achieve around 20 kills per hour with average kill times around 1:50-2:00. Preset Inventory Setup ⬥ Armour : Lunar (T60 Power Armour) ⬥ Weapon : Vanquish (T75 Weapon) ⬥ Pocket Slot : Illuminated Godbook ⬥ Aura : Maniacal ⬥ Ring : Vigour ⬥ Shield : Bandos Warshield (T70 Shield) ⬥ Inventory : Left → Right, Up → Down: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Grand Magic Potion ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Super Guthix Rest ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Green Blubber Jellyfish ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Super Prayer Renewal ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Weapon Poison+++ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bandos Warshield ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Expensive Spices ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Guthix Staff ⬥ Runes : (Runes for ) Brief Guide Drink Grand Magic Potion before going in w/ prayers on (prot melee + augury), spam Target Cycle whilst going into spot displayed in the VOD (view image below, its 1 tile Southwest of the middle shroom), then and make sure to be at that spot and then follow the rotation below. Rotation (Target Cycle) → → → → → → → → → → → → → → → → → Improvise with thresholds + specials + good basics to kill Sample Kills https://youtu.be/2PLV7HSl-vw Note: While it is beneficial to follow the rotation, as it is written in a way to deal and mitigate damage, it is not vital to follow it. It is just important to remember that you should ultimate ( ), thresh ( twice, once ideally), and that you should Resonance the cleave and Devotion the frenzy. Tips and Tricks ⬥ Avoid moving unless absolutely necessary, as it will cause Helwyr to skip autos and specs ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Only move Helwyr under the following circumstances: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Walking a bleed ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Avoiding mushroom damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Avoiding the frenzy when Devotion is on cooldown (can just Debiliate or face tank it too) ⬥ If you get shroomed in your ultimate at the start just teleport out. ⬥ Always aim to Resonance the cleave, ideally without protect from melee on. ⬥ You can Devotion every other frenzy special. ⬥ Ensure to Freedom when it ends, Vulnerbility with every second Freedom you do (this will be the Freedom after the non-Devotioned frenzy). ⬥ To time Target Cycle just spam it and run to spot and you will get it, ideally have these binds near one another to make it easy to do ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Refer to #mechanics to set up Target Cycle. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Further, it is important to ensure you run and spam the bind, for if you try to Target Cycle without a target it goes on a cooldown which is reset by walking a tile ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you properly Target Cycle Helwyr, his HP box will not show.
docs.title: Undergeared Helwyr

docs.text: Gp/hr Total 10,190,616 Note: Assumes Max Reputation and 35 kph. Explanation ⬥ This method will net less kills per hour but may be used if you do not wish to put high amounts of effort into a mid level boss. ⬥ It is important to pray as this method relies on constant healing. It is also important to use the Animate Dead spell, as the method heavily relies on its usage. ⬥ Please note this setup/guide is VERY new and is subject to change in the near future. ⬥ Aura choice can vary, but will affect how afk kills can be. They are listed in order of effectiveness: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vampyrism Aura provides extra safety through its healing and allows more chances for poison damage. Due to the constant damage being taken while fighting Helwyr, this is by far the safest and most reliable aura choice to afk with. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Penance Aura allows for the most afk experience, but is less safe to use and doesn't benefit the usage of a Blood Reaver familiar. It is advised to pay attention to your HP with this aura, and to be prepared to eat. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dark Magic provides extra damage, but you must pay more attention to both your HP and your prayer points. This should be an effective aura for fast kills, but is the least afk choice. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mahjarrat Aura provides extra damage, but does not give any extra poison procs. Still, it is a viable option as a secondary aura. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do not use Maniacal for afking, as it will get you killed very easily. ⬥ An Inquisitor's Staff will be one of the most effective weapons for this setup due to its passive. If you do not have one, other 2-handed staffs such as Superior Zuriel's or Noxious should be fine to use, but may be slightly slower. Mandatory Requirements ⬥ This setup should reliably allow you to afk Helwyr, with the duration between checking your status dependent on the aura you are using. However, the following needs to be done or else This method will be either unreliable or will outright not work. Cutting corners will result in failure: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You are standing 1 step west of the center mushroom ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Adrenaline retention is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Guthix Book is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blood Spell or Exsanguinate is auto-casting ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Animate Dead is unlocked and active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Soulsplit is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Torment or Affliction is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elder Overload is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Poison is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cinderbane Gloves are equipped ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Blood Reaver is summoned if using Vampyrism Aura ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ripper Demon is summoned if using other auras ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Auto-retaliate is on Preset ⬥ Persistent Rage Relic - Prevents adrenaline from draining while out of combat. Can be substituted with an Adrenaline Urn with ocassional stalling. ⬥ Kwuarm Incense Sticks - Provide extra poison damage. ⬥ Achto Armour - Tank armor is required for Animate Dead to reduce enough damage for this afk method. Can be substituted with Seasinger's armour (Even the tradable version!). Can also replace the top with power armour . ⬥ Runes - Runes are of course required to cast Animate Dead and your autocast of choice. The runes you should bring are: , , , , and . Blood Burst/Blitz will be cheaper and slightly safer, while Exsanguinate will be slightly faster but more expensive to use. Note: A possible setup is bringing with and then filling with . This way you can switch between Blood Burst/Blitz and Exsanguinate to see which one works best for you. ⬥ Essence of Finality - Stored special attack is not used, but is worn for the accuracy bonus and Soulsplit passive. ⬥ Reaver's Ring - Extra critical chance helps speed up kills. If not owned or a weaker staff is being used, can be substituted for other strong rings such as Asylum Surgeon's or Ring of Death. ⬥ Book of Balance - Decent passive pocket item, provides extra poison procs and damage when activated. The damage contributed by this is actually quite massive, and should be used to ensure the most efficient kills. Reflecting Blood Essence can be used as a budget alternative. Action Bar Example/Supplementary Video: https://youtu.be/f8BJu47nH8M
docs.title: AFK Magic Strategy (~35-39 kph) (Courtesy of #FriggityFrank)

docs.text: Kalphite king Kalphite King (Courtesy of #swims) Introduction The Kalphite King (KK) is a powerful kalphite found within the Exiled Kalphite Hive just north of Menaphos. KK can use all three attack styles, but he will only use one style at a time with a set attack rotation for each style. At any time throughout the fight KK can randomly change attack style, starting a new attack rotation. KK is a significant step up in difficulty in comparison to other mid tier bosses, requiring close tracking of auto attacks and specs, and the use of specific abilites at certain times to dodge one-hit mechanics. Being on a Kalphite slayer task is recommended while fighting Kalphite King, as you gain the benefits of the Slayer Helm , Genocidal perk, and TMW set effect. Drops ⬥ ‎ ‎ Drygore weaponry 1/43 ⬥ ‎ ‎ Perfect chitin 1/50 ⬥ ‎ ‎ Kalphite claw 1/2000 (400 threshold) Each Kalphite King kill is worth 1,157,864, with 111,729 of that being from commons. Advanced players can get up to 35 kph in solo, earning on average 40,525,239 gp/hr. In duo, you can expect 50 KPH, earning on average ‎ ‎28,946,599 gp/hr. Preset ⬥ Keris + Desert amulet - Best in slot if you have completed the desert hard task set ⬥ Essence of Finality spec stored (optional - can be used if you get a relentless proc with Beserk ) ⬥ ⬥ ⬥ (Runes for ) Note: can be replaced with if you do not want . Kalphite King Attack Rotations Range Phase 2 Autos → Stun → 2 Autos → Green → 2 Autos → Dig → Repeat Melee Phase 2 Autos → Push → 2 Autos → Charge → 2 Autos → Green → Repeat Mage Phase 4 Autos → Dig → 2 Autos → Charge → Repeat Mechanics Greens (Beetlejuice) Kalphite King stuns and binds the tank for 8 seconds, leaving them unable to do anything. He then deals a melee attack that can hit up to 32k damage. Greens only happen during range and melee phase. ⬥ ‎ ‎Dealing with the Green in both melee and range phase is fundamental for successful KK kills. ⬥ ‎ ‎In range form, the Green can be skipped via stunning KK at the right time. ⬥ ‎ ‎In melee form, you cannot skip the Green, and instead must utilise the Bladed Dive technique discussed later. Green Shield (random) Kalphite King heals 75% of all damage dealt by players. Red Shield (random) Kalphite King heals 100% of all damage dealt to players. Digs Kalphite King becomes unattackable and digs under the ground for 10 seconds, it then appears under the player it last targeted, dealing up to 5k damage if not avoided. Digs only happen on range and magic phase. Charges Kalphite King becomes unattackable and charges towards a wall, players who fail to avoid the space between the charging boss and wall will be hit up to 4k damage. Charges only happen on melee and magic phase. Minions Kalphite King spawns minions when it reaches 195k (1 wave) and 65k HP (2 waves). All players within a 3 tile radius of KK will be stunned for one second before the minions appear. Minions spawning will also cause KK to skip whatever attack he would have done next, including special attacks. Player Stun Timings Stunning KK at the right time is essential, allowing you skip certain mechanics that either waste time (charge & dig) or result in a death/failed kill (Green). Range Phase: Skips Green 2 Autos → Stun → 2 Autos → Your Stun → 2 Autos → Dig → Repeat Melee Phase: Skips Charge 2 Autos → Push → 2 Autos → Your Stun → 2 Autos → Green → Repeat Mage Phase: Skips Dig 4 Autos → Your Stun → 2 Autos → Charge → Repeat Step-by-step Bladed Dive Guide Don’t during range phase. Always skip green with a stun. If you use remember to cancel after 1 GCD. ⬥ Melee charge happens or is skipped. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If learning, not skipping charge is recommended so you can learn how to get an accurate count on attacks. ⬥ Count 2 KK autos. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Equip shield or defender if you are learning. Can be done after when more experienced. ⬥ Freedom ⬥ ‎ ‎Let the boss green you ⬥ Queue and aim away from walls and minions ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Never through KK ⬥ Look at the stun timer ⬥ As the timer drops from 4 to 3 seconds, click the Bladed Dive spot ⬥ Quickly equip shield or defender if not already equipped ⬥ , or (Only or ‎ ‎if there are no minions) Note: If you get greened solo, you can spam Freedom and a teleport to avoid death. Strategies and Tips General ⬥ Anticipate before and Berserk at the start of every kill. ⬥ Never stun outside of proper stun timings. ⬥ Stay close to the tank during digs but not in the surface radius. ⬥ Run with the boss during charges. ⬥ Anticipate or Freedom at the start of Range and Magic phases, use the other defensive when your first runs out. ⬥ Don’t stand directly between KK and a wall during melee or mage phase or you will be hit up to 5k. Melee Form ⬥ Use Freedom on melee phase only after you receive both bleeds. If you a Dismember before you get Slaughtered be prepared to take hefty damage, especially if you get pushed. Ranged Form ⬥ The amount of times you get hit by the standard attack while the Incendiary Shot icon is on your buff bar is the amount of times you will be hit by the Incendiary Shot . ⬥ If you get a stun with the Incendiary Shot after green, don’t freedom. Either wait until the stun clears and GBarge to KK when he surfaces or GBarge to minions to clear and then Bladed Dive back to KK. Magic Form ⬥ Use Devotion during the first 4 autos of this phase so you can continue to attack the boss without moving. ⬥ Anticipate during charge. ⬥ Resonance the blue ball. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Usually happens the attack after charge if you forget how to count. What you must avoid General ⬥ Never use Smoke Tendrils , Unload , or Frenzy . ⬥ Attack minions at a time where the Kalphite King is still attackable. ⬥ Never stun outside of proper stun timings. If you do you could cause: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Early greens. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Early charges. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Early digs. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Skipped attacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A sped-up attack rotation. ⬥ Never stun during a Green. If you do you could cause: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Multiple greens. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Early digs. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Multiple digs. ⬥ Never Destroy for longer than 1 GCD or stun immediately after a dig or charge. If you do you could cause: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Early greens. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Multiple greens. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Early digs. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Infinite digs. Ranged Form ⬥ Never use Berserk during the middle of a range phase rotation. Wait for the cycle to reset after dig. Magic Form ⬥ Never use Berserk during mage phase unless the boss spawns in form. Example Kill (by #swims) https://youtu.be/uisDoTEmFSI

docs.title: What you must avoid

docs.text: Legiones Legiones (Courtesy of #Piegood, #Martin, and #Andy - Base Tank) Introduction Legiones are bosses in the Monastery of Ascension. Accessing them requires an Ascension Keystone. They each have a unique mechanic which are detailed below. As ascension members, Legiones can only be efficiently harmed with ranged, as they have extremely low affinity against magic and melee attacks. They are very good for learning how to move around and avoid mechanics while still doing damage. Each Legio kill is worth 618,133, with 297,605 of that being profit. Advanced players can get up to 250 kph, earning on average 74,401,195 gp/hr. Drops ⬥ ‎ ‎ Signet 1/50 ⬥ ‎ ‎ Ascension grips 1/2060 (Only on task) ⬥ ‎ ‎ Corrupted signet 1/1000 (1200 threshold) Mechanics General As ascension members, Legiones can only be efficiently harmed with ranged, as they have extremely low affinity against magic and melee attacks. They take increased damage the closer the player is to them which is why it is recommended to try to stay close to the legio during the fight. Primus ⬥ Legio Primus' unique ability is that the lower life points he has, the more damage he will deal. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For every 25% life points that Primus loses, his lightning orb attacks gain 200 extra damage. Standard lighting orb attack ⬥ Using the hit-and-run tactic as normal nullifies this ability, however it is best to eat up as being caught in the middle of a lightning attack can cause massive damage. Secundus ⬥ Legio Secundus' unique ability is using the lightning orb attack more frequently as his life points lower. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• At 75% health, he will use three orb attacks, then one basic magic attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• At 50%, he uses a simple magic attack every four orbs, and at 25% he will exclusively attack with lightning. Secundus' rapid lighting orbs ⬥ This is generally not a problem as using the hit-and-run tactic as normal will nullify this ability, however the lightning orbs will be more frequent so having high life points is advantageous when most of his are depleted. Tertius ⬥ Legio Tertius' unique ability is summoning Monastery of Ascension units as his health lowers ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 3 Rorarii, 1 Gladius and 1 Capsarius when he reaches 75%, 50% and 25% of his health respectively. ⬥ The ascended spawn under Tertius, so they will can be damaged easily with Corruption Shot and Bombardment. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Gladius can be somewhat problematic, but since Legiones take increased damage the closer the player is to them, the Gladius is unlikely to move out from Corruption Shot and Bombardment will only force him to move away from the pile. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Should the Gladius be able to land a stun, immediately use Freedom and quickly move away before the lightning attack strikes. A gladius rushes towards the player Note: Any remaining minions after Tertius is killed will die. Quartus ⬥ Legio Quartus' unique ability is teleporting the player next to him when he reaches 75%, 50% and 25% life points and launching an additional lightning attack at/around the spot he teleported the player, on top of his regular attacks. A player is teleported ⬥ Quartus is the only Legio where damage should be dealt carefully, as his ability can punish fast DPS players. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If the player damages him too fast, then Quartus will pull the player back to the same spot when he first triggers his ability, resulting in two immediate lightning strikes dead-center which will quickly shred a player's health if Devotion is not used. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Quartus' drag is unique compared to other monsters - Freedom and Anticipation do not work, as it isn't classified as a stun attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The pull also grants him a second of invulnerability, and any channeled abilities used when he drags the player are simply put on hold for the same time, after which it is cast as normal again. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is a very dangerous mechanic and makes Quartus the most deadly of the Legiones. Quintus ⬥ Legio Quintus' unique ability is summoning "Lines of Ascension" in the laboratory when he reaches 75%, 50% and 25% life points. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The first and third lines he summons will run horizontally, while the second line runs vertically. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Accidentally running into lines and getting caught by orb attacks can easily kill a player regardless of experience. ⬥ Stepping on one of these lines will deal incredibly heavy damage (more than the lighting strike in terms of individual damage) - however, it only hits once each time the player runs into a line, but due to the lightning orb attacks, you'll be forced to move regardless. ⬥ It is worth noting that the player can "force" the lines to spawn as when he reaches 75%, 50% and 25% life points respectively, a line will spawn wherever the player is currently. Doing this near the edges of the laboratory will effectively nullify them if they perform the hit-and-run tactic while keeping away from them completely - however, players should note that he will take less damage the further you are from him, so this is only recommended for inexperienced players. Note: the Lines of Ascension" are extremely similar to the Queen Black Dragon's fire walls - if you stand next to a line, then run over it, you will not take any damage from the line itself. This can allow for easier maneuverability around him to deal maximum damage without having to bring him closer. Sextus ⬥ Legio Sextus' unique ability is his lightning attacks - unlike the other Legiones, his attacks are not modified as his health decreases. ⬥ Sextus' lightning attacks last significantly longer than his fellow Legiones, as they only start to dissipate once three strikes are on the field. In addition to the increased duration of these attacks, their AoE is increased from 4x4 to 5x5. ⬥ This should be kept in mind while running around; doing so in an erratic way is not advised as the larger radius and prolonged duration can potentially slow down kills, though his laboratory is fairly large to avoid these attacks while dealing as much damage as possible. Sextus is fairly easy to kill, much like Primus and Secundus. Basic Strategy Simply get into MD of the boss (this is due to you doing more damage the closer you are), double bleed and walk your Fragmentation Shot . Then, do your best range threshold rotation (i.e. Snap Shot and Rapid Fire , avoiding Shadow Tendrils as Legiones have a hit cap of 7.5k and finally finish the kill with basics. Ideally, kill times should be consistently sub 20 seconds. Familiar Guidance For your familiars you have 3 main options: ⬥ Ripper Demon ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is for the 0-5% passive damage bonus only - Do not use scrolls as the familiar rarely hits due to boss affinities- ⬥ Steel Titan ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It primarily uses a mix of Ranged and Melee attacks, so is only partially effective- ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It can take a while to agro, so is only viable for slower kills (>20s), or when manually targetting it onto the Legiones (e.g. during Snipe ) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A budget option compared to Ripper Demon. ⬥ Unicorn Stallion (for its special attack, only if struggling for HP) Manipulating Attacks A more advanced technique worth discussing is the ability to manipulate where legiones will drop their lightning balls. This involves abusing the fact that their mechanics are based on where you click, and the fact that movement can be stopped by using an ability. This is explained here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x8A8bdTT3ic Advanced Strategy (Courtesy of #Andy - Base Tank) This method can result in around 240-250 KPH and around 200 KPH at Quartus Requirements ⬥ Greater Ricochet ⬥ Eldritch crossbow with Caroming 4 ⬥ Fleeting Boots ⬥ Nightmare Gauntlets ⬥ Ascension Crossbows or Blightbound crossbows (For Quartus only) ⬥ Reckless Aura Presets ⬥ Primus/Secundus/Tertius/Sextus Preset ⬥ Quartus/Quintus Preset ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Need food occasionally ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Replace with 2 keys for Quintus Note: Hydrix bolts are used as a switch in combination with Greater Ricochet for when you're low on adrenaline. Note also: The generic armour perks in #perks are fine, however if planning to farm for a long time, Enhanced Devoted 4 can be swapped out for the Lucky or Absorbative perks at relatively low cost as you'll be praying Soul Split anyway - You can easily combo Lucky 6 with Mobile if not already comboed with another perk. Rotations The rotation remains fairly similar between each boss but is slightly adapted to account for the mechanics of the different Legiones. Cycle between Kill 1 and Kill 2 of each boss to allow for cooldowns. Expected kill times should be around 9-11 seconds. Primus ⬥ Kill 1 Auto + + Run md → → → + ⬥ Kill 2 Auto + + Run md → → → → + Secundus ⬥ Kill 1 Auto + + Run md → → → + ⬥ Kill 2 Auto + + Run md → → → → + Tertius ⬥ Kill 1 Auto + + Run md → → → + ⬥ Kill 2 Auto + + Run md → → → → + Quartus ⬥ Kill 1 Auto + + Run md → → → (At 7500 hp) → → + ⬥ Kill 2 Auto + + Run md → → → → → + Quintus ⬥ Kill 1 Auto + + Run md → + Run 3 North → (Wait 2t) → Run 3 West 2 South → → (Wait 1t) → Run 4 South → + ⬥ Kill 2 Auto + + Run md → + Run 3 North → (Wait 2t) → Run 3 West 2 South → → (Wait 1t) → Run 4 South → → + Sextus ⬥ Kill 1 Auto + + Run md → → → + ⬥ Kill 2 Auto + + Run md → → → → + Navigating the Lines of Ascension at Quintus ⬥ Quintus can be one of the most dangerous Legiones when first starting out but there's a way to completely avoid the lines of Ascension by placing the lines at certain times and moving on specific ticks. ⬥ The diagram below shows where to stand on which phases and the ticks to run can be found within the Advanced Quintus rotation. ⬥ This placement of course applies to non advanced methods but you will have to adapt to the phasing hp rather than knowing exactly which tick to move on due to you dealing lower damage. This is demonstrated here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FlU2j4qgaq0 Table of Contents ⬥ Introduction - $linkmsg_intro$ ⬥ Drops - $linkmsg_drops$ ⬥ Mechanics - $linkmsg_mechanics$ ⬥ Beginner Strategy - $linkmsg_basic$ ⬥ Familiar Guidance - $linkmsg_familiars$ ⬥ Manipulating Attacks - $linkmsg_mani$ ⬥ Advanced Strategy - $linkmsg_advanced$
docs.title: Legiones

docs.text: Legiones (Courtesy of #Piegood, #Martin, and #Andy - Base Tank)
docs.title: Legiones

docs.text: Legiones are bosses in the Monastery of Ascension. Accessing them requires an Ascension Keystone. They each have a unique mechanic which are detailed below. As ascension members, Legiones can only be efficiently harmed with ranged, as they have extremely low affinity against magic and melee attacks. They are very good for learning how to move around and avoid mechanics while still doing damage. Each Legio kill is worth 618,133, with 297,605 of that being profit. Advanced players can get up to 250 kph, earning on average 74,401,195 gp/hr.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: ⬥ ‎ ‎ Signet 1/50 ⬥ ‎ ‎ Ascension grips 1/2060 (Only on task) ⬥ ‎ ‎ Corrupted signet 1/1000 (1200 threshold)

docs.title: Advanced Strategy (Courtesy of #Andy - Base Tank)

docs.text: Queen black dragon Queen Black Dragon (Courtesy of #Omega) Introduction She resides in the lowest level of the Grotworm Lair which can be found just west of Port Sarim. The Basics ⬥ 60 is required to be able to enter the Queen Black Dragon's Arena via the Summoning Portal. ⬥ It is however highly recommended to have level 80 in your preferred combat stat (generally or ) and level 85 for Super Antifire potions. ⬥ This boss fight is really good to get prepared for mechanics found in high tier bosses like Araxxor and Telos. Note: Completion of the Song of the Depths quest is recommended as well to reduce the amount of damage received. Drops ⬥ ‎ ‎ Royal crossbow piece: 1/6 ⬥ ‎ ‎ QBD Scale: 1/2500 (500 threshold) Presets Beginner Preset: ⬥ Dragonbane bolts for Hardened Carapace Special. ⬥ Nihil for Extra Accuracy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can be swapped out for a BoB to hold more supplies and extend trips. Advanced Preset: ⬥ + along with the occasional to maintain HP. ⬥ The Melee weapons are used to to activate artefacts and the godbook is only used for its passive stats. ⬥ Make sure to use on your armour and every other kill. ⬥ It is recommended to use a / ⬥ at the start and try to finish every kill at 100% adren. Use Dark Bow Auto Attacks with Dragonbane Arrows at the start of every phase and on Phase 3. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Note: You can downgrade or upgrade what you have to in order to meet your skill level and budget. You can comfortably do the boss with chaotic crossbows or a royal crossbow. Overview of the Fight Phase 1: ⬥ QBD attacks with or auto attacks (when the player is standing 2 tiles north from the platform artefact) and the occasional fire wall. ⬥ Fire Wall ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The chatbox will say "The Queen Black Dragon takes a huge breath." prior to her fire wall special attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If the fire wall hits your character, your character will take 750 typeless damage for each tick (generally 2 ticks) it hits you. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• By walking through it, you only take 1 tick of damage and because of this, it is recommended to walk through the firewall. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• However, with each firewall, there is a gap where you can stand and not take any damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The gap will either be on the 5th square, 9th square (one left of the center artefact) or the 15th square. ⬥ Phase 1 can be ended by depleting her life pool of 25k HP and activating the middle artefact. The QBD will spit out grotworms until you activate the artefact. Phase 2: ⬥ QBD will do her previous mechanics however with each Phase her fire wall gets stronger. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• In Phase 1, the firewall will have 1 wall you have to pass through. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• In Phase 2, it will have 2 walls. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• In Phase 3, there will be 3 walls, and so on. ⬥ Tortured Souls ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• There will be an onscreen message saying "The Queen Black Dragon summons one of her Captured Souls." ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This mechanic causes 1 Tortured Soul to appear and release a cloud that deals 900 damage to the player unless it hits a Tortured Soul or grotworm first. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- One way to deal with this mechanic is to learn how to time the cloud correctly and walk over the Tortured Soul, causing it to deal 900 damage to the Soul instead of you. Phase 3: ⬥ From now on QBD will breathe 4 fire walls for the reminder of the fight. ⬥ She will now summon 2 Tortured Souls instead of 1. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1 Soul will spawn on each side of the player, so in order to avoid getting damaged, move over one when the text box appears above their head. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• In addition to the 2 Tortured Souls, any Souls in the arena can be used to heal the QBD. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The chatbox will say "The Queen Black Dragon starts to siphon the energy of her mages." and will heal her 200 each tick from each Tortured Soul. ⬥ Crystal Form/Hardened Carapace ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Queen Black Dragon takes on the consistency of crystal; she is more resistant to magic, but weaker to physical damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This means she will take 25% less damage and 25% more and damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Queen Black Dragon hardens her carapace; she is more resistant to physical damage, but more vulnerable to magic. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This means she will take 25% less damage from and but 25% more damage. Phase 4: ⬥ She will now summon 4 Tortured Souls (one on each diagonal from the character). This Phase only has 2 new mechanics. ⬥ Time Stop ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A Soul will appear in one of the far corners of the arena saying 3 of the following: "Time is short!", "She is pouring her energy into me...hurry!" and "The spell is nearly complete!". ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- You must kill the Tortured Soul or QBD before the Tortured Soul says all three. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If the Tortured Soul gets to the final dialogue, a few seconds later you will be frozen for a few seconds, unable to move, eat, or do anything until the special is over. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This can be very deadly if paired with a Tortured Soul Special or the QBD's final special attack, the Extreme Dragon Breath. ⬥ Extreme Dragon Breath ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Does high hitting damage if not avoided correctly and is prompted when the chat box says, "The Queen Black Dragon gathers her strength to breathe extremely hot flames.". ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- It is recommended to stand on the far right side of the arena in order to avoid as much of the attack as possible. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you stand in the center of the arena, you will take over twice the amount of damage as the side. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This also is the special attack needed to brand the Royal Crossbow. Example Kill https://youtu.be/aE0YMUlK4Jk

Phase 4: ⬥ She will now summon 4 Tortured Souls (one on each diagonal from the character). This Phase only has 2 new mechanics. ⬥ Time Stop ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A Soul will appear in one of the far corners of the arena saying 3 of the following: "Time is short!", "She is pouring her energy into me...hurry!" and "The spell is nearly complete!". ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- You must kill the Tortured Soul or QBD before the Tortured Soul says all three. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If the Tortured Soul gets to the final dialogue, a few seconds later you will be frozen for a few seconds, unable to move, eat, or do anything until the special is over. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This can be very deadly if paired with a Tortured Soul Special or the QBD's final special attack, the Extreme Dragon Breath. ⬥ Extreme Dragon Breath ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Does high hitting damage if not avoided correctly and is prompted when the chat box says, "The Queen Black Dragon gathers her strength to breathe extremely hot flames.". ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- It is recommended to stand on the far right side of the arena in order to avoid as much of the attack as possible. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- If you stand in the center of the arena, you will take over twice the amount of damage as the side. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This also is the special attack needed to brand the Royal Crossbow.

docs.text: Rex matriarchs Rex Matriarchs (Courtesy of #Roarroar) Introduction The rex matriarchs are a trio of dinosaur bosses found on anachronia. They drop components required to make the Reaver's , Stalker's , Champion's and Channeller's rings. Additionally, they also drop the 4 spear parts making up Laniakea's Spear , a halberd-range stab weapon with T90 damage, T75 accuracy and a passive that increases weapon poison frequency and damage by 5%. General Information The rex matriarchs are notable for their levels of 96. While slayer helmet bonuses are applicable to them, enhanced Tuska's Wrath is not. They also serve as good bosses to learn basic hybriding for significantly higher kph. Drops Orikalka ⬥ Heart of the Warrior ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/225 ⬥ Pristine Bagrada Rex Egg ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/2000 base (1000 thresh) Rathis ⬥ Heart of the Archer ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/225 ⬥ Pristine Corbicula Rex Egg ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/2000 base (1000 thresh) Pthentraken ⬥ Heart of the Seer ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/225 ⬥ Pristine Pavosaurus Rex Egg ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/2000 base (1000 thresh) All ⬥ Savage Spear parts (Tip/Cap/Shaft/Plume) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/480 each ⬥ Heart of the Berserker ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/225 Mechanics Orikalka ⬥ Orikalka has 2 possible attack cycles: 3 Auto Attacks(AA) → Frost Storm → 1 AA → Magic Attack → Pyroclastic Shock → 3 AA → Pyroclastic Shock → 1 AA → Magic Attack → Repeat or 3 AA → Frost Storm → 1 AA → Magic Attack → Pyroclastic Shock → 3 AA → Pyroclastic Shock → Magic Attack → 2 AA → Pyroclastic Shock → 2 AA → Magic Attack → Pyroclastic Shock → 3 AA → Pyroclastic Shock → Magic Attack → Repeat ⬥ Frost Storm - Orikalka spins and generates an ice tornado. Players within 15 tiles are dealt up to 4500 magic damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Frostbite: Global cooldown for hit players are doubled for 30 seconds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The hit drains run energy is 0%. ⬥ Pyroclastic Shock - Orikalka performs a tail sweep and generates 3 fissures. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Standing on them deal rapid melee damage up to 3000 per hit with the final hit dealing 5000-6000 damage if Deflect Melee is not used. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Frostbite is active, all hits after the first deal 1 damage provided Deflect Melee is used, removing frostbite and providing an Adrenaline Rush . ⬥ Adrenaline Rush - 10% adrenaline is gained every tick for 10 ticks (100% adrenaline total). ⬥ Mage Attack - Orikalka launches a blue orb that deals low damage. Rathis ⬥ Attack Cycle: 3 Auto Attack(AA) → Poison Bombardment → 1 AA → Melee Attack → 5 AA → Melee Attack → 1 AA → Poison Absorption → 3 AA → Melee Attack → 5 AA → Melee Attack → Repeat ⬥ Poison Bombardment - Rathis launches 2 poison orbs. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• One or both will fall onto the player. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Deal up to 3500 ranged damage each to players standing in a 5x5 radius. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Leave behind 2 Poison Pits . ⬥ Poison Pits - 5x5 green pits persist on the ground following Poison Bombardment . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players take 300-500 poison damage per tick standing on them (reduced to 50-100 by Venomblood /antipoison effect). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A Corrosion debuff is applied with each stack causing players to take 20% more damage, up to 5 stacks, lasting 10 seconds form the last poison absorbed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The 10 second timer is reset as long as the player stands on the poison. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players standing in the pits reduce the size of the patches, turning from a 5x5 to 3x3, then to a 1x1 with an AoE of 2x2, and finally a normal 1x1. ⬥ Poison Absorption - Rathis absorbs leftover poison ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• She is healed based on the amount of remaining acid. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each patch heals up to 35000 health at maximum size. ⬥ Melee Attack - She lunges towards the player, dealing a relatively weak melee hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If not within melee range, Rathis will charge the player, dealing up to 4500 soft typeless damage, disabling prayers and stunning them. Pthentraken ⬥ Attack Cycle: 3 Auto Attack(AA) → Converging Lightning → 1 AA → Ranged Attack → Overcharge → 3 AA → Converging Lightning → 1 AA → Ranged Attack → Repeat ⬥ Converging Lightning - Pthentraken roars and summons 3-5 lighting bolts, with paths indicated by brown markings. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• One bolt will where the target player is. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• They deal 5000-5500 magic damage every 2 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This damage is reduced by 90% when wearing Insulated Boots . ⬥ Overcharge - An overhead bar appears on the target player. When the timer expires a 3x3 torrent will appear at the player's tile. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The torrent applies the Overcharged buff. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It deals increasing hard typeless damage capping out at 3600 every 2 ticks. ⬥ Overcharged - For 30 seconds an additional magic damage hit is caused by players' abilities and attacks (excluding poison) at 5% of their original damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The cooldown of Surge is reduced to 1 tick. Getting hit by the torrent refreshes the Overcharged buff. ⬥ Ranged Attack - Pthentraken spins, sending a rock flying towards the player which deals up to 3500 ranged damage. General Strategy Orikalka ⬥ Orikalka should be killed using 2-3 Entangles (to avoid frostbite) and fire spells . ⬥ 4TAA is recommended to increase DPS and weave in (and Vulnerability if not using ). ⬥ Start the kill with a Guthix Staff special attack if having low accuracy. ⬥ Prioritise bleeds / until first lands. Immediately build to Sunshine . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use a wand and a defender with Planted Feet to and . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- A defender is recommended for the accuracy boost it provides. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Watching for a magic xp drop can assist in confirming has landed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Wrack should be used almost whenever it is off cooldown to build when Orikalka is stunned or rooted. ⬥ Once Orikalka moves, use again and move to the other side of your to avoid attacks. ⬥ If Orikalka is not dead when the second ends, kite her with stuns like Deep Impact and Asphyxiate or do a 3rd depending on hp. ⬥ If you get Frostbite, Deflect Melee and do not kill Orikalka. Wait until fissures spawn, and then run or Bladed Dive to one. Dealing with Frostbite https://youtu.be/zx-JstVzl0k Pthentraken ⬥ Prayer flicking every auto attack is strongly recommended as she hits the hardest of the three, especially the ranged attack. ⬥ If not using Insulated Boots , move to avoid Converging Lighting to edge tiles of Death's Swiftness . Stay here to place the Overcharge Torrent and then return to the middle. ⬥ When the next Converging Lighting begins, run to the other side of . ⬥ If using , simply turn on Deflect Mage during Converging Lighting to take almost no damage. Flick to Deflect Missiles after the lighting passes for the ranged attack. ⬥ Staying closer to this boss will make her attacks land sooner. Rathis ⬥ Avoiding first Poison Bombardment is recommended as you are likely under Berserk , and can get bursted if both projectiles land on you. ⬥ Stand on a Poison Pit to reduce the overheal if not confident in killing Rathis before poison absorption. ⬥ Antipoison potion effects and the Venomblood perk both reduce poison damage, but Irit Incense Sticks do not. Introduction to Hybrid Strategies In general, use weapons of at least T90 accuracy that allow you to exploit the weaknesses of the Matriarchs. If not owning weapons to hit on their respective weakness(e.g. Do not own a T90+ bow) or weapons are low tier, ensure that you’re on task/zerker aura/highest accuracy aura for that style. Note: Most of the presets listed focus on high level hybriding which can easily yield more than 70 kph. Due to the number of combinations available, intermediate presets are not provided. Alternatives to Listed Strategies ⬥ If Blessed Flask is not owned, presets should be made for 30 minute combat instead of camping the entire instance. ⬥ 4 Restore Flasks are recommended in such a preset. ⬥ Reaver and Kwuarm Incense Sticks can be included in a bonfire preset instead to make more inventory space. ⬥ Perked hybrid armour such as Sliske’s Anima body and legs can be taken instead, although this will reduce kph. Mage/Ranged Hybrid Two Versions are provided, one with physical ECB and the other with Hexhunter Bow and EoF ECB , of which the latter is better by a little bit. Preset with ECB ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Guthix Staff stored. ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Seren Godbow stored. ⬥ Take around 500 ruby and hydrix bakriminel bolts . ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Preset with Hexhunter Bow and ECB EoF ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Guthix Staff stored. ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Seren Godbow stored. ⬥ Essence of Finality with Eldritch Crossbow stored. ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Strategy ⬥ Focus on killing Pthentraken fast with ECB special attack under DS . ⬥ Restore hp using Soul Split while kiting Orikalka. ⬥ Adrenaline potions should be used on ranged kills. ⬥ Ingenuity should be used on the second entangle under Sun to reduce the need to run out of because of splashes. Example Kills Physical ECB - https://youtu.be/Ohu3ooT4_gA Mage/Melee Hybrid Preset ⬥ Essence of finality with a Guthix Staff stored. ⬥ Rune Pouch : (Runes for ) Strategy ⬥ Aim to end Orikalka kills with 100% adrenaline. ⬥ Execute a rotation on Rathis to ensure she is killed before poison absorption. ⬥ Alternate use of adrenaline potions and Limitless with gBarge to guarantee burst on Rathis. ⬥ You may use Terrasaur Maul to apply the first hit of Assault with Ingenuity and switch to your main stab weapons. Otherwise, should be used on the second under Sun to avoid splashes. ⬥ If you end Orikalka below 100% adrenaline, target Rathis from a distance and use basics to gain adrenaline. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Getting adren - https://youtu.be/PfhJG00n61s Example Kills https://youtu.be/9LjGF5O4RQQ Melee/Ranged Hybrid This method of hybridding yields the highest kph, but is also the hardest to pull off due to the high amount of damage taken and the need to avoid Orikalka. Preset ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Seren Godbow stored. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Strategy ⬥ Bladed Dive to the East wall after each kill and run along to avoid Orikalka. ⬥ When going to Pthentraken, → + → + to start kill. ⬥ Kill Pthentraken with 1 or 2 special attacks. ⬥ Flick Deflect Magic on every Pthentraken auto and use Disruption Shield on the ranged attack. ⬥ Teleport out immediately if you gain Orikalka aggro. ⬥ If going to Pthentraken with low HP, use and use SoulSplit to get back some HP before using a Death Swiftness rotation (if low hp) or an to finish the kill (if high hp). ⬥ When going from Pthentraken to Rathis, build to 100% adrenaline by targeting Orikalka and using basics if feasible. Otherwise, use a Zaros Godsword Special Attack to kill Rathis instead of Berserk , finishing off with bleeds . ⬥ Use Ingenuity to bleed an assault with Terrasaur maul if is up. Otherwise, bleed with your main stab weapons. ⬥ Use alternate between using an adrenaline potion and limitless for melee kills. Example Kills https://youtu.be/RTsWbvYUVRY Beginner Hybrid This serves as approximately the baseline equipment you need to effectively hybrid in an instance using Mage/Ranged. Preset ⬥ Cheap PF switch for both styles (Abyssal Orb and Sunspear (ranged) in this example) ⬥ Combatant's cape containing ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Example Kills https://youtu.be/JztScaBwMIw Solo Pthentraken (Courtesy of #Andy - Base Tank) Since there is no reliable way to afk Pthentraken, instance hopping with high end ranged gear is recommended for solo active killing. Preset ⬥ Essence of Finality with an Eldritch Crossbow stored. ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Seren Godbow stored. ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Dark bow stored. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for and ) ⬥ Relics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Heightened senses ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fury of the Small ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Persistent Rage Strategy ⬥ Physical Eldritch Crossbow + → + → + Auto → → → ( ) → → → → build to ⬥ ECB in Essence of Finality + → + → + Auto → → → → → → → build to ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Limitless is needed for Rapid Fire , do → afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If not using Erethdor's Grimoire , follow the rotation for physical . Note: While waiting for Pthentraken's death animation, build adrenaline on Orikalka. ⬥ At war's retreat, to use Altar of War, to bank and to Adrenaline Crystals. Example Kill ( + ) https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1033769908 Afk Strategies Some afk strategies are viable for Rathis and Orikalka. However, they do not give as much kph as active killing. Rathis Camp Soul Split . If using lower tiered armor or otherwise notice that you constantly require food, Vampirism aura should be taken along with 10 Super Restore flasks and Holy Wrench to upkeep prayer. This setup yields about 40-42 kph. ⬥ Revo Bar ⬥ Preset ⬥ Relics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Persistent Rage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fury of the Small ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Berserker's Fury Orikalka Use Legacy with Blood Barrage (Blood Blitz if using inquisitor's staff ) as Frostbite does not affect the speed of auto attacks. Use Deflect Melee to avoid getting bursted by unlucky fissure spawns. Even through prayer and Death Ward, fissures can still kill if unlucky. Thus, it is not completely recommended to afk using this preset. Use the highest tier of restoration portent available to you. Absorbative and Enhanced Devoted perks help survive unlucky fissures. This setup yields about 30 kph. ⬥ Preset ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rune Pouch (Runes for / ) ⬥ Relics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Death Ward ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Font of Life ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Berserker's Fury

docs.text: Since there is no reliable way to afk Pthentraken, instance hopping with high end ranged gear is recommended for solo active killing. Preset ⬥ Essence of Finality with an Eldritch Crossbow stored. ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Seren Godbow stored. ⬥ Essence of Finality with a Dark bow stored. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for and ) ⬥ Relics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Heightened senses ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fury of the Small ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Persistent Rage Strategy ⬥ Physical Eldritch Crossbow + → + → + Auto → → → ( ) → → → → build to ⬥ ECB in Essence of Finality + → + → + Auto → → → → → → → build to ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Limitless is needed for Rapid Fire , do → afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If not using Erethdor's Grimoire , follow the rotation for physical . Note: While waiting for Pthentraken's death animation, build adrenaline on Orikalka. ⬥ At war's retreat, to use Altar of War, to bank and to Adrenaline Crystals. Example Kill ( + ) https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1033769908

docs.text: Some afk strategies are viable for Rathis and Orikalka. However, they do not give as much kph as active killing. Rathis Camp Soul Split . If using lower tiered armor or otherwise notice that you constantly require food, Vampirism aura should be taken along with 10 Super Restore flasks and Holy Wrench to upkeep prayer. This setup yields about 40-42 kph. ⬥ Revo Bar ⬥ Preset ⬥ Relics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Persistent Rage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fury of the Small ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Berserker's Fury Orikalka Use Legacy with Blood Barrage (Blood Blitz if using inquisitor's staff ) as Frostbite does not affect the speed of auto attacks. Use Deflect Melee to avoid getting bursted by unlucky fissure spawns. Even through prayer and Death Ward, fissures can still kill if unlucky. Thus, it is not completely recommended to afk using this preset. Use the highest tier of restoration portent available to you. Absorbative and Enhanced Devoted perks help survive unlucky fissures. This setup yields about 30 kph. ⬥ Preset ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Rune Pouch (Runes for / ) ⬥ Relics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Death Ward ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Font of Life ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Berserker's Fury
docs.title: Afk Strategies

docs.text: Twin furies Twin Furies (Courtesy of #Horacio) Introduction The Twin Furies is a Zamorakian ‎ ‎boss located in the Heart of Gielinor (aka GWD2). Entering the boss fight requires 40 (or 20 kc if you have enough rep) and 80 (boostable) Ranged . Notable drops include the Crest of Zamorak, which is an ingredient for making T80 and T85 power armor, and the T85 Fury Blades. The boss itself is the easiest of the four GWD2 fights. The boss is unique in the fact that both targets share the 200k hp pool. This means that an aoe attack will essentially do double damage. Drops ⬥ Zamorakian Essence ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/128 base, 1/64 at 100% reputation ⬥ Crest of Zamorak ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/512 base, 1/256 at 100% reputation ⬥ Blade of Avaryss ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/512 base, 1/256 at 100% reputation ⬥ Blade of Nymora ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/512 base, 1/256 at 100% reputation ⬥ Avaryss' Braid ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/2000 base (Normal Mode) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/1000 base (Hard Mode) ⬥ Nymora's Braid ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/2000 base (Normal Mode) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1/1000 base (Hard Mode) Each Twin Furies kill is worth 280,065, with 120,617 of that being from commons. Advanced players can get up to 70 kph, earning on average 19,604,561 gp/hr. Presets Advanced Melee Preset ⬥ A halberd range weapon such as a Noxious Scythe or Dragonrider Lance should be used because AoE melee abilities will hit both furies effectively doing double damage. ⬥ If you're struggling with food conservation and Soul Split is not enough to heal you, you may also use a Scrimshaw of Vampyrism to help sustain yourself for the full hour. Otherwise, an unactivated god book can remain in your pocket slot. ⬥ An elite Enhanced Excalibur and Ancient Elven Ritual shard are used to supplement your HP and prayer upkeep. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Enhanced Luck Potion - Gives tier 3 luck, can be removed if swapping to LotD ⬥ ‎ ‎ Adrenaline Urn - Prevents adren loss after dropping combat, stores up to 1000% adrenaline ⬥ ‎ ‎ Ancient Elven Ritual Shard - Restores prayer overtime, 5 minute cooldown ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for and ) Note: Currently, Deathtouch Bracelet is used as Cinderbane Gloves are bugged at Twin Furies. Mechanics Jumps Avaryss jumps towards the northern wall and charges down to the southern wall. She will repeat this attack a total of 4 times and will always travel in the cardinal directions (north to south, west to east, etc.). You may simply move out of the way after Avaryss jumps to a new wall. Any single link of this mechanic can be dealt with by using Resonance for a free heal, but is not required to deal with the mechanic at all. Ceiling Collapse Nymora will jump to a random square in the arena and cause a ceiling collapse. You have to stand in the 3x3 area around her to negate the damage from the collapse. Note: Currently Nymora is bugged and will dissapear shortly after taking flight. Pay attention to where she goes and react appropiately. Channeled Bomb The twins will jump to the center of the arena and channel a bomb attack. During this special, you will take ticks of typeless damage which can easily be negated with Soul Split If the channel finishes and the kill is not over, a bomb will detonate dealing 4,500 damage. This bomb can be avoided by Surging to the edges of the arena or blocking it with defensives. During this phase, the twins take 2x damage and stand close enough that Cleave , Hurricane , and Quake will hit both of them. AFK Strategy (~30-38 kph) (Courtesy of #FriggityFrank & #Martin) Gp/hr Total 8,401,955 Note: Assumes Max Reputation and 30 kph. Explanation ⬥ This method will net less kills per hour but may be used if you do not wish to put high amounts of effort into a mid level boss. KPH can vary wildly depending on the weapon you use, not to mention the potential of running all over the boss arena and losing time to that. ⬥ It is important to pray as this method relies on constant healing. It is also important to use the Animate Dead spell, as the method heavily relies on its usage. ⬥ NOTE: Utilizing even one source of extra healing mitigates a LOT of the danger presented by this method so long as Trimmed Masterwork Armour is being used. Do keep in mind though that the safest option by far is to use a Scrimshaw of Vampyrism . ⬥ Please note this setup/guide is VERY new and is subject to change in the near future. ⬥ Aura choice can vary, but will affect how afk kills can be. They are listed in order of effectiveness: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dark Magic provides extra damage, but you must pay more attention to both your HP and your prayer points. This should be an effective aura for fast kills, but is technically the least afk choice. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Penance Aura allows for the most afk experience, but is less safe to use. It is advised to pay attention to your HP with this aura, and to be prepared to eat in case your HP drops too low. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vampyrism Aura provides extra safety through its healing. This can mitigate the need for a Scrimshaw of Vampyrism and allows other pocket slot items to be used safely, such as a Zamorak God Book. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Mahjarrat Aura provides extra damage, but does not offer anything else. It is a viable option as a secondary aura. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Do not use Berserker for afking, as it will get you killed very easily. ⬥ A Masterwork Spear of Annihilation will be the most effective weapon for this setup due to its passive effect and accuracy. If you do not have one, other 2-handed melee weapons such as Superior Vesta's Spear or Noxious Scythe should be fine to use, but may be slightly slower. Mandatory Requirements ⬥ This setup should reliably allow you to afk The Twin Furies with the duration between checking your status dependent on the aura you are using. However, the following needs to be done or else This method will be either unreliable or will outright not work. Cutting corners may result in failure: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Animate Dead is unlocked and active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Trimmed Masterwork Armour is equipped + See Side Notes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Soulsplit is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Turmoil or Malevolence is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A passive source of healing / is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Elder Overload is active ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ripper Demon is summoned ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Run is on ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Auto-retaliate is on Side Notes: ⬥ While this is an AFK method, The Twin Furies are a special case where repositioning has a positive impact on your kills. If you don't mind actively moving your character after looting, it is suggested to move to the northeast corner between kills . This makes kill times and safety significantly more consistent. However, danger is relatively low to begin with so this is entirely optional. ⬥ Trimmed Masterwork Armour is listed as a mandatory requirement, but realistically The Twin Furies can be semi-AFK'd without it. If you elect to not use Trimmed Masterwork Armour, it is heavily advised to be monitoring your kills in case you are caught in Nymora's rain attack and to be using a Scrimshaw of Vampyrism . ‎ ‎In the case of this happening, you should also switch to Deflect Range and attack Avaryss or else you may die. Preset ⬥ Persistent Rage Relic - Prevents adrenaline from draining while out of combat. Can be substituted with an Adrenaline Urn with ocassional stalling. ⬥ Ganodermic Gloves & Boots - Magic tank armor is required for Animate Dead to reduce enough damage for this afk method. This is the cheapest and most effective option at this moment. ⬥ Runes - Runes are of course required to cast Animate Dead. The runes you should bring are: , , , . ⬥ Essence of Finality - Stored special attack is not used, but is worn for the accuracy bonus and Soulsplit passive. ⬥ Champion's Ring - Extra critical chance helps speed up kills. If not owned, can be substituted for other strong rings such as Asylum Surgeon's or Ring of Death. Action Bar:
