docs.text: If you're interested in starting to learn AoD, check out our partners at AoD 7 to 10 man: https://discord.gg/2rd8Vqe There's an active teaching community there and their help in conjunction with the guides here will help you get up to speed at AoD in no time!
docs.title: Start Learning

docs.text: Nex duo ranged Nex Duo (Courtesy of #Hoobs and #Iecy) Introduction Duo Nex is significantly more forgiving than solo, as the DPS check present on Blood phase is much less harsh. When Nex spawns for the first time in a custom instance it will be praying Deflect Magic for the majority of the kill, this is why Range only kills are the meta for fast consistent kills. After every kill you will teleport out of the instance and re-enter in order to force Nex to always be praying Deflect Mage Note: It is strongly advised to complete the Ritual of the Mahjarrat quest in order to get access to the Jas boost which gives a 5% damage boost in GWD1 (including Nex). This can be done via Fairy ring code D.K.Q. Presets Banking Preset ⬥ The most important thing is to have a Frozen key + Ancient Ceremonial set for use with your boss portal. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can speak to Ashuelot Reis in the Nex bank and pay a one time cost of the Frozen key + Ancient Ceremonial along with 10M GP to be able to access Nex bank without these items. ⬥ An Enhanced Luck Potion works and can be used here. Beginner Preset ⬥ A Bladed Dive switch is used, and some solid food is recommended for panic eating, with Jellies + Guthix Rests are used for healing during the fight without losing adrenaline. ⬥ The shield is used for building at the start. ⬥ A Reaper necklace is used as accuracy is low at Nex. As you get more experienced it is recommended to start bringing a vuln switch if you do not have an ⬥ ‎ ‎Expensive spices, gives increased healing per bite of solid food. Advanced Preset ⬥ As a more experienced Nexer, your objective is to implement: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bring DW and 2H weapons ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bring less food, replacing it with spices, bolt switches, and optional glove switches. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ruby bolts will be used throughout the kill until ice phase, after which you should use your own judgement of when to use Hydrix or Onyx ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Generally Hydrix will be used on minions, or if you're falling short on adren. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If opting to glove switch you can bring a pair of swift gloves. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Death lotus chaps are used as a Clear Headed switch. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Essence of Finality Dark bow spec stored Mechanics Nex overview ⬥ Nex is a 1x1 NPC and has very strict softcaps, which means that any damage over a certain amount is reduced by X% depending on the phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• During the first four phases, Nex has a soft cap that reduces excess damage above 5,000 by 50% . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- For example, a 6,000 damage hit would be reduced to 5,500 damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• On the Zaros phase, the soft cap is changed to reduce excess damage above 2,000 by 75% . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This means a 6,000-damage hit would be reduced to 3,000. Mages overview ⬥ Mages have a soft cap that reduces excess damage above 1,000 by a random amount between approximately 80% and 100%. ⬥ Each mage is combat level 111 with 10,000 health, possesses a max hit of around 850, and are weak to bolts. The mages are static and can only be attacked whenever Nex calls their name. ⬥ An unusual trait they all share is that they are immune to magic attacks. Nex has 5 phases; Smoke, Shadow, Blood, Ice, and Zaros. Each phase has 2 special attacks, with the exception of Zaros Smoke Phase Virus → 5 auto-attacks → No escape → Five auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Don't stand in middle crossways ⬥ Nex may drag you to MD of her at random times, nulling all damage sent to her during this timeframe. Shadow Phase Shadow traps (only if the phased before the virus attack) → Darkness → Shadow traps → 4 auto-attacks → Repeats from the second set of shadow traps ⬥ Move from Shadows and don’t stand MD. A shadow trap is avoided A player escapes the shadows engulfing them Blood Phase Siphon summon → 3 auto-attacks → Blood sacrifice → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Attacks during Siphon will heal Nex and sacrifice will heal Nex if not phased and in range. Nex summoning her Blood Reavers Nex sacrifices a player ⬥ Any bleeds used during this phase will heal Nex rather than damage her ( ) ⬥ Cruor's attacks always have 100% accuracy and will heal him for 100 damage regardless of the damage he deals. Ice Phase First special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Second special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Sacrifice, Ice will start with Contain ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Siphon, Ice will start with Prison ⬥ Run from Contain and Freedom into eating up then . ⬥ Glacies' attacks can freeze players if they aren't using Protect/Deflect Magic; keeping the prayer active will result in all of her attacks missing regardless of the player's armour rating. Zaros Phase ⬥ Upon the start of this phase, Nex activates Turmoil and heals herself for 33,333 (1/6) of her health to boost it up to 73,333. ⬥ Nex does not have any unique special attacks in this phase and uses only her melee and magic autoattacks Further details on the mechanics can be found here: https://runescape.wiki/w/Nex/Strategies#The_phases Positioning Good positioning is the next best thing to focus on after learning the rotation. This is a simple layout of the path you will follow during the kill. Starting position ⬥ The pink square is where the 1/3 will stand in the start of the kill. ⬥ The blue square is where the 2/4 will stand in the start of the kill, they will also from here. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You will stand in these spots until either smoke phase ends or Nex moves towards you, after which you will go to the yellow squares to attack the minion (Fumus). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You don't want to be standing adjacent to each other incase one of you gets virus. Umbra ⬥ It's not recommended to Surge diagonally across the middle to Umbra as it can mess up the path for duo kills. The only time you will Surge is on Ice phase, this is explained more below. ⬥ Since the 1/3 will be using Incite , it is their job to lure and position Nex correctly. Blood ⬥ Do not stand adjacent to each other at the start to reduce virus spread (described below) and the 1/3 must make sure to position themselves between Nex and Cruor on Blood phase so 2/4 may Flank General path during the kill Ice ⬥ After ending Blood phase and killing Cruor, Nex will be in either one of 2 places depending if you lured correctly or not. If done correctly Nex will be in the red box as described in the 1st picture and you will run to melee distance of the minion Cruor as shown by the white box ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is important to only run MD of minion after it is killed and Nex is phased into Ice or it will follow you and the 2nd scenario will occur. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Standing in the white box will cause Nex to walk the Fragmentation Shot bleed. ⬥ From here you will end Ice phase with a Shadow Tendrils + Snap Shot most of the time, if not just use a basic. ⬥ You will then immediately Surge towards Glacies (angle your camera so that you can click Glacies as soon as you reach him). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If for any reason Nex comes into the red box as described in the 2nd picture, then you will carry out the Ice phase rotation while running towards Glacies as this will most likely kite Nex and dodge contain. Ice Surge Ice run Rotations without an Eldritch Crossbow Note: If you are using dual wield instead of a two handed weapon, replace Dazing Shot with Needle Strike . As 1/3 you should use Incite . If you are stalling adrenaline after each kill you can save your adrenaline potion for Zaros phase. Pre-Fight ⬥ Make sure to use jas boost Target Fumus ASAP and start building adrenaline with defensives. Freedom should be first, and Anticipate should be last. Spam click the minion as sometimes when you Escape , you won't get adrenaline from Anticipate if you don't keep clicking the minion before Escape . Smoke phase → → Fumus 1/3 2/4 → Shadow phase 1/3 Tag with → Auto + → → ( or if needed) 2/4 Tag with → Auto + → → ( or if needed) Umbra 1/3 → 2/4 Blood phase Tag with → → → → Cruor 1/3 2/4 → Ice phase 1/3 Tag with → → → 2/4 Tag with → → → Glacies 1/3 → 2/4 Zaros phase 1/3 Tag with → → → → 2/4 Tag with → Eldritch crossbow rotation Pre-Fight ⬥ Make sure to use jas boost → Build adren if needed → → → Smoke phase 1/3 → 2/4 Auto + → Fumus 1/3 2/4 → Shadow phase 1/3 Tag with → + Auto → ( if needed) 2/4 Tag with → Auto + → ( ‎ ‎if needed) Umbra 1/3 2/4 Blood phase 1/3 Tag with → + → Any defensive for adren → → 2/4 Tag with → → → → Cruor 1/3 → → 2/4 → → Note: You want to place mines at the last tick of snipe or they will be wasted due to the delay on popping Ice phase 1/3 during phase transition → Auto + → 2/4 during phase transition → → Glacies 1/3 → ( ‎ ‎if needed) 2/4 → ( ‎ ‎if needed) Zaros phase 1/3 Tag with → → ‎ ‎→ / if needed 2/4 Tag with → → → / if needed Camp , on minions and after blood, Zaros Eldritch Crossbow with Greater Ricochet rotation Note: Make sure to use Jas Boost! Pre-Fight the combat dummy → → Smoke Phase 1/3 → 2/4 Auto + → → Fumus 1/3 → 2/4 Shadow Phase 1/3 → 2/4 Auto + Umbra 1/3 Look pretty. 2/4 Blood Phase 1/3 Pre-phase → + 2/4 Pre-phase → Auto + / depending on adrenaline. Cruor 1/3 Auto + . Skip auto if you had a clean Blood skip. 2/4 Ice Phase 1/3 Pre-phase / → Auto + → walk 2/4 Pre-phase / → Auto + / → depending on adrenaline → Glacies 1/3 2/4 Zaros Phase 1/3 → → / / depending on your adrenaline and cooldowns. 2/4 → → / depending on adrenaline. Video Examples Casual rotation (Some tactics in these videos are a bit outdated, however the general path and idea is still a good reference) 1/3 https://youtu.be/ifiYdbm73rI 2/4 https://youtu.be/RiaRV3MfG_E Advanced rotation (#Alex Browser and #Kidys) 1/3 https://youtu.be/B9ajkULgOow 2/4 https://youtu.be/BWAU5YtmiCw

docs.text: Nex solo melee Solo Nex - Melee (Courtesy of #Alex Browser) Introduction When Nex spawns for the first time in a custom instance it will be praying Deflect Magic for the majority of the kill, this is why Range only kills are the meta for fast consistent kills. After every kill you will teleport out of the instance and re-enter in order to force Nex to always be praying Deflect Mage Note: It is strongly advised to complete the Ritual of the Mahjarrat quest in order to get access to the Jas boost which gives a 5% damage boost in GWD1 (including Nex). This can be done via Fairy ring code D.K.Q. Presets Banking Preset ⬥ The most important thing is to have a Frozen key + Ancient Ceremonial set for use with your boss portal. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can speak to Ashuelot Reis in the Nex bank and pay a one time cost of the Frozen key + Ancient Ceremonial along with 10M GP to be able to access Nex bank without these items. ⬥ An Enhanced Luck Potion works and can be used here. Advanced Preset ⬥ Malevolent Greaves - Contain Mobile and the Clear Headed 4 perk, which lengthens Anticipation's stun immunity by 4.8s (8 ticks). ⬥ Vulnerability Bombs - Used at the start and during Blood phase ⬥ Dominion Mines - Two mines are used on Glacies (the last minion) ⬥ Eldritch Crossbow - Used to clear minions more effectively ⬥ Hydrix Bakriminel Bolts(e) - Used to gain more adrenaline when killing minions. ⬥ Essence of Finality - Dragon Claws stored ⬥ Essence of Finality - Statius Warhammer stored ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for Disruption Shield ) Note: If you do not own an Eldritch Crossbow , you can substitute with a Wyvern Crossbow for slightly slower kills. Mechanics Nex overview ⬥ Nex is a 1x1 NPC and has very strict softcaps, which means that any damage over a certain amount is reduced by X% depending on the phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• During the first four phases, Nex has a soft cap that reduces excess damage above 5,000 by 50% . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- For example, a 6,000 damage hit would be reduced to 5,500 damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• On the Zaros phase, the soft cap is changed to reduce excess damage above 2,000 by 75% . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This means a 6,000-damage hit would be reduced to 3,000. Mages overview ⬥ Mages have a soft cap that reduces excess damage above 1,000 by a random amount between approximately 80% and 100%. ⬥ Each mage is combat level 111 with 10,000 health, possesses a max hit of around 850, and are weak to bolts. The mages are static and can only be attacked whenever Nex calls their name. ⬥ An unusual trait they all share is that they are immune to magic attacks. Nex has 5 phases; Smoke, Shadow, Blood, Ice, and Zaros. Each phase has 2 special attacks, with the exception of Zaros Smoke Phase Virus → 5 auto-attacks → No escape → Five auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Don't stand in middle crossways ⬥ Nex may drag you to MD of her at random times, nulling all damage sent to her during this timeframe. Shadow Phase Shadow traps (only if the phased before the virus attack) → Darkness → Shadow traps → 4 auto-attacks → Repeats from the second set of shadow traps ⬥ Move from Shadows and don’t stand MD. A shadow trap is avoided A player escapes the shadows engulfing them Blood Phase Siphon summon → 3 auto-attacks → Blood sacrifice → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Attacks during Siphon will heal Nex and sacrifice will heal Nex if not phased and in range. Nex summoning her Blood Reavers Nex sacrifices a player ⬥ Any bleeds used during this phase will heal Nex rather than damage her ( ) ⬥ Cruor's attacks always have 100% accuracy and will heal him for 100 damage regardless of the damage he deals. Ice Phase First special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Second special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Sacrifice, Ice will start with Contain ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Siphon, Ice will start with Prison ⬥ Run from Contain and Freedom into eating up then . ⬥ Glacies' attacks can freeze players if they aren't using Protect/Deflect Magic; keeping the prayer active will result in all of her attacks missing regardless of the player's armour rating. Zaros Phase ⬥ Upon the start of this phase, Nex activates Turmoil and heals herself for 33,333 (1/6) of her health to boost it up to 73,333. ⬥ Nex does not have any unique special attacks in this phase and uses only her melee and magic autoattacks Further details on the mechanics can be found here: https://runescape.wiki/w/Nex/Strategies#The_phases Rotations Note: Make sure to use Jas Boost. Pre-Fight After entering the boss room, do the following: → → → → → → → (release an auto attack with it) → → stalled → After barging, proceed North of Nex as shown in the image below Note: you stall for the adren gain but do not actually release the stall. Position When Nex Becomes Attackable + as Nex says "Fill my soul with smoke!" (~14s) Smoke Phase Auto → ‎ ‎→ → → to one of the marked tiles shown below Bladed Dive Pathing Fumus ⬥ With Greater Ricochet → / if Armadyl book procs ⬥ Without Greater Ricochet → / if Armadyl book procs Shadow Phase before the phase changes → → Auto → → → → (dw) → Umbra ⬥ With Greater Ricochet Auto → → wait 1 tick before attacking Nex ⬥ Without Greater Ricochet Auto → → Blood Phase / if you have sufficient adren → → → → a Blood Reaver → wait 1 tick so as not to heal Nex during Siphon → → → → → along the path shown in the picture below Surge + Bladed Dive Pathing Cruor ⬥ With Greater Ricochet → ⬥ Without Greater Ricochet → → if minion is still alive Ice Phase before the phase changes → ‎ ‎ to the tile marked in the image below → → → → Place both on Glacies → stalled → → → Surge Pathing Glacies ⬥ With Greater Ricochet → / if the minion is low ⬥ Without Greater Ricochet → → ‎ ‎ if minion is still alive Zaros Phase ⬥ If Nex starts with Deflect Magic → → → → → → → ⬥ If Nex does not start with Deflect Magic → → + → → → → → → → → → Phase Notes Smoke Phase Notes ⬥ Throw your bomb right before the kill is about to start. ⬥ Swap to your Dragon Claws EoF after using the SWH Eof Spec, as you will not be using that EoF anymore throughout the fight Shadow Phase Notes ⬥ Walk under Nex when using Slaughter for extra damage. Blood Phase Notes ⬥While bleeds should not be used during Blood phase, the bleed effect from using a channeled ability ( ) after Greater Barge will not heal Nex, as they are not true bleeds. ⬥The reason you need to wait one tick before using Assault on Nex is for the Siphon to end. ⬥Wait for Nex to use her Blood Sacrifice spec before phasing her so that you start the Ice phase with a Contain This. Ice Phase Notes ⬥If you get caught in an Ice Prison, use Freedom then to survive the hit. Zaros Phase Notes ⬥ Nex cycles her overhead curses every 3 auto attacks during ‎ ‎Zaros Phase, following this rotation: → → No overhead curse ⬥ Disruption shield may be used if you are low on food. ⬥ If Nex ends her Ice Phase with , there is a chance it will carry over to Zaros Phase. She may also switch to during Zaros phase, improvise accordingly ⬥ When Nex uses , there is a chance your attacks will be reflected back at you if you hit her. Hence, be careful not to release any defensive autos when using and Example Kills https://youtu.be/YrAFQwdtHM4 1:37 (Courtesy of#Alex Browser) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-4MVYY4cMkc 2:09 (courtesy of #Unknown user)

docs.text: Banking Preset ⬥ The most important thing is to have a Frozen key + Ancient Ceremonial set for use with your boss portal. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can speak to Ashuelot Reis in the Nex bank and pay a one time cost of the Frozen key + Ancient Ceremonial along with 10M GP to be able to access Nex bank without these items. ⬥ An Enhanced Luck Potion works and can be used here. Advanced Preset ⬥ Malevolent Greaves - Contain Mobile and the Clear Headed 4 perk, which lengthens Anticipation's stun immunity by 4.8s (8 ticks). ⬥ Vulnerability Bombs - Used at the start and during Blood phase ⬥ Dominion Mines - Two mines are used on Glacies (the last minion) ⬥ Eldritch Crossbow - Used to clear minions more effectively ⬥ Hydrix Bakriminel Bolts(e) - Used to gain more adrenaline when killing minions. ⬥ Essence of Finality - Dragon Claws stored ⬥ Essence of Finality - Statius Warhammer stored ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for Disruption Shield ) Note: If you do not own an Eldritch Crossbow , you can substitute with a Wyvern Crossbow for slightly slower kills.
docs.title: Presets

docs.text: Nex overview ⬥ Nex is a 1x1 NPC and has very strict softcaps, which means that any damage over a certain amount is reduced by X% depending on the phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• During the first four phases, Nex has a soft cap that reduces excess damage above 5,000 by 50% . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- For example, a 6,000 damage hit would be reduced to 5,500 damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• On the Zaros phase, the soft cap is changed to reduce excess damage above 2,000 by 75% . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This means a 6,000-damage hit would be reduced to 3,000. Mages overview ⬥ Mages have a soft cap that reduces excess damage above 1,000 by a random amount between approximately 80% and 100%. ⬥ Each mage is combat level 111 with 10,000 health, possesses a max hit of around 850, and are weak to bolts. The mages are static and can only be attacked whenever Nex calls their name. ⬥ An unusual trait they all share is that they are immune to magic attacks. Nex has 5 phases; Smoke, Shadow, Blood, Ice, and Zaros. Each phase has 2 special attacks, with the exception of Zaros Smoke Phase Virus → 5 auto-attacks → No escape → Five auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Don't stand in middle crossways ⬥ Nex may drag you to MD of her at random times, nulling all damage sent to her during this timeframe. Shadow Phase Shadow traps (only if the phased before the virus attack) → Darkness → Shadow traps → 4 auto-attacks → Repeats from the second set of shadow traps ⬥ Move from Shadows and don’t stand MD. A shadow trap is avoided A player escapes the shadows engulfing them Blood Phase Siphon summon → 3 auto-attacks → Blood sacrifice → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Attacks during Siphon will heal Nex and sacrifice will heal Nex if not phased and in range. Nex summoning her Blood Reavers Nex sacrifices a player ⬥ Any bleeds used during this phase will heal Nex rather than damage her ( ) ⬥ Cruor's attacks always have 100% accuracy and will heal him for 100 damage regardless of the damage he deals. Ice Phase First special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Second special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Sacrifice, Ice will start with Contain ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Siphon, Ice will start with Prison ⬥ Run from Contain and Freedom into eating up then . ⬥ Glacies' attacks can freeze players if they aren't using Protect/Deflect Magic; keeping the prayer active will result in all of her attacks missing regardless of the player's armour rating. Zaros Phase ⬥ Upon the start of this phase, Nex activates Turmoil and heals herself for 33,333 (1/6) of her health to boost it up to 73,333. ⬥ Nex does not have any unique special attacks in this phase and uses only her melee and magic autoattacks Further details on the mechanics can be found here: https://runescape.wiki/w/Nex/Strategies#The_phases

docs.text: Note: Make sure to use Jas Boost. Pre-Fight After entering the boss room, do the following: → → → → → → → (release an auto attack with it) → → stalled → After barging, proceed North of Nex as shown in the image below Note: you stall for the adren gain but do not actually release the stall. Position When Nex Becomes Attackable + as Nex says "Fill my soul with smoke!" (~14s) Smoke Phase Auto → ‎ ‎→ → → to one of the marked tiles shown below Bladed Dive Pathing Fumus ⬥ With Greater Ricochet → / if Armadyl book procs ⬥ Without Greater Ricochet → / if Armadyl book procs Shadow Phase before the phase changes → → Auto → → → → (dw) → Umbra ⬥ With Greater Ricochet Auto → → wait 1 tick before attacking Nex ⬥ Without Greater Ricochet Auto → → Blood Phase / if you have sufficient adren → → → → a Blood Reaver → wait 1 tick so as not to heal Nex during Siphon → → → → → along the path shown in the picture below Surge + Bladed Dive Pathing Cruor ⬥ With Greater Ricochet → ⬥ Without Greater Ricochet → → if minion is still alive Ice Phase before the phase changes → ‎ ‎ to the tile marked in the image below → → → → Place both on Glacies → stalled → → → Surge Pathing Glacies ⬥ With Greater Ricochet → / if the minion is low ⬥ Without Greater Ricochet → → ‎ ‎ if minion is still alive Zaros Phase ⬥ If Nex starts with Deflect Magic → → → → → → → ⬥ If Nex does not start with Deflect Magic → → + → → → → → → → → →
docs.title: Rotations

docs.text: Smoke Phase Notes ⬥ Throw your bomb right before the kill is about to start. ⬥ Swap to your Dragon Claws EoF after using the SWH Eof Spec, as you will not be using that EoF anymore throughout the fight Shadow Phase Notes ⬥ Walk under Nex when using Slaughter for extra damage. Blood Phase Notes ⬥While bleeds should not be used during Blood phase, the bleed effect from using a channeled ability ( ) after Greater Barge will not heal Nex, as they are not true bleeds. ⬥The reason you need to wait one tick before using Assault on Nex is for the Siphon to end. ⬥Wait for Nex to use her Blood Sacrifice spec before phasing her so that you start the Ice phase with a Contain This. Ice Phase Notes ⬥If you get caught in an Ice Prison, use Freedom then to survive the hit. Zaros Phase Notes ⬥ Nex cycles her overhead curses every 3 auto attacks during ‎ ‎Zaros Phase, following this rotation: → → No overhead curse ⬥ Disruption shield may be used if you are low on food. ⬥ If Nex ends her Ice Phase with , there is a chance it will carry over to Zaros Phase. She may also switch to during Zaros phase, improvise accordingly ⬥ When Nex uses , there is a chance your attacks will be reflected back at you if you hit her. Hence, be careful not to release any defensive autos when using and

docs.text: Nex solo ranged ecb Solo Nex (Courtesy of #Hoobs & #Frog) Introduction Duo Nex is significantly more forgiving than solo, as the DPS check present on Blood phase is much less harsh. When Nex spawns for the first time in a custom instance it will be praying Deflect Magic for the majority of the kill, this is why Range only kills are the meta for fast consistent kills. After every kill you will teleport out of the instance and re-enter in order to force Nex to always be praying Deflect Mage Note: It is strongly advised to complete the Ritual of the Mahjarrat quest in order to get access to the Jas boost which gives a 5% damage boost in GWD1 (including Nex). This can be done via Fairy ring code D.K.Q. Presets Banking Preset ⬥ The most important thing is to have a Frozen key + Ancient Ceremonial set for use with your boss portal. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can speak to Ashuelot Reis in the Nex bank and pay a one time cost of the Frozen key + Ancient Ceremonial along with 10M GP to be able to access Nex bank without these items. ⬥ An Enhanced Luck Potion works and can be used here. Preset ⬥ The Death Lotus chaps have Clear Headed 4 . ⬥ It is recommended to use lunars for Disruption Shield during Zaros phase ⬥ Vulnerability Bombs at the start and on Blood phase ⬥ ‎ ‎ Essence of Finality with a Dark Bow stored. ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch (Runes for ) Mechanics Nex overview ⬥ Nex is a 1x1 NPC and has very strict softcaps, which means that any damage over a certain amount is reduced by X% depending on the phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• During the first four phases, Nex has a soft cap that reduces excess damage above 5,000 by 50% . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- For example, a 6,000 damage hit would be reduced to 5,500 damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• On the Zaros phase, the soft cap is changed to reduce excess damage above 2,000 by 75% . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This means a 6,000-damage hit would be reduced to 3,000. Mages overview ⬥ Mages have a soft cap that reduces excess damage above 1,000 by a random amount between approximately 80% and 100%. ⬥ Each mage is combat level 111 with 10,000 health, possesses a max hit of around 850, and are weak to bolts. The mages are static and can only be attacked whenever Nex calls their name. ⬥ An unusual trait they all share is that they are immune to magic attacks. Nex has 5 phases; Smoke, Shadow, Blood, Ice, and Zaros. Each phase has 2 special attacks, with the exception of Zaros Smoke Phase Virus → 5 auto-attacks → No escape → Five auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Don't stand in middle crossways ⬥ Nex may drag you to MD of her at random times, nulling all damage sent to her during this timeframe. Shadow Phase Shadow traps (only if the phased before the virus attack) → Darkness → Shadow traps → 4 auto-attacks → Repeats from the second set of shadow traps ⬥ Move from Shadows and don’t stand MD. A shadow trap is avoided A player escapes the shadows engulfing them Blood Phase Siphon summon → 3 auto-attacks → Blood sacrifice → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Attacks during Siphon will heal Nex and sacrifice will heal Nex if not phased and in range. Nex summoning her Blood Reavers Nex sacrifices a player ⬥ Any bleeds used during this phase will heal Nex rather than damage her ( ) ⬥ Cruor's attacks always have 100% accuracy and will heal him for 100 damage regardless of the damage he deals. Ice Phase First special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Second special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Sacrifice, Ice will start with Contain ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Siphon, Ice will start with Prison ⬥ Run from Contain and Freedom into eating up then . ⬥ Glacies' attacks can freeze players if they aren't using Protect/Deflect Magic; keeping the prayer active will result in all of her attacks missing regardless of the player's armour rating. Zaros Phase ⬥ Upon the start of this phase, Nex activates Turmoil and heals herself for 33,333 (1/6) of her health to boost it up to 73,333. ⬥ Nex does not have any unique special attacks in this phase and uses only her melee and magic autoattacks Further details on the mechanics can be found here: https://runescape.wiki/w/Nex/Strategies#The_phases Eldritch Crossbow rotation Note: Make sure to use Jas boost and always swap to Hydrix Bakriminel if you get a Ruby proc and make sure to equip your Ring of Vigour for your ECB and Dark Bow specs . They all add up immensely over the course of the entire fight! Pre-Fight + as Nex says "Fill my soul with smoke!" (~14s). Turn on your Godbook right as the timer starts or before it. Smoke Phase → Auto + → Fumus: → → ^^Shadow Phase Option 1 ^^ Tag with and surge away ( if not 100% adrenaline) ^^Shadow Phase Option 2 ^^ → Auto + → Finish with strong basics Umbra: → → (If shadow phase was fast, wait a tick for cooldown) Blood Phase Tag with (if high adren) or any strong non bleed basic (if low adren) → → → → ( if needed) Cruor: → → (or any strong basic if used on blood phase) Ice Phase Note: You should ideally phase into contain first Tag with → towards Glacies → (Surge + Anticipate is done while the phase transition is ongoing) → → Auto + or → + place Mines on Glacies → ( if needed) Glacies: → / if Nex is close Note: Your mines will do the rest of the damage, if that isn't the case, try to walk Nex as much as you can if possible as with a 3 ability Glacies you’re much more likely to get a prison than with a 2 ability Glacies. Zaros Phase Tag with → + → → → → + → Improvise with good basics to finish the kill. Eldritch Crossbow Rotation with Greater Ricochet (Courtesy of #Hoobs & #Frog) Note: Make sure to use Jas boost and always swap to Hydrix Bakriminel if you get a Ruby proc and make sure to equip your Ring of Vigour for your ECB and Dark Bow specs . They all add up immensely over the course of the entire fight! Note: Wait for the Mages to die before swapping targets! Pre-Fight If you want to make sure that one-hits Fumus 99% of the time you can use two mines one square out of md ‎ ‎at (~10s). + right before as Nex says "Fill my soul with smoke!" (~13s for Option 1 and ~12s for Option 2) followed by an ecb spec (~15s for Option 1 and ~14s for Option 2). Turn on your Godbook right as the timer starts or before it. Smoke Phase Option 1 Auto + → → minion Smoke Phase Option 2 Auto (always comes out with ) + → → minion Shadow Phase Option 1 and click mid to underwalk it → → Auto + ‎ ‎ → → → minion Shadow Phase Option 2 and click mid to underwalk it → → Auto + -> → → minion Blood Phase Snap Shot (if high adren) or any strong non bleed basic (if low adrenaline you can drink your adrenaline pot) → → → → → ( if needed) → minion Note: If your Blood Phase went fast you can on cruor and save an ability on Ice Ice Phase Note: You should ideally phase into contain first Tag with → towards Cruor → (Surge + Anticipate is done while the phase transition is ongoing) → → Auto + or → ( if needed) → towards Glacies and run md to stall autos from Nex → minion Zaros Phase Tag with Corruption Shot → → → → → → Finish the kill Positioning Note: The white square represents the player, the red square represents Nex and the pink square where to click. The arrow points in the general direction of movement for the phase Smoke Phase ⬥ Stand on the west side, once she’s phased click on Fumus and after your targetcycle on Nex and click mid while using . Shadow Phase ⬥ During shadow make your way to the east safe spot while phasing Nex ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Once phased, try to stay MD / 2 squares away from Nex so she can reach you instantly and begin siphoning. Blood Phase ⬥ During her siphon, make your way over to the eastern safe spot whilst staying at an even number of squares so that if she does run to you, she won’t run underneath you which could delay her attacks which could mean she won’t sacrifice if everything lines up poorly. ⬥ At the eastern safespot you can click Cruor during your Rapid Fire and it won’t switch unless your ability ends or Nex phases. Ice Phase ⬥ Once Cruor is dead, Surge to Glacies and stand MD to him to stall Nex autos. Zaros Phase ⬥ Try to get in MD of Nex fast to prevent book walks. Phase Notes General Notes ⬥ If the minion is 2.5k or lower after the initial it should die to the dmg. ⬥ After you a minion wait a tick before prephasing Nex ⬥ If you get a Book Proc or you premine Fumus you can prephase Nex a tick earlier Smoke Phase Notes ⬥ Throw your bomb right before the kill is about to start. ⬥ If Nex tries to MD you earlier you can walk around the corner to prevent her underwalking you Shadow Phase Notes ⬥ If you around 136k you won't need to use / Blood Phase Notes ⬥ Be sure to let her Sacrifice so you get a contain first on Ice phase ⬥ In rare cases it is possible to have to your Adrenaline Potion in order to use Rapid Fire . In this case you will need to improvise your Zaros rotation. ⬥ Practice your Snipe timing so that it hits right when Nex is attackable, rather than healing her. You can snipe when her Wings go up a 3rd time. Ice Phase Notes ⬥ If you get prisoned before targeting Glacies you can target cycle to attack him. ⬥ If you around 56k you won't need to use Zaros Phase Notes ⬥ Disruption shield may be used if you are low on food. ⬥ You can run Nex if low on food, but don't need to (and will end up walking book procs). It's optimal to do so if you notice her SS is active. Advanced Video Example This is a sample 31 kill hour using the Eldritch Crossbow and its special attack. Kills following this rotation should average out at around sub 1:30. You can also use this as a visual guide for movement during the kill. https://youtu.be/l0HHhI74m-U

docs.text: Nex solo ranged Solo Nex (Courtesy of #Hoobs & #Frog) Introduction Nex is the Zarosian general in the God Wars dungeon. When Nex spawns for the first time in a custom instance it will be praying Deflect Magic for the majority of the kill, this is why Range only kills are the meta for fast consistent kills. After every kill you will teleport out of the instance and re-enter in order to force Nex to always be praying Deflect Mage Note: It is strongly advised to complete the Ritual of the Mahjarrat quest in order to get access to the Jas boost which gives a 5% damage boost in GWD1 (including Nex). Preset ⬥ Throw your Vulnerability Bomb at start and on Blood phase. ⬥ Akrisae body has Clear Headed 4 , and is used to build with Escape at the start. ⬥ This method relies on Ruby bolt procs on Nex. However, around Ice phase, Ruby bolt procs start to hit less than the ability they are replacing, so it’s optimal to bring a bolt switch. It is generally preferred to camp Ruby until Ice phase, then switch to Dragonstone bolts . ⬥ Reckless is the only aura recommended to all players, the hitchance increase will make the fight much smoother. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For reference, compare your setup with the !hitchance command with and without the aura. Each phase has 2 special attacks, with the exception of Zaros Smoke Phase Virus → 5 auto-attacks → No escape → Five auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Don't stand in middle crossways ⬥ Nex may drag you to MD of her at random times, nulling all damage sent to her during this timeframe. Shadow Phase Shadow traps (only if the phased before the virus attack) → Darkness → Shadow traps → 4 auto-attacks → Repeats from the second set of shadow traps ⬥ Move from Shadows and don’t stand MD. A shadow trap is avoided A player escapes the shadows engulfing them Blood Phase Siphon summon → 3 auto-attacks → Blood sacrifice → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Attacks during Siphon will heal Nex and sacrifice will heal Nex if not phased and in range. Nex summoning her Blood Reavers Nex sacrifices a player ⬥ Any bleeds used during this phase will heal Nex rather than damage her ( ) ⬥ Cruor's attacks always have 100% accuracy and will heal him for 100 damage regardless of the damage he deals. Ice Phase First special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Second special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Sacrifice, Ice will start with Contain ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Siphon, Ice will start with Prison ⬥ Run from Contain and Freedom into eating up then . ⬥ Glacies' attacks can freeze players if they aren't using Protect/Deflect Magic; keeping the prayer active will result in all of her attacks missing regardless of the player's armour rating. Zaros Phase ⬥ Upon the start of this phase, Nex activates Turmoil and heals herself for 33,333 (1/6) of her health to boost it up to 73,333. ⬥ Nex does not have any unique special attacks in this phase and uses only her melee and magic autoattacks Further details on the mechanics can be found here: https://runescape.wiki/w/Nex/Strategies#The_phases Rotations with Ascension Crossbows + a 2H Note: Make sure to use Jas Boost Pre-Fight Target Fumus ASAP and start building adrenaline with defensives. Freedom should be first, and Anticipate should be last. Spam click the minion as sometimes when you Escape , you won't get adrenaline from Anticipate if you don't keep clicking the minion before Escape . + as Nex says "Fill my soul with smoke!" (~14s) Smoke Phase Auto → → (Walk backwards) → (dw) → → Shadow Phase Tag with walk under her → → Spam click Nex to get a lossless auto → (dw) → → → → Improvise Blood Phase → (pre-phase) → (dw) → → → (Surge from Red) → (if Nex isn't phased yet) → / / Thresh Ice Phase ⬥ Contain First Auto → → (Run from Contain) → → (tag minion ASAP) ⬥ Prison First Run to max attack distance and phase with Dazing Shot → during the phase and eat a lot of jellies and grests to get to full HP → → → prison → → / Zaros Phase → → → → → → → → → 5 tick Auto → → Video Guide This rotation was entirely adapted from the fantastic video version made by #Glaucon. https://youtu.be/6gkd8pFJrkg Rotations with Dual Wield + Greater Ricochet (Courtesy of #Hoobs) Note: Make sure to use Jas Boost Notes ⬥ Use the same preset listed above for dual wield. ⬥ will likely be used after Blood phase/Cruor, but should be improvised depending on adrenaline needs. ⬥ These rotations involve specific positioning to achieve fast kill times (1:40s - 1:50s). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Be sure to check out the videos section to see how to position, especially in Shadow and Ice Phase. ⬥ Stay in combat in-between runs by using / / defensives. This will help ensure that you can trigger crackling in Smoke phase. + as Nex says "Fill my soul with smoke!" (~14s). Turn on your Godbook right as the timer starts or before it. Smoke Phase .→ → Fast basics as needed . This assumes one of Ruby/Crackling/Book procs, which happen often. You should be ready to improvise i.e. ‎ ‎ will hit for ~13k, so if Nex is at 176k after rapid fire, use before . Fumus Tag with → + Run/ towards Fumus → Position at corner + . Finish with basics if needed. Example Smoke → Shadow transition. Note: There is a step towards Nex and then away from Nex when is cast. This ensures walked damage. Otherwise, the first few hits will be un-walked while Nex does her speech to transition Shadow Phase Tag with → towards Cruor off GCD → for adrenaline→ ‎ ‎Spam click Nex to get a lossless auto → → → → / /Fast Basics if needed. Example Shadow phase kiting Note: Soul Split can be freely used at the start of Shadow phase. Nex will not attack you until she does “Embrace Darkness!” Running back and forth here allows you to delay the Nex autos. Umbra Tag with → Position at corner + . Finish with basics if needed. Blood Phase → / for adren → ‎ ‎(pre-phase) → → + Surge to Cruor → Finish with basics if needed. Cruor Tag with → Position at corner + . Finish with basics if needed. Example Blood → Ice transition Ice Phase Tag with → for adrenaline + towards Glaices → (will trigger Auto) → ‎ ‎(Run from Contain) + place mines at Glaices if you have them → → basics as needed → ‎ ‎(tag minion ASAP). You might want to do before if she’s >55k HP. Watch the video for positioning and keep your HP high for ice prison. When in prison, you can target-cycle to Glaices to finish the minion. Glacies Tag with → + basics if needed/no mines. Zaros Phase Tag with + walk → ‎ ‎→ → → ‎ ‎→ Repeat and finish. Rotation with a Noxious Longbow and Greater Ricochet (Courtesy of #Hoobs) Note: Make sure to use Jas Boost What to Expect This method can achieve around 1:50-2:00 kills optimally. Even with scuffed kills you can average 2:20-2:30. Nex has an attack range of 8 spaces, while Nox Bow has a range of 9, so you can always force Nex to walk frags and delay attacks depending on where you stand. Review the position indicators at the bottom of this guide to see where to stand while phasing. Use → + basics as needed to phase minions. Preset ⬥ Stalker ring adds 3% crit chance when using bows and makes kills more consistent. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Switch to Ring of Vigour when using . ⬥ Adrenaline renewal can be used at Cruor / before Ice phase, but improvise as needed. ⬥ Bring two Dominion Mines to mine Glaices in Ice phase for smoother phasing. ⬥ You will need to apply 8-15 Black Stone Arrow stacks to get to 100% hitchance on Nex, depending on weapon tier, prayer variant ( Anguish / Desolation ), and Reaper stacks. You can check the Hit Chance calculator to get the number for your exact setup. Pre-Fight Target Fumus ASAP and start building adrenaline with defensives. Freedom should be first, and Anticipate should be last. Spam click the minion as sometimes when you Escape , you won't get adrenaline from Anticipate if you don't keep clicking the minion before Escape . + as Nex says "Fill my soul with smoke!" (~14s). Turn on your Godbook when you enter the instance or as the timer starts. Smoke Phase Auto → → ‎ ‎ → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎→ + basics as needed Shadow Phase Tag with → towards Cruor for adrenaline → Spam click Nex to get a lossless auto → → → → + Basics if needed. Blood Phase (if needed) → (pre-phase) /fast basic → ‎ ‎ → → + Surge to Cruor → Finish with basics if needed. Ice Phase Tag with → towards Glaices. Auto → → ‎ ‎(Run from Contain) → → → (tag minion ASAP). Depending on adren + Nex HP, you might need to do instead of . ‎ ‎For Glaices, tag with ASAP. In prison, into eating up then . Target cycle to minion and finish with + basics. Zaros Phase Tag with + walk → → → → / /repeat basics → Finish the kill Positioning Note: The white square represents the player, the red dot represents Nex and the yellow dot represents minions. The arrow points in the general direction of movement for the phase Smoke Phase Stand on the west side, once she’s phased click on Fumus and after you Corruption Shot , Surge into Fumus and make your way over to the north-western safespot, by the time she’s able to attack you Fumus should be low HP or dead depending on if you got any procs. Try and run her if she’s close to surging through the middle. Shadow Phase During shadow make your way over to the north-eastern safespot, one method is to phase her on the northern side then once she is phased make your way to the north-eastern safe spot whilst you're killing Umbra so you're not stuck taking shadow bleed damage at the safe spot for long. Once phased, try to stay MD/ 2 squares away from Nex so she can reach you instantly and begin siphoning. Blood Phase During her siphon, make your way over to the eastern safe spot whilst staying at an even number of squares so that if she does run to you, she won’t run underneath you which could delay her attacks which could mean she won’t sacrifice if everything lines up poorly. At the eastern safespot you can click Cruor during your Rapid Fire and it won’t switch unless your ability ends or Nex phases. After she is phased, make your way over to the south-eastern safespot so she will follow you, allowing no tick loss during the transition from Blood to Ice as you’ll want to be MD to Glacies during the beginning of Ice. Ice Phase : Once Cruor is dead, Surge to Glacies and stand MD to her. Zaros Phase Try not to run Nex too much whilst your book is off cooldown. Phase Notes Smoke Phase Notes ⬥ Throw your bomb right before the kill is about to start. ⬥ Make sure to Rapid Fire with Ascensions so that there's a chance to proc the Ruby bolt effect. ⬥ If the boss doesn't phase, follow up with → → , and run the boss while you do so. ⬥ Both bleeds then good basics on the minion. Shadow Phase Notes ⬥ If you proc a Ruby bolt during Rapid Fire , Needle Strike into Snap Shot without Snipe . ⬥ Reprisal isn't necessary , but makes it easier when you don't get a Ruby bolt proc. ⬥ Both bleeds and good basics on the minion. Blood Phase Notes ⬥ Be sure to let her Sacrifice so you get a contain first on Ice phase ⬥ In rare cases it is possible to have to your Adrenaline Potion in order to use Rapid Fire . In this case you will need to improvise your Zaros rotation. ⬥ Both bleeds and good basics on Cruor. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Nex is MDing you, it's worth it to run her to stall autos, but don't worry too much if she does another Siphon before you can phase. ⬥ Practice your Snipe timing so that it hits right when Nex is attackable, rather than healing her. You can snipe when her Wings go up a 3rd time. Ice Phase Notes ⬥ If you get prisoned before targeting Glacies you can target cycle to attack him. Zaros Phase Notes ⬥ Disruption shield may be used if you are low on food. ⬥ You can run Nex if low on food, but don't need to (and will end up walking book procs). It's optimal to do so if you notice her SS is active. Example Kills Non-ECB kills (Courtesy of #Pernix) https://youtu.be/6U3B-_YXjFk Ascension Crossbow + Grico 26 kill hour (Courtesy of #Hoobs) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=as1kqW_Xw9M Nox Bow + Grico 25 kill hour (Courtesy of #Hoobs) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c2hyuT6Wc-g

docs.title: Nex solo ranged

docs.text: Nex is the Zarosian general in the God Wars dungeon. When Nex spawns for the first time in a custom instance it will be praying Deflect Magic for the majority of the kill, this is why Range only kills are the meta for fast consistent kills. After every kill you will teleport out of the instance and re-enter in order to force Nex to always be praying Deflect Mage Note: It is strongly advised to complete the Ritual of the Mahjarrat quest in order to get access to the Jas boost which gives a 5% damage boost in GWD1 (including Nex). This can be done via Fairy ring code D.K.Q.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Banking Preset ⬥ The most important thing is to have a Frozen key + Ancient Ceremonial set for use with your boss portal. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can speak to Ashuelot Reis in the Nex bank and pay a one time cost of the Frozen key + Ancient Ceremonial along with 10M GP to be able to access Nex bank without these items. ⬥ An Enhanced Luck Potion works and can be used here. Preset ⬥ Throw your Vulnerability Bomb at start and on Blood phase. ⬥ Akrisae body has Clear Headed 4 , and is used to build with Escape at the start. ⬥ This method relies on Ruby bolt procs on Nex. However, around Ice phase, Ruby bolt procs start to hit less than the ability they are replacing, so it’s optimal to bring a bolt switch. It is generally preferred to camp Ruby until Ice phase, then switch to Dragonstone bolts . ⬥ Reckless is the only aura recommended to all players, the hitchance increase will make the fight much smoother. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For reference, compare your setup with the !hitchance command with and without the aura.
docs.title: Presets

docs.text: Nex overview ⬥ Nex is a 1x1 NPC and has very strict softcaps, which means that any damage over a certain amount is reduced by X% depending on the phase. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• During the first four phases, Nex has a soft cap that reduces excess damage above 5,000 by 50% . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- For example, a 6,000 damage hit would be reduced to 5,500 damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• On the Zaros phase, the soft cap is changed to reduce excess damage above 2,000 by 75% . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This means a 6,000-damage hit would be reduced to 3,000. Mages overview ⬥ Mages have a soft cap that reduces excess damage above 1,000 by a random amount between approximately 80% and 100%. ⬥ Each mage is combat level 111 with 10,000 health, possesses a max hit of around 850, and are weak to bolts. The mages are static and can only be attacked whenever Nex calls their name. ⬥ An unusual trait they all share is that they are immune to magic attacks. Nex has 5 phases; Smoke, Shadow, Blood, Ice, and Zaros. Each phase has 2 special attacks, with the exception of Zaros Smoke Phase Virus → 5 auto-attacks → No escape → Five auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Don't stand in middle crossways ⬥ Nex may drag you to MD of her at random times, nulling all damage sent to her during this timeframe. Shadow Phase Shadow traps (only if the phased before the virus attack) → Darkness → Shadow traps → 4 auto-attacks → Repeats from the second set of shadow traps ⬥ Move from Shadows and don’t stand MD. A shadow trap is avoided A player escapes the shadows engulfing them Blood Phase Siphon summon → 3 auto-attacks → Blood sacrifice → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ Attacks during Siphon will heal Nex and sacrifice will heal Nex if not phased and in range. Nex summoning her Blood Reavers Nex sacrifices a player ⬥ Any bleeds used during this phase will heal Nex rather than damage her ( ) ⬥ Cruor's attacks always have 100% accuracy and will heal him for 100 damage regardless of the damage he deals. Ice Phase First special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Second special attack (based on phase start) → 3 auto-attacks → Repeat ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Sacrifice, Ice will start with Contain ⬥ If Blood phase ended with Siphon, Ice will start with Prison ⬥ Run from Contain and Freedom into eating up then . ⬥ Glacies' attacks can freeze players if they aren't using Protect/Deflect Magic; keeping the prayer active will result in all of her attacks missing regardless of the player's armour rating. Zaros Phase ⬥ Upon the start of this phase, Nex activates Turmoil and heals herself for 33,333 (1/6) of her health to boost it up to 73,333. ⬥ Nex does not have any unique special attacks in this phase and uses only her melee and magic autoattacks Further details on the mechanics can be found here: https://runescape.wiki/w/Nex/Strategies#The_phases

docs.title: Example Kills

docs.text: Ed2 hydrix ED2 Hydrix Dragons Stats ⬥ ‎ ‎XP per kill : 17,134 + 5654 HP ⬥ ‎ ‎XP per kill : 17,000 (29,325 with Scrimshaw of Sacrifice + Dragon Slayer gloves) ⬥ Optimal kills per hour: 120+ ⬥ Optimal XP per hour : ~3.5m Desirable Drops Due to the nature of the Scrimshaw of Sacrifice, all tradeable drops are destroyed. These are elite dungeon mobs, and untradeable drops are not destroyed by the scrimshaw, therefore they still drop Laboratory Relics and Perfect Gemstone Scales. Location and How to Get There Two dragons are located in a large clearing shortly before the Black Stone Dragon encounter inside the Dragonkin Laboratory Elite Dungeon. The closest method of teleporting is via the usage of the elite dungeon chest, teleporting to option 4 ( Kalist Kiket Fia ) and running north to get to the dragons. Useful Items ⬥ Scrimshaw of Sacrifice - Provides 50% extra Slayer experience at the cost of tradeable drops. Extremely useful here as relics are kept, and the tradeable drops are worth very little. ⬥ Dragon Slayer Gloves - Provides a 15% Slayer experience boost and 10% accuracy boost when slaying dragons. Purchaseable with 100 thaler or 200 Fist of Guthix tokens, and last for 1000 kills. ⬥ Dominion Mines - Deployable twice per minute, deals up to 10k damage on a target below 138 combat level. ⬥ Acceleration Potions - Reduces the cooldown of mobility abilities such as Bladed Dive , Surge and Escape to 0.6s, allowing for extremely quick travel over large distances. ⬥ Dragonbane Weaponry - T79 Melee weapons, provide a 25% damage increase against Dragon class mobs. This only affects the mainhand and 2h variants, so a normal offhand should be used if meleeing. General Strategy ⬥ There are two Hydrix dragons inside ED2, each with 70,000 LP. These are not door mobs, as such, they respawn upon leaving and re-entering the dungeon, as long as the next set of door mobs aren't killed. To set up the dungeon for slayer purposes, the two doors after defeating Verak Lith must be opened, but do not open the two doors before the Black Stone Dragon, as this will prevent the dragons from respawning. ⬥ To start, the Adrenaline Crystal at War's Retreat can be used to build up to 100% adrenaline. Use the boss portal to teleport to the Dragonkin Laboratory, enter and use the chest to teleport to option 4. Bladed dive , Double Surge and Barge are all helpful for navigating the dungeon, running north to get to the dragons. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Acceleration potions are extremely useful here for faster runs. ⬥ Place Dominion Mines , and use an ultimate ability Death's Swiftness / Berserk / Sunshine , alongside AoE's to kill the dragons quickly. The Dragon Slayer ability is worth using here, providing a 15% damage boost for 10 seconds, and can be used every run. Once killed, teleport out, refill on adrenaline and repeat the process. Note: Whilst any style can be used here, both Ranged and Melee outshine Magic, and are recommended for faster XP/h. The presets below show best-in-slot gear, but this is not required to kill them by any means, downgrade items to fit your setup. Ranged Method Attempt to lure the two dragons together by casting Binding Shot , running further south, then moving back to target the northern-most dragon. Melee Method ⬥ Usage of the Dragon slayer gloves is highly recommended, as they have a low affinity to melee. ⬥ When using bane weaponry, an aura such as Berserker/Brawler should be utilised to reach 100% hitchance, it can be checked via the calculator in #pvm-spreadsheets . Presets ⬥ Ranged Preset ⬥ Melee Preset Video Guides ⬥ Ranged (Courtesy of #geherman) https://youtu.be/ftFzvJJg5hg ⬥ Melee (Courtesy of #Terpsichore) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dgRA0BbJmhA

Useful Items ⬥ Scrimshaw of Sacrifice - Provides 50% extra Slayer experience at the cost of tradeable drops. Extremely useful here as relics are kept, and the tradeable drops are worth very little. ⬥ Dragon Slayer Gloves - Provides a 15% Slayer experience boost and 10% accuracy boost when slaying dragons. Purchaseable with 100 thaler or 200 Fist of Guthix tokens, and last for 1000 kills. ⬥ Dominion Mines - Deployable twice per minute, deals up to 10k damage on a target below 138 combat level. ⬥ Acceleration Potions - Reduces the cooldown of mobility abilities such as Bladed Dive , Surge and Escape to 0.6s, allowing for extremely quick travel over large distances. ⬥ Dragonbane Weaponry - T79 Melee weapons, provide a 25% damage increase against Dragon class mobs. This only affects the mainhand and 2h variants, so a normal offhand should be used if meleeing. General Strategy ⬥ There are two Hydrix dragons inside ED2, each with 70,000 LP. These are not door mobs, as such, they respawn upon leaving and re-entering the dungeon, as long as the next set of door mobs aren't killed. To set up the dungeon for slayer purposes, the two doors after defeating Verak Lith must be opened, but do not open the two doors before the Black Stone Dragon, as this will prevent the dragons from respawning. ⬥ To start, the Adrenaline Crystal at War's Retreat can be used to build up to 100% adrenaline. Use the boss portal to teleport to the Dragonkin Laboratory, enter and use the chest to teleport to option 4. Bladed dive , Double Surge and Barge are all helpful for navigating the dungeon, running north to get to the dragons. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Acceleration potions are extremely useful here for faster runs. ⬥ Place Dominion Mines , and use an ultimate ability Death's Swiftness / Berserk / Sunshine , alongside AoE's to kill the dragons quickly. The Dragon Slayer ability is worth using here, providing a 15% damage boost for 10 seconds, and can be used every run. Once killed, teleport out, refill on adrenaline and repeat the process. Note: Whilst any style can be used here, both Ranged and Melee outshine Magic, and are recommended for faster XP/h. The presets below show best-in-slot gear, but this is not required to kill them by any means, downgrade items to fit your setup. Ranged Method Attempt to lure the two dragons together by casting Binding Shot , running further south, then moving back to target the northern-most dragon. Melee Method ⬥ Usage of the Dragon slayer gloves is highly recommended, as they have a low affinity to melee. ⬥ When using bane weaponry, an aura such as Berserker/Brawler should be utilised to reach 100% hitchance, it can be checked via the calculator in #pvm-spreadsheets . Presets ⬥ Ranged Preset ⬥ Melee Preset Video Guides ⬥ Ranged (Courtesy of #geherman) https://youtu.be/ftFzvJJg5hg ⬥ Melee (Courtesy of #Terpsichore) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dgRA0BbJmhA
docs.title: ED2 Hydrix Dragons

docs.text: Moss golems Moss Golems Stats ⬥ ‎ ‎XP per kill : 2951 + 973 HP ⬥ ‎ ‎XP per kill : 2408.8 ⬥ Optimal kills per hour: 950 (high effort), 800 (low effort) ⬥ Optimal XP per hour : ~2.3m Desirable Drops ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves - Drop Rate of 1/1500 on task and 1/5000 off task ⬥ Ancient Elven Ritual Shard - Drop Rate of 1/1500 on task and 1/5000 off task ⬥ Torn Grimoire Pages - Drop Rate of 1/512 on task and 1/1536 off task. This makes Moss Golems worth 66,451 in uniques alone, paired with high kph, this makes them a very good gp task. Location and How to Get There Moss Golems are located in the south east clearing of the Lost Grove, accessible through the monolith west of the Incandescent wisp colony, west of Yanille. The easiest way to get there would be through the fairy ring (code B J S ) after repairing it with 5 Bittercap mushrooms. An alternative method is to run west from the Incandescent wisp colony, accessible via the portal in the Max guild garden, or via the fairy ring south of Castle Wars (code B K P ). Useful Items ⬥ Alloy Spikes - Very strong here, allowing for increased poison hits and healing via the usage of a scrimshaw of Vampyrism and the Vampyrism aura . ⬥ Restocking Cannon Ability - Allows the cannon to restock without requiring interaction ⬥ Essence of Finality with an Annihilation stored inside - Provides a 1% damage boost for 30s per stack, capping at 20 stacks. A stack is gained on each successful hit, including armour spikes. Usage of the special attack is only recommended if the player is using both a Blood nihil familiar and the T99 prayer Malevolence , as your hit chance will drop too low without them and the special attack will clear itself upon splashing. Method ⬥ Moss Golems have hard hitting melee auto-attacks, and can hit from halberd range. When they lose HP, their heads pop off and spawn a Mossy Rock that also deals damage. ⬥ Moss Golems can be effectively afk'd with the correct setup, which will be detailed here. The Devotion ability is a high priority here, alongside the enhanced devoted and devoted perks, which provide a huge melee damage reduction, as you will be praying . For the most part the task can be done afk using the bar below, however make sure to keep an eye out and eat food if required. Moss golems have a high defence level, so usage of a blood nihil is recommended. The Vampyrism aura and Scrimshaw of Vampyrism are the main sources of healing, with Alloy Spikes helping with the healing. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If using the Corbicula Rex perk from the Ranch out of Time, excess adrenaline can be used in the form of the or , both of these can be rotated between to greatly increase the damage dealt. A Blood nihil is especially important if using spec, as it loses its effect and duration upon splashing. Melee Preset Action Bar Note: It is assumed certain abilities such as Bladed Dive , EoF special attack and weapon special attack are accessible on other action bars, or through ability books, for manual use. The player may also prefer to manually cast Devotion to be able to have more control and use it in a more strategic manner Where to Stand Place the cannon around the red square, and stand on the yellow square shown in the image below, which is in a corner north east of the treeline on the map. Placement is also shown in the low effort video example shown below. Video Guide ⬥ High Effort https://youtu.be/tStClTZnOKc ⬥ Low Effort https://youtu.be/Vdz98o6zjo0

docs.text: Nightmare creatures Nightmare Creatures Introduction Unlockable for 50 slayer points after the completion of the Children of Mah quest, Nightmare Creatures are powerful slayer creatures, requiring 80 to kill. They offer good XP rates, good GP rates, afk-ability and a high valued unique. Stats ⬥ ‎ ‎XP per kill : 1954 + 645 HP ⬥ ‎ ‎XP per kill : 1540 ⬥ Optimal kills per hour: 700 ⬥ Optimal XP per hour : ~1050k Desirable Drops ⬥ Nightmares have a strong common drop table, offering a large amount of alchables, fletching supplies, and coins, alongside being a very good source of Soul runes. ⬥ For the slayer log, Nightmares also drop the Nightmare Gauntlets , a set of powerful range gloves that are best-in-slot in some scenarios. These are dropped at a rate of 1/2000 on-task and 1/10000 off-task. This makes Nightmare Creatures worth 83,490 per kill. Location and How to Get There Nightmare Creatures are located at the Ritual site on Freneskae, accessible through the World Gate after completion of the quest Children of Mah. Bring a Sixth-Age circuit for an easy teleport. Useful Items ⬥ Restocking Cannon Ability - Allows the cannon to restock without requiring interaction. ⬥ Sixth-Age Circuit - Allows for an easy teleport to the World Gate. ⬥ Alloy spikes are very strong here, allowing for increased poison hits and healing via the usage of a scrimshaw of Vampyrism and the Vampyrism aura . Method ⬥ Nightmares have two forms of attacks, a weaker melee auto-attack, and a ranged special attack which can deal large amounts of damage in 2 hits. Due to this, when killing nightmares it is recommended to pray and use a form of healing such as a Scrimshaw of Vampyrism or Blood spells from the Ancient spellbook. ⬥ Both melee and magic can be used to kill Nightmares optimally, and the strategy between the styles does not change. Place your at the spot shown in the image below, and stand next to the large pillar with and auto-retaliate on. Use strong AoE abilities, the AFK bar in #overview-of-slayer can be used. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Melee suffers from a lower hitchance than magic, therefore an aura such as could be used if the healing from is not required. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Manually inputting or will greatly increase AoE damage and increase the kph. ⬥ Magic is used via Legacy mode, as the healing offered from Blood spells is extremely strong, alongside hard hitting auto-attacks. Due to the nature of the Inquisitor's staff, the spell Blood Burst can be used for a small damage reduction whilst saving a large amount of blood runes, which one could do to improve profits. Due to Nightmare Creatures' high accuracy, they can deal large amounts of damage in short periods of time, so higher tiered armour or even tank armour should be used when maging in legacy, to mitigate the damage taken. Melee Preset Magic Preset Cannon + Stand Spot Place the on the red square, and stand on the yellow square after loading it with cannonballs. The player may have a chance to be walked backwards one square if they attack a Nightmare that is running towards them, in this case simply click back onto the highlighted square. Video Guides ⬥ High effort Melee https://youtu.be/Oi_q253KxY4 ⬥ Low effort Melee https://youtu.be/yvRns_cDPxE ⬥ Legacy Magic https://youtu.be/wXRr_2Nkxoc

docs.text: Optimal block prefer lists Optimal Block and Prefer Lists For XP For GP Assumptions ⬥ In the pictures above, the optimal block and prefer lists for XP and GP focused slayer is shown. These are based off the weightings of each task, the blocked tasks are highly weighted and offer low rates in either XP, GP or both. Some high-weight but fast tasks were excluded from the block list, as those are used to build points, such as Dagannoths or Order of Ascension Members. ⬥ The XP-focused tasks have a few assumptions, that Ripper Demons are killed for all Demon tasks, ED2 Hydrix dragons are killed for both Gemstone Dragons and Dragon tasks, Moss Golems are killed for Creatures of the Lost Grove, and that the player's highest level Soul Devourer is killed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If required to, the player should boost with the use of a Wilder Pie to kill higher levelled mobs, to boost their XP rates further. ⬥ The GP focused tasks assume that the player is using Binding Contracts for both Ripper Demon and Demon tasks. Tasks that are not preferred but are often good to do include Crystal Shapeshifters, Iorwerth Elves, Nihils and Tormented Demons, with the latter two being required to be unlocked. ⬥ Laniakea's special assignment is a very strong task, granting 50k slayer XP and 45 slayer points upon completion, and only requires 1 kill of each Vile Bloom. This takes a few minutes and gives large rewards, so should always be completed. On the other hand, Morvran's special assignment requires many boss kills, takes too much time and gives very little reward, so should be turned off for free, after being completed once for the completionist cape requirement. How to Use These Lists ⬥ In order for the player to profit or break-even on slayer points on average, their prefer list weighting must equal 19.2% of the total task weighting, as long as Slayer VIP tickets are used. Slayer tasks completed with Laniakea award 35.2 slayer points on average, and as a skip costs 30 points, the player must complete 46% of their tasks on average to profit slayer points, so don't be too afraid to skip tasks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If the player is 120 Slayer, the cape perk allows them to skip even more tasks, as they have a guaranteed task they will complete when they choose it, 20% of the time. ⬥ Bad tasks should always be blocked or skipped with quick tasks completed to upkeep slayer points, and never reset your streak via a Spria task, as the streak bonus is very important to gaining slayer points consistently. Due to the nature of some tasks, slayer points can be quite valuable. ⬥ Whilst these lists are optimal, many players will find that they enjoy or dislike tasks, which is perfectly fine. Take into account which tasks you personally prefer, and build your lists around that. The most important thing is to enjoy slaying!
docs.title: Optimal block prefer lists
