docs.text: Overview This phase is split into two sections, the first is dealing with Eruptions and the blight storm in the centre of the arena, and the second is lowering the secondary blight bar underneath Solak's HP bar. ⬥ Eruptions can be killed in a combination of 4 different ways, duo or solo, and 3-hit or 2-hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Eruptions can be killed together or seperately, requiring slightly different rotations and less co-ordination if done solo. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 2-hit eruptions result in tanking the storm for longer, as you deal 1k less damage per click on the blight storm compared to 3-hit. 3-hit eruptions deal 10k per click on the first eruption, and then 8k on the north eruption, killing it faster and resulting in a safer but slower strategy. ⬥ Once eruptions are killed, it is assumed that cleansing with Merethiel is done once, before going up to clear the blight storm for the first time. ⬥ Solak does not have enough HP to deplete the blight bar naturally before he reaches his HP cap, however, the blight damage from the ECB special attack drains the secondary blight bar directly. With 1 good use of the ECB spec, the boss can phase during the arm climb attack. As such, only general outlines will be detailed below, and improvisation rotations continue into P3. The general outline is as follows: ⬥ If you used ECB on Eruptions: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Base Finish spec → bleeds ( + ) → ( + ) → Build to 100% → Death's Swift ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• DPS Finish spec as you go up Erupt → Build to 100% → ( + ) → Build to 100% → ⬥ If you did not ECB on Eruptions: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Base bleeds ( + + ) → ( + ) → Build to 100% → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• DPS Improvise (Snap if high adren) → go up Erupt → ( + ) → Build to 100% → ⬥ If Solak is above 1300k HP , use another spec. This is to quicken the build to 100% in order to use Death's Swiftness . ⬥ The P2 is where the improvisational skills of the player are tested. Hydrix bolts give extremely variable adrenaline, so no two kills will follow the same rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As a general guideline, the player should aim to get 2x Snapshot , 2x Rapid Fire , 1-2x ECB spec , 1+ Dbow EoF spec ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• With strong procs, excess adrenaline should be dumped in the form of ECB specs and Dbow EoF specs , before building for when the boss is below 1300k HP.

docs.text: Solak range Solak Range Camp (DPS) (Courtesy of #Nouzar) Introduction With the powerful ECB and Dbow special attacks, alongside Greater Ricochet , Ranged has the potential for extremely high damage output at Solak, as his weak attacks and plentiful opportunities for healing allow for easy sustain. However, due to the nature of the Ranged combat style, no two kills will ever be the same, and as such, this channel will go over guidelines for Ranged Duo DPS kills, with the aim of sub 6:00 non storm-tank and 5:45 storm-tank kills. Basing Solak with Ranged camp is not recommended, due to Solak's innate ability to not splash on the base tank, and the Split Soul special attack disabling healing from ⬥ Effectively using Ranged as a combat style requires a large degree of improvisational skills. This is to make the best use of the excess adrenaline gained from Hydrix Bakriminel bolts . As such, rotations are not set in stone and the player's intuition is required to achieve optimal kills, as no two kills will ever be the same. Excess adrenaline can be used through more ECB specs, more EoF Dark Bow specs, or better use of thresholds. ⬥ The use of an ECB EoF is required for some of the rotations outlined below. A physical ECB can execute similar rotations, however, making use of SGB EoF special attacks and 4-tick auto attacks with the is required, alongside good improvisation skills. General Notes ⬥ The guide contains rotations for Root skips, the timings of which can be found in #solak-mechanics . ⬥ In duo, it is advised that the DPS pre-places their dominion mines on the SE roots , and the Base on the NW roots . ⬥ It is easier to apply the Smoke Cloud debuff with Ranged, at the start of Death's Swiftness with the use of Ingenuity of the Humans . Solak, Core, and Erethdor should all be debuffed, and co-ordinate between team members as to who is applying it. ⬥ It is assumed Borrowed Power is set to Smoke Cloud Presets General ⬥ It is assumed that the Spirit Weed , Kwuarm , and Lantadyme incense sticks are used, and an Overload and Weapon Poison +++ is drank at the bank, to save an inventory space. ⬥ These presets are completely filled, requiring the player to drop a Spiritual at the start of the fight to pick up later when the spot is free, after the P1 dummy is placed or another is drank. If not comfortable with this, the player can opt to bring a with them, to free up a space. Advanced Preset ⬥ The two dummies are for chinning the Legs in P1, and for building out of the realm at the start of P4. ⬥ Essence of Finality - SGB ⬥ Essence of Finality - Dbow ⬥ Essence of Finality - ECB ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch (Runes for , , ) Phase 1 P1 Start → → → (or + ) → → → → to pad → back → → → → → → → → (last tick of DS) → → Improvise Note 1: Depending on procs from the first , you can replace the first with an ECB spec and use to Note 2: Depending on HP at the end of , you can use a mixture of good thresholds and basics to build up to 100% for the next at ~57s, whilst placing the dummy . Video examples of how to place the dummy can be found in #solak-mechanics This uses . When clearing roots you can use those to build to 100%, kill at least 1 with mines and 1 (2 if you have time with a good P1) with abilities, before moving on to arms. Solak's Arms Pre-ECB + → → → if needed, finish with / Note: The DPS uses Rubies for and . If you get a Ruby proc early into , immediately switch to Solak's Legs (with dummy ) ⬥ Option 1: → → ⬥ Option 2: → → → Core ECB + → → + → (last tick of DS) → Improvise Note: Depending on the player's adren after ends, you can use or good thresholds like Phase 2 Overview This phase is split into two sections, the first is dealing with Eruptions and the blight storm in the centre of the arena, and the second is lowering the secondary blight bar underneath Solak's HP bar. ⬥ Eruptions can be killed in a combination of 4 different ways, duo or solo, and 3-hit or 2-hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Eruptions can be killed together or seperately, requiring slightly different rotations and less co-ordination if done solo. ⬥ Once eruptions are killed, it is assumed that cleansing with Merethiel is done once, before going up to clear the blight storm for the first time. ⬥ Solak does not have enough HP to deplete the blight bar naturally before he reaches his HP cap, however, the blight damage from the ECB special attack drains the secondary blight bar directly. With 1 good use of the ECB spec, the boss can phase during the arm climb attack. Eruptions The DPS on Eruptions goes up twice if not storm tanking, use defensives like to build adrenaline whilst damaging the Blight Storm. After eruptions are dead, target Solak and build adrenaline with abilities like and , co-ordinated with the base. ⬥ South pre-ECB + tc + → → → ‎ ‎ (if needed) ⬥ North → Post-Eruptions Due to the aforementioned improvisational skills, the rotations for P2 post-eruptions are not set in stone, and achieving good damage requires strong ability management. As such, only general outlines will be detailed below, and improvisation rotations continue into P3. ⬥ North Eruption - As you go up for the second time, build on Solak with good basics and continue building with defensives as you damage the Blight Storm, aiming to build to 100% adrenaline as soon as possible ⬥ P2 Death's Swiftness ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The aim of this is to deal good damage, whilst dodging the minefield. The general outline for the is as follows: 1x ECB , 2x SGB (1 last tick of DS), 1-2x Snap , 2x Rapid , 1-2x Dbow ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is similar to the one in P1, however will still be on cooldown from the Core and cannot be used. If adrenaline permits, ECB spec is vital here. ⬥ P2 Post-DS The aim here is to get good ECB damage, immediately after ends trying to end at 100% as the arm slam mechanic happens. As DPS, you will be climbing. The general outline is as follows: 1-2x ECB , 1x Rapid , 1x Snap , strong basics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you deal good damage and Solak is close to HP cap by the climb, build to 100% early and use → → strong basics → to 100% (Or another strong basic if damage is needed) ⬥ P2 Arm Climb As the DPS is the player who climbs, this is a good time to build adrenaline-boosting rotations in preparation for P3. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Incendiary Shot as the player jumps off the arm, the 2nd ability after climbing. This allows the buff to be stalled into the start of P3 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If using at the end of P2, you can build back to 100% with defensives after the . Use → → . The Divert will ensure you reach 100% with Solak's large melee hit. Phase 3 This phase is also split into two parts, the P3 damage phase, and killing Erethdor in the mind realm. If following the rotations, Solak should be around ~600k HP as he moves towards the second pad. P3 Rotation ⬥ Depending on whether a damaging ability or were used at the end of P2, use the opposite to hit 100% for Death's Swiftness . ⬥ The P3 is similar to P1 and P2, with much greater use of thresholds and due to the greatly increased adrenaline gain from the buff. The general outlines are as follows: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1x ECB , 2x SGB (1 last tick of DS), 1-2x Snap , 2x Rapid , 1-3x Dbow ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Save 1 stun ( / ) for the 2nd pad. ⬥ After DS ends, 1-2 ECB specs will be required to finish the remaining HP. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Co-ordinate with the base as to who uses Fragmentation Shot as he moves. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Aim to enter the mind realm with above ~30% adrenaline, if necessary, use to get off thresholds. Erethdor Ecb EoF Rotation → → → → → Note: can replace if co-ordinated with base. Try to use as early as possible to build adrenaline. Phase 4 Overview Phase 4 rotations assume that the player is intending to kill Solak without entering the realm, known as "no realm". Depending on what HP Solak ends P3 on, the rotations vary slightly. ⬥ To potentially save kills that are extremely close, use the prayer for a last-ditch attempt. ⬥ If teammates are missing, a realming guide can be found in #solak-mechanics , as an attempt to salvage the kills. ⬥ With or without the use of a dummy as you exit the mind, build to 100% adrenaline and immediately use Death's Swiftness P4 Rotation + → Build ( → → → ) → → → → → (cancel Rapid early if good adren) → → Video Examples https://youtu.be/c0-Lz2Vzgv4 - Storm tank by #Nouzar https://youtu.be/q7RcxcQEhUE - Non storm tank by #Nouzar

The general outline is as follows: 1-2x ECB , 1x Rapid , 1x Snap , strong basics ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you deal good damage and Solak is close to HP cap by the climb, build to 100% early and use → → strong basics → to 100% (Or another strong basic if damage is needed) ⬥ P2 Arm Climb As the DPS is the player who climbs, this is a good time to build adrenaline-boosting rotations in preparation for P3. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Incendiary Shot as the player jumps off the arm, the 2nd ability after climbing. This allows the buff to be stalled into the start of P3 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If using at the end of P2, you can build back to 100% with defensives after the . Use → → . The Divert will ensure you reach 100% with Solak's large melee hit.
docs.title: Phase 2

docs.text: This phase is also split into two parts, the P3 damage phase, and killing Erethdor in the mind realm. If following the rotations, Solak should be around ~600k HP as he moves towards the second pad. P3 Rotation ⬥ Depending on whether a damaging ability or were used at the end of P2, use the opposite to hit 100% for Death's Swiftness . ⬥ The P3 is similar to P1 and P2, with much greater use of thresholds and due to the greatly increased adrenaline gain from the buff. The general outlines are as follows: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 1x ECB , 2x SGB (1 last tick of DS), 1-2x Snap , 2x Rapid , 1-3x Dbow ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Save 1 stun ( / ) for the 2nd pad. ⬥ After DS ends, 1-2 ECB specs will be required to finish the remaining HP. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Co-ordinate with the base as to who uses Fragmentation Shot as he moves. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Aim to enter the mind realm with above ~30% adrenaline, if necessary, use to get off thresholds.
docs.title: Phase 3

docs.text: Ecb EoF Rotation → → → → → Note: can replace if co-ordinated with base. Try to use as early as possible to build adrenaline.
docs.title: Erethdor

docs.text: Overview Phase 4 rotations assume that the player is intending to kill Solak without entering the realm, known as "no realm". Depending on what HP Solak ends P3 on, the rotations vary slightly. ⬥ To potentially save kills that are extremely close, use the prayer for a last-ditch attempt. ⬥ If teammates are missing, a realming guide can be found in #solak-mechanics , as an attempt to salvage the kills. ⬥ With or without the use of a dummy as you exit the mind, build to 100% adrenaline and immediately use Death's Swiftness P4 Rotation + → Build ( → → → ) → → → → → (cancel Rapid early if good adren) → →
docs.title: Phase 4

docs.title: Video Examples

docs.text: Telos 0 999 magic Telos (Courtesy of #Inflem, #Aiex, and #Wh) Introduction Telos, the Warden is the true guardian of the Heart of Gielinor. Telos is a solo boss that can only be fought after obtaining the four parts of an Ancient Sigil from the four other bosses in the Heart requiring 80 in Attack, Prayer, Magic, and Ranged. Telos is regarded as the most profitable boss currently once a player is able to consistently kill and streak high enrages. Telos drops t92 two-hand weapons consisting of the Staff of Sliske , Zaros Godsword , and Seren Godbow . Telos has a unique looting mechanic where players can choose to risk the drops from a kill for increased chance of better loot at the cost of a more difficult fight known as streaking. Each kill players choose to forgo claiming the loot increases enrage between 5-20%. As enrage increases, mechanics are added to the fight as well as every mistake being much more punishing. A successful kill at 500% enrage unlocks the green Warden title, a successful kill at 2000% enrage unlocks the silver Warden title, and enrage is capped at 4000% where a successful kill will unlock the golden Warden title. On phases 1 and 2, Telos will attack with melee unless players are out of range. When out of range, Telos will shoot off a magic attack and move into melee distance again. Phase 3 is only magic auto attacks. On phase 4, the only difference with autos from phases 1 and 2 is when players are out of range, Telos will continue to use magic autos rather than move into melee range. ‎Phase 5, Telos will only use magic auto attacks. Presets Beginner Telos ⬥ Weapon Poison +++ (1 dose) ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves ⬥ Arcane Spirit Shield ⬥ Dreadnips ⬥ Guthix Staff - for its special attack Advanced Telos ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ Essence of Finality - Statius Warhammer ⬥ Kalphite Rebounder ⬥ Seren Godbow - used with Ingenuity of the Humans ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ Superior Zuriel's legs Turtling 4 Clear Headed 4 Runes for (BP ) Enrage Mechanics Telos gains mechanics as the enrage increases ⬥ 50% : Virus is added on P2 and P3 ⬥ 100% : Phase 5 ⬥ 150% : Telos will freedom stuns and binds with a 50 tick cooldown ⬥ 200% : Telos HP caps at 600,000 on P1-4 ⬥ 250% : Telos will freedom stuns and binds with a 31 tick cooldown, and P5 will be stun-immunes after freedom for 10 ticks ⬥ 300% : Telos HP caps at 200,000 on P5 ⬥ 500% : P4 font HP caps at 10,000 ⬥ 1000% : P4 a rock will fall, P5 multiple rocks will fall, immortality no longer works P5, and Telos will freedom stuns and binds with a 16 tick cooldown Telos Phasing Diagram Note: No Spec translates to 7 auto attacks → Pause → 3 auto attacks → Spec. Target Cycling at Telos Target cycling can be used to tag earlier on phase 1 and phase 5. Phase 5 is simple - just target cycle as soon as you see Telos' head pop up, or as soon as you see the yellow dot on the minimap. Your target range must be set to max for this to work. For phase 1, you need to trigger GCD (using Devotion ) wait 2 ticks then Surge in (off gcd) and sun on the next tick. Wait 3 ticks then target cycle + abil. Be aware that if your first abil splashes, it can cause Telos' first auto to hit 2 ticks earlier. https://youtu.be/h1v5kS9I50w Phase 1 Attack Rotation 7 Autos → Tendrils → 3 Autos → Uppercut → 3 Autos → Hold Still → 3 Autos → Repeat from tendrils until phased Mechanics ⬥ On P1, a green beam will spawn on Telos and then stay for 20 ticks. If stood in the beam the player will gain 10% adrenaline per tick, and their prayer points will be drained slightly, scaling with enrage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• While Telos stands in the beam, his attack speed will increase from four ticks per attack to three ticks per attack and his special bar will fill. If his special bar fills on P1, Telos will fire off a So Much Power in place of his next special. ⬥ The Tendrils special will require you to deal 3,000 + 10 × Enrage damage, and Telos will also heal himself while channeling this special. Telos also drains your adrenaline while channeling this spec so it's important to clear it quickly. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You should aim to use a high damage ability like Dragonbreath , Wild Magic or Guthix staff spec to cancel this. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As enrage goes up it becomes increasingly important to stack damage properly, so it's recommended to use Ice Barrage + Detonate ‎ ‎ + Wrack as these will all hit on the same tick. Telos tendriling a player ⬥ Surge , Escape , or Bladed Dive away from the Uppercut 1t after the dialogue window disappears. The timing of avoiding this attack will come with practice. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players must be at least three squares away from their original position to not get hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players can also Resonance or Disruption Shield to negate the typeless damage, but this is not recommended because these are better used on other specials. Telos uppercutting a player ⬥ Use Freedom or Anticipate ‎ ‎before Hold Still to avoid the stun, equip wand and shield, and Resonance ‎ ‎the big melee hit, but be careful not to resonance the attack that comes right before the actual damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Devotion and Deflect Melee is another way to avoid the damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move three squares away to avoid the stomp afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you forget to Freedom / Anticipate , you can manually click your shield in your inventory and spam Resonance to negate the stomp hit. Hold Still, Invader. ⬥ Continue to DPS and deal with mechanics until phase HP. In general you want to be phasing either immediately after the first Tendrils, or even before. This will depend on enrage, gear and skill though. Phase 1 Rotations (250%-999%) Faster Rotation (can skip Deep Impact) (Courtesy of #senie) → → → → → → → (3-hit) → → → ‎ ‎ (3t) → ‎ ‎→ (if high hp → ‎ ‎→ ) More Consistent Rotation (Courtesy of #Wh) → → → → → (3-hit) → → → → → → ‎ ‎ → (3t) → → ⬥ Notes: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is worth noting that a more consistent P1 will lead to a more consistent P2, which is very helpful, especially while learning. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If your mainhand melee weapon used to Statius Warhammer spec is fastest or fast speed, make sure your 2nd auto with freedom is not too early or your ice won't go off. In order to do this, just cancel your freedom after the first auto by clicking something in inventory (e.g. EoF or Ring of Vigour ), or just walk instead. Old Rotations https://i.imgur.com/v7ncL5c.png Phase 2 Attack Rotation The first spec will depend on what spec was last used on P1, and how soon it happens depends on how many autos are left (max of three). Refer to spec order image. Assuming phase after tendrils and before uppercut. (3-auto attacks after last spec on P1) auto attacks → Magic Onslaught → 3 Autos → Hold Still → 3 Autos → Virus (if 50%+ enrage; uppercut if <50%) → 3 Autos → Uppercut → 3 Autos → Tendrils → 3 Autos → Repeat from Magic Onslaught until phase hp Mechanics ⬥ On P2 a black beam spawns on Telos and stays for 33 ticks. While players stand in the beam, they take and deal 30% reduced damage. While Telos stands in the beam, his special bar will fill and he will take 20% less damage. ⬥ Telos will fire off Magic Onslaught hits until his bar is empty. He cannot be moved during this, so if he is standing in the beam, players must block the beam to negate the bar filling. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Devotion and Deflect Mage the orange/red attacks if his bar was relatively full before the attack started. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Other damage reducing abilities, such as Debilitate and Reflect ), will also reduce the damage taken. ⬥ The virus damage is negligible at low enrages, but it can really cut into your food if not dealt with quickly at higher enrages so you should aim to clear this as quickly as possible. ⬥ Deal with the other mechanics the same as you would on P1 and DPS until phase HP. Ideally you phase before the virus even comes out, but this is heavily influenced by your P1 rotation. It's important not to end the phase with Tendrils as the previous spec unless you are confident dealing with Hold Still as the first spec on P3. Phase 2 Rotations (250%-999%) Recommended Rotation → (2H) → → + Run to Corner → (2H) (4 hit) → + → → → (4t) → → (2H) → → → → → → ( (2 hit) → → Stall ) or ( ) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zwQ9ffK6was Phase 3 Attack Rotation Same situation where the first spec depends on last spec from P2; however, there will always be seven auto attacks first. Refer to diagram. Assuming phase after virus and before uppercut. 7 Autos → Uppercut → 3 Autos → Hold Still → 3 Autos → Virus (if 50%+ enrage; skips this spec if <50%) → 3 Autos → Repeat from Uppercut until phase hp Mechanics ⬥ On P3, a red beam will spawn at a random location, lasting for 33 ticks. While players are standing in the beam, they will take and deal 30% increased damage. While Telos is in the beam, he will deal 30% increased damage. ⬥ Telos can apply a Red Virus on this phase. ⬥ Telos’s special bar is replaced by a balancing bar. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When the bar is in the red on the left, Telos will siphon player’s prayer and adrenaline. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When the bar is in the red on the right, Telos will send out a shockwave dealing typeless damage. ⬥ Telos’ bar charges to the right when he is standing in the beam or golems are alive. Telos' bar naturally moves to the left otherwise. A mini-golem ⬥ When the balance is in the red on the right, Telos will emit one shockwave along with Uppercut and Hold Still. Depending on how far the bar is to the right, Telos will emit up to three shockwaves with the virus. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The shockwave can easily nuke players at higher enrages. Reflect , Debilitate , or even Barricade can be used to survive being nuked. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• On the other end, at 3500%+ enrage, player’s will be smited if Telos is not allowed to step into the beam for a tick. ⬥ When starting out, players can escape into the corner to ensure Telos does not have a beam spawn on him. Once comfortable, it is better to not move from drop down to get into the beam as fast as possible. Once the beam spawns, Bladed Dive into it to decrease the likelihood Telos walk over you into the beam. ⬥ The worst case scenario is ending P2 on Tendrils because the first spec on P3 will be Hold Still, so Onslaught cannot be fully used to dump DPS and the phase can take longer than needed. If this happens, it is often better to just dump thresholds in the beam dealing with mechanics as they come and killing golems if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can also use Limitless if necessary. Phase 3 Rotations (250%-999%) Recommended Rotation → → → → + → → ‎ ‎→ (3t) ‎ ‎→ + Old Rotations https://i.imgur.com/fKsuypa.png Phase 4 Attack Rotation Again, first spec depends on last spec from P3. Refer to diagram. Assuming last spec on P3 was Uppercut. 3 Autos → Uppercut → 3 Autos → Weak Anima Bomb → 3 Autos → Hold Still → Repeat until Telos reaches 0 hp Mechanics ⬥ The one new special is the Weak Anima Bomb which can be dealt with using Debilitate on Telos or Resonance if phasing into a font before Hold Still. ⬥ No beams spawn on P4; however, there are three fonts which must be filled and used to negate the instakill attack. The Pure font (next to where you drop down) becomes active when Telos is at ¾ hp, Volcanic at ½ hp, and Corrupt at ¼ hp, moving clockwise around the arena. ⬥ Telos’s number of auto attacks between specs carries over from font to font, so if Telos was one auto attack from firing off a Weak Anima Bomb before the font became active, there will only be one attack before the weak anima bomb after the instakill. There is a slight caveat with phasing on Hold Still that will be discussed later. ⬥ When these fonts become active, Telos is immune to damage and one of each type of golem spawns. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Pure golems (green) deal increased damage the longer they are alive. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Volcanic golems (red) will occasionally stun and bind players for five ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The priority is to always kill or inmobilize the red golem(s) as quickly as possible to avoid stuns. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Corrupt golems (black) reduce player’s defensive rating by 1% for each stack up to 100 stacks. ⬥ Players must stand in each font to charge it. Players will take five hits of typeless damage which can be reduced with Reflect except for the last hit which can only be negated with Barricade ⬥ After using the font to negate the instakill, player’s defensives will be reset and put on a 10 tick cooldown. ⬥ Barring taking an eternity to get into the first and third fonts, most players will receive a So Much Power in place of the next spec after the second font. ⬥ The best way to deal with SMP is to just Resonance or Disruption Shield the hit as this completely negates the hit while preserving adrenaline. SMP behaves much like Hold Still in the sense that an auto attack comes before the actual big damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Be sure to Resonance the SMP not the auto attack. ⬥ When trying to Resonance SMP with golems still alive, Surge away so their hits don't snipe Resonance, or Devotion + Deflect Melee → Resonance the SMP. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• At lower enrages a Spirit shield can be used to reduce the hit from SMP to a survivable number. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If phasing into the font with one or zero autos before the next spec, Telos will have to be stun-locked to allow for defensives to come off cooldown to deal with SMP. ⬥ Continue to DPS and deal with mechanics until Telos’s HP hits 0. If <100% enrage, congratulations on loot. Phase 4 Rotations (250%-999%) Objective ⬥ Goal with P4 is to minimise the number of specs (and hence autos aswell) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is done by using Ice Barrage as each font ends in order to break Telos' freedom and allow effective stunlocking immediately - meaning ideally no autos between each font. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If executed properly you won't get any specs this phase - if you do, use where convenient. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Always use AoE abilties on golems for adrenaline between fonts excluding for the Third Font. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• First and Third font are assumed you use 2H for all abilities used on Telos. On Drop Down Note: Slightly dependent on how much adren you have left over from P3. This is the best time to use your adren pot unless already high adren. ⬥ Assuming 0% start: (dw) → → (3 hit) → → ( ) or ( → ) ⬥ If Telos' freedom is up: (dw) → → → (3 hit) → → First Font Note: When Telos reaches phase HP he'll activate the font and walk over to it. This will cause you to lose your target so (unless you tag a minion) you can use defensive thresholds for free. ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → → (2-3 hit) → Second Font Note: Can optionally stall for here or just run straight in. ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → (2-3 hit) → + → Third Font Note: Method will cost you ~5 seconds but is safer, ignore tagging golems, instead tag telos while using defensives. Note: Ideally you use right before Telos phases to P5. ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → → (2-3 hit) → → Phase 5 Attack Rotation Phase 5 is independent of how Phase 4 ends, unlike all other phases. It will always follow this rotation. Phase 5 only occurs at 100+ enrage. Golem Spawn → 10 Autos → Virus → 17 Autos → Instant-Kill Bomb → 2 Autos → Repeat from beginning until dead Mechanics ⬥ At the start Telos will spawn a particular set of six golems (Pure, Corrupt, or Volcanic). ⬥ On P5 <1000% enrage, a single rock will fall at certain times during the phase. 1000%+ enrage up to five rocks will fall. ⬥ All three colored beams will spawn on Telos having the same effects from earlier phases. ⬥ Fonting is the process of killing the golems at their corresponding font to be used during the insta-kill bomb. ⬥ <1000% enrage just wipe the golems out because Immortality can still be used to negate the insta-kill Bomb. ⬥ A simple Tsunami inside Sunshine is enough to wipe golems up to ~350% enrage with some basics to kill any stray golems. ⬥ After ~350% a Deto + Tsunami will be needed to kill the golems. ⬥ After 1000% golems will have to be fonted if not comfortable zero-fonting. Whittle down the golems with AoEs before clearing the virus and killing them at the font. ⬥ The virus will be a random color. Surge /bladed dive to the beam to cleanse the virus, head back to Sunshine and the green beam as fast as possible. A player with Green Virus, exclusive to Phase 5 ⬥ If not fonting wait for the next rock to fall, onslaught until either Telos dies or the next rock falls. ⬥ <1000% Immortality to negate the Insta-Kill Bomb Telos charging his attack ⬥ 1000%+ activate the font and get back onto Telos. ⬥ Continue to DPS Telos until he dies. Finally, congratulations on loot. Tips and Tricks ⬥ To properly tag P5 on the first tick, watch the pure font on the left side, when it does this animation https://i.imgur.com/H3CceEu.gif , press target cycle. If using a Vulnerability Bomb you must throw it one tick after target cycling. ⬥ Telos auto-attacks can hit surprisingly hard, so make sure you use Deflect Magic at the start of the phase. Use Deflect Melee whenever Telos is stunlocked, while minions are alive. Ideally, you should prayer flick between both deflects. ⬥ Dreadnips are helpful for complete learners. They have a chance of stunning Telos and consequently triggering his freedom timer - especially helpful during P5 start and your Onslaught . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These will be ditched as you become more experienced however. ⬥ Telos' Freedom is triggered on a set timer, starting from the beginning of P5, as long as you stun or bind him at any point between his freedoms. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This means that with a 20-second freedom (on 250-999%), and Asphyxiate having a cooldown of 20 seconds, your Asphyxiate + Deep Impact combo will always stunlock Telos if used properly. Take advantage of this! ⬥ In the event that you get an instant kill, use Immortality + Sunshine and Vulnerability Bomb ‎ ‎ . Rotate defensives such as Reflect / Debilitate / Devotion / Barricade while finishing Telos. Using Revenge is recommended. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Anticipation and Freedom if you get Volcanics. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The general idea behind this is to maximize damage output on Telos while having defensives up to tank minions. ⬥ Minion luring is important for side beams, simply standing 1 out of MD will generally lure the golems properly. For back beams, you want to stand 1 out of MD, then move 2 squares back to lure the golems. Here is an image detailing the lure: Enrage Checkpoints ⬥ 100-149% : and under Sunshine will kill all of the minions. Telos cannot use Freedom at this enrage - with stuns and a Sunshine rotation, you should be able to kill him before virus. ⬥ 150-249% : under Sunshine will kill all of the minions. Telos will start using Freedom every 30 seconds, however there is no immunity period after using it. You can either tank the virus with Revenge / Reprisal or clear it. This is easily 0 fontable. ⬥ 250-349% : Tsunami under Sunshine will generally kill all of the minions, but you may need to start using and to clear out remainders. Telos will also start using Freedom every 20 seconds, with a 6 second immunity period, and will remain that way all the way to 999%. You should start to learn to clear the virus efficiently - use Debilitate on the virus for safety. ⬥ 350-999% : Detonate + Tsunami under Sunshine will kill all or most of the minions. Using a Kalphite Rebounder and Revenge may be useful for dealing with the minions, especially if you have Ruthless on your defender. At this point, you can Debilitate the virus if it comes out, or Barricade if low on food, though neither is strictly necessary. DPS and stunning becomes increasingly important in order to get a 0 font. Phase 5 Rotations (250%-999%) Note: Autos are intentionally omitted for the sake of stunlocking Left Beam (TC) → → → → + (3-hit) → + → golems + Telos → → → → → (TC) / → → → (3 hit) → → → spam → / depending on HP and food left. How to get into the beam properly: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MIsCETA4L_0&feature=youtu.be Right Beam (TC) → → + to beam → → → + (3 hit) → + → golems + Telos → → → → → (TC) / → → → (3 hit) → → → spam → / depending on HP and food left. How to get into the beam properly: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZvAYvTXYqGA&feature=youtu.be Back Beam (TC) → → → golem + Telos → → (4 squares from Telos and run back to the edge) → → + + → (2 hit) → → + (Run 4 squares back from Telos) → → → (TC) / → → → → → → → to clear virus → How to get into the beam properly: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qFaWBZbgdTA&feature=youtu.be Footnotes ⬥ Side Beams You can use Omnipower before Impact is good if you're confident you won't get Virus. Guthix Staff is otherwise better due to keeping adrenaline for Barricade and Reflect Rockfall can be dodged allowing you to skip Reflect , can still use it for increased safety. Optionally skip Reflect , or Revenge before Reflect in order to gain more stacks for Detonate If you get volcanics, Anticipate after Guthix Staff . ⬥ Back Beam If you get volcanics, Anticipate after Revenge . With bad RNG, or being slow to beam you will have to Anticipate right before Revenge if you're getting hit on the way there. Rotation Cheat Sheet Phase 1 → → → → → (3-hit) → → → → → → ‎ ‎ → (3t) → → Phase 2 → (2H) → → + Run to Corner → (2H) (4 hit) → + → → → (4t) → → (2H) → → → → → → ( (2 hit) → → Stall ) or ( ) Phase 3 → → → → + → → ‎ ‎→ (3t) ‎ ‎→ + Phase 4 ⬥ Assuming 0% start: (dw) → → (3 hit) → → ( ) or ( → ) ⬥ If Telos' freedom is up: (dw) → → → (3 hit) → → First Font ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → → (2-3 hit) → Second Font ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → (2-3 hit) → + → Third Font ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → → (2-3 hit) → → Phase 5 ⬥ Left Beam (TC) → → → → + (3-hit) → + → golems + Telos → → → → → (TC) / → → → (3 hit) → → → spam → / depending on HP and food left. ⬥ Right Beam (TC) → → + to beam → → → + (3 hit) → + → golems + Telos → → → → → (TC) / → → → (3 hit) → → → spam → / depending on HP and food left. ⬥ Back Beam (TC) → → → golem + Telos → → (4 squares from Telos and run back to the edge) → → + + → (2 hit) → → + (Run 4 squares back from Telos) → → → (TC) / → → → → → → → to clear virus →

docs.title: Presets

docs.text: Telos gains mechanics as the enrage increases ⬥ 50% : Virus is added on P2 and P3 ⬥ 100% : Phase 5 ⬥ 150% : Telos will freedom stuns and binds with a 50 tick cooldown ⬥ 200% : Telos HP caps at 600,000 on P1-4 ⬥ 250% : Telos will freedom stuns and binds with a 31 tick cooldown, and P5 will be stun-immunes after freedom for 10 ticks ⬥ 300% : Telos HP caps at 200,000 on P5 ⬥ 500% : P4 font HP caps at 10,000 ⬥ 1000% : P4 a rock will fall, P5 multiple rocks will fall, immortality no longer works P5, and Telos will freedom stuns and binds with a 16 tick cooldown
docs.title: Enrage Mechanics

docs.text: Note: No Spec translates to 7 auto attacks → Pause → 3 auto attacks → Spec.
docs.title: Telos Phasing Diagram

docs.text: Target cycling can be used to tag earlier on phase 1 and phase 5. Phase 5 is simple - just target cycle as soon as you see Telos' head pop up, or as soon as you see the yellow dot on the minimap. Your target range must be set to max for this to work. For phase 1, you need to trigger GCD (using Devotion ) wait 2 ticks then Surge in (off gcd) and sun on the next tick. Wait 3 ticks then target cycle + abil. Be aware that if your first abil splashes, it can cause Telos' first auto to hit 2 ticks earlier. https://youtu.be/h1v5kS9I50w
docs.title: Target Cycling at Telos

docs.text: Attack Rotation 7 Autos → Tendrils → 3 Autos → Uppercut → 3 Autos → Hold Still → 3 Autos → Repeat from tendrils until phased Mechanics ⬥ On P1, a green beam will spawn on Telos and then stay for 20 ticks. If stood in the beam the player will gain 10% adrenaline per tick, and their prayer points will be drained slightly, scaling with enrage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• While Telos stands in the beam, his attack speed will increase from four ticks per attack to three ticks per attack and his special bar will fill. If his special bar fills on P1, Telos will fire off a So Much Power in place of his next special. ⬥ The Tendrils special will require you to deal 3,000 + 10 × Enrage damage, and Telos will also heal himself while channeling this special. Telos also drains your adrenaline while channeling this spec so it's important to clear it quickly. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You should aim to use a high damage ability like Dragonbreath , Wild Magic or Guthix staff spec to cancel this. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• As enrage goes up it becomes increasingly important to stack damage properly, so it's recommended to use Ice Barrage + Detonate ‎ ‎ + Wrack as these will all hit on the same tick. Telos tendriling a player ⬥ Surge , Escape , or Bladed Dive away from the Uppercut 1t after the dialogue window disappears. The timing of avoiding this attack will come with practice. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players must be at least three squares away from their original position to not get hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players can also Resonance or Disruption Shield to negate the typeless damage, but this is not recommended because these are better used on other specials. Telos uppercutting a player ⬥ Use Freedom or Anticipate ‎ ‎before Hold Still to avoid the stun, equip wand and shield, and Resonance ‎ ‎the big melee hit, but be careful not to resonance the attack that comes right before the actual damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Devotion and Deflect Melee is another way to avoid the damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Move three squares away to avoid the stomp afterwards. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If you forget to Freedom / Anticipate , you can manually click your shield in your inventory and spam Resonance to negate the stomp hit. Hold Still, Invader. ⬥ Continue to DPS and deal with mechanics until phase HP. In general you want to be phasing either immediately after the first Tendrils, or even before. This will depend on enrage, gear and skill though.
docs.title: Phase 1

docs.text: Faster Rotation (can skip Deep Impact) (Courtesy of #senie) → → → → → → → (3-hit) → → → ‎ ‎ (3t) → ‎ ‎→ (if high hp → ‎ ‎→ ) More Consistent Rotation (Courtesy of #Wh) → → → → → (3-hit) → → → → → → ‎ ‎ → (3t) → → ⬥ Notes: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is worth noting that a more consistent P1 will lead to a more consistent P2, which is very helpful, especially while learning. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If your mainhand melee weapon used to Statius Warhammer spec is fastest or fast speed, make sure your 2nd auto with freedom is not too early or your ice won't go off. In order to do this, just cancel your freedom after the first auto by clicking something in inventory (e.g. EoF or Ring of Vigour ), or just walk instead. Old Rotations https://i.imgur.com/v7ncL5c.png
docs.title: Phase 1 Rotations (250%-999%)

docs.text: Attack Rotation The first spec will depend on what spec was last used on P1, and how soon it happens depends on how many autos are left (max of three). Refer to spec order image. Assuming phase after tendrils and before uppercut. (3-auto attacks after last spec on P1) auto attacks → Magic Onslaught → 3 Autos → Hold Still → 3 Autos → Virus (if 50%+ enrage; uppercut if <50%) → 3 Autos → Uppercut → 3 Autos → Tendrils → 3 Autos → Repeat from Magic Onslaught until phase hp Mechanics ⬥ On P2 a black beam spawns on Telos and stays for 33 ticks. While players stand in the beam, they take and deal 30% reduced damage. While Telos stands in the beam, his special bar will fill and he will take 20% less damage. ⬥ Telos will fire off Magic Onslaught hits until his bar is empty. He cannot be moved during this, so if he is standing in the beam, players must block the beam to negate the bar filling. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Devotion and Deflect Mage the orange/red attacks if his bar was relatively full before the attack started. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Other damage reducing abilities, such as Debilitate and Reflect ), will also reduce the damage taken. ⬥ The virus damage is negligible at low enrages, but it can really cut into your food if not dealt with quickly at higher enrages so you should aim to clear this as quickly as possible. ⬥ Deal with the other mechanics the same as you would on P1 and DPS until phase HP. Ideally you phase before the virus even comes out, but this is heavily influenced by your P1 rotation. It's important not to end the phase with Tendrils as the previous spec unless you are confident dealing with Hold Still as the first spec on P3.
docs.title: Phase 2

docs.text: Recommended Rotation → (2H) → → + Run to Corner → (2H) (4 hit) → + → → → (4t) → → (2H) → → → → → → ( (2 hit) → → Stall ) or ( ) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zwQ9ffK6was
docs.title: Phase 2 Rotations (250%-999%)

docs.text: Attack Rotation Same situation where the first spec depends on last spec from P2; however, there will always be seven auto attacks first. Refer to diagram. Assuming phase after virus and before uppercut. 7 Autos → Uppercut → 3 Autos → Hold Still → 3 Autos → Virus (if 50%+ enrage; skips this spec if <50%) → 3 Autos → Repeat from Uppercut until phase hp Mechanics ⬥ On P3, a red beam will spawn at a random location, lasting for 33 ticks. While players are standing in the beam, they will take and deal 30% increased damage. While Telos is in the beam, he will deal 30% increased damage. ⬥ Telos can apply a Red Virus on this phase. ⬥ Telos’s special bar is replaced by a balancing bar. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When the bar is in the red on the left, Telos will siphon player’s prayer and adrenaline. ‎‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When the bar is in the red on the right, Telos will send out a shockwave dealing typeless damage. ⬥ Telos’ bar charges to the right when he is standing in the beam or golems are alive. Telos' bar naturally moves to the left otherwise. A mini-golem ⬥ When the balance is in the red on the right, Telos will emit one shockwave along with Uppercut and Hold Still. Depending on how far the bar is to the right, Telos will emit up to three shockwaves with the virus. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The shockwave can easily nuke players at higher enrages. Reflect , Debilitate , or even Barricade can be used to survive being nuked. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• On the other end, at 3500%+ enrage, player’s will be smited if Telos is not allowed to step into the beam for a tick. ⬥ When starting out, players can escape into the corner to ensure Telos does not have a beam spawn on him. Once comfortable, it is better to not move from drop down to get into the beam as fast as possible. Once the beam spawns, Bladed Dive into it to decrease the likelihood Telos walk over you into the beam. ⬥ The worst case scenario is ending P2 on Tendrils because the first spec on P3 will be Hold Still, so Onslaught cannot be fully used to dump DPS and the phase can take longer than needed. If this happens, it is often better to just dump thresholds in the beam dealing with mechanics as they come and killing golems if needed. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You can also use Limitless if necessary.
docs.title: Phase 3

docs.text: Recommended Rotation → → → → + → → ‎ ‎→ (3t) ‎ ‎→ + Old Rotations https://i.imgur.com/fKsuypa.png
docs.title: Phase 3 Rotations (250%-999%)

docs.text: Attack Rotation Again, first spec depends on last spec from P3. Refer to diagram. Assuming last spec on P3 was Uppercut. 3 Autos → Uppercut → 3 Autos → Weak Anima Bomb → 3 Autos → Hold Still → Repeat until Telos reaches 0 hp Mechanics ⬥ The one new special is the Weak Anima Bomb which can be dealt with using Debilitate on Telos or Resonance if phasing into a font before Hold Still. ⬥ No beams spawn on P4; however, there are three fonts which must be filled and used to negate the instakill attack. The Pure font (next to where you drop down) becomes active when Telos is at ¾ hp, Volcanic at ½ hp, and Corrupt at ¼ hp, moving clockwise around the arena. ⬥ Telos’s number of auto attacks between specs carries over from font to font, so if Telos was one auto attack from firing off a Weak Anima Bomb before the font became active, there will only be one attack before the weak anima bomb after the instakill. There is a slight caveat with phasing on Hold Still that will be discussed later. ⬥ When these fonts become active, Telos is immune to damage and one of each type of golem spawns. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Pure golems (green) deal increased damage the longer they are alive. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Volcanic golems (red) will occasionally stun and bind players for five ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The priority is to always kill or inmobilize the red golem(s) as quickly as possible to avoid stuns. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Corrupt golems (black) reduce player’s defensive rating by 1% for each stack up to 100 stacks. ⬥ Players must stand in each font to charge it. Players will take five hits of typeless damage which can be reduced with Reflect except for the last hit which can only be negated with Barricade ⬥ After using the font to negate the instakill, player’s defensives will be reset and put on a 10 tick cooldown. ⬥ Barring taking an eternity to get into the first and third fonts, most players will receive a So Much Power in place of the next spec after the second font. ⬥ The best way to deal with SMP is to just Resonance or Disruption Shield the hit as this completely negates the hit while preserving adrenaline. SMP behaves much like Hold Still in the sense that an auto attack comes before the actual big damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Be sure to Resonance the SMP not the auto attack. ⬥ When trying to Resonance SMP with golems still alive, Surge away so their hits don't snipe Resonance, or Devotion + Deflect Melee → Resonance the SMP. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• At lower enrages a Spirit shield can be used to reduce the hit from SMP to a survivable number. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If phasing into the font with one or zero autos before the next spec, Telos will have to be stun-locked to allow for defensives to come off cooldown to deal with SMP. ⬥ Continue to DPS and deal with mechanics until Telos’s HP hits 0. If <100% enrage, congratulations on loot.
docs.title: Phase 4

docs.text: Objective ⬥ Goal with P4 is to minimise the number of specs (and hence autos aswell) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This is done by using Ice Barrage as each font ends in order to break Telos' freedom and allow effective stunlocking immediately - meaning ideally no autos between each font. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If executed properly you won't get any specs this phase - if you do, use where convenient. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Always use AoE abilties on golems for adrenaline between fonts excluding for the Third Font. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• First and Third font are assumed you use 2H for all abilities used on Telos. On Drop Down Note: Slightly dependent on how much adren you have left over from P3. This is the best time to use your adren pot unless already high adren. ⬥ Assuming 0% start: (dw) → → (3 hit) → → ( ) or ( → ) ⬥ If Telos' freedom is up: (dw) → → → (3 hit) → → First Font Note: When Telos reaches phase HP he'll activate the font and walk over to it. This will cause you to lose your target so (unless you tag a minion) you can use defensive thresholds for free. ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → → (2-3 hit) → Second Font Note: Can optionally stall for here or just run straight in. ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → (2-3 hit) → + → Third Font Note: Method will cost you ~5 seconds but is safer, ignore tagging golems, instead tag telos while using defensives. Note: Ideally you use right before Telos phases to P5. ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → → (2-3 hit) → →
docs.title: Phase 4 Rotations (250%-999%)

docs.text: Attack Rotation Phase 5 is independent of how Phase 4 ends, unlike all other phases. It will always follow this rotation. Phase 5 only occurs at 100+ enrage. Golem Spawn → 10 Autos → Virus → 17 Autos → Instant-Kill Bomb → 2 Autos → Repeat from beginning until dead Mechanics ⬥ At the start Telos will spawn a particular set of six golems (Pure, Corrupt, or Volcanic). ⬥ On P5 <1000% enrage, a single rock will fall at certain times during the phase. 1000%+ enrage up to five rocks will fall. ⬥ All three colored beams will spawn on Telos having the same effects from earlier phases. ⬥ Fonting is the process of killing the golems at their corresponding font to be used during the insta-kill bomb. ⬥ <1000% enrage just wipe the golems out because Immortality can still be used to negate the insta-kill Bomb. ⬥ A simple Tsunami inside Sunshine is enough to wipe golems up to ~350% enrage with some basics to kill any stray golems. ⬥ After ~350% a Deto + Tsunami will be needed to kill the golems. ⬥ After 1000% golems will have to be fonted if not comfortable zero-fonting. Whittle down the golems with AoEs before clearing the virus and killing them at the font. ⬥ The virus will be a random color. Surge /bladed dive to the beam to cleanse the virus, head back to Sunshine and the green beam as fast as possible. A player with Green Virus, exclusive to Phase 5 ⬥ If not fonting wait for the next rock to fall, onslaught until either Telos dies or the next rock falls. ⬥ <1000% Immortality to negate the Insta-Kill Bomb Telos charging his attack ⬥ 1000%+ activate the font and get back onto Telos. ⬥ Continue to DPS Telos until he dies. Finally, congratulations on loot. Tips and Tricks ⬥ To properly tag P5 on the first tick, watch the pure font on the left side, when it does this animation https://i.imgur.com/H3CceEu.gif , press target cycle. If using a Vulnerability Bomb you must throw it one tick after target cycling. ⬥ Telos auto-attacks can hit surprisingly hard, so make sure you use Deflect Magic at the start of the phase. Use Deflect Melee whenever Telos is stunlocked, while minions are alive. Ideally, you should prayer flick between both deflects. ⬥ Dreadnips are helpful for complete learners. They have a chance of stunning Telos and consequently triggering his freedom timer - especially helpful during P5 start and your Onslaught . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These will be ditched as you become more experienced however. ⬥ Telos' Freedom is triggered on a set timer, starting from the beginning of P5, as long as you stun or bind him at any point between his freedoms. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This means that with a 20-second freedom (on 250-999%), and Asphyxiate having a cooldown of 20 seconds, your Asphyxiate + Deep Impact combo will always stunlock Telos if used properly. Take advantage of this! ⬥ In the event that you get an instant kill, use Immortality + Sunshine and Vulnerability Bomb ‎ ‎ . Rotate defensives such as Reflect / Debilitate / Devotion / Barricade while finishing Telos. Using Revenge is recommended. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use Anticipation and Freedom if you get Volcanics. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The general idea behind this is to maximize damage output on Telos while having defensives up to tank minions. ⬥ Minion luring is important for side beams, simply standing 1 out of MD will generally lure the golems properly. For back beams, you want to stand 1 out of MD, then move 2 squares back to lure the golems. Here is an image detailing the lure: Enrage Checkpoints ⬥ 100-149% : and under Sunshine will kill all of the minions. Telos cannot use Freedom at this enrage - with stuns and a Sunshine rotation, you should be able to kill him before virus. ⬥ 150-249% : under Sunshine will kill all of the minions. Telos will start using Freedom every 30 seconds, however there is no immunity period after using it. You can either tank the virus with Revenge / Reprisal or clear it. This is easily 0 fontable. ⬥ 250-349% : Tsunami under Sunshine will generally kill all of the minions, but you may need to start using and to clear out remainders. Telos will also start using Freedom every 20 seconds, with a 6 second immunity period, and will remain that way all the way to 999%. You should start to learn to clear the virus efficiently - use Debilitate on the virus for safety. ⬥ 350-999% : Detonate + Tsunami under Sunshine will kill all or most of the minions. Using a Kalphite Rebounder and Revenge may be useful for dealing with the minions, especially if you have Ruthless on your defender. At this point, you can Debilitate the virus if it comes out, or Barricade if low on food, though neither is strictly necessary. DPS and stunning becomes increasingly important in order to get a 0 font.
docs.title: Phase 5

docs.text: Note: Autos are intentionally omitted for the sake of stunlocking Left Beam (TC) → → → → + (3-hit) → + → golems + Telos → → → → → (TC) / → → → (3 hit) → → → spam → / depending on HP and food left. How to get into the beam properly: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MIsCETA4L_0&feature=youtu.be Right Beam (TC) → → + to beam → → → + (3 hit) → + → golems + Telos → → → → → (TC) / → → → (3 hit) → → → spam → / depending on HP and food left. How to get into the beam properly: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZvAYvTXYqGA&feature=youtu.be Back Beam (TC) → → → golem + Telos → → (4 squares from Telos and run back to the edge) → → + + → (2 hit) → → + (Run 4 squares back from Telos) → → → (TC) / → → → → → → → to clear virus → How to get into the beam properly: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qFaWBZbgdTA&feature=youtu.be Footnotes ⬥ Side Beams You can use Omnipower before Impact is good if you're confident you won't get Virus. Guthix Staff is otherwise better due to keeping adrenaline for Barricade and Reflect Rockfall can be dodged allowing you to skip Reflect , can still use it for increased safety. Optionally skip Reflect , or Revenge before Reflect in order to gain more stacks for Detonate If you get volcanics, Anticipate after Guthix Staff . ⬥ Back Beam If you get volcanics, Anticipate after Revenge . With bad RNG, or being slow to beam you will have to Anticipate right before Revenge if you're getting hit on the way there.
docs.title: Phase 5 Rotations (250%-999%)

docs.text: Phase 1 → → → → → (3-hit) → → → → → → ‎ ‎ → (3t) → → Phase 2 → (2H) → → + Run to Corner → (2H) (4 hit) → + → → → (4t) → → (2H) → → → → → → ( (2 hit) → → Stall ) or ( ) Phase 3 → → → → + → → ‎ ‎→ (3t) ‎ ‎→ + Phase 4 ⬥ Assuming 0% start: (dw) → → (3 hit) → → ( ) or ( → ) ⬥ If Telos' freedom is up: (dw) → → → (3 hit) → → First Font ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → → (2-3 hit) → Second Font ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → (2-3 hit) → + → Third Font ⬥ Go straight into font, → → (Tag golems) → → → 4t AoE minions until the font fully charges → and step away from golems → target Telos → → (2-3 hit) → → Phase 5 ⬥ Left Beam (TC) → → → → + (3-hit) → + → golems + Telos → → → → → (TC) / → → → (3 hit) → → → spam → / depending on HP and food left. ⬥ Right Beam (TC) → → + to beam → → → + (3 hit) → + → golems + Telos → → → → → (TC) / → → → (3 hit) → → → spam → / depending on HP and food left. ⬥ Back Beam (TC) → → → golem + Telos → → (4 squares from Telos and run back to the edge) → → + + → (2 hit) → → + (Run 4 squares back from Telos) → → → (TC) / → → → → → → → to clear virus →
docs.title: Rotation Cheat Sheet

docs.text: Telos 1k plus magic High Enrage Telos (1k to 4k) Introduction This guide assumes VERY strong understanding of everything found in #telos-0-999-magic and #telos-stun-guide , and also assumes usage of ancients and spellbook swap (mostly for disruption shield). An average kill at 2449% enrage is worth 15,942,553 in uniques alone. This assumes an estimated orb price of 193,723,482. Advanced players can get up to 12 kph, earning 191,310,631/hr. Notable Enrage Checkpoints and Changes Past 999 ⬥ 1000% P4 one rock will fall, P5 multiple rocks will fall, immortality no longer works P5, and Telos will freedom stuns and binds with a 16 tick cooldown ⬥ 2000% "So you think you can guard?" Achievement, aka Silver Warden ⬥ 2700% Tendrils damage required caps at 30,000 ⬥ 3300% The first prayer drain on P3 will smite you from full unless Telos touches the beam. ⬥ 4000% Hard enrage cap; "True Warden" achievement, aka Gold Warden Preset ⬥ Tectonic robe bottom Turtling 4 ‎ ‎ Clear Headed 4 ⬥ Essence of Finality - Seren God Bow ⬥ Essence of Finality - Guthix Staff ⬥ Essence of Finality - Statius Warhammer ⬥ Heightened Senses is required. ⬥ Fury of the Small is required. ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch ⬥ ‎ ‎ Rune Pouch Runes for (BP ) Phase 1 P1 remains mostly unchanged from 999%. The only thing to be aware of as you start to push higher and higher is that tendrils will start to require more and more damage to free yourself from. Note that it is recomended that you bring a dummy inside the instance for Natural Instinct and building to 100% adrenaline again before starting the fight. This means your adrenaline potion won't be on cooldown for Phase 4 start. P1 Walk It's important to make sure you are either south or west of Telos to ensure your deto wm hits are all on the same tick. You do this by checking walk direction with your combust at start, running to the edge of your sun in the opposite direction. Next, run out of your sun immediately after an ability and escape back 2 ticks later. More specifically: ⬥ If West walk, run to the east to drag telos and escape back into your sun. When walking your second combust, click one square under Telos to walk it, then click on Telos again 1t later to stay on his west side. ⬥ If South walk, run to the north west of your Sun and run north before escaping/running back south. Video Examples of West and South Walk P1 (Courtesy of @96129999500738560 ) ⬥ West Walk - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L_hNGDNHdiM ⬥ South Walk - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nDxlekndiaA Rotation ⬥ Pre-Fight auto cast → → → → → (wait 2 ticks) → ⬥ Phase 1 ( if not using ) → → → (2h) → (dw) + → (3t) → auto cast → (3-hit) → → → → ⬥ Depending on HP ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• if alot of damage is needed to put telos to ~480k hp: → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• if only a little damage is needed to put telos to ~480k hp: / → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• if would phase telos to 450k hp: → / ⬥ For Tendril Clear → → (towards jump spot) Phase 2 Again, very little will change during Phase 2. It's important to be aware that due to the shorter freedom CD at 1k+, you will have to stun more in order to prevent specs. After your asphyxiate at the beginning of the phase, you should take a step forward and escape or run back to the corner. Taking a step forward ensures that the black beam spawns mid arena and prevents telos from pre-walking your escape which will help keep telos out of the beam when it changes. As Telos' autos at this enrage start to deal more damage, it becomes heavily encouraged to stay out of melee distance of Telos, as his mage autos do less damage than melee. Using escape prior to detonate will allow you to force force mage autos, while keeping you within familiar range and maximum weapon range. Phase 2 can have a lot of variance depending on hit and vengence RNG. Ideally if less than two venges were needed in P1, you will be able to use 2 venges in P2. This should be done by switching to soul split while under the effects of . It may also be required to use disrupt or switch back to protection prayer after only one vengence hit as well. Rotations ⬥ (dw) → (3-hit) → → → → → → → (3t) → (forces mage autos for the rest of the phase) → ⬥ Depending on Telos' hp, you can continue: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fastest (~310k hp): → excal stall (or if not stalling) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fast: (2h) (2-hit) → → → excal stall (or if not stalling) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Slow: (2h) (2-hit) → → (dw) → (dw for accuracy) → → → . Note: If the phase hp is reached after , replace → with (dw) wait 2 ticks → (2h) (stall) . Doing so leads to a faster P3. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QexFjeAr1ik Phase 3 Rotations ⬥ Without Stalled Combust → → → → (bd to beam) → → → (3t) → (or if telos is low) → (+ drink at hp cap, if not using on p1) ⬥ With Stalled Combust (dw) release → (click Telos for 2h auto) → (dw) → → → → (3t) → (2-4 hit) → ⬥ Notes: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Phase 2 ended quickly after the , skip the in Phase 3 and go into a 4 hit → . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It is important to lure correctly as a good Phase 3 will leave you without to reach the exit tile. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Aim to excal stall at the end of the phase. Doing so will make the fast drop rotation more consistent, and possibly save a GCD. Phase 4 Should aim to minimise number of autos here, similar to #telos-0-999-magic . Phase start varies greatly depending on how much adren you have, but should and aim to at some point before going into the font. For the first font hit you have the choice of using resonance or divert . If you have limited adrenaline divert is generally better because it will allow you reflect the following font hits. You will drop target as telos starts to charge the anima bomb, as you enter the fonts. You should aim to use your defensive thresholds before targeting the golems to help with adrenaline management. Note: First and Third font are assumed you use 2H for all abilities used on Telos. Rotations ⬥ If stalled (dw) release → → → → ⬥ Fast Drop (dw) → → → → ⬥ Safe Drop (dw) → → → → → ⬥ No Auto Drop (dw) → → → (if needed) → → ⬥ First Font (or ) → → target telos + → target golems → → → target telos → ( instead if low adren or doing the stalled / fast drop rotations)→ (2-3 hit) → toward second font → into second font ⬥ Second Font tc golems → → → → → → → target telos → (2-3 hit) → ( if damage is not needed to phase) toward third font → ⬥ Entering Third Font ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Optionally run the golems around the centre before + to enter the 3rd font. docs.text: This guide assumes VERY strong understanding of everything found in #telos-0-999-magic and #telos-stun-guide , and also assumes usage of ancients and spellbook swap (mostly for disruption shield). An average kill at 2449% enrage is worth 15,942,553 in uniques alone. This assumes an estimated orb price of 193,723,482. Advanced players can get up to 12 kph, earning 191,310,631/hr. Notable Enrage Checkpoints and Changes Past 999 ⬥ 1000% P4 one rock will fall, P5 multiple rocks will fall, immortality no longer works P5, and Telos will freedom stuns and binds with a 16 tick cooldown ⬥ 2000% "So you think you can guard?" Achievement, aka Silver Warden ⬥ 2700% Tendrils damage required caps at 30,000 ⬥ 3300% The first prayer drain on P3 will smite you from full unless Telos touches the beam. ⬥ 4000% Hard enrage cap; "True Warden" achievement, aka Gold Warden

docs.text: P1 remains mostly unchanged from 999%. The only thing to be aware of as you start to push higher and higher is that tendrils will start to require more and more damage to free yourself from. Note that it is recomended that you bring a dummy inside the instance for Natural Instinct and building to 100% adrenaline again before starting the fight. This means your adrenaline potion won't be on cooldown for Phase 4 start. P1 Walk It's important to make sure you are either south or west of Telos to ensure your deto wm hits are all on the same tick. You do this by checking walk direction with your combust at start, running to the edge of your sun in the opposite direction. Next, run out of your sun immediately after an ability and escape back 2 ticks later. More specifically: ⬥ If West walk, run to the east to drag telos and escape back into your sun. When walking your second combust, click one square under Telos to walk it, then click on Telos again 1t later to stay on his west side. ⬥ If South walk, run to the north west of your Sun and run north before escaping/running back south. Video Examples of West and South Walk P1 (Courtesy of @96129999500738560 ) ⬥ West Walk - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L_hNGDNHdiM ⬥ South Walk - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nDxlekndiaA Rotation ⬥ Pre-Fight auto cast → → → → → (wait 2 ticks) → ⬥ Phase 1 ( if not using ) → → → (2h) → (dw) + → (3t) → auto cast → (3-hit) → → → → ⬥ Depending on HP ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• if alot of damage is needed to put telos to ~480k hp: → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• if only a little damage is needed to put telos to ~480k hp: / → ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• if would phase telos to 450k hp: → / ⬥ For Tendril Clear → → (towards jump spot)
docs.title: Phase 1

docs.text: Again, very little will change during Phase 2. It's important to be aware that due to the shorter freedom CD at 1k+, you will have to stun more in order to prevent specs. After your asphyxiate at the beginning of the phase, you should take a step forward and escape or run back to the corner. Taking a step forward ensures that the black beam spawns mid arena and prevents telos from pre-walking your escape which will help keep telos out of the beam when it changes. As Telos' autos at this enrage start to deal more damage, it becomes heavily encouraged to stay out of melee distance of Telos, as his mage autos do less damage than melee. Using escape prior to detonate will allow you to force force mage autos, while keeping you within familiar range and maximum weapon range. Phase 2 can have a lot of variance depending on hit and vengence RNG. Ideally if less than two venges were needed in P1, you will be able to use 2 venges in P2. This should be done by switching to soul split while under the effects of . It may also be required to use disrupt or switch back to protection prayer after only one vengence hit as well. Rotations ⬥ (dw) → (3-hit) → → → → → → → (3t) → (forces mage autos for the rest of the phase) → ⬥ Depending on Telos' hp, you can continue: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fastest (~310k hp): → excal stall (or if not stalling) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Fast: (2h) (2-hit) → → → excal stall (or if not stalling) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Slow: (2h) (2-hit) → → (dw) → (dw for accuracy) → → → . Note: If the phase hp is reached after , replace → with (dw) wait 2 ticks → (2h) (stall) . Doing so leads to a faster P3. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QexFjeAr1ik

Doing so will make the fast drop rotation more consistent, and possibly save a GCD.
docs.title: Phase 3

docs.text: Should aim to minimise number of autos here, similar to #telos-0-999-magic . Phase start varies greatly depending on how much adren you have, but should and aim to at some point before going into the font. For the first font hit you have the choice of using resonance or divert . If you have limited adrenaline divert is generally better because it will allow you reflect the following font hits. You will drop target as telos starts to charge the anima bomb, as you enter the fonts. You should aim to use your defensive thresholds before targeting the golems to help with adrenaline management. Note: First and Third font are assumed you use 2H for all abilities used on Telos.
