docs.text: Permanent unlocks Auras Berserker Auras ⬥ Costs 25,000 Marks of War ⬥ BIS auras at most places, they last 30 minutes but are extended to 1 hour via vis wax. Provide the following effects: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These auras provide an invisible 10% boost to the player's melee/magic/ranged damage and accuracy. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This does not stack with damage-boosting ultimates ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The respective combat level is also increased by 10%. With an elder overload, this results in a level of 130. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• You will also receive 15% more melee, magic, ranged and soft typeless damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Hard typeless is unaffected. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- In addition to this, your defence level is reduced by 15%. ⬥ They should be used in nearly all bossing encounters, especially if you don't have 100% hitchance. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These should be the first auras you unlock. Start with the combat style you use the most then move on to the remaining two before getting other auras. Accuracy Auras ⬥ Costs 107,000 Loyalty Points per aura (cumulative cost for supreme variant) ⬥ Increase melee/magic/ranged accuracy by 3%/5%/7%/10% per rank respectively. They last 1 hour by default and can be extended to 2 hours. ⬥ Reasonable option if zerk auras are on cooldown and you do not have 100% accuracy. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium Mahjarrat & Dark Magic Aura ⬥ Dark Magic costs 12,500 Marks of War ⬥ Mahjarrat costs either 1000 Reaper Points or 3 Bonds. The bond is always the more cost-efficient choice. ⬥ Mahjarrat provides a 5% damage boost and Dark Magic deals damage over time to your target. ⬥ These are used in cases where you hybrid or already have 100% accuracy with zerk auras on cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium, High if you intend to camp Solak/Elite Dungeons Inspiration & Invigorate Aura ⬥ Inspiration costs 23,000 Loyalty Points ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Causes successful attacks to grant an extra 0.5% adrenaline. This counts all hits of bleeds/multihit attacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Some use cases have been found where the large adrenaline income with + can be used for higher damage output via ⬥ Invigorate costs 115,000 Loyalty Points (cumulative cost for supreme variant) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Invigorate saves 2.5%/5%/7.5%/10% adrenaline after an ultimate. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This effect stacks with a ring of vigour ⬥ These auras can be used as a last resort option for bosses you already have 100% accuracy. Alternatively they can be used for Elite Dungeons or slayer, but are still inferior to zerk auras. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium/Low Penance & Vampyrism Aura ⬥ Vampyrism costs 5,000 Marks of War ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vampyrism restores life points equal to 5% of any damage dealt. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This is capped at 50 life points per hit. ⬥ Penance costs 23,000 Loyalty Points ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Penance restores prayer points equal to 5% of any damage taken, rounded down. ⬥ Very low usage for bossing and are mainly used for slayer ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low Invention Perks Beginner Perks ⬥ Higher invention levels give you access to new components and perks. Important milestones are level 49/74/89 giving you crackling , precise , and planted feet/aftershock ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note: Ilujankan & Cywir components also require 2,500 reputation in their respective GWD2 faction. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Crackling deals 50% ability damage per rank every 60 seconds ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Precise increases your minimum damage by 1.5% per rank of your maximum damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Planted Feet increases the duration of Sunshine and Death's Swiftness by 25%. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Aftershock deals additional AoE damage every 50,000 damage the player deals. ⬥ These basic perks should be used in any general combat scenario as they are unlocked early and provide a substantial boost to DPS ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note: Check #perks to see updated basic perks with ancient invention. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Potions & Prayers Overloads/Supreme/Elder variants ⬥ Overloads increase a player's combat stats + 15% of the stat level + 3 ⬥ Supreme overloads increase a player's combat stats + 16% of the stat level + 4 (128 at 99 + berserker aura) ⬥ Elder overloads increase a player's combat stats + 17% of the stat level + 5 (130 at 99 + berserker aura) ⬥ The stat boost is significant in every combat scenario for additional damage and accuracy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These should be one of the first unlocks to get if you want to do any sort of PvM T95 curses ⬥ Turmoil, torment and anguish provide the following combat boosts for melee/mage/ranged respectively: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +10 Combat levels (for accuracy) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +10% Damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +10 Defence levels (for armour) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Drains enemy -6 to -10 levels (for accuracy) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• -6 to -10 enemy drain modifier (for armour) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• -9% to -15% enemy damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Another very important upgrade that should be prioritized to unlock as early as possible T99 curses ⬥ Costs 654,733,260 per prayer ⬥ Stronger versions of the level 95 variants that do the following: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +12 Combat levels (for accuracy) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +12% Damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +12 Defence levels (for armour) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• drains enemy -8 to -12 levels (for accuracy) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• -8 to -12 enemy drain modifier (for armour) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• -9% to -15% enemy damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bigger upgrade than t92s without a special attack or passive, as well as the Staff of Sliske , should be prioritized after basic gear is obtained (see #upgrade-order ) Archaeology Relics The general layout for most pvm scenarios is: Fury of the Small, Berserker's Fury, and Death Ward. Further examples may be seen here: https://runescape.wiki/w/Optimal_PvM_Relic_Power_Setup General PvM Relics ⬥ Font of Life ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases maximum health by 500 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Obtained by completing the Archaeology tutorial ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low, replace with Death Ward when you unlock 650 monolith power ⬥ Berserker's Fury ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Deal up to +5.5% damage the lower your current life points are below max ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Averages to around 2-3% dpm increase ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Combine Saradomin I collection reward with Forsaken amulet ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 56 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Detailed information can be found here: https://i.imgur.com/NqHePFM.png ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Death Ward ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5% damage reduction when your life points are below 50%; 10% damage reduction when they are below 25% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 81 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dig up an Aviansie dreamcoat, repair and give to Armadyl on top of Armadyl's tower. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note: If Armadyl isn't at his tower, check your Sliske's Endgame quest log. If it is not complete, you need to redo the last boss fight. Once the quest is completed Armadyl will be back on top of his tower. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium if you have 650 monolith power unlocked, low otherwise ⬥ Fury of the Small ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• All basic abilities generate 1% more adrenaline ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked by solving Out of the Cruicible mystery. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 97 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Heightened Senses ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases maximum adrenaline by 10% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked by solving The Everlight mystery ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 105 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if ranging, low otherwise (replaces Fury of the Small in some Ranged encounters) ⬥ Conservation of Energy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After using an ultimate ability, you will regain 10% adrenaline ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Chuluu stone combined with invention components, requires 108 invention ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 118 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ Persistent Rage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Prevents adrenaline from being drained. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked by giving two Hellfire Katars to Dagon the Gatekeeper ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 98 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low Task Sets for PvM General PvM Task Sets ⬥ Hard Seers' Village Task Set ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ability to enhance Excalibur ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Recovers 20% of your LP over time ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Elite Seers' Village Task Set ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doubles effectiveness of Enhanced Excalibur ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- A lossless source of healing with a cooldown of 5 minutes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Heals 4% of your max hp 10 times over 40 seconds with Elite Seers' Task Set completed for a total of 40% hp restoration ⬥ Increases enchanted bolt proc chance by a flat 2% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Easy Tirannwn Task Set ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to quiver (each tier gives a higher prayer bonus) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if using ascendri bolts, low otherwise ⬥ Hard Desert Task Set ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Boosts effect of Keris ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- +25% hitchance, +5% chance to deal triple damage when worn ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for Kalphite King, low otherwise ⬥ Elite Fremmenik Task Set ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Deal 10% more damage with autos and 5% more damage with abilities against Dagannoth Kings ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Notes DK bones automatically ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if camping DKs, low otherwise Quest Unlocks General PvM Quests ⬥ The World Wakes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks the Sunshine, Death's Swiftness, Natural Instinct, and Balanced Strike abilities ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Merlin's Crystal ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks Excalibur ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Lossless healing with completion of both Hard and Elite Seers' Task Sets ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ The Light Within ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks Seren spells/prayers + access to Spellbook Swap in the Ancient Spellbook ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Temple at Senntisten and Desert Treasure quests are prerequisites for The Light Within. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ The Digsite ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Awards the Codex Ultimatus, which unlocks the smoke/shadow/blood tendrils and ice asylum abilities ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for Melee/Ranged, low for Magic ⬥ Dream Mentor ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Full access to Lunar spellbook ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Lunar Diplomacy quest gives access to all useful spells for PvM + access to Livid Farm ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Broken Home ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Must do all 3 challenges post-quest for Asylum surgeon's ring ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ Icthlarin's Little Helper ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Sophanem, its slayer dungeon, and Magister ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Jack of Spades quest gives access to Menaphos and its reputation system ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for slayer ⬥ Summer's End ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Corporeal Beast ⬥ Impressing the Locals ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Miniquest ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Temple of Aminishi (ED1) ⬥ One Piercing Note ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Illuminated God books ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Horror from the Deep quest unlocks God books ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ River of Blood ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks blood essences ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Branches of Darkmeyer quest unlocks Drakan's medallion ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ One of a Kind ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks dragonrider amulet and celestial dragons ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Song from the Depths ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Reduced damage at Queen Black Dragon ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to QBD as reaper assignment ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if doing QBD, Low otherwise ⬥ Curse of the Black Stone ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 10% dmg reduction in all Elite Dungeons ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if doing Elite Dungeons ⬥ The Elder Kiln ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks the Fight Kiln ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Ritual of the Mahjarrat ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlock ability to make dragonbane arrows/bolts ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlock Stone of Jas buff for GWD1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if PvMing anywhere Stone of Jas buff works ⬥ Contact! ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Keris (good for Kalphite King with Desert Amulet 3+) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if doing Kalphite King, Low otherwise ⬥ Haunted Mine ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Salve Amulet ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎-The Lair of Tarn Razorlor miniquest gives access to Salve Amulet (e) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Let Them Eat Pie ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Expensive Spices ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ As a First Resort ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks spas ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks ability to have NPCs decant flasks for you ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ City of Senntisten ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks the Smoke Cloud , Animate Dead , Exsanguinate , and Incite Fear spells ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Quests for Dominion Mines Note: Only the last quests in a quest line are listed, rather than listing all prerequisites. ⬥ The Chosen Commander ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Sigmund ⬥ A Void Dance ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Black Knight Guardian ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Solus Dellagar ⬥ Blood Runs Deep ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dagannoth Sentinels + Both Mothers ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Inadequacy, Everlasting + Illusive, Untouchable ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Koschei + Draugen ⬥ The Curse of Arrav ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Arrav ⬥ Demon Slayer ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Delrith ⬥ Dragon Slayer ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Melzar + Elvarg ⬥ Lair of Tarn Razorlor ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Tarn ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Treus ⬥ Missing My Mummy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Tumeken ⬥ Mountain Daughter ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Kendal ⬥ Nomad's Requiem ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Nomad ⬥ Recipe for Disaster ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• All bosses ⬥ Spirits of the Elid ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Golems ⬥ Vampyre Slayer ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Count Draynor Reaper Store ⬥ Mahjarrat Aura ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases player damage by 5% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Makes no sense to buy with reaper points, as bonds are objectively cheaper ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Reaper's Choice ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 10% chance of being able to choose your own reaper assignment ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium if you need to farm reaper points, Low otherwise ⬥ Bonfire Booster ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Permanently increases duration of bonfire health boost duration by 25% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Instance Cost ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Reduces instance costs by 25% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ Death's Support ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doubles the amount healed by Portents of Life/Death ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Ring of Death (o) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Quintuples charge capacity of RoD ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if you forget to charge your RoD often, Low otherwise ⬥ Aura Resets ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Recharge your aura without waiting for the normal cooldown time ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Player Owned Farm/Ranch Out of Time PvM Perks ⬥ NopeNopeNope Perk ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A 2% (at tier 1) or 3% (at tier 2) damage increase against all spiders as well as Araxxor/Araxxi ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if you do Araxxi, Low otherwise ⬥ King of Beasts Perk ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A 5% (at tier 1) or 10% (at tier 2) chance to conserve a bomb when thrown ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium, can save some money when other perks are not useful ⬥ No Fear Perk ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases the critical hit chance of Meteor Strike by 20% (at tier 1) or 40% (at tier 2) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Armoured Hide Perk ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases the duration of Barricade by 1.8 seconds (at tier 1) or 3.6 seconds (at tier 2) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High at any place you need to Barricade Miscellaneous Upgrades General Upgrades ⬥ Reaper Crew ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For killing each boss once you unlock the following benefits: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- +2 Prayer bonus ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- +20 Armor ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- +200 Life points ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- +12 Melee/Mage/Ranged Damage bonus ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Anachronia Slayer Helmet Stand ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Placing a slayer helmet grants slayer helmet bonuses everywhere without needing to wear it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for slayer, low otherwise ⬥ Spirit Cape ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bought from the Dungeoneering shop for 45,000 Dungeoneering tokens ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Permanently reduces the cost of Summoning familiar special attack costs by 20% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Permanent Access to Nex Bank ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players can speak to Ashuelot Reis in the Nex Bank with a set of ancient ceremonial robes, a frozen key and 10,000,000 coins to allow for permanent free access to Nex's lobby. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if doing a lot of Nex/AoD, Low otherwise Customizable Upgrades ⬥ Increased Monolith Energy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After completing the Mysterious City mystery in the Orthen digsite, you will receive an extra 150 monolith energy, totalling to 650. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Level 120 arch, boostable from 117 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium, 500 monolith energy is good enough for most activities ⬥ Anachronia Skillcape Stand ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Adds an additional skillcape slot at the Anachronia player lodge ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Dreadnips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dominion Tower reward for achieving 450 boss kills and spectating another player's match. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dreadnips can deal upwards of 8k average dpm and are usable against most monsters. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Raids Shop Ring Imbues ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Applies mainly for RoD and Asr , but the general idea is the same for all imbueable rings ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Gives a ~+2 permanent stat buff to the ring's damage bonuses ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low

Accuracy Auras ⬥ Costs 107,000 Loyalty Points per aura (cumulative cost for supreme variant) ⬥ Increase melee/magic/ranged accuracy by 3%/5%/7%/10% per rank respectively. They last 1 hour by default and can be extended to 2 hours. ⬥ Reasonable option if zerk auras are on cooldown and you do not have 100% accuracy. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium Mahjarrat & Dark Magic Aura ⬥ Dark Magic costs 12,500 Marks of War ⬥ Mahjarrat costs either 1000 Reaper Points or 3 Bonds. The bond is always the more cost-efficient choice. ⬥ Mahjarrat provides a 5% damage boost and Dark Magic deals damage over time to your target. ⬥ These are used in cases where you hybrid or already have 100% accuracy with zerk auras on cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium, High if you intend to camp Solak/Elite Dungeons Inspiration & Invigorate Aura ⬥ Inspiration costs 23,000 Loyalty Points ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Causes successful attacks to grant an extra 0.5% adrenaline. This counts all hits of bleeds/multihit attacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Some use cases have been found where the large adrenaline income with + can be used for higher damage output via ⬥ Invigorate costs 115,000 Loyalty Points (cumulative cost for supreme variant) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Invigorate saves 2.5%/5%/7.5%/10% adrenaline after an ultimate. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This effect stacks with a ring of vigour ⬥ These auras can be used as a last resort option for bosses you already have 100% accuracy. Alternatively they can be used for Elite Dungeons or slayer, but are still inferior to zerk auras. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium/Low Penance & Vampyrism Aura ⬥ Vampyrism costs 5,000 Marks of War ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Vampyrism restores life points equal to 5% of any damage dealt. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- This is capped at 50 life points per hit. ⬥ Penance costs 23,000 Loyalty Points ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Penance restores prayer points equal to 5% of any damage taken, rounded down. ⬥ Very low usage for bossing and are mainly used for slayer ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low
docs.title: Auras

docs.text: Beginner Perks ⬥ Higher invention levels give you access to new components and perks. Important milestones are level 49/74/89 giving you crackling , precise , and planted feet/aftershock ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note: Ilujankan & Cywir components also require 2,500 reputation in their respective GWD2 faction. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Crackling deals 50% ability damage per rank every 60 seconds ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Precise increases your minimum damage by 1.5% per rank of your maximum damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Planted Feet increases the duration of Sunshine and Death's Swiftness by 25%. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Aftershock deals additional AoE damage every 50,000 damage the player deals. ⬥ These basic perks should be used in any general combat scenario as they are unlocked early and provide a substantial boost to DPS ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note: Check #perks to see updated basic perks with ancient invention. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High
docs.title: Invention Perks

docs.text: Overloads/Supreme/Elder variants ⬥ Overloads increase a player's combat stats + 15% of the stat level + 3 ⬥ Supreme overloads increase a player's combat stats + 16% of the stat level + 4 (128 at 99 + berserker aura) ⬥ Elder overloads increase a player's combat stats + 17% of the stat level + 5 (130 at 99 + berserker aura) ⬥ The stat boost is significant in every combat scenario for additional damage and accuracy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• These should be one of the first unlocks to get if you want to do any sort of PvM T95 curses ⬥ Turmoil, torment and anguish provide the following combat boosts for melee/mage/ranged respectively: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +10 Combat levels (for accuracy) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +10% Damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +10 Defence levels (for armour) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Drains enemy -6 to -10 levels (for accuracy) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• -6 to -10 enemy drain modifier (for armour) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• -9% to -15% enemy damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Another very important upgrade that should be prioritized to unlock as early as possible T99 curses ⬥ Costs 654,733,260 per prayer ⬥ Stronger versions of the level 95 variants that do the following: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +12 Combat levels (for accuracy) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +12% Damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• +12 Defence levels (for armour) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• drains enemy -8 to -12 levels (for accuracy) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• -8 to -12 enemy drain modifier (for armour) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• -9% to -15% enemy damage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bigger upgrade than t92s without a special attack or passive, as well as the Staff of Sliske , should be prioritized after basic gear is obtained (see #upgrade-order )
docs.title: Potions & Prayers

docs.text: The general layout for most pvm scenarios is: Fury of the Small, Berserker's Fury, and Death Ward. Further examples may be seen here: https://runescape.wiki/w/Optimal_PvM_Relic_Power_Setup General PvM Relics ⬥ Font of Life ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases maximum health by 500 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Obtained by completing the Archaeology tutorial ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low, replace with Death Ward when you unlock 650 monolith power ⬥ Berserker's Fury ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Deal up to +5.5% damage the lower your current life points are below max ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Averages to around 2-3% dpm increase ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Combine Saradomin I collection reward with Forsaken amulet ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 56 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Detailed information can be found here: https://i.imgur.com/NqHePFM.png ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Death Ward ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 5% damage reduction when your life points are below 50%; 10% damage reduction when they are below 25% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 81 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dig up an Aviansie dreamcoat, repair and give to Armadyl on top of Armadyl's tower. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Note: If Armadyl isn't at his tower, check your Sliske's Endgame quest log. If it is not complete, you need to redo the last boss fight. Once the quest is completed Armadyl will be back on top of his tower. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium if you have 650 monolith power unlocked, low otherwise ⬥ Fury of the Small ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• All basic abilities generate 1% more adrenaline ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked by solving Out of the Cruicible mystery. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 97 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Heightened Senses ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases maximum adrenaline by 10% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked by solving The Everlight mystery ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 105 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if ranging, low otherwise (replaces Fury of the Small in some Ranged encounters) ⬥ Conservation of Energy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After using an ultimate ability, you will regain 10% adrenaline ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Chuluu stone combined with invention components, requires 108 invention ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 118 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ Persistent Rage ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Prevents adrenaline from being drained. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked by giving two Hellfire Katars to Dagon the Gatekeeper ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 98 Archaeology (boostable) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low
docs.title: Archaeology Relics

docs.text: General PvM Task Sets ⬥ Hard Seers' Village Task Set ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ability to enhance Excalibur ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Recovers 20% of your LP over time ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Elite Seers' Village Task Set ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doubles effectiveness of Enhanced Excalibur ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- A lossless source of healing with a cooldown of 5 minutes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Heals 4% of your max hp 10 times over 40 seconds with Elite Seers' Task Set completed for a total of 40% hp restoration ⬥ Increases enchanted bolt proc chance by a flat 2% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Easy Tirannwn Task Set ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to quiver (each tier gives a higher prayer bonus) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if using ascendri bolts, low otherwise ⬥ Hard Desert Task Set ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Boosts effect of Keris ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- +25% hitchance, +5% chance to deal triple damage when worn ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for Kalphite King, low otherwise ⬥ Elite Fremmenik Task Set ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Deal 10% more damage with autos and 5% more damage with abilities against Dagannoth Kings ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Notes DK bones automatically ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if camping DKs, low otherwise
docs.title: Task Sets for PvM

docs.text: General PvM Quests ⬥ The World Wakes ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks the Sunshine, Death's Swiftness, Natural Instinct, and Balanced Strike abilities ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Merlin's Crystal ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks Excalibur ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Lossless healing with completion of both Hard and Elite Seers' Task Sets ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ The Light Within ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks Seren spells/prayers + access to Spellbook Swap in the Ancient Spellbook ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Temple at Senntisten and Desert Treasure quests are prerequisites for The Light Within. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ The Digsite ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Awards the Codex Ultimatus, which unlocks the smoke/shadow/blood tendrils and ice asylum abilities ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for Melee/Ranged, low for Magic ⬥ Dream Mentor ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Full access to Lunar spellbook ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Lunar Diplomacy quest gives access to all useful spells for PvM + access to Livid Farm ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Broken Home ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Must do all 3 challenges post-quest for Asylum surgeon's ring ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ Icthlarin's Little Helper ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Sophanem, its slayer dungeon, and Magister ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Jack of Spades quest gives access to Menaphos and its reputation system ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for slayer ⬥ Summer's End ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Corporeal Beast ⬥ Impressing the Locals ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Miniquest ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Temple of Aminishi (ED1) ⬥ One Piercing Note ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Illuminated God books ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Horror from the Deep quest unlocks God books ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ River of Blood ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks blood essences ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Branches of Darkmeyer quest unlocks Drakan's medallion ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ One of a Kind ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks dragonrider amulet and celestial dragons ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Song from the Depths ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Reduced damage at Queen Black Dragon ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to QBD as reaper assignment ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if doing QBD, Low otherwise ⬥ Curse of the Black Stone ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 10% dmg reduction in all Elite Dungeons ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if doing Elite Dungeons ⬥ The Elder Kiln ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks the Fight Kiln ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Ritual of the Mahjarrat ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlock ability to make dragonbane arrows/bolts ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlock Stone of Jas buff for GWD1 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if PvMing anywhere Stone of Jas buff works ⬥ Contact! ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Keris (good for Kalphite King with Desert Amulet 3+) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if doing Kalphite King, Low otherwise ⬥ Haunted Mine ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Salve Amulet ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎-The Lair of Tarn Razorlor miniquest gives access to Salve Amulet (e) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Let Them Eat Pie ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Access to Expensive Spices ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ As a First Resort ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks spas ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks ability to have NPCs decant flasks for you ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ City of Senntisten ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocks the Smoke Cloud , Animate Dead , Exsanguinate , and Incite Fear spells ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Quests for Dominion Mines Note: Only the last quests in a quest line are listed, rather than listing all prerequisites. ⬥ The Chosen Commander ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Sigmund ⬥ A Void Dance ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Black Knight Guardian ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Solus Dellagar ⬥ Blood Runs Deep ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dagannoth Sentinels + Both Mothers ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The Inadequacy, Everlasting + Illusive, Untouchable ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Koschei + Draugen ⬥ The docs.title: Quest Unlocks

docs.text: ⬥ Mahjarrat Aura ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases player damage by 5% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Makes no sense to buy with reaper points, as bonds are objectively cheaper ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Reaper's Choice ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• 10% chance of being able to choose your own reaper assignment ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium if you need to farm reaper points, Low otherwise ⬥ Bonfire Booster ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Permanently increases duration of bonfire health boost duration by 25% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Instance Cost ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Reduces instance costs by 25% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ Death's Support ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Doubles the amount healed by Portents of Life/Death ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Ring of Death (o) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Quintuples charge capacity of RoD ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if you forget to charge your RoD often, Low otherwise ⬥ Aura Resets ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Recharge your aura without waiting for the normal cooldown time ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High
docs.title: Reaper Store

docs.text: ⬥ NopeNopeNope Perk ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A 2% (at tier 1) or 3% (at tier 2) damage increase against all spiders as well as Araxxor/Araxxi ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if you do Araxxi, Low otherwise ⬥ King of Beasts Perk ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A 5% (at tier 1) or 10% (at tier 2) chance to conserve a bomb when thrown ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium, can save some money when other perks are not useful ⬥ No Fear Perk ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases the critical hit chance of Meteor Strike by 20% (at tier 1) or 40% (at tier 2) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Armoured Hide Perk ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increases the duration of Barricade by 1.8 seconds (at tier 1) or 3.6 seconds (at tier 2) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High at any place you need to Barricade
docs.title: Player Owned Farm/Ranch Out of Time PvM Perks

docs.text: General Upgrades ⬥ Reaper Crew ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• For killing each boss once you unlock the following benefits: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- +2 Prayer bonus ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- +20 Armor ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- +200 Life points ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- +12 Melee/Mage/Ranged Damage bonus ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Anachronia Slayer Helmet Stand ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Placing a slayer helmet grants slayer helmet bonuses everywhere without needing to wear it ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for slayer, low otherwise ⬥ Spirit Cape ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bought from the Dungeoneering shop for 45,000 Dungeoneering tokens ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Permanently reduces the cost of Summoning familiar special attack costs by 20% ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Permanent Access to Nex Bank ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Players can speak to Ashuelot Reis in the Nex Bank with a set of ancient ceremonial robes, a frozen key and 10,000,000 coins to allow for permanent free access to Nex's lobby. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if doing a lot of Nex/AoD, Low otherwise Customizable Upgrades ⬥ Increased Monolith Energy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• After completing the Mysterious City mystery in the Orthen digsite, you will receive an extra 150 monolith energy, totalling to 650. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Level 120 arch, boostable from 117 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium, 500 monolith energy is good enough for most activities ⬥ Anachronia Skillcape Stand ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Adds an additional skillcape slot at the Anachronia player lodge ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Dreadnips ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dominion Tower reward for achieving 450 boss kills and spectating another player's match. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dreadnips can deal upwards of 8k average dpm and are usable against most monsters. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Raids Shop Ring Imbues ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Applies mainly for RoD and Asr , but the general idea is the same for all imbueable rings ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Gives a ~+2 permanent stat buff to the ring's damage bonuses ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low
docs.title: Miscellaneous Upgrades

docs.text: Unlockable abilities Introduction These abilities are classified by either being unlocked as a quest reward, purchased from a shop (Shattered Worlds), or by using an ability codex. Abilities Unlocked by Quests Sunshine/Death Swiftness (Requires level 81 in either Magic or Ranged) ⬥ Unlocked upon completion of The World Wakes ⬥ These are ultimate abilities with a 7x7 range with the following effects for their corresponding styles: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increase your damage by 50% (bleeds excluded). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Apply a DoT of 10%-20% ability damage that hits every 2 seconds when your primary target of casting is inside the ultimate's radius. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Lasts 30 seconds. ⬥ Priority: High Note: Can be used in conjuction with the Planted Feet perk. This makes them last 37 seconds as opposed to 30 seconds but removes their DoT effect. Tendrils Abilities and Ice Asylum (Requires level 75 in either Attack, Ranged, Magic or 91 Constitution) ⬥ Unlocked upon reading the Codex Ultimatus after completing The Dig Site quest. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• All abilities are unlocked on reading the codex but require fulfillment of a specific requirement to use. ⬥ Tendrils abilities are thresholds that cause self-damage in order to deal damage to the target. ⬥ Blood Tendrils (Requires 75 Attack) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Melee tendrils ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleed that hits 5 times total. First hit is 36-180% ability damage, followed by 4 hits of 18%-90% ability damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Self-damage 27% of the damage dealt after the initial hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: Works with Masterwork Spear of Annihilation for a total of 7 hits. ⬥ Shadow Tendrils (Requires 75 Ranged) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ranged tendrils ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A single large hit ranging from 66%-500% ability damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Self-damage is half of the total damage dealt. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: Shadow tendrils damage is increased by modifiers such as Death's Swiftness without adding more self-damage taken. ⬥ Smoke Tendrils (Requires 75 Magic) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Magic tendrils ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A channeled ability that does 115%-575% ability damage total over 4 hits in 6 seconds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Self-damage is 35%-175% ability damage over 3 hits in 6 seconds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low Note: Smoke Tendrils is comparatively weak due to how long it takes to get all of the damage out. ⬥ Ice Asylum (Requires level 91 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Constitution ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Heals anyone within 8 tiles the crystal for 1%-7% of their maximum Life Points every 6 ticks (3.6 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Heals a total of 300% of the user's max hp and runs out when all hp has been healed or after 37 ticks (22.2 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Shares cooldown with Rejuvenate, Guthix's Blessing and Enhanced Excalibur. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Should never be used. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low Note: This ability is functionally identical to the Enhanced Excalibur but costs 100% adrenaline. Buyable abilities Raids These abilities are unlocked using a Mazcab Ability Codex 29,028,846 ⬥ Corruption Blast (Requires level 70 Magic) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A magic bleed ability that does 33%-100% ability damage every 2 ticks (1.2 seconds) for 10 ticks (6 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each bleed hit is 20% weaker than the last, it is also AoE, it can chain to other mobs without having them turn aggressive towards you. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: Bleeds are discouraged in group pvm because they override each other and cancel out the current bleed. ⬥ Corruption Shot (Requires level 70 Ranged) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A ranged bleed ability that does 33%-100% ability damage every 2 ticks (1.2 seconds) for 10 ticks (6 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each bleed hit is 20% weaker than the last, it is also AoE, it can chain to other mobs without having them turn aggressive towards you. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: Bleeds are discouraged in group pvm because they override each other and cancel out the current bleed. ⬥ Onslaught (Requires level 90 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A channeled ability that deals 50-150% damage on the first hit, with each subsequent hit dealing an additional 11%-33% ability damage per hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This ability drains your adrenaline (25% per hit) until your adrenaline runs out. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Once adrenaline is depleted, Onslaught will start draining your lifepoints. It will deal 25% of the damage dealt as recoil until 10 total hits. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- After the 10th hit, each subsequent hit adds an additional 1000 hp recoil. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Storm Shards (Requires level 70 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Apply a Storm Shard stack to an enemy when used, dealing no damage. A total of 10 Storm Shard stacks can be applied to an enemy. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each stack stores 75%-95% ability damage which can be cashed out in one big hit by using the Shatter ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally used during timegated parts of bosses or if you need to do a lot of burst at once with shatter. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for Vorago, low otherwise Note: Shards themselves are unaffected by things such as Berserk, Sunshine, etc. ⬥ Shatter (Requires level 70 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Releases all the stored Storm Shard stacks at once dealing damage equivalent to the stored shards, with a cap of 30,000 damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This hit is affected by damage modifiers like Berserk, Sunshine, etc. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for Vorago, low otherwise Note: Storm Shards and Shatter are unlocked together. Raksha ⬥ Greater Ricochet (Requires level 45 Ranged) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Greater Ricochet ability codex ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• AoE ability that does 20%-100% ability damage on the initial hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Can damage up to 2 additional targets (a total of 7 hits with Caroming 4). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The primary target will be hit for an additional 10%-50% ability damage for each ricochet shot that cannot find an additional target. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: Works with the Caroming perk. ⬥ Greater Chain (Requires level 45 Magic) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Greater Chain ability codex ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Aoe ability that does 20%-100% ability damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Damage up to 2 additional targets. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The next ability on the primary target is also cast on the additional targets with a 50% damage reduction. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- 6 second duration. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium Note: Works with the Caroming perk. ⬥ Divert (Requires level 48 Defense) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Divert ability codex 21,497,733 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The next Melee, Magic, or Ranged attack received by the player within 6 seconds will be blocked, instead granting the player adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Generates 0.8% adrenaline for every 100-200 damage blocked, based on the level of shield equipped with diminishing returns at 3,000, 6,000 and 9,000 damage blocked. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Powerful attacks will have their damage blocked, but will not generate adrenaline (i.e. Telos So Much Power or Weak Anima Bomb special attacks). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium Note: Shares cooldown with resonance. Telos ⬥ Reprisal (Requires level 85 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Reprisal Ability Codex 40,119,221 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When activated it tracks all damage taken from all sources for up to 6 seconds (can release early by activating it again) with a damage cap of 10,000 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It releases the damage on whatever you were targetting when you activated it. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Damage on activation is boosted by Zerk auras, Vulnerability, etc. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Damage stored is based on damage taken. Defensives and the Trimmed Masterwork passive will reduce this. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally used when you are going to take a large amount of damage at once, like Vorago's Teamsplit attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if you do something like Vorago, Low otherwise Elite Dungeon 2 ⬥ Greater Barge (Requires level 30 Attack) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Greater Barge ability codex 335,257,480 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Works like normal barge, except each tick (0.6 seconds) the player is not damaging an enemy, barge gains +10% ability damage, capping at 10 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If it has been at least 8 ticks (4.8 seconds) since you have last hit a target, using barge will allow you to turn a channeled ability used within the next 6 seconds (10 ticks) into a Damage over Time ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally used within Zerk combined with Adrenaline potion or Limitless, as well as in a Zaros Godsword special attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Greater Flurry (Requires level 37 Attack) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Greater Flurry ability codex 67,464,315 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When used against a single target it deals 94-157% damage per hit and reduces Berserk cooldown by 2 tick (1.2 seconds) per successful hit up to a max of 8 ticks (4.8 seconds) reduction. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When used as an AoE does the same damage as normal flurry, but still reduces Berserk cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When bled the first hit does its AoE version of damage, then normal single target damage for the remaining hits. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Generally canceled after 2 hits (cancelled on GCD) or 3 hits, depending on the rotation used. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Greater Fury (Requires level 24 Strength) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Greater Fury ability codex 193,395,412 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Turns Fury into a non-channeled 157% ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Greater Fury is a critical hit, the next ability used within 30 seconds is guaranteed to be a critical hit, provided the ability used is not a bleed . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium Note: Can be worse than normal fury, but marginally assuming no grim. With grim it is usually better. Anachronia ⬥ Double Surge (Requires level 30 Magic) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Double Surge codex 25,846,753 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Gives Surge 2 uses per cooldown cycle, these can both grant adrenaline if both are used off global cooldown ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The cooldown is based on the first Surge ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can change the cooldown between charges at the Anachronia Lectern ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally just used for mobility, overall a QOL unlock ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Double Escape (Requires level 30 Ranged) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Double Escape codex 31,052,785 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Gives Escape 2 uses per cooldown cycle, these can both grant adrenaline if both are used off global cooldown ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The cooldown is based on the first Escape ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can change the cooldown between charges at the Anachronia Lectern ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally just used for mobility, overall a QOL unlock ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium Miscellaneous Purchasable Abilities ⬥ Limitless (Requires level 10 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Limitless ability codex 356,430,000 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Made by combining 2000 vital sparks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• An ability that allows the usage of thresholds under 50% adrenaline for 6 seconds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Thresholds still cost 15% adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally used when your Adrenaline potion is on cooldown or if you need to squeeze in extra thresholds in a short timeframe. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: Cannot be used if above 60% adrenaline. ⬥ Ingenuity of the Humans (Requires level 10 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using an Ingenuity of the Humans ability codex 154,293,764 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• An ability that guarantees your next spell or ability within 10 ticks (6 seconds) hits. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Primarly used for off-style SGB spec , SWH , and Smoke Cloud . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High X Slayers (Requires level 10 Constitution) ⬥ Unlocked using a X Slayer ability codex ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Undead Slayer 52,771,589 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Dragon Slayer 45,097,609 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Demon Slayer 34,318,014 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When used you will deal 15% more damage against X creature of the same type for 17 ticks (10 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally used when you are going to use strong abilities against said creature. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low Abilities Unlocked by Activities God Wars Dungeon / Anima Islands ⬥ Devotion (Requires level 1 Defense) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Chance to unlock after killing Kree'arra, General Graardor, or their followers in their respective encampments. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Alternatively can be unlocked as a reward from Anima Islands. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When activated, all damage dealt whilst using a protection prayer or deflect curse of the same style is reduced to 1 for 16 ticks (9.6 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Effect extends by 5 seconds per target killed whilst active, capping at 20 seconds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Sacrifice (Requires level 10 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Chance to unlock after killing Kree'arra, General Graardor, or their followers in their respective encampments. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Alternatively can be unlocked as a reward from Anima Islands. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Basic ability that does 20-100% ability damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Heals 25% of damage done, 100% if it killed the target. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ Transfigure (Requires level 10 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Incapacitate yourself for 10 ticks (6 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- You can still eat food, drink potions and switch prayers during this period. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Afterwards heal 250% of any damage taken, to a maximum of 75% of your Life Points. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Become immune to binds and stuns for 15 seconds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ Tuska's Wrath (Requires level 50 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked as a reward from Anima Islands ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When on slayer task, you deal (100 x Slayer level) damage to target assuming it is the monster you are assigned. This gives it a 120 second cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Caps at 15,000 damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If not on slayer task, this ability deals 30%-110% ability damage with a 15 second cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally only used as a filler ability if you mess up your rotation, should not be a regular part of your rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if doing a lot of slayer, low otherwise Note: This also works on some bosses like Magister while on a Soul Devourer task. Shattered Worlds ⬥ Bladed Dive (Requires level 65 Attack) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A great mobility ability, has a 10 tile range from your current position at any angle. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally used in conjunction with surge/escape, sometimes on the same tick, for greater mobility. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Functions as a 3x3 AoE ability when used off global cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown instantly resets if the target dies within 10 ticks (6 seconds) of using Bladed Dive. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: goes from 3x3 to 5x5 when used in conjuction with noxious scythe and laceration boots. ⬥ Greater Dazing Shot (Requires level 8 Ranged) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Gives Dazing Shot a puncture stack each time it is used, with a maximum of 10 puncture stacks on a target. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Puncture stacks last 9 seconds and hit 4 times (every 3 ticks or 1.8 seconds), dealing 8%-10% ability damage per stack over its duration. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Puncture bleed does not count for: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Aftershock building ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Soulsplit ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Araxxor web shield reflect ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Personal damage multipliers such as scrimshaws ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Combat experience ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Challenge gems ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Nex's blood phase ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium Note: Salt the Wound and Greater Dazing Shot both reset the stack duration (9 seconds) even if they splash, only Greater Dazing Shot will increase puncture count though. ⬥ Salt the Wound (Requires level 60 Ranged) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A threshold that deals 37.6%-188% ability damage at 0 puncture stacks, going up to 73.6-368% with 10 puncture stacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally never used since it required 8+ stacks to be viable. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low Note: Unlocking Greater Dazing Shot also unlocks Salt the Wound .
docs.title: Unlockable abilities

docs.text: These abilities are classified by either being unlocked as a quest reward, purchased from a shop (Shattered Worlds), or by using an ability codex.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Sunshine/Death Swiftness (Requires level 81 in either Magic or Ranged) ⬥ Unlocked upon completion of The World Wakes ⬥ These are ultimate abilities with a 7x7 range with the following effects for their corresponding styles: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Increase your damage by 50% (bleeds excluded). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Apply a DoT of 10%-20% ability damage that hits every 2 seconds when your primary target of casting is inside the ultimate's radius. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Lasts 30 seconds. ⬥ Priority: High Note: Can be used in conjuction with the Planted Feet perk. This makes them last 37 seconds as opposed to 30 seconds but removes their DoT effect. Tendrils Abilities and Ice Asylum (Requires level 75 in either Attack, Ranged, Magic or 91 Constitution) ⬥ Unlocked upon reading the Codex Ultimatus after completing The Dig Site quest. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• All abilities are unlocked on reading the codex but require fulfillment of a specific requirement to use. ⬥ Tendrils abilities are thresholds that cause self-damage in order to deal damage to the target. ⬥ Blood Tendrils (Requires 75 Attack) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Melee tendrils ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Bleed that hits 5 times total. First hit is 36-180% ability damage, followed by 4 hits of 18%-90% ability damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Self-damage 27% of the damage dealt after the initial hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: Works with Masterwork Spear of Annihilation for a total of 7 hits. ⬥ Shadow Tendrils (Requires 75 Ranged) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Ranged tendrils ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A single large hit ranging from 66%-500% ability damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Self-damage is half of the total damage dealt. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: Shadow tendrils damage is increased by modifiers such as Death's Swiftness without adding more self-damage taken. ⬥ Smoke Tendrils (Requires 75 Magic) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Magic tendrils ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A channeled ability that does 115%-575% ability damage total over 4 hits in 6 seconds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Self-damage is 35%-175% ability damage over 3 hits in 6 seconds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low Note: Smoke Tendrils is comparatively weak due to how long it takes to get all of the damage out. ⬥ Ice Asylum (Requires level 91 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Constitution ability ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Heals anyone within 8 tiles the crystal for 1%-7% of their maximum Life Points every 6 ticks (3.6 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Heals a total of 300% of the user's max hp and runs out when all hp has been healed or after 37 ticks (22.2 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Shares cooldown with Rejuvenate, Guthix's Blessing and Enhanced Excalibur. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Should never be used. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low Note: This ability is functionally identical to the Enhanced Excalibur but costs 100% adrenaline.
docs.title: Abilities Unlocked by Quests

docs.text: Raids These abilities are unlocked using a Mazcab Ability Codex 29,028,846 ⬥ Corruption Blast (Requires level 70 Magic) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A magic bleed ability that does 33%-100% ability damage every 2 ticks (1.2 seconds) for 10 ticks (6 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each bleed hit is 20% weaker than the last, it is also AoE, it can chain to other mobs without having them turn aggressive towards you. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: Bleeds are discouraged in group pvm because they override each other and cancel out the current bleed. ⬥ Corruption Shot (Requires level 70 Ranged) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A ranged bleed ability that does 33%-100% ability damage every 2 ticks (1.2 seconds) for 10 ticks (6 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each bleed hit is 20% weaker than the last, it is also AoE, it can chain to other mobs without having them turn aggressive towards you. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: Bleeds are discouraged in group pvm because they override each other and cancel out the current bleed. ⬥ Onslaught (Requires level 90 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A channeled ability that deals 50-150% damage on the first hit, with each subsequent hit dealing an additional 11%-33% ability damage per hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This ability drains your adrenaline (25% per hit) until your adrenaline runs out. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Once adrenaline is depleted, Onslaught will start draining your lifepoints. It will deal 25% of the damage dealt as recoil until 10 total hits. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- After the 10th hit, each subsequent hit adds an additional 1000 hp recoil. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Storm Shards (Requires level 70 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Apply a Storm Shard stack to an enemy when used, dealing no damage. A total of 10 Storm Shard stacks can be applied to an enemy. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Each stack stores 75%-95% ability damage which can be cashed out in one big hit by using the Shatter ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally used during timegated parts of bosses or if you need to do a lot of burst at once with shatter. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for Vorago, low otherwise Note: Shards themselves are unaffected by things such as Berserk, Sunshine, etc. ⬥ Shatter (Requires level 70 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Releases all the stored Storm Shard stacks at once dealing damage equivalent to the stored shards, with a cap of 30,000 damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• This hit is affected by damage modifiers like Berserk, Sunshine, etc. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High for Vorago, low otherwise Note: Storm Shards and Shatter are unlocked together. Raksha ⬥ Greater Ricochet (Requires level 45 Ranged) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Greater Ricochet ability codex ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• AoE ability that does 20%-100% ability damage on the initial hit. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Can damage up to 2 additional targets (a total of 7 hits with Caroming 4). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- The primary target will be hit for an additional 10%-50% ability damage for each ricochet shot that cannot find an additional target. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: Works with the Caroming perk. ⬥ Greater Chain (Requires level 45 Magic) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Greater Chain ability codex ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Aoe ability that does 20%-100% ability damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Damage up to 2 additional targets. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The next ability on the primary target is also cast on the additional targets with a 50% damage reduction. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- 6 second duration. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium Note: Works with the Caroming perk. ⬥ Divert (Requires level 48 Defense) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Divert ability codex 21,497,733 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• The next Melee, Magic, or Ranged attack received by the player within 6 seconds will be blocked, instead granting the player adrenaline. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Generates 0.8% adrenaline for every 100-200 damage blocked, based on the level of shield equipped with diminishing returns at 3,000, 6,000 and 9,000 damage blocked. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Powerful attacks will have their damage blocked, but will not generate adrenaline (i.e. Telos So Much Power or Weak Anima Bomb special attacks). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium Note: Shares cooldown with resonance. Telos ⬥ Reprisal (Requires level 85 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Reprisal Ability Codex 40,119,221 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When activated it tracks all damage taken from all sources for up to 6 seconds (can release early by activating it again) with a damage cap of 10,000 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• It releases the damage on whatever you were targetting when you activated it. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Damage on activation is boosted by Zerk auras, Vulnerability, etc. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Damage stored is based on damage taken. Defensives and the Trimmed Masterwork passive will reduce this. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally used when you are going to take a large amount of damage at once, like Vorago's Teamsplit attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if you do something like Vorago, Low otherwise Elite Dungeon 2 ⬥ Greater Barge (Requires level 30 Attack) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Greater Barge ability codex 335,257,480 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Works like normal barge, except each tick (0.6 seconds) the player is not damaging an enemy, barge gains +10% ability damage, capping at 10 ticks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If it has been at least 8 ticks (4.8 seconds) since you have last hit a target, using barge will allow you to turn a channeled ability used within the next 6 seconds (10 ticks) into a Damage over Time ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally used within Zerk combined with Adrenaline potion or Limitless, as well as in a Zaros Godsword special attack. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Greater Flurry (Requires level 37 Attack) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Greater Flurry ability codex 67,464,315 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When used against a single target it deals 94-157% damage per hit and reduces Berserk cooldown by 2 tick (1.2 seconds) per successful hit up to a max of 8 ticks (4.8 seconds) reduction. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When used as an AoE does the same damage as normal flurry, but still reduces Berserk cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When bled the first hit does its AoE version of damage, then normal single target damage for the remaining hits. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Generally canceled after 2 hits (cancelled on GCD) or 3 hits, depending on the rotation used. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium ⬥ Greater Fury (Requires level 24 Strength) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked using a Greater Fury ability codex 193,395,412 ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Turns Fury into a non-channeled 157% ability. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If Greater Fury is a critical hit, the next ability used within 30 seconds is guaranteed to be a critical hit, provided the ability used is not a bleed . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium Note: Can be worse than normal fury, but marginally assuming no grim. docs.title: Buyable abilities

docs.text: God Wars Dungeon / Anima Islands ⬥ Devotion (Requires level 1 Defense) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Chance to unlock after killing Kree'arra, General Graardor, or their followers in their respective encampments. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Alternatively can be unlocked as a reward from Anima Islands. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When activated, all damage dealt whilst using a protection prayer or deflect curse of the same style is reduced to 1 for 16 ticks (9.6 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Effect extends by 5 seconds per target killed whilst active, capping at 20 seconds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High ⬥ Sacrifice (Requires level 10 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Chance to unlock after killing Kree'arra, General Graardor, or their followers in their respective encampments. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Alternatively can be unlocked as a reward from Anima Islands. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Basic ability that does 20-100% ability damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Heals 25% of damage done, 100% if it killed the target. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ Transfigure (Requires level 10 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Incapacitate yourself for 10 ticks (6 seconds). ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- You can still eat food, drink potions and switch prayers during this period. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Afterwards heal 250% of any damage taken, to a maximum of 75% of your Life Points. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Become immune to binds and stuns for 15 seconds. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low ⬥ Tuska's Wrath (Requires level 50 Constitution) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Unlocked as a reward from Anima Islands ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• When on slayer task, you deal (100 x Slayer level) damage to target assuming it is the monster you are assigned. This gives it a 120 second cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Caps at 15,000 damage. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If not on slayer task, this ability deals 30%-110% ability damage with a 15 second cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally only used as a filler ability if you mess up your rotation, should not be a regular part of your rotation. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High if doing a lot of slayer, low otherwise Note: This also works on some bosses like Magister while on a Soul Devourer task. Shattered Worlds ⬥ Bladed Dive (Requires level 65 Attack) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A great mobility ability, has a 10 tile range from your current position at any angle. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally used in conjunction with surge/escape, sometimes on the same tick, for greater mobility. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Functions as a 3x3 AoE ability when used off global cooldown. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Cooldown instantly resets if the target dies within 10 ticks (6 seconds) of using Bladed Dive. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: High Note: goes from 3x3 to 5x5 when used in conjuction with noxious scythe and laceration boots. ⬥ Greater Dazing Shot (Requires level 8 Ranged) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Gives Dazing Shot a puncture stack each time it is used, with a maximum of 10 puncture stacks on a target. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Puncture stacks last 9 seconds and hit 4 times (every 3 ticks or 1.8 seconds), dealing 8%-10% ability damage per stack over its duration. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Puncture bleed does not count for: ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Aftershock building ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Soulsplit ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Araxxor web shield reflect ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Personal damage multipliers such as scrimshaws ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Combat experience ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Challenge gems ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Nex's blood phase ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Medium Note: Salt the Wound and Greater Dazing Shot both reset the stack duration (9 seconds) even if they splash, only Greater Dazing Shot will increase puncture count though. ⬥ Salt the Wound (Requires level 60 Ranged) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• A threshold that deals 37.6%-188% ability damage at 0 puncture stacks, going up to 73.6-368% with 10 puncture stacks. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Generally never used since it required 8+ stacks to be viable. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Priority: Low Note: Unlocking Greater Dazing Shot also unlocks Salt the Wound .
docs.title: Abilities Unlocked by Activities

docs.text: Upgrade decisions How to Use Upgrade Order The lists in #upgrade-order are recommended natural combat style progression templates for players to follow. Upgrades are ranked based on many factors to determine the best progression for general bossing -- that is to say, the listed upgrade order may not be the best order for the bosses you do. Equally problematic, creating individual upgrade orders for every single boss would not work as most players do not do only 1 boss but rather several. Therefore, the best way to present upgrade order is to present a list and teach how to determine which upgrades are best for you. Below is the current Melee upgrade order at the time of writing (2021/06/24). Araxxor Melee was used to demonstrate the thought process for adapting upgrade order to specific content. In this example, you will notice some upgrades recommended by the general list are skipped/omitted (crossed out) here while others have been moved (+) to better reflect the specific needs presented by the Araxxor boss fight. See #araxxor-melee for more information about the strategies mentioned and #mastery-system-reqs for speed references. Although this upgrade order is specific to Araxxor Melee, the critical thinking concepts are not and can be translated to other bosses. If you find yourself having any difficulties deciding what upgrade would best fit the content you do, please ask for assistance in #unknown-channel or #unknown-channel . Araxxor Specific Needs ⬥ Accuracy - Araxxor has reasonably high defense ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Prioritize weapons with high accuracy ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Use the strongest possible accuracy aura (Berserker Aura > T4 Brawler ). ⬥ Burst - the Araxxor fight is split into 4 100k hp phases ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Melee's go-to ultimate ability is Berserk . ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- Perfect for bursting a phase ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎- As you speed up, you will run into cooldown problems. ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Upgrades which improve your burst capabilities are prioritized. Annotated Upgrade Order for Melee Araxxor Note: All upgrades will be listed in bold. Araxxor will commonly be abbreviated to 'rax'. Stage 1: No Real Variance Based on Content ⬥ Berserker Aura ⬥ Blade of Nymora + off-hand Ripper claw/Masuta's Warspear / Melee benefits heavily from dual wield/2h switching as it gives access to both Decimate and Cleave as well as Destroy and later gFlurry . A Blade of Nymora offers you a cheap mainhand with T90 accuracy which is important for rax while an offhand Ripper Claw is a cheap offhand with T85 damage. Masuta's Warspear is a 2h with T82 accuracy and damage to be used for and occasionally Hurricane . ⬥ Level 95 Prayer ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Should also complete The Temple at Senntisten quest. ⬥ Level 99 Herblore ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can boost from 99 to make Elder Overloads with the aid of pulse cores, and can request assistance to make Adrenaline Renewals Normal Overloads are good but the extra stats from Elder Overloads are definitely worth the price when bossing. Any combination with your Elder Overloads such as making them into Elder Overload Salves is optional. ⬥ Drygores MH + Ripper Claw OH + ⬥ Entry Level Perks ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Refer to #perks Starter Perks for Entry Level Perks. Here you should sell your Blade of Nymora to purchase and a Drygore mainhand to acquire an additional 10 tiers of damage. Your offhand only accounts for 33% of your damage compared to your mainhand's 66% so upgrading your offhand is not recommended yet. Entry level perks also offer a serious damage increase and should be aquired here. ⬥ Superior Vesta's Spear with Entry Level Perks Superior Vesta's Spear is a T88 2h created by combining a Vesta's Spear with an Ancient Warrior Equipment patch and should be augmented immediately. It uses the same degrade system as T90 armours ; however, your first one will likely last you until you reach your next 2h upgrade. You can sell your Masuta's Warspear here or keep it to be used as a halberd for slayer. At this point, it would be ok to start trying rax; however, you should expect slow kills. ⬥ Strength Skillcape ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Primarily beneficial for extended Dismember duration. All upgrades above this line should be the same for every boss. ⬥ T90 Armour Definitely go for good dps perks on this rather than perks like Scavenging. If you want Scavenging for slayer, put it on a piece of augmented Bandos armour . ⬥ Laceration Boots ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves Rax is poison immune. If your goal is to mainly do rax, you should skip Cinderbane Gloves . ⬥ Amulet of Souls ⬥ Greater Barge ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Feel free to use the !barge command in #unknown-channel for more information. gBarge is a massive upgrade for rax as it significantly improves your burst capabilities. ⬥ Greater Flurry gFlurry improves your overall dps and fills out a basic rotation. At this point you are ready to start using rotations from #araxxor-melee . You will still need to improvise some rotations, P4 in particular; however, you should notice a serious uptick in your kill speeds. Beware, you should not use the recommended DBA spec as your accuracy is not high enough yet. ⬥ Biting 4 Biting 4 is a decent general upgrade; however, in the context of rax it is not noticeably better than Biting 3. With the real cost of roughly 3 times as expensive as listed (due to acquiring components in batches of 20), it is ok to push this back until after Zaros Godsword . ⬥ Limitless Natural Instinct can commonly be used for your P3 at rax, saving Apot for P4. Limitless is therefore less impactful than it would be at many other bosses and should be purchased later in the list. Stage 2: Some Variance Based on Content/Wealth ⬥ An off-hand t80 Flanking 4 Switch You cannot flank rax so you should skip this. ⬥ Zaros Godsword For rax, this is the most important upgrade as it is the solution to your cooldown problem. From this point on, you can follow almost all strategies in #araxxor-melee . Slightly different P2 Top Path (no Masterwork Spear ) and P4 rotation (no Seren Godbow - substitute for ) are needed. You should be using a Ripper Demon familiar by now. Your gear should be enough to achieve the @Araxxor Adept times. +⬥ Storm Shards and Shatter Storm Shards and Shatter are unlocked via a Mazcab Ability Codex. For the advanced Mid path strategy, shards are stacked throughout P1 and P2 to be shattered during your P3 . This rotation saves up to 10s every kill -- a substantial improvement for such a cheap upgrade. Shards are, however, rarely used in advanced strategies -- especially for solo bosses -- and should not be considered a general upgrade. ⬥ Masterwork Spear of Annihilation + Lunging Masterwork Spear gives you access to the meta Top P2 rotations. It also allows for a better P4 rotation ( replaces ). +⬥ Limitless Now would be a good time to acquire Limitless for rax. You will use it to clean up your P4 rotation and consistently before 25k hp. ⬥ Essence of Finality (adding Dragon Claws is recommended) When doing ideal rotations at rax, you do not have the additional adrenaline for EoF special attacks. Instead you are purchasing EoF for the stats and for the Reaper Necklace passive. Adding an Ornament Kit is optional and likely not worth until later due to the costs. This passive finally provides you the accuracy needed to start using the top path strat with a Quake . ⬥ Drygore OH At this point you should be closing in on @Araxxor Master times; however, they are likely still out of reach. ⬥ P6AS1 + AS4E2 (or P6R1 on 2h) ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• AS4 is a very strong perk in its own right. If you fail going for AS4E2, feel free to use AS4 in its place for the time being. AS4 is more than enough for rax. Dont worry if you don't get AS4E2 . ⬥ Malevolence ⬥ Custom Fitted Trimmed Masterwork By no means a necessity but TMW will make P4 at high enrage less risky. ⬥ Noxious Scythe Noxious Scythe is a popular weapon for rax; however, the best rax strategies require dual wield/2h switching -- negating Scythe's only strength, its range. It can still be used as a quality of life improvement during some of the more timegated phases, but for that purpose it should be purchased later on. Stage 3: Pretty Low ROI +⬥ Seren Godbow and Ingenuity of the Humans SGB unlocks the best P4 rotation. IoH is needed to ensure your spec does not splash. You now have all the gear needed to follow all rotations in #araxxor-melee . +⬥ Terrasaur Maul and Erethdor's Grimoire Terrasaur Maul has very low ROI when compared to most of the upgrades recommended above, and Erethdor's Grimoire is expensive to maintain. However, these two upgrades are most likely to shore up your rotations and ensure you have the damage you need to get over the final hurtles. At this point, your gear is capable of consistently achieving @Araxxor Master times. ⬥ An off-hand t90 Flanking 4 Switch ⬥ Khopesh Khopesh provide a small dps increase. At rax they mostly negate the need for if using . ⬥ Greater Fury gFury is a quality of life upgrade. +⬥ Noxious Scythe If you want to reduce a bit of damage during timegated phases, get Scythe here. ⬥ Upgrade to Flanking 4 Equilibrium 1 These last upgrades do not offer much in terms of improving kill times and are more for improving quality of life. Final Upgrade Order Summary for Melee Araxxor ⬥ Berserker Aura ⬥ Blade of Nymora + off-hand Ripper claw/Masuta's Warspear ⬥ Level 95 Prayer ⬥ Level 99 Herblore ⬥ Drygores MH + Ripper Claw OH ⬥ Entry Level Perks ⬥ Superior Vesta's Spear with Entry Level Perks At this point, it would be ok to start trying rax; however, you should expect slow kills. ⬥ Strength Skillcape All upgrades above this line should be the same for every boss. ⬥ T90 Armour ⬥ Laceration Boots ⬥ Amulet of Souls ⬥ Greater Barge ⬥ Greater Flurry At this point you are ready to start using rotations from #araxxor-melee. You will still need to improvise some rotations, P4 in particular; however, you should notice a serious uptick in your kill speeds. Beware, you should not use the recommended DBA spec as your accuracy is not high enough yet. ⬥ Biting 4 ⬥ Zaros Godsword (Most important upgrade) From this point on, you can follow almost all strategies in #araxxor-melee. Slightly different P2 Top Path and P4 rotations are needed. You should be using a Ripper Demon familiar by now. Your gear should be enough to achieve the Araxxor Adept times. +⬥ Storm Shards + Shatter ⬥ Masterwork Spear of Annihilation + Lunging +⬥ Limitless ⬥ Essence of Finality ⬥ Drygore OH At this point you should be closing in on Araxxor Master times; however, they are likely still out of reach. ⬥ P6AS1 + AS4E2 (or P6R1 on 2h) ⬥ Malevolence ⬥ Custom Fitted Trimmed Masterwork +⬥ Seren Godbow + Ingenuity of the Humans +⬥ Terrasaur Maul + Erethdor's Grimoire At this point, your gear is capable of consistently achieving Araxxor Master times. ⬥ Khopesh ⬥ Greater Fury +⬥ Noxious Scythe These last upgrades do not offer much in terms of improving kill times and are more for improving quality of life. Closing Thoughts The primary goal of this exercise is to stress that you should not buy upgrades just because a list told you to. Always consider what your next upgrade offers you in the context of how you play the game. If you ever have any questions, please come by #unknown-channel or #unknown-channel and ask.

docs.text: The primary goal of this exercise is to stress that you should not buy upgrades just because a list told you to. Always consider what your next upgrade offers you in the context of how you play the game. If you ever have any questions, please come by #unknown-channel or #unknown-channel and ask.
docs.title: Closing Thoughts

docs.text: Upgrade order Introduction This channel lists the general natural combat style progression template for players to follow. Disclaimer Priorities can of course change depending on content being done by the player. You should note that when you upgrade weapons, you can sell the weapon being upgraded to deduct cost from the new weapon. For example, once you are ready to obtain Blightbound Crossbows , you can sell one or both of your Ascensions for a good chunk of change. Keep in mind that the old off-hand Ascension Crossbow can be used as a Flanking switch, so you may want to keep that specifically to Flank. You should also feel free to buy items that are stated as less important in the upgrade order, such as buying Laceration Boots which costs 1,639,566 before the Zaros Godsword , which currently costs ‎ ‎ 863,354,747. Feel free to ask in #unknown-channel for a tailored list for the content that you do! Magic This is a generalized order which assumes a starting point of T70 weapons and armour. For further information on each upgrade check the relevant section in #armour-and-weapons , #perks and #perk-info , #unlockable-abilities , or #eof-specs . If you would like specialized advice, ask in #unknown-channel or #unknown-channel . Stage 1: No Real Variance Based on Content ⬥ Maniacal Aura ⬥ Guthix Staff + Ring of Vigour ⬥ Sunshine ⬥ Level 95 Prayer ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Should also complete The Temple at Senntisten quest ⬥ Level 99 Herblore ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Can boost from 99 to make Elder Overloads with the aid of pulse cores, and can request assistance to make Adrenaline Renewals ⬥ Superior Zuriel's Staff ⬥ Entry Level Perks ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Refer to #perks Starter Perks for Entry Level Perks ⬥ Corruption Blast ⬥ Planted Feet ⬥ Seismic Wand + Virtus Book with Entry Level Perks ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Strongly recommended to learn 4TAA at this stage, check #dpm-advice-mage for details ⬥ T88 Armour + Celestial Handwraps with Entry Level Perks ⬥ Blast Diffusion Boots ⬥ Cinderbane Gloves ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Skip Cinderbanes if mostly doing poison immune content. ⬥ Amulet of Souls Stage 2: Some Variance Based on Content/Wealth ⬥ Off-hand Flanking 4 Switch ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• Primarily for group based content, with some niche solo uses, skip if these do not pertain to you. ⬥ Inquisitor Staff ⬥ Seismic Singularity ⬥ Essence of Finality (adding guthix staff is recommended) ⬥ Ring of Death or Reaver's Ring / ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎• If chosen, purchase down the line when you feel comfortable with the death cost risk. docs.title: Upgrade order

docs.text: This channel lists the general natural combat style progression template for players to follow.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Priorities can of course change depending on content being done by the player. You should note that when you upgrade weapons, you can sell the weapon being upgraded to deduct cost from the new weapon. For example, once you are ready to obtain Blightbound Crossbows , you can sell one or both of your Ascensions for a good chunk of change. Keep in mind that the old off-hand Ascension Crossbow can be used as a Flanking switch, so you may want to keep that specifically to Flank. You should also feel free to buy items that are stated as less important in the upgrade order, such as buying Laceration Boots which costs 1,639,566 before the Zaros Godsword , which currently costs ‎ ‎ 863,354,747. Feel free to ask in #unknown-channel for a tailored list for the content that you do!
